story:
Please take a couple minutes and watch my campaign video above. 

I am BEYOND excited to share with you my passion for food and comedy. 

By supporting the Almost Balanced Foodie Project:

So lets talk.... do you have a business or product? I would love to feature you in a promotional photo on the Instagram as a thank you!

story:
Short Summary

My name is Megan Rach and I’m the co-owner of the brand new children’s entertainment company, Acorns & Dewdrops. I’m a recent graduate at a performing arts high school with a musical theatre focus. I am currently a freelance model and film actor in the Twin Cities. Aria May, the tree fairy, is currently a children’s author and performer.

Acorns and Dewdrops is a comedic series about two fairies who discover a ‘magic box’ (cell phone) and, after an attempt to return the box to its owner goes haywire, find themselves trapped in the human world with no money, no magic, and no idea how to get home. Here they will meet a new friend that shows them how fairies are famous here! Can Aria and Miri survive as children’s stars?

After writing a full season (12 episodes) I’m finally confident enough to get this project off the ground!

This goal is made to cover costs of film equipment rental, cast payment, advertisement and distribution, and helping launch our combined etsy page.

What We Need & What You Get

The money we raise fund our equipment rental or company hire (depending on funds raised). We will be able to grow our company and push the duo on to new and exciting things! Our goal is to be able to have a full crew and guest appearances from our fellow fairies!

If we don’t reach our full goal, the money will go towards whatever we can for film equipment and the rest will be used to advertising and funding our Etsy shop: A&D: Wings and Things! Creating new and exciting products made by fairies, for fairies! (and fairies at heart).

The Impact

Our project will create a fun, family-friendly, comedy that everyone will enjoy! Similar to Netflix original Girlboss, and Disney’s Enchanted, we find the perfect combination of laughter, friendship, and music! (There’s a musical episode written and composed and waiting to be shown to the world!)

 

If anything, our project will bring a smile to your face, and isn’t that what really matters in the end?

Risks & Challenges

Currently there are some obstacles that can make this project more difficult. While funding is always an issue, filming itself and creating a following are a few things that can make or break our project. But that’s okay!

Being a film actor, I have multiple connections with local film companies and upcoming directors that are willing to help in any way they can! I also am the executive assistant of Zenoscope Productions, popular for their short Cured and their upcoming Sci-fi thriller, Evergreen. I have access to help, insight, and local, fairly priced connections! We also have experience in social media marketing that will help us build a large and continuous following!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can't donate, we'd love your support! Here's how you can help: 

We are in development on an Acorns and Dewdrops online store. Our store will go live on Etsy August 1st. We are seeking partners who can advertise our store on your site.

We are looking to increase our Social Media following and would like your help. You can do so by sharing our feeds, like and subscribe, or be added to our mailing list for deals and upcoming events! You can find our Facebook, Instagram, Etsy, and Website here! 

 

Every little bit counts, and we’d love to have your support!

story:
FIRST.

Feel free to browse or read a draft of the pilot script here. In fact, we encourage it for the most resonant picture of the project. Now, on to the overview:

 

 

I.  THE TRUTH IS-

****

You can't get away from yourself by going from one place to another. Plenty of people don't care for the truth, though.

The story goes that six, unsettled strangers from around the world abandon home for escape or adventure in a new, exotic place. By chance - or by providence if you're religious - their paths cross, so starting a fluke family and, later, an exciting venture as they begin an offbeat business together. They discover and explore a stirring, dissimilar world and then construct their own within it. Maybe then - there - they'll all find what they need.

That's Bound. A scripted, comedy-drama series highlighting kinship, migration, and illusion.

     

     

    II.  A FEW STRANGERS AND A FAMILY.

    ****

     

    Introducing (left-to-right; top-to-bottom) the story's characters:

    Jaya.  

    The polished, sincere, and silly entrepreneur from Delhi who travels to escape the guilt of a tragic choice. Played by Bhavnisha Parmar.​

    Rosa.  

    The witty, graceful, but aloof medical student from Mexico City who keeps wandering around trying to figure out what or why. Played by Karina Aldape.

    Lana.  

    The steely but romantic filmmaker from Moscow who was mistaken for something else. Played by Katya Pylova.

    Tate.  

    The earnest but expressive driver from Atlanta who travels in celebration of a major milestone. Played by Evan Sandoval.

    Chuk.  

    The endearing and eccentric police officer from Lagos who can't yet be forgiven at home. Played by Isaac Sosanya.

    Bo.  

    (Not pictured) The suave, sardonic barber from Shanghai who can't get back what he's lost.​

     

    Also featuring:

    Peta.  

    The curious (nosy?), at times fiery chef from Chicago who left a long time ago. Played by Lorey Hayes.

    Fred.  

    (Not pictured) The booming, hustling ex-footballer from Oliwia; Rosa's grandfather.

     

    (You've seen the show Friends, right? Or you at least know about it. Well, this show will be like Friends - just weightier and farther out of the way.)

     

     

    III.  HOME AND FAR FROM IT.

    ****

     

    Introducing the story's setting:

    Few destinations in the world feature clashes of the extreme like Rio de Janeiro. It’s a diverse, highly-developed urban area mixed with jungle, mountains and sea. For Bound, we want to use those eclectic, physical gifts as a base for our own fictional place - a socially distinct location that lies in the middle of the Atlantic and speaks a language long since lost to the rest of the modern world. 

    We call it Oliwia (o-lee-wee-uh).

     

     

    IV.  MORE MONEY, MORE PROBLEMS?  DON'T BELIEVE IT.

    ****

     

    The following is a general register of items needed to produce the pilot episode. We're working for a 12-day, mid-year shoot in Brazil.

    Locations.

    • 8 indoor locations serving 17 different settings.
    • Security and permits for 2-4 outdoor locations.

    Equipment & Transportation.

    • Camera and lens rental with add-on purchases.
    • Lighting and rigs.
    • Sound gear.
    • Van rental.

    Contingency & Fees.

    • 10% contingency.
    • 8% Indiegogo/Stripe fees.

    1% Pledge.

    • Donation to local NGO

    If the campaign meets its goal, we'd like to give 1% of the earnings and designated time for volunteer work back to the community in which we shoot the pilot. Learn more about giving 1% of your earnings or time at pledge1percent.org

     

     

    V.  PEOPLE SAY THERE'S TIME.  THERE ISN'T.

    ****

    Risks and challenges:

    • This is the pilot for Bound.

    A decision was made early to commit to producing something larger and harder to ignore, but thus riskier and harder to make. We could have filmed something local in Los Angeles with actors and crew based there, but we wanted to take a shot at filming Bound in its ultimate, preferred location and we wanted to find the right actors no matter where they were based.

    We are certainly hopeful of sponsorship or larger investment - let's talk! - but until that's achieved (if it is), we're going to move forward and make something.

    The money raised here will allow us the basic tools for producing a good, though guerrilla-style, shoot in Rio. 

     

    So, if you find the story and the project at all intriguing, we'd value - immensely - your donation, and importantly, your sharing of the story to others!

     

     

    VI.  IN THE LAST PLACE-

    ****

     

    Themes and objectives for the series:

    1. Life is curvy, baby.

    One sunny day you're walking - straight - down the way. Then you're not. Principally, the story of Bound examines the journeys of people trying to find some kind of personal liberation or wholeheartedness. Obstacles at home propel them to take some different path. Maybe that choice is a wrong turn. Maybe it's right. That's one reason we'd like to make Bound  - to find the answers and along the way examine how and/or why people overcome.

     

    2. Earth is sundry, sweetie.

    Fact is, there's a whole, separate world afar to your left. Another to your right. And another up ahead. The lie is, that they actually are separate. A second reason we'd like to make Bound is for the enjoyment and exploration of how different people from different cultures behave and believe, and for the challenge of integrating them, as their distinct selves, into the same tribe. Finally, to review and question their histories and wonder how, in the end, we are all bound.

     

     

    Thank you so much for your time!

story:
Thank you SO MUCH for checking out the campaign for CAMP COWABUNGA! My name is Jason and I’ve been involved with summer camps since 1992. From Camper to Counsellor to Program Director, summer camp has always been a huge part of my life! And as you can see below, I've always been a fan of the ringer tee. 

Combining my love of summer camp and obsession with the '80s, I created CAMP COWABUNGA to bring the spirit of summer camp and classic '80s television into the homes of the new generation of kids (and future campers)!!

Set during the 1980's, CAMP COWABUNGA is a live-action series for kids that takes place at a summer camp (think PEE-WEE'S PLAYHOUSE meets CAMP CARIBOO) and features a host of fun and zany camp staff as well as lovable wilderness animal friends (in puppet form)!!

WHY THE '80s?

Because, like summer camp, it's a simpler time without modern technologies to distract us from learning and growing. At CAMP COWABUNGA, we connect with nature and others around us.

The look of CAMP COWABUNGA will reflect the simple, softer, slightly grainy and older look of children's television shows from the 1980's. The show will feel like it was made in that decade.

In each episode, viewers will get to experience what life is like as a camper at CAMP COWABUNGA! You'll go to different activities, hang out at the Dining Hall, tell jokes with new friends, and sing songs around the camp fire.

Last year I noticed that my 3-year-old nephew was binge-watching a bunch of videos on YouTube that offered nothing of substance. They weren’t creative and they weren’t educational. I was then reminded of all the wonderful shows I used to watch as a kid in the ‘80s (YOU CAN’T DO THAT ON TELEVISION, MR. DRESSUP, PEE-WEE’S PLAYHOUSE, TODAY’S SPECIAL, CAMP CARIBOO, and SHARON, LOIS & BRAM'S ELEPHANT SHOW) and thought that kids today deserved something similar to these shows we grew up on. They need to have FUN while LEARNING!

There are a TON of animated shows out there for kids today… and, for some reason, a serious lack of live-action, educational shows. Now, I LOVE animation… but there’s just something about a live-action show (with REAL people and actual PUPPETS you can touch) that is so special. It’s a real world of it’s own. It's a world that kids want to escape to. And that's why I've created CAMP COWABUNGA.

Last fall we filmed the pilot episode of CAMP COWABUNGA on location. It gave us an idea as to what this show could be. There are additional characters (both people and puppets) that we hope to add to the show to help round it out and make the world even bigger.

WATCH THE PILOT below… and SHARE IT with friends & family with children! SPREAD THE WORD!! And let us know what you think!

 

Although this is a low-budget production, we can’t do this alone. The cast & crew for the pilot episode volunteered their time, we shot it using two iPhones, we called in all sorts of favours… and it still cost a significant amount of money to produce. For the remaining episodes, we want to make sure everyone involved is compensated for their time and talent.

Every child deserves the right to experience summer camp at least once. This show aims to teach kids some of the lessons we learn when away at summer camp. By donating to our campaign, you’re helping educate children through entertainment!

The TARGET AUDIENCE for CAMP COWABUNGA is kids 4-8 years old (but kids younger and older - and adults - love it too!). My niece and nephews have seen the pilot episode many times and they LOVE the show! They can’t wait for more episodes!! Check out this video of them at Christmas when they received their very own CAMP COWABUNGA T-Shirts! I think their reactions say it all.

 

With the money raised, we’ll be able to pay for the following:

  • MORE PUPPETS!! These are HIGH QUALITY Canadian-Made Puppets that are a BIG part of the show (and Flip needs some friends).

  • Cast & Crew: Our cast and crew volunteered on the pilot, so we’d like to pay them (at least a little bit) for their time and continued commitment to the project. And for the series, we'll be adding several more people to both the Cast and Crew.
  • Camera Equipment
  • Lighting Equipment
  • Audio Equipment
  • Craft Services
  • Transportation
  • Post-Production (Editing, Colour Correction, Sound Design, etc.)
  • Publicity/Marketing Costs

THE PERKS:

Check out the totally awesome CAMP COWABUNGA gear included in some of the perks!!

NOTE: Final appearance of items may differ slightly than what is currently shown.

OTHER AWESOME PERK ITEMS INCLUDE:

  • Social Media Shout Outs!
  • MP3 of the CAMP COWABUNGA THEME SONG!
  • Personalized "Thank You" Video Message from FLIP!
  • Have your children's art appear in an episode!!
  • Behind The Scenes Footage from the set!
  • Special Thanks on the Camp Cowabunga Website
  • Associate Producer Credit
  • Executive Producer Credit

PRINCIPAL PHOTOGRAPHY: We hope to shoot the remaining episodes in September 2018.*

POST PRODUCTION: The plan is to have the first episode completed during Fall 2018, and to release a new episode weekly.*

*Note: Production could be postponed should there be interest from a third party to develop the show further.

With any production, there are bound to be some challenges along the way. One of the major challenges we could face is inclement weather. The show is shot entirely on location and many of the scenes are filmed outdoors. Rainy days could halt production of these outdoor scenes. Our plan would be to film all of the outdoor scenes at the beginning of the shoot to avoid any potential delays later in production.

IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL, we will re-evaluate the budget and see what we can do with the money raised. For example, if we only have enough to shoot it using two iPhones (like we did with the pilot) then we'll go that route. Or we could reduce the amount (or length) of episodes to shoot, if necessary. If we come to the conclusion that we just don't have enough money to make it work, we will donate the money to a summer camp in need.

Low on funds, but want to help?! Please SPREAD THE WORD and SHARE (using the Indiegogo share tool!) with your friends, colleagues, and/or on your social media feeds!!

Be sure to FOLLOW CAMP COWABUNGA on social media to stay in the loop:

  • FACEBOOK: @CampCowabungaTV
  • INSTAGRAM: @campcowabungatv
  • TWITTER: @campcowabunga

PLEASE SUBSCRIBE to our YouTube Channel! The more subscribers we have, the more chances we have at getting our show out there! Check it out at www.youtube.com/campcowabunga

For other inquiries, please contact us at info@campcowabunga.ca

And THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!

Rainy days could halt production of these outdoor scenes. Our plan would be to film all of the outdoor scenes at the beginning of the shoot to avoid any potential delays later in production.IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL, we will re-evaluate the budget and see what we can do with the money raised. For example, if we only have enough to shoot it using two iPhones (like we did with the pilot) then we'll go that route. Or we could reduce the amount (or length) of episodes to shoot, if necessary. If we come to the conclusion that we just don't have enough money to make it work, we will donate the money to a summer camp in need.Low on funds, but want to help?! Please SPREAD THE WORD and SHARE (using the Indiegogo share tool!) with your friends, colleagues, and/or on your social media feeds!!Be sure to FOLLOW CAMP COWABUNGA on social media to stay in the loop:
FACEBOOK: @CampCowabungaTV

INSTAGRAM: @campcowabungatv

TWITTER: @campcowabunga

PLEASE SUBSCRIBE to our YouTube Channel! The more subscribers we have, the more chances we have at getting our show out there! Check it out at www.youtube.com/campcowabungaFor other inquiries, please contact us at info@campcowabunga.caAnd THANK YOU, THANK YOU, THANK YOU!!

story:
THE BIG IDEA: What’s our show about?

#Followus is a satirical comedy demonstrating the insanity of the social media culture with a look at how millennials often ”fake”’ their perfect lives through the use of filters, Photoshop and cropping.

Logline: Provoked by the fear of being slaves to the 9 to 5 life, four recent graduates plan to embark on a world adventure funded by their baby sitting paper and the support of a lifestyle brand that discovered them through their viral video.

The day they are supposed to fly out of McCarran Airport in Vegas (they got a really cheap deal) the friends wake up with no recollection of what happened the night before or where all of their passports went.

Rather than return home and let their parents, fans, frenemies, and followers down, they decide to fake that they’re abroad through social media using America's good ol’ rip off of European architecture. Little do the friends know they are being followed and stalked by far more dangerous people than high school girls on Instagram.

THE MAIN CHARACTERS (The Fab Five) 

GENNY WITH A G

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RxFRnZpPRPA&t=12s (click here to watch Genny's Bachelor Audition) 

( 21, barely legal): Genny is the leader of her eclectic group of friends, the “A Broad Squad”. She changed her name because she felt Jenny with a J was too basic. Genny was the product of a one night stand, no literally “one nightstand”. Her father worked for Ikea and came to her mother’s home to help her set up one nightstand. They ended up doing some kind of nailing, but not the kind you’d expect. Genny changes herself to connect with other people due to her absent connection with her father. This is how she discovered her knack for method acting. Genny is a “yes” girl through and through and a 100% people pleaser. She dreams of being a famous actress and, as Dylan calls it, she dreams of being Kylie Jenner Plus. 

Follow Genny on Insta at: https://www.instagram.com/_gennywithag_/

KEANDRA (23, Think KEKE PALMER): Keandra has placed a lot of pressure on herself to be a human rights lawyer. She’s constantly talking about all the cases she works (aka she shows up to jury duty every week). Much to the disappointment of one of our characters named Matt, Keandra only dates men who make six figures and are eights. When Matt protests that he’s actually pretty good looking, Keandra explains that she means “eights on the Enneagram scale”. Keandra loves to smash men because they are a metaphor for patriarchy (she makes men yell the names of powerful women while they do it). Keandra has successfully argued her way out of every parking/speeding ticket she’s ever been given.

DYLAN CON UN “D”

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=gtZR_EQ5gzc (click here to watch one of Dylan’s monologues from our script)

(22): Dylan is both gay and Latin, but his biggest struggle is that he always needs to be the center of attention (Genny with a G is his biggest competition despite the fact that they’re BFF’s). He's constantly talking about all the "shows" he "books" (aka every Thursday he sings "Defying Gravity" on karaoke at a shitty dive bar to some crack heads, and a crusty woman who wears shirt that says"single and ready to mingle"). His grandmother has no idea he’s gay even though he had his own quinceañera. As a dance major, he’s just now realizing he can’t get paid to grind up on drag queens in WeHo for the rest of his life.

Follow Dylan on Insta at: https://www.instagram.com/leggsbenedicked/ (content coming soon!)

GINA (pronounced vagina) (22, Think REBEL WILSON): Gina is the only one of the group who literally does not care what anyone thinks of her. Gina is lesbian, but she also sometimes identifies as Bob (something she struggles with throughout the arc of the first season). The only thing that holds her back from traveling the world is that she’ll have to pay for two airplane seats. Gina’s hobbies include getting high, going to Taco Bell, and having spiritual awakenings brought on by drugs. Gina has no idea what she wants to do with her life due to lack of guidance from her parents: her mother who lives for five o’ clock showings of Jeopardy, and her father who is actually just an urn of an ashes with a name tag that says “Hello My Name is Earl”. Gina’s friends are like the family she never had.

MARISSA (RIS) (22, Think BRENDA SONG): Marissa is the grounded one of the group, and the only one with her head on straight, besides Keandra. Marissa has been in a committed relationship with her boyfriend from high school for eight years (minus the two month break where she took too many Jell-O shots and had a threesome in the school chapel). Marissa is the only one who isn’t going abroad, because she’s the only one who is employed post grad. She has a marketing job lined up, which she took due to extreme pressure (from herself) to pay back her student loans. She is constantly looking at her friend’s “abroad” social media posts and getting major FOMO (Fear Of Missing Out).

SUPPORTING CHARACTERS (they don’t support the main characters at all)

JENNY WITH A J

(22): Jenny with a J is Genny with a G’s arch nemesis. She is never spotted without her band of loyal followers who all have J’s embroidered on their Cher from Clueless like uniforms. Jenny’s daddy owns the largest junk food drink franchise in the world and yet she still can’t seem to pay her assistant (aka unpaid intern) Amy. Throughout the season Jenny always appears with a different inbred, tiny dog, but Jenny always pretends it’s the same one: Princess Snuffleoffogas. It turns out Jenny has a very similar affliction to Lennie from Of Mice Of Men where she thinks each dog is so cute that she smooshes it to death. While they are “abroad” Jenny sees a good opportunity to befriend a sad Marissa and turn her against Genny with a G and the rest of the squad.

DONNA (Genny’s Mom) (42, Think JANE KRAKOWSKI): Donna and Genny, although mother and daughter, are highly competitive. Donna resents Genny for finding her way into Donna’s womb and not letting Donna live out her dream of being an actress/super model/ soft core porn star. She also resents Genny for ruining her vagina, which was once "as tight as a pinhole”. She has spent most of Genny’s child support money on boob jobs and ten dollar psychics. Donna constantly reminds Genny not to do drugs because one time she, “had a seven day iowaska trip during which she thought she found Jesus, who actually just ended up being 'Jesus', a homeless man with syphilis from the Ralph’s parking lot across the street. And while syphilis is curable the scars of bad decisions are not…” Throughout their journey Genny must fake that she is traveling the world over weekly FaceTime dates with Donna. Little does Genny know (until episode three) that Donna harbors a dark secret of her own.

WHY US? 

  • We grew up in this world: faking our lives through the facade of social media.
  • Female factor: Hollywood still lacks strong female producers, directors, writers and a female voice, but it is looking to fill that void. 
  • Unique competitive advantage: we’ve already started to put our content on social media through The Eskimo Sisters’ social accounts.

WHY NOW?

  • Social media component: Relevant now as it's constantly changing. We also tie social media into our series in a very creative way (we don't want to reveal too much).
  • Diverse characters: There is a great desire now more than ever to showcase diverse voices and characters from different backgrounds and perspectives and this is something we care about. 
  • Abroad/ "find yourself" component: chasing the millennial dream of "happiness".

WHY THIS IDEA? 

Because we’re all sick of going to dinner and talking to someone looking down a screen. Because social media causes anxiety and depression and we want to expose what a facade it is.

HIT SHOWS/ MOVIES SIMILAR IN TONE 

  • Girls
  • Broad City 
  • The Hangover 
  • House Bunny 
  • Sex in the City

But What Do We Have that They Don't?

  • Social media/self promotion component 
  • More diversity 
  • “Abroad” component
  •  A hook and engine (new social media post each week) 
  • Strong millennial feedback on our content

WHY ARE WE DOING THIS OURSELVES?

As we state in our video, we are doing this ourselves because the Hollywood senior execs who have mentored us have encouraged us to do so. Often times when production companies purchase a series or a script, it sits on a shelf and is never made, but with the new digital platforms creators are breaking the rules of old Hollywood and developing hugely successful content. We don’t just want to be writers. We want a chance to produce and act in our series. We are the millennial Tina Fey and Amy Poehler. There is a huge shift towards digital content, and many series utilizing platforms such as Netflix, Hulu or Amazon are becoming hits without having to go through the highly competitive old school studio system. Below are two charts that can help you better to understand our thinking.

 

Hit Shows That Began as Digital Series 

  •  Broad City (YouTube → Comedy Central) 
  •  Workaholics (YouTube → Comedy Central) 
  •  Whatever, Linda (YouTube → Vimeo → TV)
  •  Insecure (YouTube → HBO)

WHERE IS THE MONEY GOING?

Above you can see exactly where the money is going. We want to raise $35,000 because Indiegogo takes a cut, and there are always extra travel, equipment, and insurance expenses that we may not foresee (something we experienced with our last project)!

OUR DIGITS

If you have any questions please contact us at one of the email addresses listed below. 

Kendall: Kendall.milton@gmail.com

Lily: Lily@lilydrew.com

NOTE: If you donate a certain amount, but prefer to receive a perk designated to a lower donation amount that is definitely an option, just let us know!

story:
Brittney McWilliams

Creator/Writer/Executive Producer/Director/Actor

 

 

I've been writing since the age of 8. It started with song lyrics, then the dreaded essays for high school and college courses, then came my first book, a memoir titled Not That Girl: A Tell-All Memoir. After the release of my book which documents my struggles with abuse, heartache, and chasing my dream of becoming an actress while being a single mother, I knew that my story would one day become a television show.

I moved to Atlanta to pursue my dream of being an actress in July 2016 at the age of 26. With less than $800 to my name, my son and I started a new life in Georgia. A short while after being in Georgia, I found myself, unemployed, and emotionally broken. I applied to tons of jobs and nothing seemed to work out. I can't remember the exact day or time, but I felt God telling me to create my own series. I have always been one to go full-speed ahead when I believe in my vision and that is exactly what I did. In a little over three weeks, I had written my first draft of all eight of the Season One episodes. It hasn't been easy, but knowing that my son gets to see me pursue my dream that can give us a better life, despite the hardships,  and giving others the opportunity to pursue their dreams, makes me fight everyday to make Living Vee a success. The nights of no sleep and non stop work, the time my son has had to sacrifice playtime and cuddle time with me, the tears I have shed throughout this process, will all be worth it. Living Vee will relate to so many people and I cannot wait to see where God takes the Cast and Crew of Living Vee. In spite of everything, I have hope and I truly believe that there's nowhere to go but up from where I am. 

On January 16, 2016 at 2:30am, I made a list of BIG entertainment goals. I was actually writing goals that I never thought would be obtainable but they sounded awesome. Number 20 on that list was "Have my own show and be the Director." A year and a half later, here I as the head of Living Vee.

GOD IS FAITHFUL! NEVER GIVE UP.

 

Creating and Casting "Living Vee"

I began writing the first episode of Living Vee and the words and visions for the show started to flow. Eight episodes later, I had what would become Season One of "Living Vee". With $1.47 in my bank account at the time, and unemployed with a bachelor's degree despite applying to over 300 jobs with a pretty impressive resume, I felt in my spirit that I was supposed to make Living Vee public. I knew that there was a reason why I was not landing the jobs I had applied for, but I was scared to start the process of Living Vee. After a lot of prayers and a few encouraging conversations to myself, I decided to take a huge leap of faith and start casting my project. I ended up having 1200 submissions for all of season one and after callbacks, I now have the most talented cast I could ever ask for. Not only are they talented, they are dedicated, and eager to get started with filming this project that we believe has the potential to become a huge success. The cast and crew have all agreed to donate their time to this project however, there are filming necessities that we need to make this project a contender when pitching to online and TV networks, film festivals, and other avenues that will give Living Vee the attention it will deserve. 

 

 

 

Funding- Your contributions will make the following happen

Pre-Production, Production, and Post-Production Costs such as:

Rental of film equipment needed to make the vision for Living Vee come alive. 

Show Editor to make the episodes of Living Vee be the best they can be and to make them ready for the highly anticipated depute. 

Insurance.

An event called Beyond the Camera. The Living Vee cast and crew will feed pizza, snacks, and drinks to the homeless and provide them with toiletry items.

Meals for the cast and crew.

Locations, permits, props, wardrobe, and transportation.

Producer's expenses for Living Vee . 

If enough funding is raised, Living Vee Season One will be paid for Cast and Crew!

 

Why Should You Donate to Living Vee?

I have everything set, but as you know money is important in the film industry. There will be someone on set doing behind the scenes footage so you can actually see what your money is creating. 

There will be video updates from the Creator to give you an update of how your funds are changing the lives of a talented cast and crew. 

Risks & Challenges

I know that it is a risk putting a series out there for the world to see, but I am dedicated to seeing this project through. I have spent time away from my 3-year -old son to make Living Vee happen. I know there are challenges that I will face during this process, but ultimately with my faith in God, prayers, hard work, dedication, willingness, and a sprinkle of luck, Living Vee has the potential to be the next big series. The experienced cast and crew will make Living Vee stand out among the many web series online right now. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Just  because you can't contribute financially, doesn't mean you can't help Living Vee succeed. Here are a few things you can do to help:

Share the link to this campaign on your social media!  https://igg.me/at/livingvees1

Follow us on social media! Instagram: @livingveeseries  Facebook: Living Vee Web Series

Pray for the success of the show! 

Share any contacts you have that may be beneficial to Living Vee!

 

CHECK OUT THE AWESOME PERKS!! 

DONATE $5000 AND BE THE DATE OF ONE OF THESE CHARACTERS! 

Includes: Formal invitation to be the date of Vee, Jakob, or Neal to the Premier Party and the Cast Dinner, two night hotel stay, round trip airfare (flying into ATL).  2 Extra VIP Premier tickets, Skype Call, autographed T-shirt, social media shoutout.

"NEAL"

CHASE VASSER

 

"JAKOB"

BEN SMITH

 

"VEE"

BRITTNEY MCWILLIAMS

The experienced cast and crew will make Living Vee stand out among the many web series online right now. Other Ways You Can HelpJust  because you can't contribute financially, doesn't mean you can't help Living Vee succeed. Here are a few things you can do to help:Share the link to this campaign on your social media!  https://igg.me/at/livingvees1Follow us on social media! Instagram: @livingveeseries  Facebook: Living Vee Web SeriesPray for the success of the show! Share any contacts you have that may be beneficial to Living Vee!

 
CHECK OUT THE AWESOME PERKS!! DONATE $5000 AND BE THE DATE OF ONE OF THESE CHARACTERS! Includes: Formal invitation to be the date of Vee, Jakob, or Neal to the Premier Party and the Cast Dinner, two night hotel stay, round trip airfare (flying into ATL).  2 Extra VIP Premier tickets, Skype Call, autographed T-shirt, social media shoutout."NEAL"CHASE VASSER "JAKOB"BEN SMITH "VEE"BRITTNEY MCWILLIAMS

story:
About Us

This is it. After three seasons of our web series, we’re calling this the end of an era. This is the Final Season of MANBEAST. It only took us half-a-dozen years. But, we're here now for one more epic run and we need you!

My name is Brandon Aquino and I'm the creator of MANBEAST. I’m an aspiring comedy writer and director edging towards my big break in film and entertainment. Being the creator requires… uh, creativity? While my education in film has taught me the principles of the art, I push the boundaries and break the rules in my work. They're really just guidelines, if you ask me.

 

How This Came About

The idea for MANBEAST sprouted many years ago between friends just talking about a buncha bullshit. I thought it would be a fun idea to make a show about our misadventures. From there, who would have guessed that our blunders would still be funny enough to write about and capture it on film. We’ve been very fortunate that many continue to find the humor, ironically, in our misfortunes after all these years.

With the help of a handful of people, we have been able to produce 15 episodes of MANBEAST. Each season shows more evolution in the writing, editing, acting, lighting - basically everything associated with the film making process has improved. Now, with the final season at hand, I believe this will be our swan song. A truly perfect farewell season that will launch the ultimate writing gig in television. We’ve already started writing the season and everything is going to end in a climactic twist. Dun dun dunnnn. I promise everything isn't a dream. No Jacob's Ladder shit here.

We’re asking you, for the final time, to support us with our last season. With your contribution, you can help us get the recognition by our fellow writers and the film community. We want more viewers, more film festival nominations, and of course, awards. Thanks!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down for you and tell you where your money goes:

This season, we are aiming high because this project deserves it. With your support, let’s get to $5,000. The money will go towards a few areas. Take a look at my professional-looking graph I made to help you visualize our goal. It’s really a piece of pie to understand.

 

 

  • Crew: Stipends for our creatives, technicians, and writers and food for our hungry staff.
  • Equipment: We need better lenses, we must harness the HD quality. And more lights.
  • Locations and Set Design: Sometimes we need to make illusions.
  • Wardrobe: We’re big fans of thrift shops and the Goodwill. 
  • Festival Entry Fees: We want to win some shit! And gloat!
  • Indiegogo Fees: Gotta pay money to make money. Unfortunately.
  • Perk Production: Our glue gun skills are slowly improving. We only started one slow burning fire so far...

 

We're proud of ourselves!

When we were crowd funding for the Third Season of MANBEAST, we made a promise to you all. We were going to write better jokes, improve our audio and keep a Dave character. By golly, we did all of it! But thanks to you of course. So, we will pat ourselves on the back. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help MANBEAST!

Go ahead, scroll up and take a look at some of the perks and find the right one for you. There are some pretty awesome things to show our appreciation for your support to MANBEAST. From a SHOUT OUT, a MANBEAST STRONG wristband, t-shirts, posters, and an Executive Producer credit, your investment in us will be recognized.  

Even if you can’t contribute dolla dolla bills, you can support us by sharing this page with your network. Share it on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, and tag @manbeastseries. If you do this, you can find your name in a special thanks section in our first episode of the season. Do what you can to spread the word - send it to your latest Tinder match, tell your friends, make a new friend at the park, send a carrier pigeon, smoke signals, email, snail mail, or shout it from a rooftop! But please spread us like that new form of gonorrhea. Thanks!

 

Season 3

 
The Porn Star - Dave finally has a girlfriend. Unfortunately for him, they all saw her coming.

 

Babysitters - Jacqi needed help watching her niece. Too bad for the gang, her niece is the spawn of Satan.

 

The Master Debater - The ultimate battle of the sexes begins!

 

The Sound of MANBEAST - It's a muuuuuuusical!

story:
virgins! so far... 

  1. January 2018, we received $13K in sponsorship, catering & donations and with a cast and crew of 25 people, filmed 5 short teaser videos 

  2. February 14, 2018 [Valentines' Day] we launched virgins! teasers on Facebook and YouTube.
  3. May 2018, we ran a fully funded, 4-week screenwriter's mentorship program where we brought 4 aspiring women writers of colour (3 East African and 1 Singaporean) into our writer's room where they wrote for the show and learned from our team
  4. June 2018, launch IndieGogo
  5. July 7, 2018, our launch event entitled, Fourth Base with virgins! is presented in partnership with Charles Street Video and the Toronto Media Arts Centre, with your contributions
  6. July - September 2018, with your investment, develop season 1

 

virgins! is groundbreaking, and heres why:

  •  It follows four first-generation African Canadian Black women, without 'ethnic' accents, who aren't sexualized just being funny, living life and figuring it all out. There's a thought.
  • Millennials are reported as the most sexless generation since the great depression and yet stories written about us overwhelmingly portray the opposite. Where are the stories that millennials can relate to? (*Hint: try searching "virgins! series" - we out here, doing the damn thing)
  • East African girls are more than a Drake lyric and Black women can be interesting without being sexual. Facts.

On July 7th, we are hosting, FOURTH BASE with virgins!, a launch event celebrating the Toronto-based comedy series. The night includes a screening of the series, a table read of future work, a moderated discussion with the creative team (writers, producers and creator) behind the series and the best East African sounds and hip hop beats will be mixed by Mozambican DJ, Ëlle. This is a co-presentation by Miskeen Productions and Charles Street Video, in partnership with the Toronto Media Arts Centre,

 

We're crowdfunding in support of two critical projects:

  1. FOURTH BASE with virgins!: We are 2 weeks away from our launch celebration and need help pulling together the final elements of our event.  
  2. Development of Season 1: We hear you! You want more and longer episodes - we want to make them, and with your help, we can make that happen. Development funds will go towards supporting in the creation and development of new 10minute episodes.

 

    What We Need

    Launch event, $5,552.00

    • This launch is an immense opportunity to introduce the series to a larger audience made up of press, tv executives, and our fans. Getting this done right is our first priority.
    • Funds will go towards the cost of supplies, rentals and paying talent (moderator, emcee, creative team etc.).

    Development of Season 1, $27,553.00

    • Behind the scenes, we are collective of Black and Brown women (and a few men) creators and artists doing everything we can to bring this show to life. So many hours have gone into bringing virgins! to the place it is at right now, and all of it has been done with the support of our creative community but now we need your help.
    • Funds will cover the costs of creating and developing new scripts, and creative content

     

    What You Get

    Everyone who invests in our campaign will be named in the Special Thanks section of our upcoming videos.

    Additionally, we have some perks for you too!

     

    The Impact 

      The sex positive movement has been fantastic and empowering for women who choose to have sex and has even been suggested to be a potential factor for why millennials are choosing to say ‘no’ to sex. Yay for empowerment! Keeping it real though, where are the stories of empowered, bold, interesting women not having sex?

      Contemporary stories that relate to the doe-eyed in-betweeners navigating adulthood blind and seeking love without sex, haven't existed in the media landscape. Your contributions, big and small, will go a long way towards helping us tell more of these stories and bringing them to bigger and wider screens around the world. 

       

      Other Ways You Can Help

      If you love this campaign but can't afford to help, don't sweat it! We're millennial artists, we get it! Here are 3 ways you can help:

      1. Help us get the word out and make some real noise about our campaign - hit the share button below.
      2. Help us get to 2000 new views by July 7th - watch our teasers, leave a comment and share them with your friends
      3. Follow us on our socials:

      TW: @VirginsSeries

      IG: @VirginsTheSeries

      FB: @VirginsTheSeries

      YT: www.youtube.com/VirginsTheSeries

story:
“They will pay… with rivers of blood!”

It may sound corny now, but if you grew up in the early 80s, those words turned every broomstick into a lethal katana. Martial Arts films dominated the American imagination, and kids everywhere devoured the canon. Many were lost to time. But one staple, one classic of the genre, kicks the most ass: Shogun Assassin. The bloodiest of them all. In humble tribute to Shogun Assassin, we warmly present WOLF, an original web series.

Set in present-day Las Vegas, WOLF, follows Judah WOLF, a dishonored ex-cop, searching the streets of Las Vegas with his 7-year-old daughter, Kikuyu WOLF, seeking bloody revenge on Korando Shinoda, the Yakuza boss responsible for his wife’s murder.

We, the producers of WOLF, want to offer a new generation a tale of revenge, loyalty, and honor. But we need bloodthirsty heroes to help!

We are raising $250,000 to create the highest quality web series.  You have watched the sizzle. That is just a taste of what the nine-episode series will be. Your awesome donations will go toward:

  • Nine quality episodes: 10-12 minutes each.
  • SAG Cast
  • Film Equipment
  • Set Design
  • Location Fees
  • Post Production, i.e., Editing, Sound Design, and more.

We're a Mixed Bag

The good folks in front of the camera look a lot like the good folks behind the camera. This series is a true melting pot. Broadcasting characters of varied races, ethnicities, genders, and sexual orientations.  To add, our team of producers is made up of all women. 

WOLF presents and represents a healthy American tapestry. And we welcome everyone to contribute to this series. Your love and support means more than written words can express.  

The Team

Sean Jackson - Writer/Director

Native Detroiter, Sean Jackson has written, directed and produced over 30 short films and one feature film. Sean has honed his craft by focusing on high impact content with strong themes. 

Kiki Knowles - Producer

Native Detroiter, KiKi Knowles is an independent film producer, who made her debut producing the web series sizzle Wolf directed by Sean Jackson. KiKi was first introduced to the industry as a child performing in stage productions across the Detroit Metropolitan Area. Her early training and background groomed her for the position to later serve as a manager for two of her children for several years propelling her into the film industry. 

In addition to film, KiKi enjoys writing poetry and is set to release her first published work of art this year. She is a devoted wife and mother of 3 who loves to travel and has a passion for working with underprivileged children. Paying homage to her Detroit roots, KiKi and her spouse are currently working to create a group home for children and veterans in the heart of the city.

Kathleen Shinn - Producer

Kathleen Shinn has had an interest in fine art since high school, she enjoys working with all mediums including collage, acrylics and clay. In college she continued her love of fine art but her area of concentration was in healthcare. Equipped with her artistic capabilities and knowledge in nursing, Shinn was exposed to filmmaking as a set nurse/EMT and with that exposure, a new passion took over. With an interest in film and a background in Healthcare, she developed an interest in special effects makeup. Working with these skills she served as a special effects artist on films “Sweet Ninja Brown” and “Territory 8”. Her love of filmmaking grew over the next several years working alongside writer/director Sean Jackson. She has produced several short films such as “It’s Karma, Baby,” “Dying to Tell You,” “Sweet Ninja Brown,” “House Rules,” “The Nowheres,” “The Bay Laurel,” and feature film “Bubblegum & Broken Fingers.” Shinn is writing her first screenplay and directed her first short film “Unintended”.

story:
Short Summary

  • Roberta, writer/director, has been in the film industry for over 25 years: programming film festivals, writing "the bible" for short filmmakers "How To Make A Short Film: Secrets From A Sundance Programmer, and directing and producing over 50 film projects and TV pilots.
  • We are raising a modest amount of money to cover a 3 day production, focusing on keeping the number of locations, and characters manageable, and the STORY value high. We are creating a project that ensures you realize just how much this issue matters to you. We all want the space to laugh at ourselves and address the issues: Judgment suffocates growth.
  • Your contribution will support an exceptionally well crafted work, made by mostly women of color who believe in our collective ability to transform the pain and suffering we live with into a bright, funny, insightful story of real transformation. Women falter, men falter, and we owe it to ourselves to create a  bridge that leads to loving action with a drive to create real community. Your support means everything and Dr. Detox is a dream come true for this team!

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We are raising $30,000 (or more!) to secure our outstanding SAG-AFRTA actors, our highly qualified veteran crew, equipment rentals, fresh and local food, transportation, and one house location in Los Angeles. We'll be shooting our project for three days utilizing weekend rental rates, and ensuring we get the highest quality group of people on board.
  • Once the filming is complete, we will then need to pay for post-production costs that would include: editing, sound mixing and design, and music licensing. With all our connections in this industry, you have our word that we will find the best deals to spend our budget wisely. 
  • Our perks! They all speak to the enormous talent and support we have on board this project! If you're a filmmaker, we've got you with indie support perks, social media shout outs for your projects and if you're a film lover, we've got the fun stuff: mugs, posters, legal advice, and on-set visits! 

The Impact

  • I, Roberta, want the impact of this show to be something you cannot wait to BINGE! I'll take a not often seen deep dive into "toxic masculinity". I believe that without vulnerable loving action you are left with half the story! Dr. Detox will have some comedic moments, but it is about real issues we face on the daily. The show will answer these sometimes catastrophic questions with laughter, and honesty: How do we as a community support men during the hardest times in their lives without eviscerating them? How do men & women see themselves and support each other when their worlds are falling apart? How do we laugh at ourselves, and also get the help we need? No dragging allowed.
  • This creative team has over 25 years of filmmaking experience! Our writer/director Roberta Munroe has written/directed and/or produced several award-winning projects that have premiered at top tier festivals:  Sundance, Tribeca, DC, Hollyshorts (LA), BFI London, Venice and hundreds more. She also produced The Parker Tribe, mulitple award-winner at the New York Film & Television Festival, and The Procession which was chosen for theatrical release! She produced several AT&T Hello Lab projects (check the links below), programmed short film at Sundance for 5 years, and has successfully championed 100's of artists on the path to making their dreams come true.
  • Our producer, Reiko Napier joins this team fresh from overseeing all forms of production from digital to film with top industry companies Endemol and Vertical Networks garnering millions of views and awards. Most recently her work has resided in unscripted comedic formats with rising comedians for top social platforms YouTube, Facebook and Snapchat. Beyond her background in comedy, her experience also lies within social impact which can be seen with her work for the popular millennial publisher ATTN:.
  • Our Casting Director, Matthew Lessall, C.S.A., was born in London, raised in New York, educated in Indiana and London, and is now based in Los Angeles. Matthew’s life and casting experiences are equally diverse. Having cast successful, international, award-winning projects for film, television and new media, in the form of features, pilots, and series, his primary recognition is on the indie film front. Matthew has also worked at major networks and studios, as Director of Feature Film Casting at 20th Century Fox; in-house casting consultant for the Fox Searchlab Writer/Director Program; and as in-house consultant to Paramount Pictures Television Studios. He has an impressive award history that includes being recipient of the 2019 Artios Award for Outstanding Achievement in Casting - Short Film for, The Lost' , a 2015 coveted Palme d'Or Award and 2017 Independent Spirit Award Nominee for Best Picture. His long list of festival films includes Official Entries at the Venice Film Festival, TIFF, Sundance, SXSW, Austin Film Festival, San Sebastián, and the Los Angeles Film Festival. He has cast productions/co-productions for Australia, Canada, Dominican Republic, Germany, Greece, Italy, Mexico, Netherlands and the UK. Matthew is a member of BAFTA and has served  on the National Board of the Casting Society of America, including as its former President. 
  • Our 1st AD, Rita Krasniqi, is a Kosovar writer, director and cinematographer. She finished her undergraduate studies for Film and TV Directing at the University of Prishtina in Kosovo. Now she is finishing her graduate studies at New York Film Academy for Film and Media Productions. She's written and directed five short films with the subject matter concentrating on human rights, LGBTQI community and gender equality. Apart from writing and directing, Rita has worked on numerous sets as an assistant director, casting director, production coordinator and script supervisor. She has been trained to organize, manage and coordinate productions to run smoothly and accordingly.   
  • This is all to say: you can trust us with your contribution. We have managed budgets 20 times this amount, we have successfully worked with A-List talent, we have a long list of successful films that have gone on to engage audiences worldwide, and you will enjoy real pride in knowing that you supported two exceptional women artists, who with great integrity, are committed to community. 

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Television and film production, even on a small scale, are not a walk in the park. There are hundreds of details that go into every show, and this team knows how to deal with all of them. We came together to make this show because we all have one dynamic personality trait in common: We never ever EVER give up. Dr. Detox will be an incredible success because we will ensure that.
  • Finally, both of us have significant ties to the indie, and studio level production communities. In short, we have enormous support so barring an Act of God, or other catastrophe, this project will get made, and it will get made well, and it will premiere in some amazing festival, and it will get sold for BILLIONS! Okay, okay, we'll aim for millions - aim for the moon and falling amongst the stars is our motto!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help :)

  • Other ways we could use your support: We will need meals for the cast & crew: fresh & hearty breakfast, lunch and/or dinner. Camera equipment, truck rentals, and a Los Angeles location.  And of course, the more you share this with your friends, and people you believe to be supporters of the arts, and would be inspired by our story we would be eternally grateful. It takes a community to build a successful society, and it takes one to make a successful project!
story_txt:
Short Summary

Roberta, writer/director, has been in the film industry for over 25 years: programming film festivals, writing "the bible" for short filmmakers "How To Make A Short Film: Secrets From A Sundance Programmer, and directing and producing over 50 film projects and TV pilots.
We are raising a modest amount of money to cover a 3 day production, focusing on keeping the number of locations, and characters manageable, and the STORY value high. We are creating a project that ensures you realize just how much this issue matters to you. We all want the space to laugh at ourselves and address the issues: Judgment suffocates growth.
Your contribution will support an exceptionally well crafted work, made by mostly women of color who believe in our collective ability to transform the pain and suffering we live with into a bright, funny, insightful story of real transformation. Women falter, men falter, and we owe it to ourselves to create a  bridge that leads to loving action with a drive to create real community. Your support means everything and Dr. Detox is a dream come true for this team!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are raising $30,000 (or more!) to secure our outstanding SAG-AFRTA actors, our highly qualified veteran crew, equipment rentals, fresh and local food, transportation, and one house location in Los Angeles. We'll be shooting our project for three days utilizing weekend rental rates, and ensuring we get the highest quality group of people on board.
Once the filming is complete, we will then need to pay for post-production costs that would include: editing, sound mixing and design, and music licensing. With all our connections in this industry, you have our word that we will find the best deals to spend our budget wisely. 
Our perks! They all speak to the enormous talent and support we have on board this project! If you're a filmmaker, we've got you with indie support perks, social media shout outs for your projects and if you're a film lover, we've got the fun stuff: mugs, posters, legal advice, and on-set visits! 


The Impact

I, Roberta, want the impact of this show to be something you cannot wait to BINGE! I'll take a not often seen deep dive into "toxic masculinity". I believe that without vulnerable loving action you are left with half the story! Dr. Detox will have some comedic moments, but it is about real issues we face on the daily. The show will answer these sometimes catastrophic questions with laughter, and honesty: How do we as a community support men during the hardest times in their lives without eviscerating them? How do men & women see themselves and support each other when their worlds are falling apart? How do we laugh at ourselves, and also get the help we need? No dragging allowed.
This creative team has over 25 years of filmmaking experience! Our writer/director Roberta Munroe has written/directed and/or produced several award-winning projects that have premiered at top tier festivals:  Sundance, Tribeca, DC, Hollyshorts (LA), BFI London, Venice and hundreds more. She also produced The Parker Tribe, mulitple award-winner at the New York Film & Television Festival, and The Procession which was chosen for theatrical release! She produced several AT&T Hello Lab projects (check the links below), programmed short film at Sundance for 5 years, and has successfully championed 100's of artists on the path to making their dreams come true.

Our producer, Reiko Napier joins this team fresh from overseeing all forms of production from digital to film with top industry companies Endemol and Vertical Networks garnering millions of views and awards. Most recently her work has resided in unscripted comedic formats with rising comedians for top social platforms YouTube, Facebook and Snapchat. Beyond her background in comedy, her experience also lies within social impact which can be seen with her work for the popular millennial publisher ATTN:.
Our Casting Director, Matthew Lessall, C.S.A., was born in London, raised in New York, educated in Indiana and London, and is now based in Los Angeles. Matthew’s life and casting experiences are equally diverse. Having cast successful, international, award-winning projects for film, television and new media, in the form of features, pilots, and series, his primary recognition is on the indie film front. Matthew has also worked at major networks and studios, as Director of Feature Film Casting at 20th Century Fox; in-house casting consultant for the Fox Searchlab Writer/Director Program; and as in-house consultant to Paramount Pictures Television Studios. He has an impressive award history that includes being recipient of the 2019 Artios Award for Outstanding Achievement in Casting - Short Film for, The Lost' , a 2015 coveted Palme d'Or Award and 2017 Independent Spirit Award Nominee for Best Picture. His long list of festival films includes Official Entries at the Venice Film Festival, TIFF, Sundance, SXSW, Austin Film Festival, San Sebastián, and the Los Angeles Film Festival. He has cast productions/co-productions for Australia, Canada, Dominican Republic, Germany, Greece, Italy, Mexico, Netherlands and the UK. Matthew is a member of BAFTA and has served  on the National Board of the Casting Society of America, including as its former President. 
Our 1st AD, Rita Krasniqi, is a Kosovar writer, director and cinematographer. She finished her undergraduate studies for Film and TV Directing at the University of Prishtina in Kosovo. Now she is finishing her graduate studies at New York Film Academy for Film and Media Productions. She's written and directed five short films with the subject matter concentrating on human rights, LGBTQI community and gender equality. Apart from writing and directing, Rita has worked on numerous sets as an assistant director, casting director, production coordinator and script supervisor. She has been trained to organize, manage and coordinate productions to run smoothly and accordingly.   

This is all to say: you can trust us with your contribution. We have managed budgets 20 times this amount, we have successfully worked with A-List talent, we have a long list of successful films that have gone on to engage audiences worldwide, and you will enjoy real pride in knowing that you supported two exceptional women artists, who with great integrity, are committed to community. 


 
Risks & Challenges

Television and film production, even on a small scale, are not a walk in the park. There are hundreds of details that go into every show, and this team knows how to deal with all of them. We came together to make this show because we all have one dynamic personality trait in common: We never ever EVER give up. Dr. Detox will be an incredible success because we will ensure that.
Finally, both of us have significant ties to the indie, and studio level production communities. In short, we have enormous support so barring an Act of God, or other catastrophe, this project will get made, and it will get made well, and it will premiere in some amazing festival, and it will get sold for BILLIONS! Okay, okay, we'll aim for millions - aim for the moon and falling amongst the stars is our motto!

 

Other Ways You Can Help
We know some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help :)
Other ways we could use your support: We will need meals for the cast & crew: fresh & hearty breakfast, lunch and/or dinner. Camera equipment, truck rentals, and a Los Angeles location.  And of course, the more you share this with your friends, and people you believe to be supporters of the arts, and would be inspired by our story we would be eternally grateful. It takes a community to build a successful society, and it takes one to make a successful project!

story:
Fifty Shades of Perfect Melanin

Season 1 trailer: 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=baGlst48QLo

Episode 1:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0U6iA3jiadI

My name is Phillip Rice. Creator and director of the newest web series that has everyone feeling as if the story line hits right at home. I created this web series to shed light on the reality of how hard it is in finding true love and appreciation from a partner. This campaign is extremely important to myself and my team for the purpose of educating everyone on the daily trials and tribulations we all face when trying to find love. From vulnerability, compassion, understanding, emotional hurt, and the risk we take to ensure our hearts are fulfilled. All while trying to protect ourselves from the pain we receive when those factors come up short in our search for a partner. We have successfully launched a season 1 trailer as well as episode 1, to show viewers the quality of content we will continue to produce. With the help of donations we can finish filming season 1 & ensure to maintain the highest level of production possible. Please help us continue and finish our remarkable journey with a donation. It is not easy funding a project of this magnitude without financial help.  We are looking to finish filming season 1 with the hopes of launching the web serious by mid August. Our content is original and full of suspense that has caught the eye of many already from our release of season 1 trailer as well as episode 1. No matter how small all contributions are greatly appreciated and will help us complete our journey.​

Our campaign direction

  • To complete season 1 our project is in need of roughly $15k in funding. We have already started this journey on our own and have provided successful production at its highest form. A donation no matter how small will continue to assist us in delivering nothing less then expectations that have been already fulfilled. By contributing to this project you are assisting with contributing to a never before seen production of film that holds a ton a originality and exciting footage. Guaranteed to have you wanting more. If our goal is not met all contributions will directed in use towards are ares of need. Such as filming locations, production turn around time, casting and more. We aim to fulfill our campaign request for the purpose of ensuring viewer complete satisfaction. No one person contribution is better then the next. All assistance is beyond appreciated and we would like to thank you in advance.

Brief Reminder

  • Yes a financial contribution is greatly appreciated but for those whom may be unable to donate money. Can still assist with the campaign by sharing and telling a friend about the creative and satisfying production. Below you will find a link for a sample viewing of what the cast of Fifty Shades of Perfect Melanin has already worked hard to deliver.

Thank you for your time regarding this campaign and film project. Please continue to help us push. Remember, all contributions help no matter how small and if you would like to contribute but are unable to financially you can ensure to tell a friend about our campaign and make sure to share our campaign on are social media sights as well as sharing via Indiegogo share tools. 

-BLESSINGS-

story:
First, Credit Where Credit is Due!

Doctor Who, its concepts and characters are the intellectual property of the British Broadcasting Corporation. This is not an official BBC/Doctor Who production. We claim no rights to the concepts or characters of Doctor Who. This is entirely a not-for-profit, fan-produced production. The Doctor Who: CSR team respectfully and graciously wants to say “Thank you!” to the BBC for understanding the passion fans have for this series and for allowing creative outlets for fan-based, non-profit productions of all types over the years.

Who We Are!

Temporal Orbit Films, LLC., is a dedicated group of both people with (literally) decades of creative film, video, theater, and writing experience and some first-time volunteers looking to gain production experience. However, we all have one thing in common… A love of classic Doctor Who and passion for film making and the creative process. (Images below taken during production of the trailer.)

This Adventure!

What dangers have the Doctor and Sarah Jane gotten into now? In our planned first adventure, "Mind Bomb", the TARDIS lands on a seemingly derelict spaceship where our duo suddenly find themselves separated from each other and wind up in a struggle to keep control of their own sanity! Will the Doctor and Sarah Jane be able to survive this peril? Well... that could depend on the success of this fundraiser!

                 

This traditional 2 x 25-30 minute adventure was written by Jonithan Patrick Russell. Jon, along with being an excellent writer, was also a 2018 Parsec Award nominee for work on his original, and very entertaining sci-fi audio series "Robotz of the Company" (produced by Dream Realm Enterprises). 

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise $7,000 for this production. You may by thinking, "Wow! That's a lot just for a fan production". However, we want to create a production that you would watch and believe came out of the BBC studios, circa the 1970s. To do this, we know that production costs can and will add up fast. These costs include:

  • Full size set construction of multiple spaceship & TARDIS interiors. (No green screening.)
  • Studio rental... We have to have space to build the sets and produce the episodes.
  • Professional grade production equipment rental (cameras, lighting, audio)
  • Costuming
  • Prop creation...Including a full-sized police box.
  • Original music score
  • Post production costs
  • Indigogo and other processing fees
  • Taxes
  • And especially to you, our supporters, production and shipping of your promised perks!

Again, we want to emphasize that this is a not-for-profit production.  Every donation that we receive will be put into the directly into hard production costs at every level. It is our promise that we will be 100% transparent about where every dollar of your donation will go.

        Check out the FAQ section for other information about pledging your support!

Risks & Challenges

With any project there is always the possibility of delays and setbacks. The largest setback we face currently is if our fundraising efforts fall through.

Setbacks during production can and will happen, but we will tackle those as they come. Luckily, we are blessed with a highly talented and experienced crew of film/video production professionals and first-time volunteers that are driven and dedicated to seeing this project through if this fundraiser is successful. As issues might arise, you will be informed on the progress of the production. Your pledge of support shows your desire for this production to succeed and we never want to disappoint any of our supporters.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that it is not always possible to donate, but you can still help out. Tell any Doctor Who or sci-fi fan about us! Share this page and our Facebook page! The more people know about us the more likely this project will be a great success!

story:
Logline

When a Doctor discovers her ability to bring the dead to life, she believes to be blessed by God. But are her powers too good to be true?

 

Synopsis

June prays every day for her sister to wake from an indefinite coma. Feeling alone and helpless, God is the last hope she clings to. After a sudden accident, she discovers that her prayers have been answered; possessing an extraordinary gift of resurrection. However she does not yet know the extent of her powers, could she save her sister?

 

Inspiration and the Bigger Picture

Touch of June is the first in a webseries that tells a greater story through the eyes of different characters. Each Two-Part story is told with a new protagonist, weaving and entwining each smaller narrative together, crossing paths and joining up to reveal the bigger picture.

The main inspiration actually comes from the Goosebumps Horrorland book series; each book’s story is told from someone new, but a small section at the end combines the stories into a larger narrative at Horrorland itself.

 

A short promo video is on it's way, but for now here are some visual references for the tone and style of the film:

 

Writer/Director 

 Deaglán Brennan

Deaglán likes to write. In particular, he likes to write screenplays. He likes it so much that he secured a place as a writer on the BFIs Craft Skills Residential, hosted by the National Film and Television School, with his film ‘Silver’. He was also chosen for the BAFTA Mentoring Scheme, with Screenwriter Adrian Hodges as his mentor. Currently finishing a degree in Digital Film Making, Deaglán is brimming with ambitious ideas that are just waiting to get themselves down on that paper.

 

Producer

Graham Michael Roberts

"Having worked on both low budget and High budget productions, I have come to understand the ins and outs of the Production Department. Being both a low budget producer aswell as a Studio Feature Production Assistant, I get to see both sides of the coin when it comes to creativity. Being part of this film gives me the freedom to make both mine and the Director's vision come true. I'M also an NFTS BFI Alumini." This is Graham's first outing as a Producer and already the project is making great strides through Pre-production.

 

Cinematographer

Joseph Nowell 

Joseph Herridge-Nowell is a filmmaker based in Norwich Norfolk, working freelance as a Camera Trainee and Camera Assistant on short film productions, documentaries and commercial work while DP’ing on personal projects. He also works in technical theatre lighting. Joseph is a graduate of both the BFI Future Film Academy and the National Film and Television School Craft Residential programme. As a result producing two short films that premiered in London at the BFI Southbank then went on to screen at The Barbican Centre during the 'Focus Film Festival' and the 21st 'Portobello Film Festival’.

 

Production Designer 

Milly Zoe Wild

"I am the production designer for Touch of June, I design and put together the sets for all the different scenes in the film. My challenge for June is creating a convincing hospital setting that is true to life but also conveys the eeriness and unnatural events that take place. I have worked on many short films in the past as well as assisting the art department on music videos and adverts. I am fascinated by how creating a space can give clues about the story and characters."

story:
Short Summary

The Cargo is the semi-autobiographical, altogether debauched misadventures of four buddies who cavort, carouse, and carnally consort their way through their late 20's in a Staten Island bar populated by a motley collection of kooks, oddballs, crackpots, fetishists, and one New York City fireman who once got arrested for drunkenly exposing his hose in a hotel elevator, eternally traumatizing the lovely Midwestern family who encountered him. 

We are looking for your help to fund our second episode and beyond.

What We Need & What You Get

We need roughly 5k to scrape together our 2nd episode. More would be great... 

Every dollar from you glorious people gets us one step closer to getting this bad boy off the ground, and that would mean the world to this crazy group of misfits toys

We will have some special prizes for those who contribute big money to this campaign. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We do have a Bonfire campaign set up as well, so please click on over to check out some of our swag in our online store! https://www.bonfire.com/store/the-cargo-merch/

Please share and help us spread the word!

story:
I'm having a baby! 

A YouTube channel baby

Well its like a baby...as I'll be devoting my time, energy, and love to it.  All this, but without the diapers.  I'm raising funds that will go to a DSLR camera, mic, and other gear to support the channel. I'm so excited and grateful to have your support.

The first 10 people to donate will be entered in a raffle to win a super secret prize!

 

Other ways to support:

Share the campaign with your friends

Pre-subscribe to the channel - right now its a placeholder but will add content soon!

Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC5baTYYFOKI_fV...

Follow the corresponding Instagram page: https://www.instagram.com/pinkcap_design/

 

The Pinkcap Design channel will include User Experience Design (UX) tutorials, UX design challenges, and other fun design videos.

 

Thank you!

Charlene
