story:
Are you passionate about friendship, inclusivity, social justice, spirituality, and millennial culture?

Do you love a diverse, fun comedy?

Would you enjoy watching good looking, but relatable people?

If so, you'll love our upcoming series called Prospect Park soon to be streaming on Black Oak TV!

About us:

Prospect Park was originally created in the beginning of 2019.

The pilot script went on to win Best Screenplay at the Hip Hop Film Festival NYC.

From there the Prospect Park team was able to pitch the show to Revolt TV and Theo Rossi.

We were then courted by a new streaming service called Black Oak TV, and will premiere on their platform in the latter part of this year.

Currently we are filming 8 episodes for your enjoyment!

Creator:

Courtni Saizon, the creator of Prospect Park Series is originally from New Orleans, La.

Ever since she was little she loved telling stories (not lies lol) by acting in plays.

Eventually she started writing. 

In 2016 she formed her inclusive multi-media  production company Fragile Wildflower Productions.

She hopes to continue to create fun, compelling content, with diverse storylines.

Courtni ensures she casts actors and hires crew from a myriad of backgrounds as everyone has something unique to bring to the table.

What we'd like from you:

Ladies and Gents,

The moment you've all been waiting for...

Here's your chance to support Prospect Park Series!

Any and all donations you make go toward our filming happening NOW, May 4-11th!

We have an incredible team of actors and film crew working on our series.

We also have post production editing to do that enables us to deliver an amazing show for your viewing pleasure.

Please follow @ProspectParkSeries and @ProspectParkTVShow on Instagram, and @ProspectParkSeries on Facebook.

Lastly, we'd love for you to share this campaign to spread the word, as all are welcome in our diversely intriguing Prospect Park Series world!
story_txt: Are you passionate about friendship, inclusivity, social justice, spirituality, and millennial culture?Do you love a diverse, fun comedy?Would you enjoy watching good looking, but relatable people?If so, you'll love our upcoming series called Prospect Park soon to be streaming on Black Oak TV!About us:Prospect Park was originally created in the beginning of 2019.The pilot script went on to win Best Screenplay at the Hip Hop Film Festival NYC.From there the Prospect Park team was able to pitch the show to Revolt TV and Theo Rossi.We were then courted by a new streaming service called Black Oak TV, and will premiere on their platform in the latter part of this year.Currently we are filming 8 episodes for your enjoyment!Creator:Courtni Saizon, the creator of Prospect Park Series is originally from New Orleans, La.Ever since she was little she loved telling stories (not lies lol) by acting in plays.Eventually she started writing. In 2016 she formed her inclusive multi-media  production company Fragile Wildflower Productions.She hopes to continue to create fun, compelling content, with diverse storylines.Courtni ensures she casts actors and hires crew from a myriad of backgrounds as everyone has something unique to bring to the table.What we'd like from you:Ladies and Gents,The moment you've all been waiting for...Here's your chance to support Prospect Park Series!Any and all donations you make go toward our filming happening NOW, May 4-11th!We have an incredible team of actors and film crew working on our series.We also have post production editing to do that enables us to deliver an amazing show for your viewing pleasure.Please follow @ProspectParkSeries and @ProspectParkTVShow on Instagram, and @ProspectParkSeries on Facebook.Lastly, we'd love for you to share this campaign to spread the word, as all are welcome in our diversely intriguing Prospect Park Series world!

story:
Check out our brand new website here!

Company Mission: 

The Beer Dabbler exists to elevate the craft beer industry and connect beer lovers with craft beer brands to forge lasting bonds, increase consumer education, and broaden brand awareness.

What are we aiming to do? 

The Beer Dabbler began hosting beer festivals in Minnesota in 2008 and has been connecting the Midwest craft beer community with breweries big and small ever since. In 2012, the company launched its own magazine, The Growler, to cover the beer scene. Now, with the shuttering of the magazine in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic, we are aiming to relaunch the Beer Dabbler as your go-to source for all things beer: brewery news, beer reviews, exclusive interviews with industry members, events coverage, limited edition beer merchandise, and more. 

As a part of this relaunch, The Beer Dabbler is kickstarting a brand new video department with a commitment of bringing our viewers exclusive video content that showcases all that the Midwest’s vibrant craft beer scene has to offer. Our goal is to make videos that capture the fun-loving, adventurous spirit of beer culture for brew geeks and newbies alike.

But in order to accomplish this goal, we are in need of financial support to help get our new video programming off the ground. Our crowdfunding campaign will help us raise the funds necessary to support our video department and our overall pivot as a brand into content creators. 

Why Should I Support This Project?

The economic downturn resulting from COVID-19 has taken its toll on the entire beer industry, including us at Gray Duck Media. Safety concerns and regulations have placed the future of our 2021 events in serious jeopardy, and with it, the revenue that we rely on to keep the Beer Dabbler in business. As a result, our company needs your support now more than ever.

We are doing everything we can to keep the Beer Dabbler alive until we are able to safely host large-scale festivals again, and we are hoping to fill the content void left by The Growler Magazine and deliver the news and stories beer drinkers are thirsty for. Your support will help us thrive into the next phase of our business.

story:
Short Summary

AAW was going to be filming a studio style web called series "Fight For The Future" on Saturday, March 28th from a closed set that will air weekly in April on all of our streaming platforms for FREE.

Due to the shelter in place issued by the State of Illinois, we can no longer film this series.

It is no secret that the COVID-19 outbreak is affecting everyone. We want to give back to the performers, especially those who do not have a guaranteed contract. Most of them rely solely on wrestling to pay their bills and others supplement their income with wrestling.

Even the smallest of donations will help.

Other Ways You Can Help

Visit prowrestlingtees.com and buy merchandise that goes directly to the wrestlers.

story:
Hello! I'm Lyralen Kaye and I want to tell you a little about Assigned Female at Birth, A Web Series about Some Bodies.

First, we've won best web series/new media in 6 film festivals since January of 2021!

We have thousands of views on YouTube.

In order to help this happen when we had a shortfall, Teddy Howland offered us matching funds in November of 2020. We hit our original goal of $1500 and went on to raise $4000 more to fund Season 2.

Season 3 is now in preproduction with an on line reading of the script scheduled for August 1. And for the first time, we will be incorporating higher end cameras and in-person shoots.

How did we do the series in the pandemic? The series itself was born out of our need to tell stories while keeping 100% safe about our health, AFAB necessitated a journey through cyber space into the hearts and minds of people across the United States, Canada, the UK, Australia and Mexico. We filmed everything remotely on smart phones with actors in their own homes and crew on zoom for 2 seasons.

The first two seasons were based on 32 interviews (I've now done 50+) with people who have been taught from birth that their bodies can never be good enough. Not able enough, not straight enough, not cis enough, not thin enough, not white enough, not gay enough, not femme enough, not butch enough, not young enough...the list goes on. All feel invisible—from the gender fluid Asian lesbian born with a fibular hemimelia disability to the blind ballet dancer, from the women fighting clinical depression to the rabbi on the spectrum who is also a cancer survivor, from the preschool teacher to the non-binary person with multiple personalities—they struggle to be seen. And whether the prejudice they fight is ableism or racism, homophobia or misogyny, whether they seek healing from #metoo issues, prejudice or disabilities they’ve had since birth, they reach for life with courage. They are bold, frightened , vulnerable and ridiculously strong.

They are, above all things, woke.

They are my people, my community, the only place I call home...and I want them to be that place for you too, no matter your gender or orientation, your ability or your age.

For too long, these stories have not been not heard anywhere in the mainstream, and besides the oppression that implies, it is a terrible loss, because having an outlier identity means you have to unpack what it means to be human in order to both survive and thrive. And then you have so much to teach, and so many ways to laugh at the absurdity and the pain of being human.

We are in a crucial time in history. Art and stories hold us to empathy, to a growing understanding, to an ability to connect.

This is a world changing project, and we want you to be part of it.

We also want to move beyond our first 2 seasons into a deeper ongoing examination of these lives, and to pay cast and crew equally, according to SAG-AFTRA guidelines, moving forward.

We believe this is crucially important.

Why? Because this project represents unheard voices telling human stories of struggling to accept the bodies in which they live...a struggle we all have in this culture. Because loving our bodies is a way to love the earth, to find peace...and art inspires empathy, compassion, passion, commitment to the core issues of our lives in a way political rhetoric approximates.

It's important because we, those of us creating this project, those of us interviewed for this project, are among the most at risk. It's important because telling our stories is a way to overcome our fear of being hurt and in doing so to love the world and offer connection to our communities.

It's important because we've been trolled on FB and YouTube since the very first day, and we want to sing against that hate.

It's important because you are part of this, and we are one world and one people.

Please give. Please spread the world. Please watch the videos and the series. We hope to make you laugh and cry.

Nuts and Bolts: Please do visit and like and subscribe!

Our YouTube channel:

https://www.youtube.com/c/AnotherCountryTV

Our first episode:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=egcDfCDBQWs&amp........

 

Help us make more!

We appreciate whatever you can do!

Be well, stay safe. We wish you peace.

Lyralen Kaye, fae/faire, they/them

Jude Sclarsky, e, eir

Nelda Quigley, she/her

Tina D'Elia, she/her

Alex Alexander, she/her

 

How we're doing it? The technology?

I'm a push-the-envelope person, so as the writing moved along, I started asking directors of photography if we could film remotely and still create the illusion that characters were relating in the same world. And we decided to try. So our actors are spread across the country and most have never met in 3D!

For Season 3, we have our first opportunity to film fully vaxxed and in person. This is likely to triple our budget...but it will be so worth it.

We appreciate everything you do!!!!

story:
Short Summary

It all begins with a legend, the Legend of the 46 Norman soldiers that with the help of Saint George killed 3000 Arabs in a single night in 1063. After that fateful night, Sicily became an easy conquest for the military forces of France. A fight between two great religions that brings back the conflict to our present days.

From this legend, this new Thermopylae, a new hero is born in Cerami: Serlon The Warlord!
The French are more than happy at the court of Jerax, in the heart of Sicily, and celebrating.

 

It doesn’t take long for the infidels to be banished from the island. Benavert, emir of Syracuse, the last to fall, plotted against the Normans by sending Prince Ibrahim asking for armistice.

[Italian]

Tutto ebbe inizio con una leggenda, la Leggenda dei 46 soldati normanni che con l’aiuto di San Giorgio sconfissero 3000 arabi in una sola notte. Dopo quella notte fatidica la Sicilia divenne facile conquista per le forze militari francesi. Una lotta tra due grandi religioni che riportano il conflitto al presente.

Da questa leggenda, queste nuove Termopili, nacque un nuovo eroe a Cerami: Serlon Il Condottiero!

Non ci volle troppo tempo che gli infedeli venissero banditi dall’isola. I francesi festeggiavano felici, alla corte di Jerax, nel cuore della Sicilia, fu allora che Benavert, emiro di Siracusa, l’ultimo a cadere, tesse un complotto contro i normanni inviando il Principe Ibrahim con una richiesta di armistizio.

About project

A web series composed by 7 episodes of 10 minutes each. 70 minutes to tell an unknown Sicily. A land of innovations, where the rocky mountains became castles for us to explore, the Madonie. 

The events are juxtaposed with short digressions called Indictus (literally, what is not told) that subvert the storyline and provide two different points of view: the classic tale narrated by the winners and the one of the defeated.

[Italian]
 

Una web serie composta da 7 episodi di 10 minuti l’uno. 70 minuti per raccontare una Sicilia sconosciuta, terra di innovazione, dove montagne rocciose diventano castelli da esplorare, le Madonie.

Gli eventi narrati sono intermezzati da brevi digressioni chiamate Indictus (letteralmente, quello che non è detto) che sconvolgono la trama dando 2 differenti punti di vista: quello classico narrato dai vincenti e quello degli sconfitti.

 

The Team

 

     Director  Francesco Dinolfo

     Writer Marianna Lopizzo

    Coach Actor Santi Ciccardo

    Costume design Francesco Mocchia di Coggiola, Ilaria Turchetti

 

The Impact

Indictus is born from a 1000 years long story that began when Northen people crossed Europe to get to this exotic island, at times when the Pillars of Hercules were considered to be the World’s border.

In Sicily you will find the most warm and welcoming people, descendants of viking explorers’ curiosity and arabian merchants’ speech.

We know hidden places we want to show and we know stories you won’t find in books; and these places and stories need to be brought back to life. You might find them in our language, in our food and in our habits and we want to share these things, because the land is no one’s. 

We belong to a land of people, a land of welcome that shouldn’t be the graveyard of any sailor.

[Italian]

Indictus nasce da una storia millenaria iniziata quando i popoli del Nord hanno attraversato l’Europa per giungere a questa isola esotica, in un tempo in cui le Colonne d’Ercole erano considerate i confini del mondo.

In Sicilia troverai persone calorose e accoglienti, discendenti della della curiosità dei navigatori vichinghi e della dialettica dei mercanti arabi.

Conosciamo luoghi nascosti che vorremmo mostrarti, storie che non troverai nei libri; questi luoghi e queste storie hanno bisogno di essere riportate in vita. Perché la ritroviamo ogni giorno nella nostra lingua, nella nostra cucina, nei nostri modi di fare e vogliamo condividere queste cose, perché la terra non è di nessuno. Apparteniamo a una terra di popoli diversi, una terra di accoglienza che non dovrebbe essere la tomba di nessun navigatore.

What we need & what you get

We need your help to bring these story to life. We want to show you these incredible locations and that’s why we have plenty of gifts for you!

We are looking for executive producers as brave as our main character, Serlon!


Film Commission Sicilia already joined us together with other important brands who believe in this project.

You might win the chance to spend your holidays in Sicily in the places where Indictus will be shot, admiring the Aeolian Islands from the top of the wild mountains of the Madonie and feeling like the king of Sicily for a few days!

Contribute to our project and become part of this amazing story!

http://www.indictus.it

[Italian]

Abbiamo bisogno del tuo aiuto per portare in vita questa storia. Vogliamo mostrarti queste locations fantastiche ed è per questo che abbiamo dei doni speciali proprio per te!

Cerchiamo executive producers coraggiosi almeno quanto Serlon, il nostro protagonista!
La Film Commission Sicilia si è già unita a noi assieme ad altri importanti brand che credono in questo progetto.

Potresti passare le tue vacanze proprio qui, in Sicilia, nei luoghi dove Indictus verrà girato!
Potrai ammirare le Isole Eolie dalle montagne delle Madonie e sentirti il Re della Sicilia per qualche giorno!

Contribuisci al nostro progetto e diventa parte di questa incredibile storia!

story:
ESPAÑOL

En nuestra intención de dar a conocer el verdadero mundo del DragQueen, hemos hecho creado este proyecto. Nuestra pasión es potenciar el talento de los DragQueen locales y acercar a más personas que conozcan esta disciplina.

Todo nuestro proyecto es autosugestión y hemos puesto todo el dinero posible para entregar un producto de calidad, es por eso que aun debemos cubrir varios items de producción y nuestros recursos se agotaron y creemos que tu aporte será fundamental para finalizar como corresponde nuestro proyecto.

NECESITAMOS REUNIR US3.500.-

 

Este es el monto que necesitamos cubrir para finalizar nuestra producción. Con esto podremos pagar a los técnicos que trabajaran en las filmaciones, podremos pagar la post producción de cada capítulo y aportar en parte a los premios de los participantes

TODO APORTE NOS SIRVE

Si no completamos la meta, el dinero que se reúna será un gran aporte, por lo mismo estaremos agradecidos de todo lo que se consiga. 
 

SERÁS PARTE DE UN GRAN PROYECTO

 Como colaborador pondremos tu nombre en los créditos de cada capitulo, ademas recibirás un set que incluye una camiseta, cofee mug y un bolso de nuestro programa.

¿Pero en que harás la diferencia?

En que estarás participando en un proyecto que mostrará la cara artística del DragQueen y sus diferentes exponentes en Chile.
 

EL DESAFÍO

Este proyecto esta en marcha, por lo cual de alguna u otra forma lo terminaremos como corresponde, ahora si, tu ayuda será un apoyo más para poder conseguir el éxito. 

 

ENGLISH

We have created this project because we intend to show the real world behind the art of Drag, We feel passionate about enhancing the talents of local chilean DragQueen and bringing new audiences to this discipline.

Our project is completely independent and we have placed our personal funds and hard work to bring it to life, Bit we have yet to cover several production items, but our resources have depleted, that is why we believe that your contribution will be fundamental to finalizing this project.
 

WE NEED US3,500.-

This is the amount we need to finish our production. With this we will be able to pay the technicians that worked in the filming, and we will also be able to cover the post production costs of each epsidoe, and contribute in part to the prizes of the participants.

ALL CONTRIBUTIONS ARE VALUABLE

If we do not complete the goal, the money that we gather will be a great contribution, so we will be grateful for any financial support we receive.

 

YOU WILL BE PART OF A GREAT PROJECT
As a collaborator we will put your name in the credits of each episode; in addition you will receive a set that includes a t-shirt, a coffee mug and a bag from our show.

But how will you make a the difference?

By supporting and taking part in a project that will show a more artistic face of the art of drag and support directly different drag queens from Chile.

THE CHALLENGE
This project is already on it's way, and for this reason we will properly finish it one way or another. But your contribution will fasten the pace and help us be successful at our goal.

Todo nuestro proyecto es autosugestión y hemos puesto todo el dinero posible para entregar un producto de calidad, es por eso que aun debemos cubrir varios items de producción y nuestros recursos se agotaron y creemos que tu aporte será fundamental para finalizar como corresponde nuestro proyecto.

NECESITAMOS REUNIR US3.500.- Este es el monto que necesitamos cubrir para finalizar nuestra producción. Con esto podremos pagar a los técnicos que trabajaran en las filmaciones, podremos pagar la post producción de cada capítulo y aportar en parte a los premios de los participantes

Si no completamos la meta, el dinero que se reúna será un gran aporte, por lo mismo estaremos agradecidos de todo lo que se consiga.

story:
HELLO

Tony Tambi, Constance Ejuma and Bambadjan Bamba are the production team behind Con$equences; a web series that follows the lives of culturally diverse con artists. However, unlike other similarly themed shows, this one is anchored by reformed Yahoo Boys (think “Nigerian Prince” type email scams).

Most of us have either heard about or received solicitations from scammers like the Yahoo Boys, so as characters they are well known and intriguing, but never fully explored on TV, movies or in a web series. We want to change that, not only because it provides a different perspective of the immigrant experience in the US, but also because it makes for great storytelling!

Needless to say Con$equences isn’t just a web series about reformed con artists, it deals with familiar themes like love, friendship, betrayal, revenge, family and cultural identity.

WHO is in the Cast & Crew?

Tony Tambi    Bambadjan Bamba  Constance Ejuma

 

Eboni Adams       John Tague

Jarvis George     Samantha Stewart

Irvin Liu - DP        Ari Dassa - Editor

WHAT do we have?  

Episode 1: Yahoo Boys/Con Men. We were able to fund and produce this episode entirely on our own. If you haven't already, check it out below:

WHAT do we need?

$18,000 to cover Production Costs that include: 

WHAT do you get? 

  • Episode 1: Yahoo Boys/Con Men 

An additional Six Episodes

  • Episode 2: Help Me Help You
  • Episode 3: Halfway Crooks
  • Episode 4: Tell Me A Story
  • Episode 5: Oliver Twist
  • Episode 6: Show Me The Money (Part 1)
  • Episode 7: Show Me The Money (Part 2)

Plus A Ton of Perks

It's all about relationships. Look to the right to see what we have, but do feel free to reach out and tell us what you want.

WHEN & WHERE

  1. Crowdfund on Indiegogo in May & June 2017.
  2. Pre-production in Los Angeles May, June & July 2017.
  3. Shoot over a 2 week period in July 2017.
  4. Post-production in July & August 2017.
  5. Episodes will begin to air on YouTube in September 2017.

HOW else can you help?

We understand that not everyone can always help out financially. Your time and support are of immense value to us and there are a couple of things you could do that will help us reach our goal:

  • Share our campaign with your friends, family and social media network.
  • Follow us on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram and YouTube.

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, I'm Saycsar Fleurima (as many of you already know). I am working on this romantic thriller mini-series. We are currently recording our pilot and will update on here but this summer we would like to film and distribute the rest of this mini-series (around 8-10 episodes). With your help, you can springboard the career for a very talented group of SF Bay Area based young artists as well as be a part of the series yourself. Fiscal donations are not the only way you can help but even a dollar means a lot to us! We love volunteers/extras, locations, permission for locations/borrowing props and/or costumes, 

What We Need & What You Get

Production Costs:

- supplies for building sets and props, 

- insurance

- travel

- pay for actors and crew

Distribution:

- entrance fee for festivals

- set up for the soundtrack concert/premiere

- screening at local theaters

- DVD/Digital Copy

- rights for music and images

BY HELPING:

You may be listed as a producer, have a role as an extra, be a part of a series behind the scenes, receive tickets to the premiere and concert and a copy for yourself and other perks (T-Shirt, autograph poster, etc)

The Impact

The cast and I are all a talented group of men and women from all kinds of background who are hoping that you can help springboard careers and support challenging, vibrant, unique art from SF Bay Area artists. I am in school for filmmaking but have been practicing my craft for close to ten years, rarely seeing myself do something else. 

Risks & Challenges

We are hoping to make this as streamlined as possible but given the nature of the craft, we may not be able to stick to deadlines but we are of our word and will take that time to present something of quality. I'd rather have a project be delayed but done impeccably then presenting something half baked on time. We value transparency and will keep you up to date. We want to make this production a family affair! 

As well, we may go over budget but hoping we don't. I am very confident in the ability of all of us and we will be able to make the difference. By helping out, you are opening the door for grander projects in the future - such as my next project a feature film. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Spread the Word!

donate your volunteer time or a location/costumes/props! 

Even a dollar is appreciated

And that's all there is to it :)

story:
WOW! Thank you for helping us get SO FAR in our campaign goal! We're not finished yet - you can still fund 'Unfair & Ugly' Season 1 by PayPal at strangerxmagic@gmail.com! 

AS FEATURED IN NBC NEWS, HUFFINGTON POST & FUSION!

WE'RE ALMOST THERE!!!

 

 

We need $50K to film Season 1 this summer (6 episodes, 15-20 minutes long each)! With your support, we can release Unfair & Ugly this Fall! 

 

 

Imagine a cinematic world where people who are Asian, Black, Arab, and Latino actually exist in the background and foreground. GENIUS.

"The film industry still functions as a straight, White, boy's club,"
- AN EXPENSIVE USC STUDY

"Our television shows should have some Muslim characters that are unrelated to national security. It’s not that hard to do."
- BARACK HUSSEIN OBAMA

"We need more Muslims in the media!"
- EVERY AUNTY & UNCLE FROM THE BEGINNING OF TIME

Leave it to brown women to get the job done.

 

 

Stranger Magic is a production company founded by dear friends Yumna Khan and Nida Chowdhry. We make shows that capture the magic of everyday people around us.

We aim to create diverse, high-quality entertainment - think shows you'd watch on Netflix or HBO. We're not waiting for the shows we want to see - we're making them ourselves. 

 

If the unflattering characters of Arrested Development met the visual style of Aziz Ansari's Master of None, you'd have Unfair & Ugly. We're making a show that feels real to us, full of complex human characters, each with their own sense of humor and challenges. The main storylines deal with love, careers, and generation gaps. Layered into the show are subjects like depression, racism, and gender bias.

Our title Unfair & Ugly is a play on the skin whitening cream Fair & Lovely (yeah, that's a thing, and it's a $10 billion industry). We're told we aren't acceptable the way that we are. We have to change and hide who we are, and present these one-dimensional "positive" images of ourselves in response to the destructive narrative about us. 

Well, Unfair & Ugly isn't whitewashed. It's raw, real, and deeply human. It explores both the beautiful and less flattering aspects of our cultures through our own eyes. We don't need to be fair-skinned to be lovely, and we don't need to be saints or terrorists to be represented in the media. We deserve to see our everyday selves reflected onscreen. 
 




You can read more about each of our talented cast members here, but here's a quick fact about each of them: 

Kausar Mohammed produced the viral video "Namaste".
Rhaghuram Shetty is a professional classical Indian dancer.
Samiya Khan is a singer who once opened for Alka Yagnik. 
Saagar Shaikh is best known for his beard decorations.
Travina Springer does stand-up and performed on BET's Comic View.

 

Here's a look at our timeline from now until we launch our show: 


Wonderful people like you help us produce our show! 

We secure locations and finalize our filming schedule! 

Lights, camera, action! 

We hand over Season 1 footage to an editor to work their magic! 

We release Season 1, and start working on Season 2! 

 

We need $50K to film Season 1 (6 episodes, 15-20 minutes long each)! 

Here's a breakdown of where our Indiegogo funds would go: 

​

 

  FUND us on Indiegogo!                                                       
  SHARE our campaign with your friends and family!
  Follow us on Facebook and Instagram!                        

 

Our concept trailer would not have been possible without our incredible crew, cast, and community. It really did take a village.

A special thank you to Hidden Cafe in Anaheim, CA and That Boba Place in Costa Mesa, CA for allowing us to film at their establishments!

story:
Critically Ashamed is a younger Master of None meets HBO's Crashing with a touch of Netflix's Easy.

 

**Super Sexy Plot Summary**

Delia and Giulia both work at the same comedy club in New York City, without really knowing each other. While Giulia has been working there as a waitress for a long time and is frustrated by it, Delia is new to the club as a performer and is excited about the chance to pursue her dream. Although their paths haven’t crossed yet, they seem to be unknowingly connected.

 

Let's talk about... Did you think we were gonna say sex? Not this time, baby! (JK, we have a love story in there, too). However, in the pilot episode we specifically wanted to talk about two current social issues: The complexity of the US immigration process and how difficult and soul-crushing it really can be to go through it; And the growing epidemic that is perfectionism. As a result of this unsatisfiable desire to be perfect, studies have shown that 19% of the millennial generation are suffering from depression – a lot more than previous generations. We want to shine a light on what it feels like to constantly combat socially prescribed perfectionism and why that makes it so hard to get your sh** together sometimes. And beyond that, how unintentionally funny a personal tragedy can be and how relatable irresponsible decisions are. It's comedy after all (haha; lol).

Have you already seen everything on Netflix?! Yes? Then it's time to take a look at this!

  

Please allow us to introduce ourselves...

Hey guys! I'm Franca, your friendly alien of extraordinary ability (Yes, that is my legal status). Despite my 10 year career as a performer, it still took me a year to get my artist visa application approved. While the petition was pending, I couldn't leave the country and after my work permit expired I had to rely on friends and family to help me.. not die. When it was all over, and I realized therapy was too expensive, I wrote a screenplay based partially on my immigration struggle.

Ciao belli! This is Giuditta. For the longest time I was sure I had come up with the term "quarter life crisis" and to be honest I still claim it as mine as much as possible. Moving to the city at 25 after extensive theatre training and working in the field, I thought I had it made. I didn't. Crisis doesn't even begin I describe it. Coming from a high achieving scientist family in Italy while you still wait tables and try to confidently proclaim that "I'm an actor" takes a special kind of courage. And we all know how much courage it takes in New York. Art imitates life in hilariously tragic ways-this is my way. ​

 

THE DIRECTOR

Craig is a New York based filmmaker with more than 10 years experience in the industry. Which means that besides having studied film production on both undergraduate and graduate levels at the University of Central Florida, he's done impressive things than we can fit into this sentence. New sentence: He's directed 6 films, earning him a total of 18 domestic and international awards; he's worked with industry brand names such as Lin Manuel Miranda, DJ Funkmaster Flex and Kenan Thompson; he's one of the keenest postproduction specialists in NYC; his first feature film The Drifter has been acquired by distributor Terror Films for worldwide digital release. Now he's directing Critically Ashamed and it honestly feels like the captain of the football team asked us to go to prom with him!

 

Ultimately, we want to turn Critically Ashamed into a full series. But for now, we are shooting our pilot episode, which we'll release as a 4-part mini series online ("High Maintenance" style). Our goal is to deliver a show to our beloved audience (That's you! Hi! How you doin'?) that looks, feels, sounds like your favorite Netflix shows. Now you might wonder how we plan to accomplish that with only 10k. Here's how: Thanks to passionate supporters of our series we already have access to essential equipment (camera, lights, sound), some amazing locations, and stellar film professionals on board. So we just need a little more help from you, our beloved audience, to complete this project! So JOIN US!

What We Need

Our goal is to raise $10.000 in 45 days. These funds will go towards more equipment and locations, insurance, cast and crew expenses, etc. If you're not a fan of words (boring and outdated am I rite) here's our budget breakdown in a pie chart for visual reference.

 

What You Get

The perks are to your right. You already figured that out, because you're smart. What you don't know yet is that every week we'll raffle off a special prize among every contributor. Prizes include: A pair of Critically Ashamed star Dominick Perrier's signed undies, a headshot session with our director Craig Calamis, a personalized roast from Usama Siddiquee and much more!

If We Exceed Our Goal

If we raise more than our initial goal, funds will go towards shooting additional scenes, festival submission fees, as well as getting the series out to a larger audience.

If We Don't Reach Our Full Goal

The support we have received so far for this project has been overwhelmingly positive, and because of that we have already been able to accomplish so much with -let's be real- so little. But hey, that's why we crowdfund, right? We are very confident we will reach our goal, and hopeful that we can go beyond that... In which case the sky is the limit! However, being the scrappy hard-working New Yorkers that we are, we are ready to shoot no matter what. We want this to be F***ING amazing. And it will be. We just don't wanna go Critically in Debt in doing so. 

 

We understand not everyone can contribute financially and are so grateful for any assistance you can give to spread the word. A tweet, a text, a blog item, a Facebook or Instagram post, anything you can do to share our campaign with your networks will be immeasurably helpful in helping us reach our goal. Share this campaign, share our videos, share our posts, share anything that isn't nailed to the floor!

GIVE US A FOLLOW

     

Critically Gram-ing

   

Critically Tweeting

   

Critically Watching Out For Russian Bots and Marc Zuckerberg Stealing Our Data!

 

Delia played by Franca Paschen

A stand up comedienne from Germany. Fiercely independent and a lovable dreamer at heart. She came to NYC on a student visa and is now in the process of applying for an artist one. Underneath the tough facade is a vulnerable woman, desperately wanting to connect to people, especially Jayme, who she's fallen for hard. But she's struggling to commit fully, not knowing how much time she has left in the country. As long her immigration status is pending, she's living a temporary life and that doesn't allow permanent connections.

 

Giulia played by Giuditta Lattanzi

Born and raised in Baltimore to Italian parents. Her Italian is on point but even when she speaks English, it’s rapid fire. She’s always wanted to be an actress and has been in the city for five years, without much luck. She is funny and quick witted, but behind all that lies a big pile of insecurities. She has a big crush on her co-worker Josh, but is too shy to act on it. Her bedroom reflects what a nostalgic person she is, with lots of pictures and memorabilia from her childhood, especially high school which she considers to be her glory days.


Jayme played by Chike Robinson

A musician and urbanite who has built himself a solid career over the last decade. He is talented, good looking and confident, with a heart of gold on the inside. He's been enjoying life and taking full advantage of what New York has to offer. He's never said no to temptation of any kind before, especially women. In Delia he has finally found his match and he wants to be the man he knows she deserves, but he is struggling to break his playboy habits.

 

 

Saleem played by Usama Siddiquee

An experienced comedian on his way to the top. As confident as he is on stage, in real life he doesn't see himself as the guy who gets the girl. He has feelings for Delia, who sees him as a good friend and mentor. He confesses his feelings to her, disguised as a joke, to test her reaction. When Delia hits rock bottom, he's the one to pick her back up, although he knows that he has landed in her friend zone.

 

 

Josh played by Dominick Perrier

The classic all American, good looking, midwest frat guy. He is dead set on making his last year in his 20’s count. He has a degree in nutrition but never actually used it. Years ago he moved to NYC on a dare and has never left. He is a drifter with no clear direction in life, but also annoyingly good and whatever he does. If he didn’t look the way he does, and have the personality he has, he would be homeless. He is loud, over sexual, and crass but also very sweet. Always ready for a good time.

**Super Sexy Plot Summary**
Delia and Giulia both work at the same comedy club in New York City, without really knowing each other. While Giulia has been working there as a waitress for a long time and is frustrated by it, Delia is new to the club as a performer and is excited about the chance to pursue her dream. Although their paths haven’t crossed yet, they seem to be unknowingly connected.
 
Let's talk about... Did you think we were gonna say sex? Not this time, baby! (JK, we have a love story in there, too). However, in the pilot episode we specifically wanted to talk about two current social issues: The complexity of the US immigration process and how difficult and soul-crushing it really can be to go through it; And the growing epidemic that is perfectionism. As a result of this unsatisfiable desire to be perfect, studies have shown that 19% of the millennial generation are suffering from depression – a lot more than previous generations. We want to shine a light on what it feels like to constantly combat socially prescribed perfectionism and why that makes it so hard to get your sh** together sometimes. And beyond that, how unintentionally funny a personal tragedy can be and how relatable irresponsible decisions are. It's comedy after all (haha; lol).
Have you already seen everything on Netflix?! Yes? Then it's time to take a look at this!
  
Please allow us to introduce ourselves...
Hey guys! I'm Franca, your friendly alien of extraordinary ability (Yes, that is my legal status). Despite my 10 year career as a performer, it still took me a year to get my artist visa application approved. While the petition was pending, I couldn't leave the country and after my work permit expired I had to rely on friends and family to help me.. not die. When it was all over, and I realized therapy was too expensive, I wrote a screenplay based partially on my immigration struggle.
Ciao belli! This is Giuditta. For the longest time I was sure I had come up with the term "quarter life crisis" and to be honest I still claim it as mine as much as possible. Moving to the city at 25 after extensive theatre training and working in the field, I thought I had it made. I didn't. Crisis doesn't even begin I describe it. Coming from a high achieving scientist family in Italy while you still wait tables and try to confidently proclaim that "I'm an actor" takes a special kind of courage. And we all know how much courage it takes in New York. Art imitates life in hilariously tragic ways-this is my way. ​
 
THE DIRECTOR
Craig is a New York based filmmaker with more than 10 years experience in the industry. Which means that besides having studied film production on both undergraduate and graduate levels at the University of Central Florida, he's done impressive things than we can fit into this sentence. New sentence: He's directed 6 films, earning him a total of 18 domestic and international awards; he's worked with industry brand names such as Lin Manuel Miranda, DJ Funkmaster Flex and Kenan Thompson; he's one of the keenest postproduction specialists in NYC; his first feature film The Drifter has been acquired by distributor Terror Films for worldwide digital release. Now he's directing Critically Ashamed and it honestly feels like the captain of the football team asked us to go to prom with him!
 

Ultimately, we want to turn Critically Ashamed into a full series. But for now, we are shooting our pilot episode, which we'll release as a 4-part mini series online ("High Maintenance" style). Our goal is to deliver a show to our beloved audience (That's you! Hi! How you doin'?) that looks, feels, sounds like your favorite Netflix shows. Now you might wonder how we plan to accomplish that with only 10k. Here's how: Thanks to passionate supporters of our series we already have access to essential equipment (camera, lights, sound), some amazing locations, and stellar film professionals on board. So we just need a little more help from you, our beloved audience, to complete this project! So JOIN US!



What We Need
Our goal is to raise $10.000 in 45 days. These funds will go towards more equipment and locations, insurance, cast and crew expenses, etc. If you're not a fan of words (boring and outdated am I rite) here's our budget breakdown in a pie chart for visual reference.

 
What You Get
The perks are to your right. You already figured that out, because you're smart. What you don't know yet is that every week we'll raffle off a special prize among every contributor. Prizes include: A pair of Critically Ashamed star Dominick Perrier's signed undies, a headshot session with our director Craig Calamis, a personalized roast from Usama Siddiquee and much more!
If We Exceed Our Goal
If we raise more than our initial goal, funds will go towards shooting additional scenes, festival submission fees, as well as getting the series out to a larger audience.
If We Don't Reach Our Full Goal
The support we have received so far for this project has been overwhelmingly positive, and because of that we have already been able to accomplish so much with -let's be real- so little. But hey, that's why we crowdfund, right? We are very confident we will reach our goal, and hopeful that we can go beyond that... In which case the sky is the limit! However, being the scrappy hard-working New Yorkers that we are, we are ready to shoot no matter what. We want this to be F***ING amazing. And it will be. We just don't wanna go Critically in Debt in doing so. 

 

We understand not everyone can contribute financially and are so grateful for any assistance you can give to spread the word. A tweet, a text, a blog item, a Facebook or Instagram post, anything you can do to share our campaign with your networks will be immeasurably helpful in helping us reach our goal. Share this campaign, share our videos, share our posts, share anything that isn't nailed to the floor!
GIVE US A FOLLOW
     
Critically Gram-ing
   
Critically Tweeting
   
Critically Watching Out For Russian Bots and Marc Zuckerberg Stealing Our Data!
 


Delia played by Franca Paschen
A stand up comedienne from Germany. Fiercely independent and a lovable dreamer at heart. She came to NYC on a student visa and is now in the process of applying for an artist one. Underneath the tough facade is a vulnerable woman, desperately wanting to connect to people, especially Jayme, who she's fallen for hard. But she's struggling to commit fully, not knowing how much time she has left in the country. As long her immigration status is pending, she's living a temporary life and that doesn't allow permanent connections.
 

Giulia played by Giuditta Lattanzi
Born and raised in Baltimore to Italian parents. Her Italian is on point but even when she speaks English, it’s rapid fire. She’s always wanted to be an actress and has been in the city for five years, without much luck. She is funny and quick witted, but behind all that lies a big pile of insecurities. She has a big crush on her co-worker Josh, but is too shy to act on it. Her bedroom reflects what a nostalgic person she is, with lots of pictures and memorabilia from her childhood, especially high school which she considers to be her glory days.

Jayme played by Chike Robinson
A musician and urbanite who has built himself a solid career over the last decade. He is talented, good looking and confident, with a heart of gold on the inside. He's been enjoying life and taking full advantage of what New York has to offer. He's never said no to temptation of any kind before, especially women. In Delia he has finally found his match and he wants to be the man he knows she deserves, but he is struggling to break his playboy habits.
 

 
Saleem played by Usama Siddiquee
An experienced comedian on his way to the top. As confident as he is on stage, in real life he doesn't see himself as the guy who gets the girl. He has feelings for Delia, who sees him as a good friend and mentor. He confesses his feelings to her, disguised as a joke, to test her reaction. When Delia hits rock bottom, he's the one to pick her back up, although he knows that he has landed in her friend zone.
 

 
Josh played by Dominick Perrier
The classic all American, good looking, midwest frat guy. He is dead set on making his last year in his 20’s count. He has a degree in nutrition but never actually used it. Years ago he moved to NYC on a dare and has never left. He is a drifter with no clear direction in life, but also annoyingly good and whatever he does. If he didn’t look the way he does, and have the personality he has, he would be homeless. He is loud, over sexual, and crass but also very sweet. Always ready for a good time.

story:
About All Natural

Even the coolest among us can relate to feeling awkward, feeling out of place, day dreaming when they’re not supposed to. Who hasn’t embarrassed themselves, hasn’t recalled a moment long ago that still makes your cheeks flush?

Who hasn’t crashed their car while daydreaming?

No?

I guess it was just me then.

Still… it makes for a hell of a story.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help to film the next 7 episodes of All Natural.

  • $10,000 buys some serious production value! Equipment, actors, costumes, hair and makeup, food, promotion, etc-- creativity is expensive
  • Anyone who gives won't come away empty handed!
    • $5 donations receive an exclusive All Natural sticker
    • $10 donations receive an exclusive t-shirt (plus the above incentive)
    • $25 donations receive the above prizes and a signed poster by the cast of All Natural (plus the above incentives)
    • $50 donations receive a thank you video from the cast and crew (plus the above incentives)
    • $100 donations receive a custom video from your cast member of choice (plus the above incentives)
      • Isis sings you a song
      • Tai gives you workout tips
      • Kalani writes you a poem
      • Ben gives you a dance lesson
    • $300 donations receive the opportunity to be a part of All Natural (plus the above incentives)
      • Either join us as an extra in a scene
      • OR a character will be named after you
    • $500 donations receive your name in the credits of All Natural (plus the above incentives)
    • $1000 donations receive a producer credit in All Natural (plus the above incentives)
  • If we don't raise 100% of our goal, fear not! We will continue to produce as much of All Natural as we can.

The Impact

Your contribution helps us create a unique web series, showcasing the diversity of Hawaii. Life often imitates art, and All Natural believes that representation matters for more than just television. By donating, you are enabling us to tell the stories of a group of people who are often overlooked.

Risks & Challenges

With every creative project, there are risks. The cast and crew of All Natural all work full time positions in addition to our creative endeavors. However, we are committed to finishing this first season of our web series.

We believe strongly in All Natural, and no matter the money raised, we will continue to work hard and bring you the best product possible.

Other Ways You Can Help

Watch, like, and share! Follow All Natural on the following platforms, and share the link with your friends. Every view, like, and penny donated helps and is much appreciated.

 

Email: allnaturalwebseries@gmail.com
Facebook: All Natural Web Series
Instagram: @allnatural_web
Twitter: @allnatural_show
Tumblr: allnaturalwebseries

Or Catch Us At Vidcon 2018!

story:
WHY BACK "BAD BOY"?

"Bad Boy" is a missing component in the world of sitcoms and comedic web series.  It's a show that revolves around a "daddy/son" relationship but not in the conventional way.  It has characters that are gay but doesn't rely on it for its stories - and when its used, it's often with irony.  I aim to continue to create a sharp, dialogue-driven series with strong characters and hints of the absurd that can appeal to audiences of all ages, races, genders, and sexual orientations.
