WHY BACK "BAD BOY"?
"Bad Boy" is a missing component in the world of sitcoms and comedic web series.  It's a show that revolves around a "daddy/son" relationship but not in the conventional way.  It has characters that are gay but doesn't rely on it for its stories - and when its used, it's often with irony.  I aim to continue to create a sharp, dialogue-driven series with strong characters and hints of the absurd that can appeal to audiences of all ages, races, genders, and sexual orientations.

story:
The Disappointments is an episodic comedy that we’ve been living and breathing for the past two years.

In many ways we’ve been living it our entire lives: It’s more than a little autobiographical, which is where the biting humor and painfully relatable truths come from. I mean, who hasn’t taken an honest look at their life and seen at least one area where it comes up epically short?

The idea sprang from a dinner conversation involving margaritas. Actually, a lot of margaritas. James and myself and a few others were reminiscing about a friend who, struggling with money and career setbacks, had recently and tragically taken his own life. I know, not a happy story. We realized as the night went on that several other acquaintances had done the same thing within the past few years. What was happening? All of these people were in their late 40’s and early 50’s. All of them were feeling hopeless about how their lives had turned out.

But at the same time, we had other friends who we absolutely marveled at. These were people who recognized that the paths they had chosen for themselves when they were just kids out of school were not going to pan out. They needed new dreams, new careers. And so, well into their 40’s, they bravely shook things up and reinvented themselves, finding happiness and success as a result of the changes they made.

Both of these are very different approaches to the same dilemma: What do you do when you realize that time is running short, the road behind you is longer than the road ahead, and your job, your marriage, your relationship with your kids, your life has not turned out at all the way you had hoped and planned when you were young?

From this, The Disappointments was born. A comedy series with an edge about people in their 40’s and 50’s forced to deal with their circumstances, facing what they see as their failures and misfortunes, and taking action. Most of it ill-advised. Some of it straight-up disastrous. All in the hopes of turning their disappointing lives around.

If this resonates with you and you’re moved to make a contribution, large or small, you’ll be helping us to meet the budget for a full season of The Disappointments; six episodes, each about 20 minutes long. The scripts are all written and polished and the entire team is ready to jump into production as soon as we have the funds. Over the next 45 days, you alone -- our backers -- have the power to bring this show to life.  

What’s in it for you?

Besides the satisfaction of getting a great show made? Plenty. We’ve dug deep to get creative with what we can offer our backers. Sure, you’ll see the standard crowdfunding perks that are tried and true. But we’ve also come up with some incentives that are fun and different and that you’ll see tie into the theme of the show.

We’re grateful for every single cent that comes our way. No amount is too small or too big!  And we look forward to expressing our gratitude through these incentives, and more!

Why are we crowdfunding?

The landscape of television and movies is constantly shifting, with streaming services leading the charge. Content is king and more and more people are bypassing the traditional routes, taking matters into their own hands. And the results can be astonishingly good. Our team has been inspired by filmmakers who have broken with the traditional paths to financing in order to protect their creative integrity. Coming directly to you the audience to crowdfund our budget allows us to do the same.

We’re thankful to be able to take this route as it gives us more creative freedom AND the honor of taking you on this journey with us, every step of the way. Our incentives will provide you with timely updates via email or Skype and even give a few lucky backers a chance to own a few props from the show that are featured prominently in the storyline.

Where does your money go?

Our team will be calling in every possible favor to keep our expenditures low -- everything from free locations to the cast raiding their closets for much of their own wardrobe -- but no matter how cost-effective and ingenious we are, there simply are some expenses that cannot be avoided.

The shoot will last approximately three weeks. During that time, we will need to cover the bills for lights, cameras, lenses, accessories, sound equipment and hard drives to store the footage. All costly items. Liability insurance is a must. It’s our obligation by law to make sure our cast and crew are always protected. There’s production design and wardrobe, extras, location rentals where needed and the transportation costs for equipment, cast and crew to get to these locations. Food is another necessity. Being on set can be an all-day affair and nobody wants to deal with a hangry actor or sound engineer. Healthy meals are crucial to keep our team functioning at 110 percent.

Our cast and crew are incredibly talented and we’re honored that they believe in our show and are willing to move Heaven and Earth to see it completed. We may not be able to pay them their going rate, but they need to be paid something in return for all their hard work. They have families to feed!  And puppies! Think of the puppies!

And then there’s post-production, another big ticket item. We could capture the most artistically framed shots and award-caliber performances, but it don’t mean a thing if we fail to put the same effort into editing, sound, music and color correction. This is what makes or breaks any show!

When everything is factored in, the number we’ve set for our campaign will allow us to make an entire season of “The Disappointments” for the lowest amount possible.

Down to the last person, we are a team dedicated to and passionate about storytelling. And “The Disappointments” is the story we all want to tell.

SOME OF THE CREATIVE TEAM

Rich Burns - Producer, Director, Writer, Actor(?)

Rich has worked as a writer in both live action and animation, with TV Movies like “Snow” and “Snow 2” to his credit, the Dreamworks/Netflix animated series “Spirit Riding Free”, along with movies “Brother Bear 2” and “Fox and the Hound 2” for Disney. In fact, if there’s a 2 involved, Rich may have had his hand in it. Wait, what? More recently, he’s watched a feature script he wrote get set for a Spring 2019 start date. And it might possibly have a cast of Oscar, Golden Globe and Tony winners attached to star in it. He really can’t say. But he’ll be happy to keep you posted as things progress.  More on Rich at https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1757227/?ref_=nv_sr_1

 

David Moreton - Producer

David brings a ton of invaluable experience to our endeavor, having produced and directed the feature films “Edge of Seventeen”, “Testosterone” and “A Good Funeral”. All fantastic movies made on limited budgets. Oh, and let’s not forget he actually wrote the screenplays for“Testosterone” and “A Good Funeral” as well. There go all my plans for those crane shots! Oh, and the HALO dive. Thanks, Dave! Besides joining our team to produce “The Disappointments”, David is hard at work on a new feature script. Read more about Dave here https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0604284/?ref_=nv_sr_1

Michael Corbett - Actor

Michael, a two-time Emmy Winner, is best known to audiences for his long and epic run as the womanizing David Kimble on CBS’s “Young And The Restless”. He’s had major roles in Broadway musicals and has been seen frequently on popular shows such as “Star Trek The Next Generation”, “Zoey 101” and currently, the Emmy-winning digital series “Venice The Series”. Never one to sit at home and watch the paint dry, Michael is a Correspondent/Host on NBC’s “Extra!” and the Host/Senior producer of “Extra’s Mansions & Millionaires!” AND he’s the creator and Executive Producer of the critically acclaimed series “Hollywood Medium with Tyler Henry” on E! Network. Michael brings a ton of production experience to our show and a particularly keen eye for flattering light. Visit http://www.michaelcorbett.com

James Campbell - Actor

James has been collaborating closely with Rich on “The Disappointments” since the project’s inception. His own acting career began in San Francisco’s comedy/improv scene and has taken him to New York, Los Angeles and literally, around the world. James was the Vocal Soloist with the San Francisco Ballet, has sung with Cheyenne Jackson at the Walt Disney Concert Hall, appeared off-Broadway as Frankie in FOREVER PLAID, and has been seen in countless regional productions, acting, singing and dancing, because he just loves performing, dammit! And yes, James is proud to admit that he was a featured singer on Princess Cruises for many years. Traveling and performing are his two biggest passions, so what better way to see the world than to nail a Barry Gibb vocal whilst on the high seas! Stayin’ Alive, indeed! You can follow James on Instagram http://www.instagram.com/jcam1222/

Tom Berklund - Actor

Tom was cast sight unseen for our pilot reading two years ago and he killed it. Since then, he’s become an invaluable and enthusiastic member of our creative team. Tom trained at the University of Michigan’s prestigious Musical Theatre program. He’s performed on Broadway in the revival of “A Chorus Line and “The Addams Family” and in the national tour of “The Normal Heart”. In LA he’s starred in indie features and has appeared on “Looking”, “Kings”, “Royal Pains” and “Partners”. He played Wolfe in the acclaimed Mark Taper Forum production of “Bent” and worked with the LA Opera and Washington National Opera in their recent productions of “Candide”... Wait...how did we get Tom to be in our show? Tom is also a model. And a former competitive swimmer... Jeez... Now I’m just exhausted. Find out more about Tom at https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2321687/?ref_=nv_sr_1

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS...

Sup?

Sup.

How much can I donate?

Backers can contribute any amount they’d like. Every cent is accepted with our deepest gratitude. If the contribution equals one of our reward levels, the backer has the option of claiming that perk. (Please note some of our perks are available in limited quantities.) All funds donated (minus credit card processing and Indiegogo’s fee) will be used directly for the production of “The Disappointments”.

When will I get my perk?

All perks, whether they require mail delivery or not, will be fulfilled by February 2019, unless otherwise specified in the perk details.

What if my address changes?

Please notify us via Indiegogo ASAP if there are any changes to your shipping information and we’ll do our best to get your delivery to the new address.

How do I choose my shirt size?

We will contact you post-campaign to collect your sizing information.

Can I claim more than one perk?

You greedy little bugger! Absolutely! Each Indiegogo contribution is recorded as a standalone transaction. If you feel like showing us your love multiple times, have at it! We’ll love you all the more for it.

What if the perk I want is sold out?

Although it may be possible that we add more stock of a sold-out perk, we’ll be doing so at our discretion. If the perk you want is sold-out, keep checking back to see what new perks we’ll be rolling out as the campaign progresses. There might be something else that catches your eye.

Why was my contribution unsuccessful?

See Indiegogo’s list of common contribution errors for troubleshooting. If it’s still an issue, get in touch with our campaign and we’ll see if we can help.

In what currency is the campaign raising money?

We’ll be raising funds in USD.

What if I see an error on the campaign page?

Let us know! We want the campaign to run smoothly and any help you provide in that regard is truly appreciated.

How long will it take for the campaign to answer my question?

If you’ve submitted a question, trust that we’re working hard to get the answer to you, ASAP.  One of our team will be managing the campaign full-time, but we ask that you be patient, as we’re likely to receive hundreds of emails throughout the duration of its run. But rest assured, we will always get back to you!  You can reach us here on our Indiegogo page, or email direct at thedisappointmentstv@gmail.com

 

A FEW ART PERKS OF NOTE

Several pieces of art play a crucial role in the season’s storyline and are featured prominently on camera. Luckily, we have some amazing artist friends who have agreed to create these pieces for the show.

Mark Goldberg - Painting

We consider it Art Coup #1 that Los Angeles artist Mark Goldberg has agreed to paint an original 36” x 48” moody seascape central to one of the storylines in the show. This a painting two characters fight over in the wake of the owner’s death. Upon completion of production, Goldberg’s piece will be shipped to whoever is lucky enough to claim it as a perk.

“Goldberg has harvested a prolific and diverse body of work. Enchantingly dream-like at times, his paintings are charged with emotional resonance, rife with moody symbolism... (He) has shifted from an exacting Realism to a more liberating Impressionism. His unconventional thematic color and compositional techniques have become part of his artistic statement. In doing so he confront us, quite literally, with the compelling message of his art... Goldberg’s paintings unlock a unique, often forceful view into another world.” http://markleegoldberg.com/

 

Jan Jasiu Krajewski - Ceramics  

Art Coup #2! Jan Krajewski is gifting us with a ceramic piece he’s making specifically for the show. This is a piece that is talked about throughout the season and revealed to have a special meaning to the main characters at the end. This one of a kind vase will be shipped to the backer who claims it as a perk once production has wrapped.

Born into a family of potters that goes back eight generations, Jasiu began his art working with clay at age three. At Rhode Island School of Design Jasiu developed his skills in drawing, sculpture, painting, printmaking and industrial design and continued his studies at The Art Academy of Pont-Aven in France under the tutelage of David Lloyd and Lori Precious. He apprenticed with Potter Dennis Cooper and has studied printmaking in Japan, still life painting in Poland and taught ceramics in Kauai. Jasiu has exhibited at Gale-Martin Fine Art in Chelsea, Taxdor and Spendleman, SCOPE Miami, Glu Gallery in Los Angeles and Exposure Gallery in NYC. See more of Jan's work and the things that inspire him at  https://www.instagram.com/jasiu_k/?hl=en

Glenn Daidone - Every Picture Tells a Story

                    

Art Coup #3! Glenn Daidone is a multi-talented photographer specializing in Architecture and Interiors as well as Fine Art.  He's also a generous friend who is providing our production with a print of his image "American Vacation Series IV". This photograph will also be featured in the series storyline and, like the other pieces here, will find a new home with one lucky backer once our production has wrapped.

Glenn branched out from Commercial photography to try his hand at Fine Arts photography in 2006. Within his first year he had two reputable galleries representing him and his contemplative, sometimes desolate landscapes that have become a signature in his work. "It’s a pleasure to me (and sometimes a relief) to take a break from architectural photography and the requisite restrictions that accompany producing images for commercial use. This time I spend in the ﬁeld with my camera making pictures, whose sole function is to create a mood, is a very meditative process for me that recharges me for my commercial endeavors." http://www.glenndaidonephotography.com/

Dan Dundin - The Power of Imagination

            

Art Coup #4! Dan Dundin is graciously providing our show with three of his amazing and whimsical trucks. Like the other pieces listed here, they are featured in the storyline and get a few prominent close-ups! Once production wraps, the trucks will find new homes, with the three lucky backers who claimed them.

Founded in 2012 by brother and sister designers, Dan Dundin and Meredith Franzese, 2of2 is based on their shared passion for design.  Dan, a classically trained artist, and Meredith, an opinionated younger sister, have been collaborating on projects since they were kids growing up in the cornfields of Pennsylvania. Always fascinated with the challenge of new materials, they expanded their work to include wood, acrylic and metal.  The different materials and their differing perspectives took the designs in new directions and eventually brought 2of2 to where it is today: a line that is both contemporary yet familiar, minimalist yet ornate. "We design playful products for the home. We make lighting, sculptures and other goods - some that are functional and others that are just for fun." Based in Brooklyn, NY. https://2of2goods.com/


A FEW MORE PERKS OF NOTE - NOT AT ALL DISAPPOINTING!

Heal That Body!

Aaron Niemi -Acupuncture (l.) and Dr. Chett Mallett -Chiropractic(r.)

                                           

Nothing is more disappointing than when your body starts giving out on you. You cruise along blissfully for your first thirty years without so much as a spasm or a cramp and then, bam! Your back hurts. You get recurring headaches. Chronic indigestion. Sore muscles. You can’t sleep. Well, with this amazing perk, you’re in luck! Aaron and Chett have generously offered their combined services to help heal your body and your soul. Enjoy one chiropractic evaluation and treatment and one acupuncture evaluation and treatment at their Los Angeles clinic “Body Structure - A Healing Center” and get started on your path to wellness.

Chett has been a Doctor of Chiropractic since 1998. He employs a diverse array of therapies, ranging from gentle low force to straight adjustments, and works hard to find the right combination of care for each individual patient. He has extensive experience working with athletes and active people.

Aaron received his masters in Chinese medicine from Yo San University and acquired his license in 2013. He regularly treats a wide variety of patients’ symptoms, including back pain, the common cold, digestive disturbances, headaches, insomnia, women’s health, depression, stress and fibromyalgia. Aaron comes to Chinese medicine with 17 years of massage experience and working with patients in finding their optimal health. https://www.bodystructurela.com/

Take A Hollywood Meeting!

Producer Jill Gilbert

So, you’re a TV, Film or Animation writer and you’re disappointed with your career. Or maybe you’ve always dreamed of being a writer but never knew where to start. Well, your fortune is about to change! Producer Jill Gilbert has agreed to an hour-long consultation with one lucky backer, for development on an idea, a pitch, or a script. This can be a sit-down if you’re a local in Los Angeles or a Skype call anywhere in the world! She’s even agreed to provide networking/business development strategies and career coaching!

Jill Gilbert is Producer and Head of Animated Content at Luma, where she has built a slate of projects consisting of animated feature films and animated short form content. The company’s first animated feature is slated for pre-production in 2018. Prior to joining Luma, Gilbert was Executive Producer and Managing Director for Psyop, an innovative animation studio in the advertising and branding industry, working with such clients as Coke, Nike, Samsung, AMC and Super Cell. She has also served as Vice President of Production at Paramount’s feature animation division, where she oversaw the successful launch of their first film, “SpongeBob SquarePants in 3D. Before joining Paramount, Gilbert served in various leadership positions at Technicolor, Disneytoons Studios and began her career in live-action with posts at Fox 2000, Baltimore Pictures and Donner/Shuler Productions.

Get That Body Rockin’!

Personal Trainer Mike Faulkner

You look in the mirror and you’re disappointed with what you see. You’re thicker around the middle and muscle tone isn’t what it used to be. And, what’s down there? Wait, is that your butt?? Don’t despair -- help is on the way!

The handsome and fit Mike Faulkner is offering five fortunate backers a highly motivating one-hour session, to include a fitness assessment and a guided workout, along with nutrition and workout recommendations.

An NSCA Certified Personal Trainer, Mike has over 25 years of experience improving the fitness, health and overall wellness of his clients. His background and knowledge in athletics, psychology and special populations enables him to develop a realistic and unique fitness plan for each individual. Mike gives special focus to balance improvement, core stabilization, postural reconditioning, pre/post-natal fitness and sport specific training. Much of the equipment he uses is mobile (TRX, rubber bands, etc.) providing for a creative and convenient training experience whether it’s at a gym, home or park. And having trained with him, we can attest to his being inspirational, knowledgeable and thorough. At the end of your hour, you will work muscles you never knew you had! https://www.linkedin.com/in/pafitness

There Are Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't be part of our team!

  • Get the word out about THE DISAPPOINTMENTS and make some noise about our campaign!
  • And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And THANK YOU. From the bottom of our hearts. Your support means EVERYTHING!
story_txt:
The Disappointments is an episodic comedy that we’ve been living and breathing for the past two years.In many ways we’ve been living it our entire lives: It’s more than a little autobiographical, which is where the biting humor and painfully relatable truths come from. I mean, who hasn’t taken an honest look at their life and seen at least one area where it comes up epically short?The idea sprang from a dinner conversation involving margaritas. Actually, a lot of margaritas. James and myself and a few others were reminiscing about a friend who, struggling with money and career setbacks, had recently and tragically taken his own life. I know, not a happy story. We realized as the night went on that several other acquaintances had done the same thing within the past few years. What was happening? All of these people were in their late 40’s and early 50’s. All of them were feeling hopeless about how their lives had turned out.But at the same time, we had other friends who we absolutely marveled at. These were people who recognized that the paths they had chosen for themselves when they were just kids out of school were not going to pan out. They needed new dreams, new careers. And so, well into their 40’s, they bravely shook things up and reinvented themselves, finding happiness and success as a result of the changes they made.Both of these are very different approaches to the same dilemma: What do you do when you realize that time is running short, the road behind you is longer than the road ahead, and your job, your marriage, your relationship with your kids, your life has not turned out at all the way you had hoped and planned when you were young?From this, The Disappointments was born. A comedy series with an edge about people in their 40’s and 50’s forced to deal with their circumstances, facing what they see as their failures and misfortunes, and taking action. Most of it ill-advised. Some of it straight-up disastrous. All in the hopes of turning their disappointing lives around.If this resonates with you and you’re moved to make a contribution, large or small, you’ll be helping us to meet the budget for a full season of The Disappointments; six episodes, each about 20 minutes long. The scripts are all written and polished and the entire team is ready to jump into production as soon as we have the funds. Over the next 45 days, you alone -- our backers -- have the power to bring this show to life.  What’s in it for you?Besides the satisfaction of getting a great show made? Plenty. We’ve dug deep to get creative with what we can offer our backers. Sure, you’ll see the standard crowdfunding perks that are tried and true. But we’ve also come up with some incentives that are fun and different and that you’ll see tie into the theme of the show.We’re grateful for every single cent that comes our way. No amount is too small or too big!  And we look forward to expressing our gratitude through these incentives, and more!Why are we crowdfunding?The landscape of television and movies is constantly shifting, with streaming services leading the charge. Content is king and more and more people are bypassing the traditional routes, taking matters into their own hands. And the results can be astonishingly good. Our team has been inspired by filmmakers who have broken with the traditional paths to financing in order to protect their creative integrity. Coming directly to you the audience to crowdfund our budget allows us to do the same.We’re thankful to be able to take this route as it gives us more creative freedom AND the honor of taking you on this journey with us, every step of the way. Our incentives will provide you with timely updates via email or Skype and even give a few lucky backers a chance to own a few props from the show that are featured prominently in the storyline.Where does your money go?Our team will be calling in every possible favor to keep our expenditures low -- everything from free locations to the cast raiding their closets for much of their own wardrobe -- but no matter how cost-effective and ingenious we are, there simply are some expenses that cannot be avoided.The shoot will last approximately three weeks. During that time, we will need to cover the bills for lights, cameras, lenses, accessories, sound equipment and hard drives to store the footage. All costly items. Liability insurance is a must. It’s our obligation by law to make sure our cast and crew are always protected. There’s production design and wardrobe, extras, location rentals where needed and the transportation costs for equipment, cast and crew to get to these locations. Food is another necessity. Being on set can be an all-day affair and nobody wants to deal with a hangry actor or sound engineer. Healthy meals are crucial to keep our team functioning at 110 percent.Our cast and crew are incredibly talented and we’re honored that they believe in our show and are willing to move Heaven and Earth to see it completed. We may not be able to pay them their going rate, but they need to be paid something in return for all their hard work. They have families to feed!  And puppies! Think of the puppies!And then there’s post-production, another big ticket item. We could capture the most artistically framed shots and award-caliber performances, but it don’t mean a thing if we fail to put the same effort into editing, sound, music and color correction. This is what makes or breaks any show!When everything is factored in, the number we’ve set for our campaign will allow us to make an entire season of “The Disappointments” for the lowest amount possible.Down to the last person, we are a team dedicated to and passionate about storytelling. And “The Disappointments” is the story we all want to tell.SOME OF THE CREATIVE TEAM
Rich Burns - Producer, Director, Writer, Actor(?)

Rich has worked as a writer in both live action and animation, with TV Movies like “Snow” and “Snow 2” to his credit, the Dreamworks/Netflix animated series “Spirit Riding Free”, along with movies “Brother Bear 2” and “Fox and the Hound 2” for Disney. In fact, if there’s a 2 involved, Rich may have had his hand in it. Wait, what? More recently, he’s watched a feature script he wrote get set for a Spring 2019 start date. And it might possibly have a cast of Oscar, Golden Globe and Tony winners attached to star in it. He really can’t say. But he’ll be happy to keep you posted as things progress.  More on Rich at https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1757227/?ref_=nv_sr_1
 

David Moreton - Producer

David brings a ton of invaluable experience to our endeavor, having produced and directed the feature films “Edge of Seventeen”, “Testosterone” and “A Good Funeral”. All fantastic movies made on limited budgets. Oh, and let’s not forget he actually wrote the screenplays for“Testosterone” and “A Good Funeral” as well. There go all my plans for those crane shots! Oh, and the HALO dive. Thanks, Dave! Besides joining our team to produce “The Disappointments”, David is hard at work on a new feature script. Read more about Dave here https://www.imdb.com/name/nm0604284/?ref_=nv_sr_1

Michael Corbett - Actor

Michael, a two-time Emmy Winner, is best known to audiences for his long and epic run as the womanizing David Kimble on CBS’s “Young And The Restless”. He’s had major roles in Broadway musicals and has been seen frequently on popular shows such as “Star Trek The Next Generation”, “Zoey 101” and currently, the Emmy-winning digital series “Venice The Series”. Never one to sit at home and watch the paint dry, Michael is a Correspondent/Host on NBC’s “Extra!” and the Host/Senior producer of “Extra’s Mansions & Millionaires!” AND he’s the creator and Executive Producer of the critically acclaimed series “Hollywood Medium with Tyler Henry” on E! Network. Michael brings a ton of production experience to our show and a particularly keen eye for flattering light. Visit http://www.michaelcorbett.com

James Campbell - Actor

James has been collaborating closely with Rich on “The Disappointments” since the project’s inception. His own acting career began in San Francisco’s comedy/improv scene and has taken him to New York, Los Angeles and literally, around the world. James was the Vocal Soloist with the San Francisco Ballet, has sung with Cheyenne Jackson at the Walt Disney Concert Hall, appeared off-Broadway as Frankie in FOREVER PLAID, and has been seen in countless regional productions, acting, singing and dancing, because he just loves performing, dammit! And yes, James is proud to admit that he was a featured singer on Princess Cruises for many years. Traveling and performing are his two biggest passions, so what better way to see the world than to nail a Barry Gibb vocal whilst on the high seas! Stayin’ Alive, indeed! You can follow James on Instagram http://www.instagram.com/jcam1222/

Tom Berklund - Actor

Tom was cast sight unseen for our pilot reading two years ago and he killed it. Since then, he’s become an invaluable and enthusiastic member of our creative team. Tom trained at the University of Michigan’s prestigious Musical Theatre program. He’s performed on Broadway in the revival of “A Chorus Line and “The Addams Family” and in the national tour of “The Normal Heart”. In LA he’s starred in indie features and has appeared on “Looking”, “Kings”, “Royal Pains” and “Partners”. He played Wolfe in the acclaimed Mark Taper Forum production of “Bent” and worked with the LA Opera and Washington National Opera in their recent productions of “Candide”... Wait...how did we get Tom to be in our show? Tom is also a model. And a former competitive swimmer... Jeez... Now I’m just exhausted. Find out more about Tom at https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2321687/?ref_=nv_sr_1

FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS...
Sup?
Sup.
How much can I donate?
Backers can contribute any amount they’d like. Every cent is accepted with our deepest gratitude. If the contribution equals one of our reward levels, the backer has the option of claiming that perk. (Please note some of our perks are available in limited quantities.) All funds donated (minus credit card processing and Indiegogo’s fee) will be used directly for the production of “The Disappointments”.
When will I get my perk?
All perks, whether they require mail delivery or not, will be fulfilled by February 2019, unless otherwise specified in the perk details.
What if my address changes?
Please notify us via Indiegogo ASAP if there are any changes to your shipping information and we’ll do our best to get your delivery to the new address.
How do I choose my shirt size?
We will contact you post-campaign to collect your sizing information.
Can I claim more than one perk?
You greedy little bugger! Absolutely! Each Indiegogo contribution is recorded as a standalone transaction. If you feel like showing us your love multiple times, have at it! We’ll love you all the more for it.
What if the perk I want is sold out?
Although it may be possible that we add more stock of a sold-out perk, we’ll be doing so at our discretion. If the perk you want is sold-out, keep checking back to see what new perks we’ll be rolling out as the campaign progresses. There might be something else that catches your eye.
Why was my contribution unsuccessful?
See Indiegogo’s list of common contribution errors for troubleshooting. If it’s still an issue, get in touch with our campaign and we’ll see if we can help.
In what currency is the campaign raising money?
We’ll be raising funds in USD.
What if I see an error on the campaign page?
Let us know! We want the campaign to run smoothly and any help you provide in that regard is truly appreciated.
How long will it take for the campaign to answer my question?
If you’ve submitted a question, trust that we’re working hard to get the answer to you, ASAP.  One of our team will be managing the campaign full-time, but we ask that you be patient, as we’re likely to receive hundreds of emails throughout the duration of its run. But rest assured, we will always get back to you!  You can reach us here on our Indiegogo page, or email direct at thedisappointmentstv@gmail.com
 
A FEW ART PERKS OF NOTESeveral pieces of art play a crucial role in the season’s storyline and are featured prominently on camera. Luckily, we have some amazing artist friends who have agreed to create these pieces for the show.
Mark Goldberg - Painting
We consider it Art Coup #1 that Los Angeles artist Mark Goldberg has agreed to paint an original 36” x 48” moody seascape central to one of the storylines in the show. This a painting two characters fight over in the wake of the owner’s death. Upon completion of production, Goldberg’s piece will be shipped to whoever is lucky enough to claim it as a perk.
“Goldberg has harvested a prolific and diverse body of work. Enchantingly dream-like at times, his paintings are charged with emotional resonance, rife with moody symbolism... (He) has shifted from an exacting Realism to a more liberating Impressionism. His unconventional thematic color and compositional techniques have become part of his artistic statement. In doing so he confront us, quite literally, with the compelling message of his art... Goldberg’s paintings unlock a unique, often forceful view into another world.” http://markleegoldberg.com/
 Jan Jasiu Krajewski - Ceramics  
Art Coup #2! Jan Krajewski is gifting us with a ceramic piece he’s making specifically for the show. This is a piece that is talked about throughout the season and revealed to have a special meaning to the main characters at the end. This one of a kind vase will be shipped to the backer who claims it as a perk once production has wrapped.
Born into a family of potters that goes back eight generations, Jasiu began his art working with clay at age three. At Rhode Island School of Design Jasiu developed his skills in drawing, sculpture, painting, printmaking and industrial design and continued his studies at The Art Academy of Pont-Aven in France under the tutelage of David Lloyd and Lori Precious. He apprenticed with Potter Dennis Cooper and has studied printmaking in Japan, still life painting in Poland and taught ceramics in Kauai. Jasiu has exhibited at Gale-Martin Fine Art in Chelsea, Taxdor and Spendleman, SCOPE Miami, Glu Gallery in Los Angeles and Exposure Gallery in NYC. See more of Jan's work and the things that inspire him at  https://www.instagram.com/jasiu_k/?hl=en
Glenn Daidone - Every Picture Tells a Story
                    

Art Coup #3! Glenn Daidone is a multi-talented photographer specializing in Architecture and Interiors as well as Fine Art.  He's also a generous friend who is providing our production with a print of his image "American Vacation Series IV". This photograph will also be featured in the series storyline and, like the other pieces here, will find a new home with one lucky backer once our production has wrapped.
Glenn branched out from Commercial photography to try his hand at Fine Arts photography in 2006. Within his first year he had two reputable galleries representing him and his contemplative, sometimes desolate landscapes that have become a signature in his work. "It’s a pleasure to me (and sometimes a relief) to take a break from architectural photography and the requisite restrictions that accompany producing images for commercial use. This time I spend in the ﬁeld with my camera making pictures, whose sole function is to create a mood, is a very meditative process for me that recharges me for my commercial endeavors." http://www.glenndaidonephotography.com/
Dan Dundin - The Power of Imagination
            
Art Coup #4! Dan Dundin is graciously providing our show with three of his amazing and whimsical trucks. Like the other pieces listed here, they are featured in the storyline and get a few prominent close-ups! Once production wraps, the trucks will find new homes, with the three lucky backers who claimed them.
Founded in 2012 by brother and sister designers, Dan Dundin and Meredith Franzese, 2of2 is based on their shared passion for design.  Dan, a classically trained artist, and Meredith, an opinionated younger sister, have been collaborating on projects since they were kids growing up in the cornfields of Pennsylvania. Always fascinated with the challenge of new materials, they expanded their work to include wood, acrylic and metal.  The different materials and their differing perspectives took the designs in new directions and eventually brought 2of2 to where it is today: a line that is both contemporary yet familiar, minimalist yet ornate. "We design playful products for the home. We make lighting, sculptures and other goods - some that are functional and others that are just for fun." Based in Brooklyn, NY. https://2of2goods.com/

A FEW MORE PERKS OF NOTE - NOT AT ALL DISAPPOINTING!
Heal That Body!Aaron Niemi -Acupuncture (l.) and Dr. Chett Mallett -Chiropractic(r.)                                           Nothing is more disappointing than when your body starts giving out on you. You cruise along blissfully for your first thirty years without so much as a spasm or a cramp and then, bam! Your back hurts. You get recurring headaches. Chronic indigestion. Sore muscles. You can’t sleep. Well, with this amazing perk, you’re in luck! Aaron and Chett have generously offered their combined services to help heal your body and your soul. Enjoy one chiropractic evaluation and treatment and one acupuncture evaluation and treatment at their Los Angeles clinic “Body Structure - A Healing Center” and get started on your path to wellness.Chett has been a Doctor of Chiropractic since 1998. story:
Short Summary

I’m Daniel Nkoola, the writer/director of (Fake) 2018 XXL Freshman Class! If we are able to attend the NYC Web Fest, my cast and crew will have the opportunity to learn from and network with film industry practitioners/experts.

  • Our web series is a thoughtful, hilarious, and sneakily-touching commentary on what hip-hop is becoming, and who gets to be a part of it.
  • The story has resonated with both online viewers and festival judges. NYC Web Fest will give it a new platform and audience (including film producers, potential distributors, and network executives.)
  • The festival will also feature a series of panels with industry experts and practitioners; this has massive educational value for us as students.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We need additional funding of roughly $4,000 to cover travel expenses for our cast & crew to experience one of the most prestigious web series festivals, Web Fest, taking place in NYC. Our web series was 1 of 85 selected to be screened this year. The festival had submissions from over 12 countries. The costs will cover -- air travel, food, lodging, & tickets to Web Fest.    
  • We have several perks that we are very excited to offer to the donors of the project! 
    • Thank You! -- a Credited "Thank You!" via our social media outlets 
    • Digital Poster -- A forever digital poster of the Fake Freshman XXL web series 
    • Digital Extras --  Behind-the-scenes photos & never scene before footage
    • Signed Script -- Signed script by the Writer/Director & Producers 
    • Director's Cut -- Never before seen director's cut of our project 
    • Executive Producer -- Receive a future credit as an Executive Producer on our project  
  • If we do not reach our total goal of $4,000, our above-the-line team has an agreed upon plan to evenly distribute the money to cover a portion of the travel expenses. 

The Impact

  • By focusing on web series and online content, NYC Web Fest celebrates and promotes inventive, up-and-coming filmmakers who tend to be neglected by traditional Hollywood gatekeepers.
  • In the same spirit of inclusion, (Fake) 2018 XXL Freshman Class is a tale of underdogs who go up against gatekeepers to claim a spot in a traditionally male-dominated genre of music.
  • A previous project of mine, If #Arthur was an Edgy Teen Drama, amassed over 3,500,000 views across Twitter and Facebook. This was my first indicator that the web might be a worthwhile nontraditional avenue for reaching an audience as an independent creator.

Risks & Challenges

  • Our biggest obstacle is just getting to NYC all the way from Austin, Texas. We have budgeted the cheapest possible trip for the ten members of our cast and crew that are going.
  • It is a very real possibility that not all ten members will be able to make the trip, but our team has a plan put in place to deal with that if that is the outcome. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Even if you do not have the funds to financially help our project, you can still share our story and Indiegogo through your social media platforms! 
  • Indiegogo offers multiple online share tools so feel free to share our story and project after donating! 

And that's all there is to it.

https://celebmix.com/the-official-selections-fo...

story:
TRIPLE THREAT SIZZLE REEL
 

PLEASE SCROLL DOWN TO SEE EPISODE 1 --

 

Don’t you love the sound of that?  It already creates a questionable tone in its implication.  But only because society has conditioned our way of thinking about mature women.  

I’m Gina Surles (I'm on the left in the photo below).  I’m the creator, writer, producer and one of the lead actresses of TRIPLE THREAT.  I was formerly a ballet and modern dancer and taught ballet for 35 years, while pursuing acting and writing.  I am also a woman "of a certain age.”  Some of you may have noticed that mature women have been under-represented in advertising, TV, movies, as well as in other industries including science, technology, and business.  Enter TRIPLE THREAT, for girls who still wanna have frolicking fun after 50!   

A comedy that is a cross between "The Golden Girls" and "Charlie's Angels" has almost limitless material!  The main characters of TRIPLE THREAT, Carolyn, Rosie, and Vivienne, are seeking some excitement and meaning at this point in their lives, and that causes them to take the plunge to become “undercover detectives.”  One day while commiserating in a coffee shop Carolyn and Rosie receive a mysterious note recruiting them for the TRIPLE THREAT Detective Agency.  They have no idea what TRIPLE THREAT is, or that it's the creation of an 85-year-old widow intent on continuing her lifelong pursuit of justice for all.  

After a couple of humiliating job interviews, the idea of going undercover and "doing something that matters" becomes too tempting for Carolyn and Rosie to brush off.  They show up at the time and place in the note and meet Fran's liaison, Vivienne.  She is strong, no-nonsense, a lover of all things French, and not happy at the thought of working with Carolyn and Rosie.

As I mentioned in my video, I’m honored that TRIPLE THREAT was a project in the 2017 Creative Lab Hawaii Web Series Immersive program.  That amazing experience gave me a whole new outlook on taking control of my creative life and making things happen for a project I believe in.

THIS IS THE FULL TRIPLE THREAT PILOT EPISODE!

A COUPLE OF CLIPS FROM EPISODE 1

 

By supporting TRIPLE THREAT you will be helping us finance a fresh, fun, new web series with content that appeals to everyone, but especially fulfills that wide-open niche that lacks web content for the middle-agers to senior citizens.  The timing couldn't be better, take a look at these stats:

   

And to quote an article by Emily Peck in The Huffington Post - 

“If you’re a woman of a certain age, good luck finding people on screen who look like you.  In a lot of movies and TV shows, older women are in fact invisible… older women are interesting and beautiful and smart, and everyone misses out when we sideline such a huge group.”

Our material will remain humorous, heart-warming, and suitable for all audiences.  Future episodes may tackle some of the realities of aging such as  physical ailments, forgetfulness, illness, and possibly even romance, albeit in a humorous manner.   

As I also said in my video, I financed the first two episodes and the sizzle reel of TRIPLE THREAT myself.  We are scheduled to begin shooting the next four episodes in April and May.  Each episode costs approximately $4,500.  I'm asking to raise $18,000 because I know I can shoot four episodes for that cost.  That money will pay my actors, director, crew, editor, composer, insurance, taxes, location fees, props, costumes, makeup.  I have an awesome cast and crew, hard-working, respectful, supportive and generous.  I'm lucky.  It's hard asking people for money, but I think TRIPLE THREAT is a very special web series and will be a wonderful, fresh addition to web content for everyone.  So please help me make TRIPLE THREAT a success.

If you absolutely can't contribute money, you can still help in a big way, and we NEED your help:

  • Write a Personal Email to your friends, family, co-workers, any organization that may be women or age-related, or having to do with any woman 40 and older.  Send them the link to this IndieGogo page (https://igg.me/at/triplethreat) and to our Facebook page. 
  • Put an announcement on your Facebook Page, Instagram, email, Twitter, Tumblr, or any other social network sites you're on.
  • “LIKE” the TRIPLE THREAT WEB SERIES Facebook Page and ask your friends and family to "LIKE" it, too.
  • Write an email to all the social groups you know, especially those involved with middle age people, senior citizens or the elderly, directing them to this page or to our Facebook page, and ask them to help us by posting something about TRIPLE THREAT on their website or home page.
  • Include information about TRIPLE THREAT in an upcoming newsletter or events calendar.

If you’re based on Oahu and you would allow us to shoot in a location you’re willing to provide that would be awesome as well.  We are looking at our next shoot dates as being in April and May 2018.  We need a space that is or could pass as an assisted living home, a game room where people play Bingo, a grocery store, a house or apartment with a decent size kitchen and backyard, a drug store such as Long’s or Walgreens, a small section of a parking lot, a nightclub.
story_txt:
TRIPLE THREAT SIZZLE REEL

 
PLEASE SCROLL DOWN TO SEE EPISODE 1 --
 

Don’t you love the sound of that?  It already creates a questionable tone in its implication.  But only because society has conditioned our way of thinking about mature women.  
I’m Gina Surles (I'm on the left in the photo below).  I’m the creator, writer, producer and one of the lead actresses of TRIPLE THREAT.  I was formerly a ballet and modern dancer and taught ballet for 35 years, while pursuing acting and writing.  I am also a woman "of a certain age.”  Some of you may have noticed that mature women have been under-represented in advertising, TV, movies, as well as in other industries including science, technology, and business.  Enter TRIPLE THREAT, for girls who still wanna have frolicking fun after 50!   

A comedy that is a cross between "The Golden Girls" and "Charlie's Angels" has almost limitless material!  The main characters of TRIPLE THREAT, Carolyn, Rosie, and Vivienne, are seeking some excitement and meaning at this point in their lives, and that causes them to take the plunge to become “undercover detectives.”  One day while commiserating in a coffee shop Carolyn and Rosie receive a mysterious note recruiting them for the TRIPLE THREAT Detective Agency.  They have no idea what TRIPLE THREAT is, or that it's the creation of an 85-year-old widow intent on continuing her lifelong pursuit of justice for all.  
After a couple of humiliating job interviews, the idea of going undercover and "doing something that matters" becomes too tempting for Carolyn and Rosie to brush off.  They show up at the time and place in the note and meet Fran's liaison, Vivienne.  She is strong, no-nonsense, a lover of all things French, and not happy at the thought of working with Carolyn and Rosie.
As I mentioned in my video, I’m honored that TRIPLE THREAT was a project in the 2017 Creative Lab Hawaii Web Series Immersive program.  That amazing experience gave me a whole new outlook on taking control of my creative life and making things happen for a project I believe in.
THIS IS THE FULL TRIPLE THREAT PILOT EPISODE!

A COUPLE OF CLIPS FROM EPISODE 1



 


By supporting TRIPLE THREAT you will be helping us finance a fresh, fun, new web series with content that appeals to everyone, but especially fulfills that wide-open niche that lacks web content for the middle-agers to senior citizens.  The timing couldn't be better, take a look at these stats:

“If you’re a woman of a certain age, good luck finding people on screen who look like you.  In a lot of movies and TV shows, older women are in fact invisible… older women are interesting and beautiful and smart, and everyone misses out when we sideline such a huge group.”


Our material will remain humorous, heart-warming, and suitable for all audiences.  Future episodes may tackle some of the realities of aging such as  physical ailments, forgetfulness, illness, and possibly even romance, albeit in a humorous manner.   
As I also said in my video, I financed the first two episodes and the sizzle reel of TRIPLE THREAT myself.  We are scheduled to begin shooting the next four episodes in April and May.  Each episode costs approximately $4,500.  I'm asking to raise $18,000 because I know I can shoot four episodes for that cost.  That money will pay my actors, director, crew, editor, composer, insurance, taxes, location fees, props, costumes, makeup.  I have an awesome cast and crew, hard-working, respectful, supportive and generous.  I'm lucky.  It's hard asking people for money, but I think TRIPLE THREAT is a very special web series and will be a wonderful, fresh addition to web content for everyone.  So please help me make TRIPLE THREAT a success.








If you absolutely can't contribute money, you can still help in a big way, and we NEED your help:

Write a Personal Email to your friends, family, co-workers, any organization that may be women or age-related, or having to do with any woman 40 and older.  Send them the link to this IndieGogo page (https://igg.me/at/triplethreat) and to our Facebook page. 
Put an announcement on your Facebook Page, Instagram, email, Twitter, Tumblr, or any other social network sites you're on.
“LIKE” the TRIPLE THREAT WEB SERIES Facebook Page and ask your friends and family to "LIKE" it, too.
Write an email to all the social groups you know, especially those involved with middle age people, senior citizens or the elderly, directing them to this page or to our Facebook page, and ask them to help us by posting something about TRIPLE THREAT on their website or home page.
Include information about TRIPLE THREAT in an upcoming newsletter or events calendar.

If you’re based on Oahu and you would allow us to shoot in a location you’re willing to provide that would be awesome as well.  We are looking at our next shoot dates as being in April and May 2018.  We need a space that is or could pass as an assisted living home, a game room where people play Bingo, a grocery store, a house or apartment with a decent size kitchen and backyard, a drug store such as Long’s or Walgreens, a small section of a parking lot, a nightclub.

story:
Short Summary

Fast, comfort or gourmet--When it comes to American food, this country is best known for its array of culinary deliciousness. For example, the bacon cheeseburger at Greenwich Village Blossom’s has a lunchtime line around the block for its juicy, savory flavor. The chicken & waffles at Crossroads Kitchen in LA will knock your socks off. The chimichanga at the Cheeze Factory in Wisconsin is hands down delicious. Not only are these dishes a delightful treat for your taste buds…they are also Vegan! Veggie Hunter will hunt for the best plant-based meals throughout America & beyond. This includes restaurants, food trucks, street “no meats”, vegan bakeries, ice cream parlors and all! We will prove that meatless meals don’t lack in taste or adventure. Veggie Hunter will journey across the nation to interview owners, chefs…and sample the yummy food along the way.

Hosted by DJ CherishTheLuv & Regina Mitchell, our goal is to highlight the plant-based food scene that is underrepresented. Veggie Hunter will fill the void and highlight the unique culinary art form involved with vegan meals. Many people are becoming meat reducers, creating a rapidly growing market for all things vegan. So much that restaurants are now changing their menus to offer vegan entrées. Veggie Hunter will hunt for these restaurants, sample the food & be the "go to" show for vegans, vegetarians, meat reducers and foodies everywhere!

Our Team

DJ CherishTheLuv: Host

Reverend / DJ / Radio Host / Web Series Host. DJ CherishTheLuv is a celebrity DJ who produced music, custom mixes, and DJ’d for weddings, events and shows. After surviving cancer and a double mastectomy, DJ CherishTheLuv has been on a quest for healing through food and music. She dedicates herself to spreading freedom of movement, joy and healing via music, rooted in a mindset she entitles “Music Heals.” She has taught DJing to children and adults ages 9-86, including her most recent work at an orphanage in Ecuador. She is also the Women’s Empowerment DJ at Rikers Island, for the Literacy for Incarcerated Teens program, bringing inspiration via music.

Regina Mitchell: Host

Personal Trainer / Emmy Award Winning News Anchor / Reporter / Vegan Enthusiast. Emmy award winning news anchor and reporter, Regina Mitchell has a wealth of experience being on camera. With 10 plus years under her belt, Regina has covered news in the Poconos, Trenton and Dayton, Ohio.  Along with her passion for journalism, she is equally passionate about health & nutrition. Regina Mitchell accomplished one of her goals and became a certified personal trainer and aerobics instructor. She dedicates herself to a vegan lifestyle, training her clients & being a wife and mom. 

Kamilah Lewis: Creator

Production Manager / Event Producer / Web Series Producer / Wife / Mom. With over 15 years working in the television industry, Kamilah Lewis decided to embark on a new adventure of her own. After yearning for a vegan show on television, Kamilah decided to create one of her own. Veggie Hunter has been a work in progress for years. Now she is dedicating her time and efforts to highlighting the vegan food scene that is underrepresented.

Producer - Bonsu

Camera - Eddie 

Sound - Mike

Editor - Cecilia

PM - Abdul

What We Need & What You Get

We need your help. We are aiming to raise $5k or more to assist with season 2 of Veggie Hunter. With this donation you will help contribute to the expenses associated with each shoot.  In order to capture a wide-range of vegan eateries, we need your donation to help pay for equipment, location fees, crew and transportation costs.  We are a bare bones crew; limited to shooting within the surrounding area only. We want our viewers to have the complete vegan culinary experience. The more locations we cover, the more insane and delicious food we'll showcase to our viewers!

We are offering great perks in return for your generous contributions!   Perks include a thank you email with one of our favorite vegan recipes, shout out on social media, your name in the credits, Veggie Hunter t-shirt, an episode shout out by our fabulous show hosts and the opportunity to be a guest on the show!! That's right, we will have a special Fan Favorite episode just for you! We will interview  you at your favorite local vegan restaurant.

Risks & Challenges

Unfortunately, there is a huge misconception about vegan & vegetarian food. Many believe that meatless meals are bland & boring. We are here to prove them wrong!  We will show that vegan meals don't lack in taste or adventure!

We are facing challenges from our ability to cover all of the production costs needed for Season 2. Veggie Hunter is a food road show and getting around has been extremely challenging. We want to discover an array of locations and be the go to source for not just vegans and vegetarians, but foodies everywhere. This is why we need your help!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to financially contribute to our campaign but still want to help, please promote our campaign by spreading the word via Facebook, Twitter, YouTube and Instagram! You can like, tweet, share, and subscribe to our page / channel.

All of our social media links are listed below:

YouTube: www.youtube.com/veggiehunter

Twitter: https://twitter.com/theveggiehunter

Instagram: https://instagram.com/theveggiehunter

Facebook: https://facebook.com/theveggiehunter

There is also an Indiegogo share options which allows you to send this campaign out via email and other social media outlets. 

Thank you again for your love and support!

story:
(Spanish Versión en Español)

NEW Crowdfinding Indiegogo: IGG.me/at/LyosTV

 

This new project of LYOS.TV is a Video Blog of a Motorcycle Solo Trip from Malaysia to Spain... 

Video Blog from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona, in which LYOS, a Video Producer/Climber/Explorer from Mexico, will be documenting everything that happens...

 

We have to tell you the story really fast...

Past:

LYOS left Mexico 11 years ago and captured with his cameras 40 countries in 5 continents.

In 2008 he started a Motorcycle Trip from KL to Madrid... but was interrupted by an Avalanche when he was climbing Mount Everest and canceled the trip...

He did only 1/4 of the route... 

 

Today:

Now 9 years later, Lyos wants to finish that trip, documentating everything on weekly chapters on a Travel Vlog.

So, this Crowd Funding is to get the trip started.

Also you need to know what you will get for your money. For that, Lyos will upload the chapters of the Indonesian Vlog he did and edited to show that the KL - BCN Trip will be even more amazing, so you will support us to do it... 

And the Chapter 01 of LYOS.TV is here:

There are 16 Chapters in the Indonesian Vlog.

 

Future:

After funding the money for the new trip, Lyos will make weekly chapters in real time of all the new Motorcycle Vlog.

Trip that will be crossing 33 countries starting from KL to Barcelona in 2018.

We need your HELP for that... please support LYOS.TV to make this happen...

 

If you can´t Help us with Donations,

please Help us Sharing this Campaing with your Family and Friends or the video.

https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHho

All the Complete Details of the Perks for Supporting LYOS.TV in this Link:
https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955

 

So, that was the short version of the story... now, because we know you want them, here are all the details of the project...

Lyos left Mexico and has been 11 years on the road... and in that time he has done some weird stuff:

 

  • Traveled from Acapulco to Cancun by Bicycle

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GNBapesTV5s

 

  • Motorcycle, Car and Jeep Trips around Mexico

https://youtu.be/5Wv2frYSIBc?t=385

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0PORpqhNCj0

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yITWaC10xqI

 

  • Running with Bulls, Rappelling the Basement of Swallows and Experiencing "Flying" just like an ancient Mexica with the Papantla Flyers

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qbxm0ywyCvc

https://youtu.be/al3ncaCK_EM?t=197

 

  • Travelled the important Maya sites from Mexico to Costa Rica by car doing 25,000 kms

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9cJTZQX5ot8

 

  • Produced, presented and edited Extreme Sports capsules for a TV show in Melbourne

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1CDUSpPGagY

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mcssGFgnOE4

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=RiWCDJDsIkw

 

  • Travelled in a Motorcycle Chopper in 11 countries of Southeast Asia for 33,000 kms

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K_oa-lVAEhQ

 

  • Climbed to the Summit of 38 mountains, including almost getting killed by an avalanche and losing a finger to get to the Top of Mount Everest
 


His cameras already got him detained in 4 different countries and now he is a motivational speaker… doesn´t drink, smoke or do drugs...

All these weird activities are included in the first chapter of the LYOS.TV project... 

 

These are the Social Media the project already has:

 

  LYOS.TV        LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV         LyosTV 

 

  FB Group        FB Page        Indiegogo        PayPal        Lyos.TV@lyos.tv

         

We also have a team of translators totally ready and willing to put subtitles on LYOS.TV

So far we have Spanish, English, Indonesian, French, Russian, German, Italian, Dutch, Finnish, Polish, Turkish and Catalan.

They are just waiting for LYOS.TV to be supported by you guys... so LYOS.TV can reach as much people as possible all over the World by being subtitled in 11 or more languages...

 

​

 

If later when the chapters get released, you can´t find the subtitles in one of the languages listed, it means we still need help to do them... you can also be part of the translation team to help in these or other languages and join LYOS.TV 

If you want please contact us.

You will be part of our VIP contribuition community and will give you credits with your links in the LYOS.TV Web Site and YouTube video descriptions of each video... just like this:

LYOS.TV/who

 

 

This new project in 2018 will be a Motorcycle Trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona.

Including all kind of activities like Extreme Sports, Touristic Spots, High Mountains, Beautiful Beaches, Weird Places and Visiting Orphanages... crossing a Total of 33 Countries.

1. - Malaysia

2. - Thailand

3. - Cambodia

4. - Vietnam

5. - Laos

6. - Myanmar

7.- India

8.- Pakistan

9.- Afghanistan

10.- Tajikistan

11.- Kyrgyzstan

12.- Kazakhstan

13. - Uzbekistan

14. - Turkmenistan

15. - Iran

16. - Georgia

17. - Turkey

18. - Greece

19. - Bulgaria

20. - Romania

21. - Ukraine

22. - Hungary

23. - Slovakia

24. - Poland

25. - Czech Republic

26. - Austria

27. - Italy

28. - Switzerland

29. - Germany

30. - Netherlands

31. - Belgium

32. - France

33. - Spain

This route will take, approximately, 2 years to accomplish all the 33 countries.

Is not an easy route and could change because of many external factors like political problems... still, it will start in 2018 from Malaysia and will finish in Spain… maybe in 2020.

 

After 11 years travelling outside Mexico and his experience in the last motorcycle trip in Asia that lasted 20 months… Video that we showed you before...

 

Lyos calculated that he needs $ 33,000 usd for this KL - BCN motorcycle trip.

Funding Money:

Cost of travelling per month = $ 1,000 usd.

That was calculated on a daily basis: $10 usd for food, $10 usd for petrol and $10 usd for accommodation.

That means $ 30 usd x 30 days… so, $ 900 usd. But there are always some extra expenses and to make it easier, we will say $ 1,000 usd per month.

2 Year Trip = 24 months = $ 24,000 usd daily travelling expenses.

Cost of the second hand motorcycle and international Carnet de Passage papers, so the motorcycle can cross borders with Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.

Cost of the Video and Action Cameras = $ 2,000 usd.

Web Site to keep you informed with chapters and photos updated all the trip = $ 1,000 usd.

Costs for Visas, Subtitling, Repairs, Indiegogo Fees and more = $ 1,000 usd.

Total Cost of the 2 Year Vlog Trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd.

 

Doing this project on a budget trying to save money is important.

$10 usd food and $10 usd accommodation, will force Lyos to maintain a simple more connected to the place and people´s day to day life.

Meaning that sometimes he will have to share rooms in hostels, eat street food or bargain about any touristic service or expeditions on the trip…

All these situations will force him to meet people and make new friends everywhere… making the stories of the trip richer and unique…

 

 

Since you don´t know what to expect of this motorcycle trip, we are dividing the funding of LYOS.TV new Vlog in 2 stages.

The first stage is already this crowd funding from Indiegogo to start the Motorcycle Trip to Barcelona, asking for the first $ 5,555 usd.

 

That´s just to cover the 2 principal costs:

1. - Buying a second hand Chopper Motorcycle for = $ 3,555 usd

2. - Buying the new Video Camera and the Action Camera for = $ 2,000 usd

 

The prices for the cameras online and also in many electronic stores already checked in Kuala Lumpur, tells us that $ 2,000 usd are enough to cover the cost of buying them new.

The second hand motorcycle price is more difficult to calculate.

Lyos checked prices the last time he was in some places of Malaysia and KL, and a 5 year old Chopper was between $ 3,000 and $ 3,500 usd

So we will put the cost on $ 3,555 usd to make sure he can buy it and also because 555 is Lyos favorite number.

 

He knows that reaching this first goal to buy this is not going to be easy…

Also even a little bit harder if you guys don´t know what to expect about all the journey or if you are doubting if Lyos work is worth it or not.

The only thing that we can do, if you didn´t watched it before, is show you the Chapter 1 of the first LYOS.TV project.

A Video Blog of Indonesia in Spanish with English and French subtitles, totally produced and edited by Lyos.

LYOS.TV - Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

This chapter and all the Indonesian Vlog, has no script or camera crew, is a Solo Trip filmed in 10 countries: Spain, England, Australia, New Zealand, Sri Lanka, Malaysia, Philippines, Singapore, Thailand and the narrations are based in Indonesia, with chapters in Borneo, Sumatra, Java and Bali.

 

 

The story is exactly as it happened... without enough money, without rules and without plans… has 16 Chapters… and the list is here:

1       The Dream…

2       See You Later

3       Return to Melbourne

4       The Project

5       Living in the Car

6       Mount Cook Fall

7       Sri Lanka Fix

8       Philippines Fall

9       A Better Year

10     Exploring Borneo

11      Sumatra Fall

12     Thay Relyoaded

13.1  Crossing to... Bali

13.2  Macho Motorcycle Dream Trip

13.3  The Immortal

13.4   Ubud

 

 

All the chapters will be something between 14 - 15 minutes… but remember that the most important thing of this project, is the TRUTH.

So, we will try to make the chapters duration as standard as possible, even though sometimes reality is way different than expected and we can´t control it.

Still, we will never bore our viewers with a chapter that is longer than it should be… or so fast that you can´t enjoy it...

So, the first deal before the KL – BCN Trip Vlog starts, is that, if with your help we reach the goal to buy the stuff and motorcycle, to get ready for the next LYOS.TV trip, we will release 5 Chapters on the $ 5,555 usd goal.

You already have:

Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

So after this is done, we will release:

Chapter 02 - See You Later

Chapter 03 - Return to Melbourne

Chapter 04 - The Project

Chapter 05 - Living in the Car

 

That means that it would be $ 1,111 usd per chapter.

In this procedure you guys will be motivated to see more and more with actual results in hand, while the real project that you are funding has not even started yet.

Meaning that you are receiving and being part of 2 Vlogs for the funding of 1…

This has to convince you to help us and spread this campaign with your friends, so later more people´s help will join us on the way to start the KL – BCN Vlog.

The faster you fund and spread this project, the faster you will have more Indonesian chapters and the faster the KL-BCN will come to live.

 

After this first goal, the crowd funding will be on Demand, meaning that it will continue so we can keep releasing the chapters 6, 7, 8, 9… and every $ 1,111 usd we will upload one more until reaching number 16.

 

 

When we reach that point, LYOS.TV will have $ 17,777 usd of funding… little more than half of the total money that it´s needed to start and finish the new $ 33,000 usd 2 year Vlog until BCN.

Half of money is enough to cover the expenses of many months with the weekly capsules on real time of the KL to BCN project.

After the “first season” with the 16 chapters, you will see that the main porpuse of LYOS.TV is to show reality…

Some chapters are about beautiful places, victories and summiting mountains… some about happy, relaxing and party times… some about failures… some others are sad and even about illness recoveries… learning at the end, that no matter what shit happens in our life... we have to get up again… yes, get up... always…

The thing of LYOS.TV is showing you “travel life”… just as it is… with the goals, the dreams and the obstacles… with the ups and downs that we all have… because at the end, everybody knows that… life is not easy…

So after the Indonesian Vlog, the real time travel capsules of the new Vlog will have a different format.

Each chapter of the fist Vlog resumed the story traveling time of months in 15 minutes.

Some were formed with 1 month of traveling, others with 2 months and another with 2 weeks… and even there is one chapter, done with 11 days of traveling time…

The new Video Blog format on weekly chapters to cover the Motorcycle Trip, will be that every Sunday, Lyos will grab the camera and tell you all what happened in the last week… from Monday to Sunday…

We think each chapter will be a 4 or 5 minutes video, illustrated with footage and photos… or maybe more with special edition and music.

But each chapter duration will depend on reality… on how entertaining were the places and the activities of that single week.

And the best thing in this new project, is that we can focus the chapters on more interesting details.

We will have seven days of storytelling in 5 minutes and we don´t have to rush taking away a lot of stuff and details, just to focus on the most amazing things of the trip…

And don´t get confused, the most amazing parts of the trip will be there... just this time the narration will get more detailed and personal…

 

A motorcycle trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona by land… crossing 33 countries and some of the most difficult places in the world… alone… telling the story as it goes on a limited budget... trust LYOS.TV, we are sure it will be amazing and totally worth it.

 

 

The motorcycle gives a different perspective when you travel…

It is freedom… and gives you the opportunity to get to the corners where no foreigner or even average locals go… just because we can… and just because going to hidden and unknown places, is exactly the way in which we can use the word "explore"…

So let´s go and see what happens… let´s discover real people, real places and real stories…

Doesn´t matter in what you are interested… Rivers, Temples, Waterfalls, Animals, Religions, Villages, Mountains, Jungles, Sports, Orphanages, Beaches…

Whatever you are looking for, the motorcycle is destined to take us there and beyond to find something new…

And this time, even with the option that if you are passionate about something else… or you know anything interesting somewhere… an orphanage or a special secret place along the route… write us... we will make sure it will be soon on LYOS.TV…

 

Amazing Trip that with your Help… will be a Reality very Soon… 

 

ℒ५٥೭   ​

please Help us Sharing this Campaing with your Family and Friends or the video.

ESPAÑOL

NUEVO Crowdfinding Indiegogo: IGG.me/at/LyosTV

 

La primer pregunta que habría que responder es... ¿Porqué?

¿Porqué cruzar esos países en una motocicleta?

El objetivo es salir de la rutina para inspirarnos a explorar lo desconocido... con culturas reales, nuevos países, personas únicas... visitando niños en orfanatorios de todos los países.

Éste proyecto con presupuesto limitado tratará de mostrarte la realidad de viajar... con las cosas buenas y las cosas malas... tal como sucede con los altibajos de la vida.

No hay una mejor manera para poder entender a la humanidad y la forma de pensar de otras personas, que viajando por los rincones de sus países.

Acompañen a LYOS.TV en éste viaje para poder aprender un poco, ayudando a los niños más necesitados de ésta parte del Mundo, juntos...

 

Éste nuevo proyecto de LYOS.TV es un Video Blog de un Viaje en Moto de Malasia a España... 

Video Blog de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona, donde LYOS, un Productor de Video/Alpinista/Explorador de México, documentará todo lo que pase...

 

Te tenemos que contar la historia un poco rápido...

Pasado:

LYOS salió de México hace 11 años y ha capturado con sus cámaras 40 países en 5 continentes.

En 2008 empezó un viaje en Moto de KL a Madrid... pero el viaje fue interrumpido por una Avalancha cuando estaba escalando el Monte Everest y tuvo que cancelar el viaje...

Solo pudo hacer la cuarta parte de la ruta... 

 

Hoy:

Después de 9 años, Lyos quiere terminar ese viaje, documentando todo lo que pasa en capítulos semanales de un Vlog Viajero.

Así, éste Crowd Funding es para preparar dicho viaje.

También necesitan saber que es lo que obtendrán si nos ayudan. Y para ello, Lyos subirá los capítulos del Vlog de Indonesia que hizo y editó, para mostrar que el viaje de KL a BCN será aún más increíble y nos apoyen para realizarlo... 

Y el Capítulo 01 de LYOS.TV es este:

Son 16 Capítulos del Vlog de Indonesia.

 

Futuro:

Después de recaudar el dinero para el viaje, Lyos hará capítulos semanales del nuevo Vlog en Moto en tiempo real.

Viaje que cruzará 33 países empezando de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona en el 2018.

Necesitamos de tu AYUDA... por favor apoya a LYOS.TV para hacerlo realidad...

LYOS.TV/who

 

 

Éste nuevo proyecto para 2018 será un Viaje en Moto de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona.

Incluyendo todo tipo de actividades como Deportes Extremos, Lugares Turísticos, Montañas Altas, Playas Chidas, Lugares Raros y Visitando Orfanatorios... cruzando un Total de 33 Países. 

1. - Malasia

2. - Tailandia

3. - Cambodia

4. - Vietnam

5. - Laos

6. - Myanmar

7.- India

8.- Pakistán

9.- Afganistán

10.- Tayikistán

11.- Kyrgyzstán

12.- Kazakstán
