Esta ruta durará, aproximadamente, 2 años en completarse con los 33 países.

No es una ruta fácil y puede cambiar debido a varios factores externos como problemas políticos... aún así, empezará en 2018 de Malasia y terminará en España... tal vez en el 2020.

Después de 11 años viajando fuera de México y su experiencia con el viaje en Moto anterior en Asia que duró 20 meses... Video que ya les enseñamos antes...

 

Lyos ha calculado que necesita $33,000 usd para el viaje de KL a BCN en moto.

Recaudación de Dinero:

Costo de viajar por mes = $ 1,000 usd.

Eso fue calculado con gastos por día: $10 usd para comida, $10 usd para gasolina y $10 usd para el hotel.

Eso significa que son $ 30 usd x 30 días… $ 900 usd. Pero siempre hay algunos gastos extras y para hacerlo más fácil, diremos que son $ 1,000 usd por mes.

2 Años de Viaje = 24 meses = $ 24,000 usd de gastos de viaje.

Costo de una motocicleta usada y el Carnet de Passage internacional, para que la moto pueda cruzar fronteras con Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.

Costo de la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera = $ 2,000 usd.

Página Web para mantenerlos informados con los capítulos y fotos actualizadas del viaje = $ 1,000 usd.

Costo de Visas, Subtítulos, Reparaciones, Indiegogo y más = $ 1,000 usd.

Costo Total Vlog de Viaje de 2 Años de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd.

 

Realizar éste proyecto con presupuesto intentando ahorrar dinero es importante.

$10 usd para comida y $10 usd de hotel, hará que Lyos mantenga una vida simple y más conectada con las personas locales en su día a día.

Algunas veces tendrá que compartir cuartos en hostales, comer en la calle o regatear cualquier actividad o servicio turístico o expediciones en el viaje…

Todas estas situaciones lo forzarán a conocer gente y hacer nuevos amigos en todas partes... haciendo que las historias en el viaje sean más valiosas y únicas...

 

 

Ya que ustedes no saben que esperar de este viaje en moto, vamos a dividir la recaudación de fondos del Vlog LYOS.TV en 2 etapas.

La primera etapa será ésta campaña en Indiegogo para empezar el Viaje en Moto a Barcelona, pidiendo los primeros $ 5,555 usd.

 

Eso es solamente para cubrir los 2 costos principales:

1. - Comprar la Motocicleta Chopper usada por = $ 3,555 usd

2. - Comprar la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera por = $ 2,000 usd

 

Los precios de las cámaras en línea y también en varias tiendas electrónicas de Kuala Lumpur, nos dice que $ 2,000 usd son suficientes para cubrir el costo de comprarlas nuevas.

El precio de la moto usada será más difícil de calcular.

Lyos checó precios la última vez que estuvo en algunos lugares de Malasia y KL, y una Chopper con 5 años de uso estaba entre $ 3,000 y $ 3,500 usd

Así que pondremos el precio en $ 3,555 usd para asegurarnos de que se pueda comprar además de que 555 es el número favorito de Lyos.

 

El sabe que alcanzar esa primer meta para comprar ésto no será fácil…

E incluso un poco difícil si ustedes no saben qué va a resultar de este viaje o si están dudando si el trabajo de Lyos vale la pena o no.

Por ello si no lo vieron antes, lo primero que queremos enseñarles es el Capítulo 01 del primer proyecto de LYOS.TV

Un Video Blog de Indonesia en Español con subtítulos en Inglés y Francés por ahora, totalmente producido y editado por Lyos.

LYOS.TV - Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

Éste capítulo y todo el Vlog de Indonesia, no tiene script ni asistentes de cámara, es un viaje en solitario grabado en 10 países: España, Inglaterra, Australia, Nueva Zelanda, Sri Lanka, Malasia, Filipinas, Singapur, Tailandia y las narraciones fueron grabadas en Indonesia, con capítulos en Borneo, Sumatra, Java y Bali.

 

 

La historia es exactamente como se vivió... sin dinero extra, sin reglas y sin planes... tiene 16 Capítulos… y son éstos:

1       The Dream…

2       See You Later

3       Return to Melbourne

4      The Project

5       Living in the Car

6       Mount Cook Fall

7       Sri Lanka Fix

8       Philippines Fall

9       A Better Year

10     Exploring Borneo

11      Sumatra Fall

12     Thay Relyoaded

13.1   Crossing to... Bali

13.2  Macho Motorcycle Dream Trip

13.3  The Immortal

13.4   Ubud

 

 

Todos los capítulos durarán entre 14 y 15 minutos… pero recuerden que lo más importante de éste proyecto, es la VERDAD.

Así, trataremos de hacer la duración de los capítulos lo más estándares posible, aunque algunas veces la realidad sea muy diferente a lo que se esperaba y no la podamos controlar.

Aún así, jamás aburriremos al espectador con capítulos más largos de lo que deberían ser... o tan rápidos que no los puedan disfrutar...

Entonces el primer trato antes de que el Vlog de KL a BCN empiece, es que si nos ayudan a alcanzar la meta para comprar la moto y preparar el siguiente viaje de LYOS.TV, les daremos 5 Capítulos al llegar a la meta de los $ 5,555 usd.

Ustedes ya vieron el primero:

Chapter 01 – The Dream…

 

Después de  alcanzar la meta, les subiremos:

Chapter 02 - See You Later

Chapter 03 - Return to Melbourne

Chapter 04 - The Project

Chapter 05 - Living in the Car

 

Eso significa que serán $ 1,111 usd por capítulo.

En ese esquema siempre estarán motivados para ver más capítulos, sabiendo que lo que tendrán será de calidad, mientras que el proyecto que de verdad están financiando ni siquiera ha empezado.

En pocas palabras les estamos dando y forman parte de 2 Vlogs por financiar 1…

Esto debe convencerlos de ayudarnos y compartir ésta campaña con sus amigos para que más personas nos ayuden y se nos unan para empezar el Vlog de KL a BCN. 

Entre más rápido financien y compartan éste proyecto, más rápido tendrán más capítulos de Indonesia y más rápido podrá empezar el viaje de KL a BCN.

 

Después de ésta primer meta, la campaña crowd funding seguirá on Demand, lo que significa que continuará para seguir financiándonos y podamos darles los siguientes capítulos 6, 7, 8, 9… y así cada vez que juntemos $ 1,111 usd se subirá uno más hasta llegar al 16.

 

 

Cuando lleguemos a ese punto, LYOS.TV tendrá $ 17,777 usd financiados… un poco más de la mitad del dinero total que se necesita para empezar y terminar el nuevo Vlog de $ 33,000 usd de viaje por 2 años hasta BCN.

La mitad del dinero es suficiente para cubrir los gastos de varios meses de viaje con los capítulos semanales en tiempo real del proyecto de KL a BCN.

Después la "primer temporada” con 16 capítulos, ya habrán visto que el objetivo principal de LYOS.TV es mostrar la realidad…

Algunos capítulos son acerca de lugares chidos, victorias y escaladas de montañas… algunos son felices, relajados y de fiesta... algunos de fracasos... algunos otros tristes y recuperándose de enfermedades... aprendiendo que al final, no importa la chinga que nos ponga la vida... nos tenemos que levantar otra vez... así es, levantarse...  siempre...

En LYOS.TV queremos mostrarles lo que es “estar de viaje”… tal cual es… con las metas, los sueños y los obstáculos… con los altibajos que todos tenemos... porque al final, todos sabemos que… la vida no es fácil…

Así que después del Vlog de Indonesia, las cápsulas de viaje en tiempo real del nuevo Vlog tendrán un formato distinto.

Cada capítulo del primer Vlog resume la historia de tiempo de viaje de meses en 15 minutos.

Algunos se hicieron con 1 mes de viaje, otros con 2 meses y otro con 2 semanas… e incluso hay un capítulo que se hizo con 11 días de tiempo de viaje…

El nuevo formato del Video Blog semanal para el Viaje en Moto, será que todos los Domingos, Lyos agarrará la cámara y les contará todo lo que ha pasado en esa semana… de Lunes a Domingo…

Creemos que cada capítulo será de 4 o 5 minutes de video, ilustrado con imágenes y fotos… o tal vez más con edición especial y música.

Pero la duración de cada capítulo dependerá de la realidad… de que tan entretenidos fueron los lugares y las actividades de esa semana.

Y la mejor parte de éste nuevo proyecto, es que podremos enfocar los capítulos en los detalles más interesantes.

Tendremos 7 días de historias que contar en 5 minutos y no tenemos la presión de quitar muchas cosas y detalles, sólo para enfocarnos en las cosas increíbles del viaje...

Y no se confundan, las cosas más increíbles del viaje van a estar... sólo que ahora la narrativa será aún más detallada y personal...

 

Un viaje en motocicleta de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona por tierra... cruzando 33 países y algunos de los lugares más difíciles del mundo... sólo... contando la historia tal como pasó con presupuesto limitado... confía en LYOS.TV, estamos seguros que valdrá la pena y será increíble.

 

 

La motocicleta te da una perspectiva diferente cuando viajas…

Es completa libertad… y te da la oportunidad de llegar a lugares remotos donde ningún extranjero ni los locales normalmente van... sólo porque podemos ir... y sólo porque ir a esos lugares ocultos y desconocidos, es exactamente la forma en la que podemos usar la palabra "explorar"...

Así que vamos a ver qué pasa… descubramos personas, lugares e historias reales…

No importa que es lo que te interese… Ríos, Templos, Cascadas, Animales, Religiones, Aldeas, Montañas, Selvas, Deportes, Culturas, Playas... 

Lo que sea que estés buscando, la motocicleta está destinada a llevarnos allá y aún mucho más lejos, para encontrar algo nuevo…

Y ésta vez, con la opción de que si te apasiona alguna otra cosa... o sabes de algún lugar interesante por ahí... algún orfanatorio o algo por la ruta especial y secreto... escríbenos... lo visitaremos para ponerlo próximamente en LYOS.TV…

 

Un Viaje Increíble que con tu Ayuda… será una Realidad muy Pronto… 

 

ℒ५٥೭   ​

But there are always some extra expenses and to make it easier, we will say $ 1,000 usd per month.2 Year Trip = 24 months = $ 24,000 usd daily travelling expenses.Cost of the second hand motorcycle and international Carnet de Passage papers, so the motorcycle can cross borders with Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.Cost of the Video and Action Cameras = $ 2,000 usd.Web Site to keep you informed with chapters and photos updated all the trip = $ 1,000 usd.Costs for Visas, Subtitling, Repairs, Indiegogo Fees and more = $ 1,000 usd.Total Cost of the 2 Year Vlog Trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd. Doing this project on a budget trying to save money is important.$10 usd food and $10 usd accommodation, will force Lyos to maintain a simple more connected to the place and people´s day to day life.Meaning that sometimes he will have to share rooms in hostels, eat street food or bargain about any touristic service or expeditions on the trip…All these situations will force him to meet people and make new friends everywhere… making the stories of the trip richer and unique…  Since you don´t know what to expect of this motorcycle trip, we are dividing the funding of LYOS.TV new Vlog in 2 stages.The first stage is already this crowd funding from Indiegogo to start the Motorcycle Trip to Barcelona, asking for the first $ 5,555 usd. That´s just to cover the 2 principal costs:1. - continue so we can keep releasing the chapters 6, 7, 8, 9… and every $ 1,111 usd we will upload one more until reaching number 16.  When we reach that point, LYOS.TV will have $ 17,777 usd of funding… capsules on real time of the KL to BCN project.After the “first season” with the 16 chapters, you will see that the main porpuse of LYOS.TV is to show reality…Some chapters are about beautiful places, victories and summiting mountains… some about happy, relaxing and party times… some about failures… some others are sad and even about illness recoveries… learning at the end, that no matter what shit happens in our life... we have to get up again… yes, get up... always…The thing of LYOS.TV is showing you “travel life”… just as it is… with the goals, the dreams and the obstacles… with the ups and downs that we all have… because at the end, everybody knows that… life is not easy…So after the Indonesian Vlog, the real time travel capsules of the new Vlog will have a different format.Each chapter of the fist Vlog resumed the story traveling time of months in 15 minutes.Some were formed with 1 month of traveling, others with 2 months and another with 2 weeks… and even there is one chapter, done with 11 days of traveling time…The new Video Blog format on weekly chapters to cover the Motorcycle Trip, will be that every Sunday, Lyos will grab the camera and tell you all what happened in the last week… from Monday to Sunday…We think each chapter will be a 4 or 5 minutes video, illustrated with footage and photos… or maybe more with special edition and music.But each chapter duration will depend on reality… on how entertaining were the places and the activities of that single week.And the best thing in this new project, is that we can focus the chapters on more interesting details.We will have seven days of storytelling in 5 minutes and we don´t have to rush taking away a lot of stuff and details, just to focus on the most amazing things of the trip…And don´t get confused, the most amazing parts of the trip will be there... just this time the narration will get more detailed and personal… A motorcycle trip from Kuala Lumpur to Barcelona by land… crossing 33 countries and some of the most difficult places in the world… alone… telling the story as it goes on a limited budget... trust LYOS.TV, we are sure it will be amazing and totally worth it.  The motorcycle gives a different perspective when you travel…It is freedom… and gives you the opportunity to get to the corners where no foreigner or even average locals go… just because we can… and just because going to hidden and unknown places, is exactly the way in which we can use the word "explore"…So let´s go and see what happens… let´s discover real people, real places and real necesita $33,000 usd para el viaje de KL a BCN en moto.Recaudación de Dinero:Costo de viajar por mes = $ 1,000 usd.Eso fue calculado con gastos por día: $10 usd para comida, $10 usd para gasolina y $10 usd para el hotel.Eso significa que son $ 30 usd x 30 días… $ 900 usd. Pero siempre hay algunos gastos extras y para hacerlo más fácil, diremos que son $ 1,000 usd por mes.2 Años de Viaje = 24 meses = $ 24,000 usd de gastos de viaje.Costo de una motocicleta usada y el Carnet de Passage internacional, para que la moto pueda cruzar fronteras con Lyos = $ 5,000 usd.Costo de la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera = $ 2,000 usd.Página Web para mantenerlos informados con los capítulos y fotos actualizadas del viaje = $ 1,000 usd.Costo de Visas, Subtítulos, Reparaciones, Indiegogo y más = $ 1,000 usd.Costo Total Vlog de Viaje de 2 Años de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona = $ 33,000 usd. Realizar éste proyecto con presupuesto intentando ahorrar dinero es importante.$10 usd para comida y $10 usd de hotel, hará que Lyos mantenga una vida simple y más conectada con las personas locales en su día a día.Algunas veces tendrá que compartir cuartos en hostales, comer en la calle o regatear cualquier actividad o servicio turístico o expediciones en el viaje…Todas estas situaciones lo forzarán a conocer gente y hacer nuevos amigos en todas partes... haciendo que las historias en el viaje sean más valiosas y únicas...  Ya que ustedes no saben que esperar de este viaje en moto, vamos a dividir la recaudación de fondos del Vlog LYOS.TV en 2 etapas.La primera etapa será ésta campaña en Indiegogo para empezar el Viaje en Moto a Barcelona, pidiendo los primeros $ 5,555 usd. Eso es solamente para cubrir los 2 costos principales:1. - Comprar la Motocicleta Chopper usada por = $ 3,555 usd2. - Comprar la Cámara de Video y la Action Camera por = $ 2,000 usd Los precios de las cámaras en línea y también en varias tiendas electrónicas de Kuala Lumpur, nos dice que $ 2,000 usd son suficientes para cubrir el costo de comprarlas nuevas.El precio de la moto usada será más difícil de calcular.Lyos checó precios la última vez que estuvo en algunos lugares de Malasia y KL, y una Chopper con 5 años de uso estaba entre $ 3,000 y $ 3,500 usdAsí que pondremos el precio en $ 3,555 usd para asegurarnos de que se pueda comprar además de que 555 es el número favorito de Lyos. El sabe que alcanzar esa primer meta para comprar ésto no será fácil…E incluso un poco difícil si ustedes no saben qué va a resultar de este viaje o si están dudando si el trabajo de Lyos vale la pena o no.Por ello si no lo vieron antes, lo primero que queremos enseñarles es el Capítulo 01 del primer proyecto de LYOS.TVUn Video Blog de Indonesia en Español con subtítulos en Inglés y Francés por ahora, totalmente producido y editado por Lyos.LYOS.TV - proyecto de KL a BCN.Después la "primer temporada” con 16 capítulos, ya habrán visto que el objetivo principal de LYOS.TV es mostrar la realidad…Algunos capítulos son acerca de lugares chidos, victorias y escaladas de montañas… algunos son felices, relajados y de fiesta... algunos de fracasos... algunos otros tristes y recuperándose de enfermedades... aprendiendo que al final, no importa la chinga que nos ponga la vida... nos tenemos que levantar otra vez... así es, levantarse...  siempre...En LYOS.TV queremos mostrarles lo que es “estar de viaje”… tal cual es… con las metas, los sueños y los obstáculos… con los altibajos que todos tenemos... porque al final, todos sabemos que… la vida no es fácil…Así que después del Vlog de Indonesia, las cápsulas de viaje en tiempo real del nuevo semanas… e incluso hay un capítulo que se hizo con 11 días de tiempo de viaje…El nuevo formato del Video Blog semanal para el Viaje en Moto, será que todos los Domingos, Lyos agarrará la cámara y les cosas increíbles del viaje...Y no se confundan, las cosas más increíbles del viaje van a estar... sólo que ahora la narrativa será aún más detallada y personal... Un viaje en motocicleta de Kuala Lumpur a Barcelona por tierra... cruzando 33 países y algunos de los lugares más difíciles del mundo... sólo... contando la historia tal como pasó con presupuesto limitado... confía en LYOS.TV, estamos seguros que valdrá la pena y será increíble.  La motocicleta te da una perspectiva diferente cuando viajas…Es completa libertad… y te da la oportunidad de llegar a lugares remotos donde ningún extranjero ni los locales normalmente van... sólo porque podemos ir... y sólo porque ir a esos lugares ocultos y desconocidos, es exactamente la forma en la que podemos usar la palabra "explorar"...Así que vamos a ver qué pasa… descubramos personas, lugares e historias reales…No importa que es lo que te interese… Ríos, Templos, Cascadas, Animales, Religiones, Aldeas, Montañas, Selvas, Deportes, Culturas, Playas... Lo que sea que estés buscando, la motocicleta está destinada a llevarnos allá y aún mucho más lejos, para encontrar algo nuevo…Y ésta vez, con la opción de que si te apasiona alguna otra cosa... o sabes de algún lugar interesante por ahí... algún orfanatorio o algo por la ruta especial y secreto... escríbenos... lo visitaremos para ponerlo próximamente en LYOS.TV… Un Viaje Increíble que con tu Ayuda… será una Realidad muy Pronto…  ℒ५٥೭   ​Si no puedes Ayudarnos con Donaciones,por favor Comparte este Crowdfunding con tus Familiares y Amigos o el video.https://youtu.be/ouzTt_HbHhoTodos los detalles de los Premios por Apoyar a LYOS.TV en éste Link:https://www.indiegogo.com/project/preview/757c3955

story:
Why my story should interest you...

At the age of 16, I began crying and didn't stop for two weeks. It was then that I had my first known incident with depression. Since then, I have consistently battled mental illness throughout my life. Many times, I felt alone and ashamed. So alone, that I tried to end it all.  It  was a very scary and low point in my life.

Actress Carrie Fisher said, "take your broken heart and turn it into art." That is how Crazy with a K! came to be and this is why I am so passionate about it.

By contributing to our campaign, we can give a voice to a show that will reach people who experience mental illness. A show that will let them know that they are not alone. A show that will encourage them to move past the shame and pain often associated with this disease, to talk about it and hopefully seek treatment. If Crazy with a K! can save one life, then this entire endeavor will have been worth it.

See more: follow us on social media --

Find out what we are doing, and then come back here and donate.

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/cwak2018

YouTube: https://www.youtube.com/Numinous-Films-LLC

InstaGram: https://www.instagram.com/crazywitha-k

Twitter: https://twitter.com/@CrazyWithaK1

 

 

Let's be real...

It is very hard for small independent projects to make a dent in Hollywood. It is harder for women led projects and it is even harder for projects led by women of color. This is often due to a lack of interest and financial support because studios think no one wants to see these types of films and tv shows. That is why crowdfunding is so necessary. 

 

The 411...

We have invested our own money and even our savings to finance the first stages of Crazy with a K! -- including pre-production and most of production.  To maximize our funds, we often wore multiple hats and relied on the generosity of our entertainment community and friends who believed in us and the story we were telling. 

But in order to complete the final stages of CWAK!, we need $30K. These necessary funds will enable us to:

  • PAY our actors
  • PAY our production crew
  • PAY our post-production team

By taking care of these things we can ensure a high quality and polished final product that hopefully will catch the attention of industry higher ups (like Tina Fey...) so that Joey's story and the story of so many others that struggle with mental illness can be told on a larger scale.

 

After being active in the theatre and film world for multiple decades I became frustrated with the constant stereotypical and limited story lines for women and people of color repeatedly presented as truth on screen.  I wanted to tell stories from a different perspective. Thus, our production company, Numinous Films was born.  

In addition to my entertainment experience, I teamed up with veteran film maker, Robert Scoville. His knowledge and experience allowed us to work with other industry professionals to ensure we had a strong and marketable product.

Here's the cast and crew of Crazy With a K!

 . . . NUMINOUS FILMS, LLC.

. . . CAST OF CWAK!

. . . PRODIGIOUS CREW!

  • See more cast and crew listed on our website at www.crazywithak.com or at our IMDb page where all crew member's personal experience is listed.

 

Give a little . . . get a little . . .

We want thank you for donating and helping us reach our artistic and personal goals. We have included some pretty "crazy" perks just for you. Check them out to the right. And remember, NO donation is too small, and EVERY dollar is greatly appreciated!

 

    There's more we can do!

    • Initial Goal   $30,000 - YAY!! We did it! Thank you so much, now our cast and crew won’t hate us as much anymore!
    • Stretch Goal #1   $37,500 - We will upload a mini sneak peak video of the animation we are doing for a scene in Season 1 Episode 1
    • Stretch Goal #2   $45,000 - We will upload the K-Pop song: "Prince Charming" written specifically for Joey's "happy place?" from Season 1 Episode 3.
    • Stretch Goal #3   $55,000 - We will upload the K-Pop music video before it is officially released in the series. 
    • Stretch Goal #4   $80,000 - We will immediately start planning Season 2 where we can continue Joey's journey!

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know that sometimes, despite our best intentions, we just can't afford to donate to everyone. We understand.

    If you can't give us money, can you give us your time?  

    Word of mouth ALWAYS makes a huge difference! Sometimes we see a movie or try a new restaurant just because someone said we should. Let's do the same thing with Crazy with a K!  Please share this campaign with at least 10 people that you think can help us out financially. Talk, tweet, email, post about our campaign.  And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!

    And that's all there is to it.

     

    Shout out to Snap Inc. for their Bitmojis in our campaign pics on this page!

    Go to  www.bitmoji.com to download your own!

    Or go to your App store and download the Bitmoji app!

    |

    |

    |

Let's do the same thing with Crazy with a K!  Please share this campaign with at least 10 people that you think can help us out financially. Talk, tweet, email, post about our campaign.  And don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools!
And that's all there is to it. Shout out to Snap Inc. for their Bitmojis in our campaign pics on this page!Go to  www.bitmoji.com to download your own!Or go to your App store and download the Bitmoji app!|||

story:
Our Story

Harmless Turtle Productions are an independent production company operating out of Melbourne, Australia. Harmless Turtle was founded with the intention of creating quality genre content. As we are independent, we have the freedom to create whatever we want. 

Nigel Newton's Nocturnal Nights is a satirical take on paranormal investigation shows created by genre fans for genre fans. Influenced by the hybrid-genre approaches of An American Werewolf In London, Buffy the Vampire Slayer and Supernatural, Josh Fielding has created his own unique spin on the horror-comedy genre. He has five more episodes planned, and the team are currently in the middle of writing scripts. 

Our pilot was filmed on a shoestring budget, and we're proud of how it turned out. We're also ready to do it on the cheap all over again. But with your contribution we can:

  • Make five more episodes! 
  • Increase the production value.
  • Feed the cast and crew. 

But the question you're asking is....

What Are You Doing With My Money?

  • We need to create effects for monsters, obtain permits for filming locations, and feed our cast and crew. 
  • We'd also dearly like to pay people for their efforts, and your contribution will be a big part of helping us do that. 
  • Luckily, we have an affordable source for equipment hire, so we're all sorted in that department. 
  • And of course, we have some exciting perks lined up... 

Perk Up! 

Want to be able to say you saw Nigel Newton's Nocturnal Nights before most of the world? For just thirty dollars you'll get each episode a day early, along with exclusive bonus features. If you want to make an amazingly generous contribution, for a thousand dollars you can be credited as an executive producer! Check out all our perks to the right. 

Stretch Goals

  • $6000: More guest stars.
  • $7000: 2019 Christmas Special, "Krampus on Campus".
  • $10,000: We buy our own equipment.
  • $15,000: We make a second season!

The Impact

The hardest thing about being an independent filmmaker is finding the resources and personnel to realise your vision. With your help, the team at Harmless Turtle can create a truly special product. We're making this for people like you, people who enjoy seeing genre tropes skewered and hapless idiots blundering into supernatural danger. If you want to be a part of bringing this series to life, now is your chance. 

Risks & Challenges

With an ambitious project like this come risks. Our first attempt was successful, but problems we could encounter include:

  • Not reaching our funding goal. If this happens, we will still make Nigel Newton. We may have to cut corners or make less episodes, but it will happen. 
  • Not getting permits (this already happened to us, we worked around it). 
  • The world ending (look, maybe Nigel's right). 

There are always risks when filming a project, especially without studio backing. However, we weathered many challenges during our pilot, and believe we are prepared to deliver you the best possible product.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't afford to contribute, that's okay! Here's what you can do to support us:

  • Spread the word to anyone you think might be interested.
  • Use the share tools at the top of the page to strengthen our social media reach. 

Thank you so much for taking the time to consider our campaign. Every dollar counts and even if you're just sharing the campaign, we appreciate you immensely! 

Stay spooky,

Josh Fielding and the team at Harmless Turtle Productions

story:
The Gist

My name is Lindsey Beth Meyers (hello, nice to meet you!). I'm a writer-researcher based in New York City. I am the head-writer and co-producer of a new web-series called "Violet", and my team and I want you to be a part of the fun!

"Violet" is a farce comedy that follows nine high-school theatre students and their eccentric (to say the least) drama teacher. This semester, the class is putting on a production of Macbeth with the largest budget they've ever had: $35. "Violet" pulls on all of those wonderful, terrible theatre kid tropes: budget restraints, cast list drama, diner outings, and, of course, *showmances*.

It is co-produced and directed by my close collaborator Sofia Gregory.

 

The Cash

Our goal is to raise $3,000 to cover location costs, equipment rental fees, costume pieces,  and compensation for our cast and crew.

If you are unable to contribute financially, sharing this campaign on social media is another great way you can help us out!

Thanks so much for your contribution, time, and support!

 

Poster design by: Celia Joyce

story:
Short Summary

I'm a Vancouver-based filmmaker and artist who's been creating, preforming and collaborating to make art in many of its forms, for more than a decade. I graduated Vancouver's Nimbus School with a degree in Post and Game Audio Production and since then, have implemented sound design and composed for a number of short and full-length films.

Over the last several years, as I continued to help people tell their stories, the desire to tell my own, grew and grew until I couldn't refrain from telling them any longer!

Over the last, year I have been writing, producing, directing, implementing music and sound design for an ambitious, wholly original web-series called LITTER, which fictionalizes, distorts and chronicles the last two trimesters of my wife's pregnancy, culminating with the actual birth of our son, Bowie, on Christmas day 2019! 

The project is obviously very, very near and dear to our hearts. It has been our singular focus for the last year. It has been completely self-funded and I have done 90% of the necessary  post-production myself. 

We can see the finish line, coming over the horizon to meet us. In this final stretch, we seek funds to help pay for the post-production services I am unable to complete myself.  The series needs full color design and animation for titles and several key sequences. 

We also need funds to help pay for music licensing. We are currently in search of the right Vancouver-based band or bands to serve as the musical voice of the project and we are also in talks with Philadelphia band, Sheer Mag, to use one or more of their songs. Music sync licenses can get pretty pricey and the series requires upwards of 20 original songs so we are hoping to also raise funds for this purpose.

In addition, we will  be using funds to help pay for festival submissions, advertising, distribution and release strategy, upon completion.

I've been making art for three decades and this is by far the most important, ambitious and completely original thing I've ever been part of.  This series will make waves. It will challenge some people, inspire others, make people laugh and cry. It will bring the audience along for a journey through seasons and the changing body of a pregnant woman as she transforms in to a caring mother.

Your contributions will help us tell this story. This epic, unique, exciting story. Your help will turn this raw diamond in to the sparkling jewel it's meant to be!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are seeking $5000 to pay for color design, animation, music licensing and festival submissions.

  1. Our color designer will be getting at least, $900 (probably more). Around $10/min.
  2. Our animator will also be getting at least $1000 (hopefully more)
  3. We expect to pay at least $1000 for music sync licenses (maybe more)
  4. We will be submitting for festivals over the next couple years as well as advertising and marketing which will be at least $1000 (probably more)

Donations of $500 or more will receive a Producer's credit for the entire series!

All donations of $200 or more will receive audio and video production services by me at a 1 to 1 value! Meaning, I will work for you for donations at my standard $50/hr rate, 1 hour of my work for every $50 you donate (starting at $200). The work can be for someone else or spread out over time or reserved for later! Donate, save the hours and hit me up in five years and get my time for a hell of a bargain!

If we do not meet our full goal, the money will first and foremost go towards the color designer and animator. Anything after that, to the band, and anything after that, to help with festival submissions, advertising and marketing.

 

The Impact

There are a heck of a lot of people on the planet. So, naturally, a lot of people have been through pregnancy and child birth.  Everyone has a story. It is an amazing, exciting experience. So much change and growth.

As my wife and I entered our pregnancy with the newfound passion for storytelling, we discussed how pregnancy is shown in movies and TV. In our opinion, there's a lot about pregnancy that's never shown. Most people don't have a hallmark pregnancy and kodak birth. It's raw and gross and beautiful and scary and stressful and a million other things.

Also, what about women who get pregnant who have addiction problems? What about single, expecting mothers who are broke artists, getting evicted and dealing with real life? We hadn't seen much of anything like that before, so we decided that was the story we wanted to tell. We began writing and casting and organizing for production. 

Over the next year, we went through our pregnancy and life as anyone else would have, except that we were writing real life situations and challenges in to our story. As Candace was experiencing these new things, we were channeling them in to our art.  As life was throwing us curve-balls, we were catching 'em and turning them in to episodes and anecdotes.

Not only does this series show a side of pregnancy, child birth and life that is rarely shown, it also breaks the genre barriers, morphing between fiction and chronicle. A new kind of storytelling that distorts reality, reflected back in a wavy, fun-house mirror.

This story will speak volumes to one of the biggest groups of people in the world; peoplewho  have gone through pregnancy and child birth! As we come to know and love our main character, Suzy, we're taken along for her amazing maternal journey and get to actually see the moment when she meets her baby! For Real!! This is a truly, momentous, heavy, wondrous, hilarious, weird and wacky story of love and life that will, undoubtedly, find its loving audience upon being unleashed on the world!

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest challenge telling this story is to get people past the first few episodes. This is only because of the subject matter. In the first episode, our main character, Suzy, lays on her bed, chain-smoking and using a dating app on repeat. After a long while, she chugs a glass of wine and gets up, finally revealing a very pregnant belly!  It is meant to be a shocking reveal. It is meant to conflict, confuse and possibly anger the audience. 

My wife had a few puffs of herbal cigarettes, not inhaling, and drank cranberry juice!

We wanted to have Suzy start at the bottom, surrounded by trash and filth and wallowing in it. It gives her somewhere to go and grow! It makes for an amazing journey to watch a resentful pregnant woman with terrible habits, transform in to a capable, loving mother, before our very eyes! 

It will be hard for a lot of people to watch a pregnant person drink and smoke. The truth of life is, however, there are a lot of women who smoke and drink during pregnancy. We all know you shouldn't, but addiction is a serious issue and can override better judgement. It is a dark, cruel reality that people don't want to see.  This will be our biggest challenge.

In the first episode, immediately following the pregnant reveal and title, there will be a large disclaimer, stating that "no actual cigarettes or alcohol were consumed in the making of this production," or something to that effect (will be drafting with lawyer/producer). This same disclaimer will also be a key part of all descriptions, press releases, campaigns or any promoting, advertising or releasing of the series, clear for everyone to see. I believe this will effectively nullify this concern, although it will still be difficult to watch for some, as it's meant to be.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate, there's still a way for you to help us! Spread the word! 

Share the campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Shout it out!

Thank you so much for taking the time to read about this amazing series and our plans for unleashing it! There's still a lot of work to do, but we are getting close and the series is seriously coming together!

Much Love from Matt Beebe, Candace Chase and Bowie Beebe :)

As my wife and I entered our pregnancy with the newfound passion for storytelling, we discussed how pregnancy is shown in movies and TV. In our opinion, there's a lot about pregnancy that's never shown. Most people don't have a hallmark pregnancy and kodak birth. It's raw and gross and beautiful and scary and stressful and a million other things.
Also, what about women who get pregnant who have addiction problems? What about single, expecting mothers who are broke artists, getting evicted and dealing with real life? We hadn't seen much of anything like that before, so we decided that was the story we wanted to tell. We began writing and casting and organizing for production. 
Over the next year, we went through our pregnancy and life as anyone else would have, except that we were writing real life situations and challenges in to our story. As Candace was experiencing these new things, we were channeling them in to our art.  As life was throwing us curve-balls, we were catching 'em and turning them in to episodes and anecdotes.
Not only does this series show a side of pregnancy, child birth and life that is rarely shown, it also breaks the genre barriers, morphing between fiction and chronicle. A new kind of storytelling that distorts reality, reflected back in a wavy, fun-house mirror.
This story will speak volumes to one of the biggest groups of people in the world; peoplewho  have gone through pregnancy and child birth! As we come to know and love our main character, Suzy, we're taken along for her amazing maternal journey and get to actually see the moment when she meets her baby! For Real!! This is a truly, momentous, heavy, wondrous, hilarious, weird and wacky story of love and life that will, undoubtedly, find its loving audience upon being unleashed on the world!

Risks & Challenges
Our biggest challenge telling this story is to get people past the first few episodes. This is only because of the subject matter. In the first episode, our main character, Suzy, lays on her bed, chain-smoking and using a dating app on repeat. After a long while, she chugs a glass of wine and gets up, finally revealing a very pregnant belly!  It is meant to be a shocking reveal. It is meant to conflict, confuse and possibly anger the audience. 
My wife had a few puffs of herbal cigarettes, not inhaling, and drank cranberry juice!
We wanted to have Suzy start at the bottom, surrounded by trash and filth and wallowing in it. It gives her somewhere to go and grow! It makes for an amazing journey to watch a resentful pregnant woman with terrible habits, transform in to a capable, loving mother, before our very eyes! 
It will be hard for a lot of people to watch a pregnant person drink and smoke. The truth of life is, however, there are a lot of women who smoke and drink during pregnancy. We all know you shouldn't, but addiction is a serious issue and can override better judgement. It is a dark, cruel reality that people don't want to see.  This will be our biggest challenge.
In the first episode, immediately following the pregnant reveal and title, there will be a large disclaimer, stating that "no actual cigarettes or alcohol were consumed in the making of this production," or something to that effect (will be drafting with lawyer/producer). This same disclaimer will also be a key part of all descriptions, press releases, campaigns or any promoting, advertising or releasing of the series, clear for everyone to see. I believe this will effectively nullify this concern, although it will still be difficult to watch for some, as it's meant to be.
Other Ways You Can HelpIf you can't donate, there's still a way for you to help us! Spread the word! Share the campaign! Use the Indiegogo share tools! Shout it out!Thank you so much for taking the time to read about this amazing series and our plans for unleashing it! There's still a lot of work to do, but we are getting close and the series is seriously coming together!Much Love from Matt Beebe, Candace Chase and Bowie Beebe :)

story:
Short Summary

Hi! My name is Brandon and I am the writer and creator of Minimum Wage, a locally produced sitcom about the employees of a local coffee shop. I wrote this show because I find joy in performing and putting smiles on people's faces. I joined together with many of the talented actors in Central Illinois, as well as one of the best videographers in the area, and an AMAZING local coffee shop to create something special! 

We are seeking funding so that we can continue making quality episodes by using better equipment, and having funds to be able to rent locations for filming. We also want to be able to pay our actors, director, and extras! We believe that when people show up to help you achieve your goal, you should try as best as you can to make sure they know their help is appreciated!

Episode 1 is available now on Facebook and Youtube! Just search "Minimum Wage Sitcom"!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are hoping to raise $10,000 in funding. Here is what the money will be used for, and what you will receive by becoming a backer!

  • $4,000 will be used to upgrade equipment  for filming.
  • $1,000 will be used for filming location rental.
  • $2,000 will be used to pay our actors.
  • $3,000 will go to our writer and director to offset out-of-pocket expenses and to be put back into the show's production.

 

  • All backers who give $20 or more will receive Minimum Wage merchandise signed by the cast, and shipped directly to them! There are also opportunities for local backers to join us on set as extras!
  • If we are unable to reach our full goal, funds gathered will be used for the same reasons listed above, but in smaller amounts, of course!

The Impact

We have actors who deal with a lot of the issues we will be tackling in this show. This will give them the opportunity to personally be a part of a production that addresses these issues, and comes along side them, as well as our viewers, to show them that they have incredible value that can not be replaced or duplicated. 

Risks & Challenges

COVID-19 has greatly impacted the film industry, and we have not been immune to the challenges that come with filming a sitcom during a global pandemic. We strive to create a safe environment for our cast and crew when on set by requiring masks when not on screen, cleaning equipment and props frequently, and keeping as much distance as possible between extras, crew members, and actors. Due to the ongoing pandemic, we are always at risk of not being allowed by state and local government to film at certain times of spikes in COVID-19 cases. If  and when this happens, filming will be delayed until we can safely gather to film.

Other Ways You Can Help

You can help by sharing this campaign with your friends and family on social media. You can also share episode 1 of Minimum Wage from our Facebook page our Youtube channel so they know exactly what they are contributing to!

story:
The X-Files Preservation Collection and Museum

The X-Files is the second longest running sci-fi series in television history, a record that will likely never be broken, especially now that television is moving to streaming and binge watching an entire season in a matter of days. That alone earns it a place in television history but The X-Files is more than that. It is as big as the fandom, The X-Files is a sci-fi mystery, echoing Kolchak: The Night Stalker, with it's monster of the week episodes. It is the mythology for some and a love story for the shippers. It has saved lives and also changed lives, whether that be by providing a foundation or anchor or with it's world renowned "Scully effect". The X-Files has brought fans from all over the world together from the very beginning with AOL chat rooms and still today at the many different conventions. The X-Files is it's creator Chris Carter and the actors/actresses that we all know and love. It is the writers and producers, the camera man, and prop masters, the sound and lighting guys and the soundtrack. (Thank you, Mark Snow.) and we the fandom are now a part of this pop culture phenomenon.

This collection is a passion project of ours.  Jim has been a fan and collector since The Pilot episode aired on Sept. 10, 1993. He was instantly hooked by the Kolchak vibe and the show became a foundation for him to rebuild his life.  Once he began collecting, he never stopped.  He began with commercial items, moved on to promotional items and crew gifts, and finally to production pieces and screen used props and wardrobe.

THE X-FILES PRESERVATION COLLECTION is possibly the world's largest collection of screen used props, wardrobe, and set dressing from The X-Files. The collection is home to thousands of pieces of The X-Files history, many of which are iconic to the show.  Some of the more notable items are:  several pieces of furniture from Mulder's office,  an alien cryopod from "Fight the Future",  burnt doll from episode "Chinga",  a suit worn by Mitch Pileggi as Skinner, tattered shirt worn by David Duchovny  as Mulder in episode "Field Trip". The list goes on and on. 

The purpose of this collection is to Preserve these items for the fandom. The goal is to provide a permanent space where these items can be properly preserved and displayed for the fans. Some items come to us in need of restoration. We do our best to repair these items. We are constantly adding items and we never sell. Once an item is added to the collection it has a permanent home. 

So many of you have told us that you would like to be a part of this. We have received so much support from the fandom and celebrities and so many of you have encouraged us to open a museum. We are asking you to help us bring THE X-Files Preservation Collection Museum to fruition. We are planning more that just a place to view these items, we are planning a place for you to experience the History of The X-Files. This museum will be located in the Saratoga Springs area of New York. 

Our goal is to raise $8,000.00 to secure the location so that we can build this museum for you.  This will give us the first few months' rent and also help us to fund licensing etc.  We would never ask you to support us without getting something in return and have planned some really cool rewards.  Any amount is helpful and greatly appreciated, for a donation of $5.00 we will give you a public thank you shout--out,  for $15.00 we will give you a shout out and a The X-Files Preservation Collection coffee mug, for $25.00 we will give you a shout out and a The X-Files Preservation Collection baseball cap, for $35.00 we will give you a shout out and a T-Shirt, for $60.00 you will receive a shout out, mug and hat, for $100.00 you will receive the shout out, mug, hat and T-shirt.  

* For those of you that will be getting a T-Shirt - Thank you so much!  We will email you prior to shipping in regards to sizes.  

We greatly appreciate all the support we have received and look forward to sharing the collection with all of you. 

Thank you

Jim and Kelly

The X-Files Preservation Collection

story:
Do you love Fantaghirò: The Cave of the Golden Rose's saga as much as we do?

Fantaghirò is a cult series of Italian television from the 90s that represents an artistic and cultural heritage in the history of Italian cinema and television, and that is still known and loved around the world!

Some of the most beautiful costumes, masterfully made by the costume designers MARISA D'ANDREA and ROSANNA ANDREONI - to whom this project is dedicated - were found by the founder of Fantaghirò Fans Club in an old cinematographic tailoring near Rome, which ceased its activity and was about to throw them away! Thanks to Fantaghirò Fans Club founder, then, the tailor’s shop decided to sell them to other cinematographic and theatrical tailor’s shops. The new owners can decide to discard them, unpack them to use the fabrics, or modify them and reuse them for new theatrical and cinematographic shows. 

This crowdfunding campaign, through a considerable fundraising, aims to put forward a proposal to purchase those costumes, which would become the property of the Fantaghirò Fans Club and which could find a new location in an exhibition open to fans during the celebration of the 30th anniversary of the series. What a better way to celebrate this unique anniversary?

Contribute to save Fantaghirò’s costumes by this fundraising compaign and you will receive a poster with the characters of the fantasy TV series directed by Lamberto Bava The Cave of the Golden Rose, The Dragon Ring and Alisea and the Dream Prince.

HELP US TO SAVE THE ORIGINAL FANTAGHIRO'S COSTUMES! Any help you can give is so greatly appreciated!

Alcuni dei più bei costumi, magistralmente realizzati per la miniserie fantasy Fantaghirò dalle costumiste MARISA D'ANDREA e ROSANNA ANDREONI a cui è dedicato questo progetto, sono stati ritrovati dal fondatore del Fantaghirò Fans Club in una vecchia sartoria cinematografica, nei pressi di Roma, che cessato la sua attività. 


La sartoria ha deciso di vendere molti dei costumi di sua proprietà ad altre sartorie cinematografiche e teatrali che diventando le nuove proprietarie potranno decidere di disfarsene, scucirli per utilizzarne le stoffe, o modificarli e riutilizzarli per nuovi spettacoli teatrali e cinematografici.


Questa campagna crowdfunding, tramite una raccolta fondi considerevole, si pone l’obiettivo di avanzare una proposta di acquisto di questi costumi, che diventerebbero di proprietà del Fantaghirò Fans Club e che potrebbero trovare nuova collocazione in una mostra aperta ai fans nell’ambito della celebrazione del trentesimo anniversario della serie. 


Aiutaci a salvare i costumi originali di Fantaghirò, una serie cult della televisione italiana degli anni '90 tutt’ora conosciuta e amata in tutto il mondo, che rappresentano un patrimonio artistico e culturale nella storia del cinema e della televisione italiana!

Tutti coloro che contribuiranno alla raccolta avranno in regalo un poster con i personaggi delle serie fantasy di Lamberto Bava, Fantaghirò, Desideria e l’anello del drago, e Sorellina e il principe del Sogno.

story:
We've all been asked this question at one point or another. It's a question our team has gone in depth about - the way it's made us feel, the way it's been used against us. The dreaded: "Yeah, but where are you really from?" So we wanted to reclaim it. We wanted to change the narrative from "othering" to a way in which we discover our complex identities. 

 

WAYRF is a 30-ish minute TV drama which follows 17-year-old Jazlyn De Los Santos, whose life turns upside down when her mother returns from working abroad. What's meant to be a heartwarming welcome quickly turns sour when Jazlyn is forced to plan a traditional Filipino coming-of-age ceremony, and the secrets she's hidden (and has been hidden from) begin to unravel. 

At its core, Where Are You Really From? is about generational divide and generational unity, about discovering your identity, and the learning and unlearning that comes along with all of it. 

 

Director & Producer | Liz Quemada | 4th Year RTA Media Production

Liz has a passion for media, culture, art, and music. Her talent and vision allows her to bring the story to life while connecting pieces together in all stages of production. She's worked as a freelance videographer, graphic designer, and content creator for companies like RU Student Life and Mediaplanet. She recently directed and edited a short film titled "Note 279" and a documentary titled "A Letter To Doug Ford". 

Her goal is to make her audience feel seen and empowered through diverse stories which push for representation both on and off screen. 

Producer & Writer | Jillian Maniquis | 4th Year RTA Media Production

Jillian prides herself on her ability to make others feel heard and seen through writing. Her first-most priority when beginning any creative project is to create and occupy spaces for representation, and consequentially capturing those stories in writing. In the past she's worked as a video editor at RU Student Life, and marketing assistant at both HER Creative TO and Reel Asian Film Festival. Her published works can be found in Feels Zine, Kaleidoscope, Revibe Toronto, and Thought Catalog.  In 2018 she self-published her debut poetry collection titled "Nineteen" which became a 3x Amazon best-seller in 2019. 

She hopes to bring life to a story that has been aching to be heard through this pilot. 

Writer & Production Manager | Sarah Padillo | 4th Year RTA Media Production

Sarah Padillo has a passion for storytelling, marketing, and sports. As a first generation Filipino/Canadian, Sarah wishes to tell a compelling story about the cultural divide between 1st and 2nd generation immigrants. Upon graduating from Ryerson, Sarah wishes to work within the sports media industry.

Sarah currently works as a social media specialist for Ryerson's Alumni Relations department, and also creates content for The GIST, a female-founded sports media startup. Her biggest accomplishments during her time as an RTA student includes being nominated for Best Narrative Script, and winning Best Intermediate Video Production at the 41st TARA Awards.

Director of Photography | Ryan Ng | 4th Year RTA Media Production

Ryan has over 6 years of production experience ranging from photo to video work. Though lacking in drawing and writing skills as a child, he gravitated to storytelling through the lens of the camera. As a 2nd Generation Asian immigrant, a career in the creative industry seemed difficult to justify - yet with a little persuasion and consistency, Ryan's been able to work with clients such as Unity, DECA Ontario, Chronic Ink Tattoos, and OMERS, eventually gaining support from his parents. 

In hopes to one day penetrate the mainstream market with visual stories about Asian representation, Mixed Bowl Media is his starting point to bring the stories on screen as a DOP while using personal experiences to help nurture the show. 

1st Assistant Director | Kathleen Burgess | 3rd Year RTA Media Production

Kathleen is a Toronto-based filmmaker and photographer with a passion for the arts and the community that film and television create. Since a young age, she's been fascinated with creating the dream worlds she imagines in her mind and she's excited to assist in bringing these dreams to screen. With a diverse background in photography, production coordination, and directing, Kathleen's mission is to always make people feel empowered and valued through her work. 

Lighting & Set Director | Krista Barleta | 3rd Year RTA New Media 

Krista is a New Media student with a background in visual studies and digital fabrication. As a multimedia artist and designer, she has worked mainly for independent artists and not-for-profit community arts organizations in Toronto. Passionate about DIY and maker culture, urban foraging, and community arts, she wants to create installations that combine creative lighting with found objects and readymade art. A first generation immigrant and settler here on Turtle Island, her views and work practice are greatly influenced by concepts of memory, migration, and hauntologies. 

Audio Lead | Austin Tang | 3rd Year Media Production 

Austin has a passion for film, audio, graphic design, and music. During his free time, he likes to watch movies, skateboard, make music, and play with his dog. He is extremely excited to bring his creativity and passion for storytelling to this project. 

As Audio Lead, he will bring the soundscape of Where Are You Really From? to life. With excellent attention to detail, he will be able to capture the relationship between visuals and audio, creating a fully immersive environment for the audience. As a 1st generation immigrant, he feels very attached to this story and is excited to have the opportunity to help tell it.  

Marketing Director / Jeren Jake / 3rd Year Media Production

Jeren is currently the VP Marketing At the Course Union for RTA students. His skill set includes, videography, photography, social media management and hopes in the future that he will become a television producer. In his free time Jeren loves to do all things media- he is a co-host for the radio show "What’s Poppin" as well as hosting a stream for his followers and viewers on twitch. His love for marketing started in second year when he started researching and realizing ways in which social media can change projects for the better.

Wardrobe Lead | Jessica Agbayani | 4th Year Creative Industries 

Jessica is in her final semester at Ryerson University's Creative Industries program. She's worked as a wardrobe assistant on "Jump Darling" and multiple Soft Moc ad campaigns. In her spare time she enjoys all things pop-culture, Keannu Reeves movie marathons, and watching rom-coms & coming of age films. 

Social Media Content Creator | Francesca Fernandez | 4th Year GCM 

Francesca is the Social Media Content Creator for WAYRF. In her final year of GCM, she currently works at a non-profit which supports Indigenous entrepreneurs. In her free time she normally enjoys buying concert tickets and making travel plans, but in 2020 you can find her baking bread or attempting a short-lived hobby (see: her abandoned embroidery kit, old guitar, and empty bullet journal). 

We know asking for donations is a big request. And we're fundraising a big amount. But what we're really asking for is to give those who we don't see in mainstream media, a chance to be seen; a chance at something bigger than all of us. 

Our executive team is made up of 3 students, and because we believe in this project as much as we hope you do, we've each donated $500 of our own funds to get us started. So instead of our original 12.5K, we're asking for 11K. 

So let's break it down: 

Locations: $4,300

We're hoping to film at two primary locations and two secondary locations. Our costs have been alleviated through partnerships with Ryerson University, but locations are the biggest part - without them we basically don't have a space to shoot this pilot! 

Transport & Craft: $2,700

Something you might not know about indie student productions: everyone, from cast to crew, is pretty much a volunteer. Meaning, they're volunteering their time to make sure this show becomes a reality - and to thank them for it we feed them (yes, TV is this glamorous). Not only that but sometimes we'll have to move our peeps from Point A to Point B, and that includes drivers, fuel, rentals, and just a lot of transport to keep the ship sailing. 

Equipment: $2,500

Luckily we're students studying Television Arts and we've got some equipment to tide us over. But, if we're being honest, it's not enough for a 30-minute TV show (plus, we can't get greedy, there are a lot of other great productions at work). So while we can use some of the provided equipment, we'll also have to rent a whole lot more - and you guessed it, it gets costly! 

Wardrobe and Set: $1,400

Not to brag, but a lot of our team are expert thrifters. We're a pretty stylish bunch if you ask us - and we want the same for our characters and sets (and on a budget, just like us!). So, for the most part our items will be borrowed or donated, but others will have to be thrifted or bought. And sure, one thrifted T-Shirt is pretty inexpensive but, 10 days of outfits is a different story. 

Marketing: $1,200

Creating a show is cool and all, but we kind of need people to see it, to know about it, and to want to talk about it. This all comes down to the marketing. Eventually, we'll want to have a premiere and celebrate this episode with all of you who helped make it happen, and in order to do that we've gotta clear room for our marketing budget. 

Health & Safety: $400

More than ever, we want our team to be safe. We're ensuring our whole crew has the proper PPE - from masks to face shields to gloves, you name it and we've got it! 

For a grand total of $12,500! 

 

 

We really hope we make our goal, but we do have a contingency plan! No goal? No problem. We'll just have to scale back. That means that some folks on set might have to wear multiple hats, we might have to cut a scene or two, and we might have to change a location. Our show will still get made, it'll just get made differently.

 

 

We've got you! 

  • Do you have a business/ company that could help us alleviate the costs by in-kind donations of any of the above mentioned? Send us an e-mail! 
  • Share this Indiegogo page with a friend or a few! The more people who see this, the better chance we have at getting it made.
story_txt:
We've all been asked this question at one point or another. It's a question our team has gone in depth about - the way it's made us feel, the way it's been used against us. The dreaded: "Yeah, but where are you really from?" So we wanted to reclaim it. We wanted to change the narrative from "othering" to a way in which we discover our complex identities. 
 

WAYRF is a 30-ish minute TV drama which follows 17-year-old Jazlyn De Los Santos, whose life turns upside down when her mother returns from working abroad. What's meant to be a heartwarming welcome quickly turns sour when Jazlyn is forced to plan a traditional Filipino coming-of-age ceremony, and the secrets she's hidden (and has been hidden from) begin to unravel. 
At its core, Where Are You Really From? is about generational divide and generational unity, about discovering your identity, and the learning and unlearning that comes along with all of it. 
 

Director & Producer | Liz Quemada | 4th Year RTA Media Production
Liz has a passion for media, culture, art, and music. Her talent and vision allows her to bring the story to life while connecting pieces together in all stages of production. She's worked as a freelance videographer, graphic designer, and content creator for companies like RU Student Life and Mediaplanet. She recently directed and edited a short film titled "Note 279" and a documentary titled "A Letter To Doug Ford". 
Her goal is to make her audience feel seen and empowered through diverse stories which push for representation both on and off screen. 
Producer & Writer | Jillian Maniquis | 4th Year RTA Media Production
Jillian prides herself on her ability to make others feel heard and seen through writing. Her first-most priority when beginning any creative project is to create and occupy spaces for representation, and consequentially capturing those stories in writing. In the past she's worked as a video editor at RU Student Life, and marketing assistant at both HER Creative TO and Reel Asian Film Festival. Her published works can be found in Feels Zine, Kaleidoscope, Revibe Toronto, and Thought Catalog.  In 2018 she self-published her debut poetry collection titled "Nineteen" which became a 3x Amazon best-seller in 2019. 
She hopes to bring life to a story that has been aching to be heard through this pilot. 
Writer & Production Manager | Sarah Padillo | 4th Year RTA Media Production
Sarah Padillo has a passion for storytelling, marketing, and sports. As a first generation Filipino/Canadian, Sarah wishes to tell a compelling story about the cultural divide between 1st and 2nd generation immigrants. Upon graduating from Ryerson, Sarah wishes to work within the sports media industry.
Sarah currently works as a social media specialist for Ryerson's Alumni Relations department, and also creates content for The GIST, a female-founded sports media startup. Her biggest accomplishments during her time as an RTA student includes being nominated for Best Narrative Script, and winning Best Intermediate Video Production at the 41st TARA Awards.
Director of Photography | Ryan Ng | 4th Year RTA Media Production
Ryan has over 6 years of production experience ranging from photo to video work. Though lacking in drawing and writing skills as a child, he gravitated to storytelling through the lens of the camera. As a 2nd Generation Asian immigrant, a career in the creative industry seemed difficult to justify - yet with a little persuasion and consistency, Ryan's been able to work with clients such as Unity, DECA Ontario, Chronic Ink Tattoos, and OMERS, eventually gaining support from his parents. 
In hopes to one day penetrate the mainstream market with visual stories about Asian representation, Mixed Bowl Media is his starting point to bring the stories on screen as a DOP while using personal experiences to help nurture the show. 
1st Assistant Director | Kathleen Burgess | 3rd Year RTA Media Production
Kathleen is a Toronto-based filmmaker and photographer with a passion for the arts and the community that film and television create. Since a young age, she's been fascinated with creating the dream worlds she imagines in her mind and she's excited to assist in bringing these dreams to screen. With a diverse background in photography, production coordination, and directing, Kathleen's mission is to always make people feel empowered and valued through her work. 
Lighting & Set Director | Krista Barleta | 3rd Year RTA New Media 
Krista is a New Media student with a background in visual studies and digital fabrication. As a multimedia artist and designer, she has worked mainly for independent artists and not-for-profit community arts organizations in Toronto. Passionate about DIY and maker culture, urban foraging, and community arts, she wants to create installations that combine creative lighting with found objects and readymade art. A first generation immigrant and settler here on Turtle Island, her views and work practice are greatly influenced by concepts of memory, migration, and hauntologies. 
Audio Lead | Austin Tang | 3rd Year Media Production 
Austin has a passion for film, audio, graphic design, and music. During his free time, he likes to watch movies, skateboard, make music, and play with his dog. He is extremely excited to bring his creativity and passion for storytelling to this project. 
As Audio Lead, he will bring the soundscape of Where Are You Really From? to life. With excellent attention to detail, he will be able to capture the relationship between visuals and audio, creating a fully immersive environment for the audience. As a 1st generation immigrant, he feels very attached to this story and is excited to have the opportunity to help tell it.  
Marketing Director / Jeren Jake / 3rd Year Media Production
Jeren is currently the VP Marketing At the Course Union for RTA students. His skill set includes, videography, photography, social media management and hopes in the future that he will become a television producer. In his free time Jeren loves to do all things media- he is a co-host for the radio show "What’s Poppin" as well as hosting a stream for his followers and viewers on twitch. His love for marketing started in second year when he started researching and realizing ways in which social media can change projects for the better.
Wardrobe Lead | Jessica Agbayani | 4th Year Creative Industries 
Jessica is in her final semester at Ryerson University's Creative Industries program. She's worked as a wardrobe assistant on "Jump Darling" and multiple Soft Moc ad campaigns. In her spare time she enjoys all things pop-culture, Keannu Reeves movie marathons, and watching rom-coms & coming of age films. 
Social Media Content Creator | Francesca Fernandez | 4th Year GCM 
Francesca is the Social Media Content Creator for WAYRF. In her final year of GCM, she currently works at a non-profit which supports Indigenous entrepreneurs. In her free time she normally enjoys buying concert tickets and making travel plans, but in 2020 you can find her baking bread or attempting a short-lived hobby (see: her abandoned embroidery kit, old guitar, and empty bullet journal). 


We know asking for donations is a big request. And we're fundraising a big amount. But what we're really asking for is to give those who we don't see in mainstream media, a chance to be seen; a chance at something bigger than all of us. 
Our executive team is made up of 3 students, and because we believe in this project as much as we hope you do, we've each donated $500 of our own funds to get us started. So instead of our original 12.5K, we're asking for 11K. 
So let's break it down: 
Locations: $4,300
We're hoping to film at two primary locations and two secondary locations. Our costs have been alleviated through partnerships with Ryerson University, but locations are the biggest part - without them we basically don't have a space to shoot this pilot! 
Transport & Craft: $2,700
Something you might not know about indie student productions: everyone, from cast to crew, is pretty much a volunteer. Meaning, they're volunteering their time to make sure this show becomes a reality - and to thank them for it we feed them (yes, TV is this glamorous). Not only that but sometimes we'll have to move our peeps from Point A to Point B, and that includes drivers, fuel, rentals, and just a lot of transport to keep the ship sailing. 
Equipment: $2,500
Luckily we're students studying Television Arts and we've got some equipment to tide us over. But, if we're being honest, it's not enough for a 30-minute TV show (plus, we can't get greedy, there are a lot of other great productions at work). So while we can use some of the provided equipment, we'll also have to rent a whole lot more - and you guessed it, it gets costly! 
Wardrobe and Set: $1,400
Not to brag, but a lot of our team are expert thrifters. We're a pretty stylish bunch if you ask us - and we want the same for our characters and sets (and on a budget, just like us!). So, for the most part our items will be borrowed or donated, but others will have to be thrifted or bought. And sure, one thrifted T-Shirt is pretty inexpensive but, 10 days of outfits is a different story. 
Marketing: $1,200
Creating a show is cool and all, but we kind of need people to see it, to know about it, and to want to talk about it. This all comes down to the marketing. Eventually, we'll want to have a premiere and celebrate this episode with all of you who helped make it happen, and in order to do that we've gotta clear room for our marketing budget. 
Health & Safety: $400
More than ever, we want our team to be safe. We're ensuring our whole crew has the proper PPE - from masks to face shields to gloves, you name it and we've got it! 
For a grand total of $12,500! 

 

 
We really hope we make our goal, but we do have a contingency plan! No goal? No problem. We'll just have to scale back. That means that some folks on set might have to wear multiple hats, we might have to cut a scene or two, and we might have to change a location. Our show will still get made, it'll just get made differently.

 

 
We've got you! 

Do you have a business/ company that could help us alleviate the costs by in-kind donations of any of the above mentioned? Send us an e-mail! 
Share this Indiegogo page with a friend or a few! The more people who see this, the better chance we have at getting it made.

story:
Happy Slashers is an animated comedy series that turns all of our horror fantasies and dreams, er..nightmares into reality when we dive deep into the depths of Hell inside Freddy's boiler-room where O'Face,  Jay, Chuck, Tex and Fred meet for group therapy sessions to become A+, high class, model citizens so that they can be safely placed back into society. 

They Solemnly Swear To NOT Be Assholes Anymore.

They Promise.

For Real This Time!

 

OUR GOALS

We are looking for a minimum of $10,000 to fund the entire first season of Happy Slashers (10 episodes). That number would let us hire the most talented voice actors and impersonators on the market and also gives us the ability to produce the highest quality, most professional animation possible! If by chance we are unable to reach our main goal, we will use whatever money is raised to put out as much of the first season as possible. If we raise more than our main goal, the extra money would be used for an additional two episodes (12 total).

$5,000 or less:

  • 3-5 Episodes!
  • 12-15 Minutes in Length!
  • Ability to Hire Top Tier Voice Actor/Impersonator Talent!
  • Ability to Produce High Quality Professional Animation!

$7,500:

  • 6-8 Episodes!
  • 12-15 Minutes in Length!
  • Ability to Hire Top Tier Voice Actor/Impersonator Talent!
  • Ability to Produce High Quality Professional Animation!

$10,000:

  • 10-12 Episodes!
  • 12-15 Minutes in Length!
  • Ability to Hire Top Tier Voice Actor/Impersonator Talent!
  • Ability to Produce High Quality Professional Animation!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially and receive one of our AMAZING perks during this crazy time, we totally understand. BUT there are other ways to help. Mainly SHARE! SHARE! SHARE! with all of your passionate horror fans on every social media platform you have!

...or else!

story:
The Project

You Were Here is a planned 4-part web series focusing on a trio of friends in the wake of a tragedy. David, a quiet but once hopeful man has lost all faith after his best friend and housemate Oscar dies suddenly; Joss, a carefree childhood companion of David's is on the run from a mistake he made; and Angie, a  timid school friend of Oscar's is trying to break free of the shackles of her family. Everyone has struggles. These are theirs. Over 4 episodes we will see these characters evolve and react as they grow up just a little bit more. 

The story deals with themes of identity, sexuality and existentialism.

The series was created by Oliver Wilson-Smith, the director and co-writer. He is joined by colleague Georgie Plant as Producer and co-writer. Together they work under the company Lime 58 Films, started in 2016 and focusing on comedic films. This is their first foray into more dramatic territory and is an exciting prospect.

"This is our most ambitious project yet and we would love it if you could contribute to our campaign! 

With this project under way we as a company and as professionals can move onto bigger and better things as we build our careers and your contribution can help us on that path immensely."

The Money

The money contributed to this campaign will go straight into the budget - e.g.feeding cast and crew, hiring actors, etc. The target will allow us to comfortably cover our basic expenses to allow for a 10 day shoot.

The £2000 target is what we aspire to in order to see the project through as we would like it. However, any little contribution helps. £2000 will ensure that our budget's essentials are covered and that we can proceed without too much concern.

The Risks

This project may be ambitious but we, the creative team, have produced high-quality content before on far less and we have consistently delivered. This can be seen with our documentary, Lammas, and our comedy, Dan Can Save You.

Our producer has a well considered budget and has previously handled the financing of our projects. The chance of us not delivering the quality content you expect is next to zero.

Our director and series creator has formed this project from personal experiences and the entire team desires this to be a respectful and loyal portrayal of all issues highlighted in the series whilst still being a highly entertaining product for you, the viewer.

Other than Money

We understand that a lot of people can't put forward money - that's OK, we understand it's a big ask. However, if you live around the Hampshire area and can help out by providing locations or services then get in touch as we would love to hear from you!

Other than that, please do share this around and get the word out!

 

-Oliver Wilson-Smith & Georgie Plant, Lime 58 Films

 

Meet the Team

Oliver Wilson-Smith (Creator, Writer & Director)

Oliver is a young director who has been involved in storytelling all his life. Originally wanting to be an actor, he discovered his love for directing in college when he put together a stage performance of the Gregory Burke play Black Watch. He has since gone on to study Film Production at Winchester and directed the comedies Dan Can Save You and Please Wash Your Hands (both 2017) as well as the eco-documentary Lammas (2016).

This project is his most ambitious yet but with the team surrounding him, and your goodwill he is excited as ever.

 

Georgie Plant (Producer & Co-Writer)

Every project needs a good producer and Georgie Plant is one of the best. As the other half of Lime 58 Films (along with Oliver Wilson-Smith), Georgie has written and been involved in the production of every film the duo have released. Never seen on set without her trusty clipboard/folder combo, she is the logistic rock any creative needs.

She brings to the project both a sense of grounding as a producer as well as a slice of raw humanity in the script.

 

Jade Stratton (Assistant Director & Script Supervisor)

New to the Lime 58 family is Jade Stratton, the Assistant Director for the series. Precise and with an eye for detail, Jade is a wonderful addition to the team - able to take meticulous notes and ensure everything runs smoothly and providing counsel for both the creative and administrative side of filmmaking. 

 

Tom Crawley (Director of Photography)

An excellent photographer with a keen eye, Tom has previously worked with Lime 58 on their comedy Dan Can Save You, serving as DP and Editor. Sharing a common visual goal with the creative team and bringing a boundless enthusiasm for the craft, Tom is an exceelent and worthy addition to the team.
