story:
OVERVIEW

This steamy Romeo and Juliet, simmering with supernatural elements, will sink its hooks into your heart and leave you scarred (or lustful) long after you're done watching.

Zahara is a one hour tragic love story about a century-old druid trapped in an adolescent’s body who, like every other girl out there, dreams of living happily-ever-after with her soulmate. But in a world where dark magic reigns, nothing is that simple; not dreams, not family, not friendship, and certainly not love.  

Unlike other supernatural teen-romances with their focus on romantic entanglements and high school politics, our show is driven by multiple themes that put life to the test: the tests of choice, loyalty, power, family, friendship, war, and even faith itself. But, the HEART OF ZAHARA is the fact that it's an emotional story about what it means to be BLACK. Black Panther becomes legendary when it stands as more than just a superhero movie, but as a treatise on the African culture; to explore the power and beauty of black people. So, too, will our show celebrate and acknowledge black people and also infuse pride and meaning into what it means to be black.

The Vampire Diaries, The Originals, Teen Wolf, and Buffy are all really the same story with similar beats, ageless brooding heartthrobs, troubled young relationships, first loves and the darkness and desperation often associated with vampire myths. So our series too, is an epic (tragic) romance story set in a world where things go bump in the night... But  the STAKES ARE MUCH HIGHER. Or as I’d like to call it, Romeo and Juliet meets The Vampire Diaries in Wakanda!

 

PREMISE

FAMILY IS FOREVER: a promise that the Harris Family, a matriarchal bloodline of powerful BLACK sorcerers called druids, swore to each other in 1856 when they were still the slaves of the Lockharts; a family of flesh eating immortal humans called dhampirs. The Harrises pledged to stand together and fight against their oppressors, successfully setting themselves free from slavery, and retaking Harmony, a town that their ancestors built. Now, almost two centuries have passed and the bonds of the Harris family are about to be broken by tragedy, betrayal, hunger for power, history and a FORBIDDEN ROMANCE.

BLACK CULTURE 

Our show is, in many ways, a love letter to the black culture. It acknowledges and celebrates everything from African society to the thoughts and frustrations of Black Americans. It explores the power and beauty of black people, and the preservation of their identity. To have a black (female) lead and a majority black cast in a young adult fantasy will be groundbreaking. Our lead character's story is about more than just her forbidden romance, it is representative of the messy and complex vision of black womanhood. I want black women out there to see their lives reflected back at them through her.

Similar to Black Panther, we have characters who still proudly preserve their identities, which, unlike the Harris Family, are not influenced by the Western World. For instance, their natural hair designs will reflect the tribal diversity that draws from the real African black cultures. Black Africans have traditionally been an unsophisticated bit player in American media, often portrayed as backward, savage, and chaotic in everything from news coverage to films. It’s a portrayal that has left little room for other interpretations. This is why our show’s vision is to represent the power and beauty of black people, and infuse meaning and pride into being black.

So really, in addition to escapism and inspiration, our series offers black people the opportunity to reexamine and re-imagine their place in the world, both literally and figuratively. The power of that fantasy is directly linked to prompting challenging “think” pieces that compare a thriving black community that was not colonized to one that has experienced the harsh realities of Colonial America, and has been influenced by the Western world (The Harrises). Zahara will not only be educational and inspirational, it will be a crucial stamp of validation for black people hungry for the opportunity to have their story told. So, really, our audience should look forward to a show filled with raw honesty, breathtaking romance, and real and involving characters that they won’t be able to forget.

 

EMPOWERING WOMEN

Zahara is a show that celebrates and empowers women. It’s a show where women accomplish things that the world thinks are unattainable for women; where a female president is not a far-fetched idea. It’s a series that celebrates the female warriors who have tirelessly fought for gender equality as well as paying homage to the women in our own lives who inspire and empower us every day. Our series will be dominated by powerful, game-changing, and non-stereotypical female characters. Through these women, we will explore the dynamics that females can be badass leaders and fall in love too; those ambitions aren't mutually exclusive.

 

FRANCHISE POTENTIAL

After a year of lockdowns and binge-watching, the industry and audiences alike are hungry for new and exciting content. Zahara combines themes and elements from other shows that are proven to be successful: cultural pride of Black Panther, supernatural thrills of Vampire Diaries, timeless forbidden love of Romeo & Juliet, and the intense power struggle akin to Game of Thrones.

Further, there is an enrapturing history full of deep, complicated characters that provides endless opportunities for interwoven, cross-century storylines and multiple seasons worth of plot. And the most important and relevant thing is that it's told through a fresh lens.

It has been said that every story has already been told multiple times over, but what makes them stand out is the storyteller. Zahara is infused with the complex, personal and cultural identity, pain, and beauty of a currently underrepresented community. Canada is ready and wanting to connect with stories from peoples other than the stereotypical representation of a North American - Zahara is ready to deliver.

 

AWARDS AND PRESS

The no budget pitch concept called ZAHARA: THE RETURN was featured in FORBES, won the IPF Pitch Pit competition, and was nominated for Best Digital Series at Blood In the Snow Film Festival, and best low budget series at T.O. Webfest 2020. It is available on Amazon Prime Video USA and UK, Super Channel and Apple TV. 

WHY THIS SHOW IS IMPORTANT TO US

First of all, I want to introduce myself, and why I created this show.

My name is Natasha Heschélle. I am a Zimbabwean born Canadian actress, writer, producer and dancer. I moved to Canada in 2014 with the dream of being an actress. After years of hard work, I finally got an agent, and as you can imagine, this was a very exciting moment for me. I've always wanted to be TV shows like the vampire diaries, supernatural, the originals etc and getting an agent meant I was a step ahead towards making my dream come true... until my agent told me that I wouldn't be able to audition for the roles I wanted because a) I'm a visible minority and b) I have an accent, and this would work against me especially because, and I quote "there's a lot of discrimination in the Canadian entertainment industry".

I was obviously not happy about this, but I refused to let this stop me for chasing my dream. However, after years of trying auditioning and trying to make something out of myself, I realized that my agent was right, I was never going to be cast in the shows that I wanted, or any speaking role for that matter because of my accent. So instead of crying about it, I decided to prove to the world that, even with my accent, I CAN SELL. Everyone CAN SELL regardless of how they look or what they sound like. It's the TALENT that should matter. So, this is why I created Zahara.

WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Our show is a horror, romance drama. We have a great deal of a terrifying and interesting supernatural history, folklore and mythology. So as you can imagine, there will be a lot of special effects, stunts, and of cause, during these trying times, we need to keep everyone onset safe. Producing a HIGH QUALITY show with all these things will be pretty expensive, this is why we are asking you to help us. All contributions go towards renting gear, lights, props, costumes, makeup, blood... and MORE BLOOD. And most importantly, we have to pay our cast and crew.

RISKS & CHALLENGES

Filmmaking is tough. It takes time, dedication and loads of money. With a highly experience cast and crew, we are prepared, we promise to give it all we can and deliver the highest quality content to our audience. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We totally understand that not everyone who reads this will be able to make a financial contribution. So, another way you can help us is to share this campaign with as many people as you can. We would greatly appreciate it.

THANK YOU SO SO MUCH for taking the time read this! It means a LOT!
story_txt:
OVERVIEW
This steamy Romeo and Juliet, simmering with supernatural elements, will sink its hooks into your heart and leave you scarred (or lustful) long after you're done watching.
Zahara is a one hour tragic love story about a century-old druid trapped in an adolescent’s body who, like every other girl out there, dreams of living happily-ever-after with her soulmate. But in a world where dark magic reigns, nothing is that simple; not dreams, not family, not friendship, and certainly not love.  
Unlike other supernatural teen-romances with their focus on romantic entanglements and high school politics, our show is driven by multiple themes that put life to the test: the tests of choice, loyalty, power, family, friendship, war, and even faith itself. But, the HEART OF ZAHARA is the fact that it's an emotional story about what it means to be BLACK. Black Panther becomes legendary when it stands as more than just a superhero movie, but as a treatise on the African culture; to explore the power and beauty of black people. So, too, will our show celebrate and acknowledge black people and also infuse pride and meaning into what it means to be black.
The Vampire Diaries, The Originals, Teen Wolf, and Buffy are all really the same story with similar beats, ageless brooding heartthrobs, troubled young relationships, first loves and the darkness and desperation often associated with vampire myths. So our series too, is an epic (tragic) romance story set in a world where things go bump in the night... But  the STAKES ARE MUCH HIGHER. Or as I’d like to call it, Romeo and Juliet meets The Vampire Diaries in Wakanda!
 
PREMISE

FAMILY IS FOREVER: a promise that the Harris Family, a matriarchal bloodline of powerful BLACK sorcerers called druids, swore to each other in 1856 when they were still the slaves of the Lockharts; a family of flesh eating immortal humans called dhampirs. The Harrises pledged to stand together and fight against their oppressors, successfully setting themselves free from slavery, and retaking Harmony, a town that their ancestors built. Now, almost two centuries have passed and the bonds of the Harris family are about to be broken by tragedy, betrayal, hunger for power, history and a FORBIDDEN ROMANCE.
BLACK CULTURE 
Our show is, in many ways, a love letter to the black culture. It acknowledges and celebrates everything from African society to the thoughts and frustrations of Black Americans. It explores the power and beauty of black people, and the preservation of their identity. To have a black (female) lead and a majority black cast in a young adult fantasy will be groundbreaking. Our lead character's story is about more than just her forbidden romance, it is representative of the messy and complex vision of black womanhood. I want black women out there to see their lives reflected back at them through her.
Similar to Black Panther, we have characters who still proudly preserve their identities, which, unlike the Harris Family, are not influenced by the Western World. For instance, their natural hair designs will reflect the tribal diversity that draws from the real African black cultures. Black Africans have traditionally been an unsophisticated bit player in American media, often portrayed as backward, savage, and chaotic in everything from news coverage to films. It’s a portrayal that has left little room for other interpretations. This is why our show’s vision is to represent the power and beauty of black people, and infuse meaning and pride into being black.
So really, in addition to escapism and inspiration, our series offers black people the opportunity to reexamine and re-imagine their place in the world, both literally and figuratively. The power of that fantasy is directly linked to prompting challenging “think” pieces that compare a thriving black community that was not colonized to one that has experienced the harsh realities of Colonial America, and has been influenced by the Western world (The Harrises). Zahara will not only be educational and inspirational, it will be a crucial stamp of validation for black people hungry for the opportunity to have their story told. So, really, our audience should look forward to a show filled with raw honesty, breathtaking romance, and real and involving characters that they won’t be able to forget.
 
EMPOWERING WOMEN

Zahara is a show that celebrates and empowers women. It’s a show where women accomplish things that the world thinks are unattainable for women; where a female president is not a far-fetched idea. It’s a series that celebrates the female warriors who have tirelessly fought for gender equality as well as paying homage to the women in our own lives who inspire and empower us every day. Our series will be dominated by powerful, game-changing, and non-stereotypical female characters. Through these women, we will explore the dynamics that females can be badass leaders and fall in love too; those ambitions aren't mutually exclusive.
 
FRANCHISE POTENTIAL
After a year of lockdowns and binge-watching, the industry and audiences alike are hungry for new and exciting content. Zahara combines themes and elements from other shows that are proven to be successful: cultural pride of Black Panther, supernatural thrills of Vampire Diaries, timeless forbidden love of Romeo & Juliet, and the intense power struggle akin to Game of Thrones.
Further, there is an enrapturing history full of deep, complicated characters that provides endless opportunities for interwoven, cross-century storylines and multiple seasons worth of plot. And the most important and relevant thing is that it's told through a fresh lens.
It has been said that every story has already been told multiple times over, but what makes them stand out is the storyteller. Zahara is infused with the complex, personal and cultural identity, pain, and beauty of a currently underrepresented community. Canada is ready and wanting to connect with stories from peoples other than the stereotypical representation of a North American - Zahara is ready to deliver.
 
AWARDS AND PRESS

The no budget pitch concept called ZAHARA: THE RETURN was featured in FORBES, won the IPF Pitch Pit competition, and was nominated for Best Digital Series at Blood In the Snow Film Festival, and best low budget series at T.O. Webfest 2020. It is available on Amazon Prime Video USA and UK, Super Channel and Apple TV. 

WHY THIS SHOW IS IMPORTANT TO US
First of all, I want to introduce myself, and why I created this show.

My name is Natasha Heschélle. I am a Zimbabwean born Canadian actress, writer, producer and dancer. I moved to Canada in 2014 with the dream of being an actress. After years of hard work, I finally got an agent, and as you can imagine, this was a very exciting moment for me. I've always wanted to be TV shows like the vampire diaries, supernatural, the originals etc and getting an agent meant I was a step ahead towards making my dream come true... until my agent told me that I wouldn't be able to audition for the roles I wanted because a) I'm a visible minority and b) I have an accent, and this would work against me especially because, and I quote "there's a lot of discrimination in the Canadian entertainment industry".
I was obviously not happy about this, but I refused to let this stop me for chasing my dream. However, after years of trying auditioning and trying to make something out of myself, I realized that my agent was right, I was never going to be cast in the shows that I wanted, or any speaking role for that matter because of my accent. So instead of crying about it, I decided to prove to the world that, even with my accent, I CAN SELL. Everyone CAN SELL regardless of how they look or what they sound like. It's the TALENT that should matter. So, this is why I created Zahara.
WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP
Our show is a horror, romance drama. We have a great deal of a terrifying and interesting supernatural history, folklore and mythology. So as you can imagine, there will be a lot of special effects, stunts, and of cause, during these trying times, we need to keep everyone onset safe. Producing a HIGH QUALITY show with all these things will be pretty expensive, this is why we are asking you to help us. All contributions go towards renting gear, lights, props, costumes, makeup, blood... and MORE BLOOD. And most importantly, we have to pay our cast and crew.
RISKS & CHALLENGESFilmmaking is tough. It takes time, dedication and loads of money. With a highly experience cast and crew, we are prepared, we promise to give it all we can and deliver the highest quality content to our audience. 
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We totally understand that not everyone who reads this will be able to make a financial contribution. So, another way you can help us is to share this campaign with as many people as you can. We would greatly appreciate it.
THANK YOU SO SO MUCH for taking the time read this! It means a LOT!

story:
Who is Mister Burger?

Mr. Burger is inspired by television shows like Married with Children, Family Guy and Rick & Morty with a strong leaning towards anti-woke, anti-SJW, non-politically correct humor. The first goal of Mr. Burger is entertainment without agendas.

You know why they call it “the left?” Because it’s not right, my dude.

Mister Burger is everything you’ve ever wanted in an honest, straightforward, hilariously on-point, non-politically correct superhero who is saying the things we’re all thinking...except, you know, he’s a hamburger. Support the creation of the first ever animated series that will make your heart swell with pride to be an American again.

Snowflakes? Melted.
Cancel- Culture? Cancelled.
Social Justice Warriors? OK...calm down. Get out from behind your little twitter page, go outside and grow a pair, would you?
Woke? Go back to sleep, Losers.

 

How to make a GREAT BURGER!

We need $15,000 to complete six episodes for distribution on Amazon prime, Filmhub, Pluto TV, Roku and Tubi.TV --- our goal is to get to 2 million to 5 million watched minutes per week on each one of these platforms.

It's hard to make a cartoon in central Texas on a zero-budget, so  we need to employ at least 2 to 3 additional animators to complete each 23 minute episode. Next we need to increase profitability every episode will be dubbed into five different languages, once this process is complete the show will be exhibited at the American film market and then we will attempt to sell it in multiple regions outside the United States.

 

 

 

Hollywood Hates YOU!!!

For the last five years Hollywood and the entire entertainment industry has told a certain section of the population to "go f--k" themselves. Producers of movies and television have said with the loudest voice,"if you don't agree with me politically or ideology you are a horrible person and I don't want your money". Celebrities and creative artists have collectively told half the population of the United States of America they don't want your business.

 

Mr. Burger is the countervailing reaction to cancel culture, woke twitter idiots and the mindless angry mobs of Social Justice Warriors, this cartoon is proudly Anti-woke, Anti-PC and Pro-American through and through. If Hollywood wants to alienate half the population, then Mr. Burger says,"come on over and let me entertain you"!  This cartoon is designed to go after a specific niche audience, conservative, pro-American, pro-liberty and just people sick of cancel culture.
 
Is a hilarious nuclear bomb in the culture war!

 

PRO-PATRIOT CONTENT

 

By supporting Mister Burger, we can put this content out consistently online, we need pro-conservative, pro-patriot creative content like this. Without it, we’re not doing our fair share to help change the narrative of what really is going on in America.


Let’s not have those delicate little snowflakes and twitter warriors take over the ‘net.
We all have a hero who tells it like it is - we just need your help to bring him to life. So do your job as an American - reach those hard working hands into your pocket...and let’s make this thing happen, together

Risks & Challenges

 

By planning our budget meticulously, creating and strictly keeping a tight and well-informed production schedule, by employing economic animation technique and by presenting ourselves professionally and reaching out to production companies during the episode's creation for help and extra funding, we can sidestep the problems that caused delay during the production.

QUALITY:
This next episode we plan on realizing our potential even further, with improved attention to story structure, more jokes per minute, and deeper attention to the emotional states of our characters.

THE AUDIENCE:
Thanks to the headway made by the Adult Swim subnetwork, Archer and Cartoon Network's Adventure Time, there is now a solid 18-35 animation audience.

The greatest weapon against tyranny is humor, in that regard you should consider Mr. Burger a nuclear bomb aimed directly at woke cancel culture! Join us --- America first, last and forever!

 

 

 

STRETCH GOALS - INCLUDED FREE TO EVERY BACKER

 

$3000 -Hard Copy of comic book with bonus 18 "secret" pages

$6000 -Hard copy of comic book, Metal Membership Card. One secret poster.

$9000 -Hard copy of comic book, Metal Membership Card. Three secret poster.

story:
WELCOME

This is our official campaign for our upcoming (2021) web-series, Thick As Thieves. We had a previous Indiegogo campaign for this project, which is still visible. It went live just before the beginning of the pandemic, but we ceased all activity because we didn't think it was an appropriate time to continue. WE'RE BACK- with an updated storyline and all new content.
We hope by the end of this page you'll want to join us on this thrilling ride...

THE STORY

In friends we trust... right? Jess, Temi, Alisha and her sister Faith find themselves grappling with each other, after the choices they make. Their situations go from bad to worse but they can only rely on each other to escape the mess. Thick As Thieves unmasks the reality of friends who are just trying to make ends meet in a world of adulting.
Click to watch our concept trailers below:


 
 
 

OUR STORY

The Basement Bunch Ltd are a film and theatre production company with a commitment to community.  Based in Luton, the company was founded by Adeyinka Akinrinade, Charity Muiruri and Hannah Kelly, in 2017. Shakira Francis joined the collective and the core team was complete. The Basement Bunch are driven to create vivid and bold stories with an ambition for impact through storytelling. These women are shaping their own narrative around being young creative professionals, who come from working class backgrounds, belonging to a variety of cultures. The Basement Bunch represents the underdogs- if you can dream it, you must do it. The company will be producing this web-series, Thick As Thieves.

Click on our website below to discover a more detailed breakdown of who we are: www.thebasementbunch.co.uk 
 

THE CREATOR

Shakira Francis, who is head of film production at The Basement Bunch, originally wrote this 7 part web-series as a homage to one of her favourite American action/thriller's, Set It Off.  The story has since developed with a focused look on friendship, betrayal and the choices that lead to a troubling situation. As well as writing her vision in script format, Shakira will be directing this web-series. Her first directorial debut, 4C, is a short film that was selected as a finalist for the South East Film competition. It then went on to screen at the Cambridge Film Festival, the Brighton Cinecity Festival and toured the South East of England.  Her most recent short film, The Lost Land Girl, was supported by the BFI and is still making appearances in film festivals. Shakira is a returning member of the BFI network x Bafta Crew 2020-21 and wants to use her platform to champion more women ensemble on screen.
 

OUR CAST & CREW

from left to right: Greta Zabulyte (DOP), Charity Muiruri (Alisha), Jessica Layde (Faith), Hannah Kelly (Jess), and Adeyinka Akinrinade (Temi).
 

The production of Thick As Thieves prides itself on women collaborating to make compelling work. Our cast and crew consists of people from marginalized ethnic backgrounds who are often stereotyped in film. Representation matters and this campaign is all the more important because it showcases a production with us in the drivers seat, playing and filming mutli-dimensional characters, that are relatable. This industry is steadily changing how it reflects women, Black women and women of colour, on and off screen. This is our contribution.
 

COSTS

15,000 GBP. That is our crowdfunding goal for Thick As Thieves. This budget will cover the entire production process of all 7 episodes. The funds we previously raised will be used to cover the implementation of Covid-19 health and safety practises (PPE). Please see chart below explaining how we plan to distribute the funds we raise from this campaign:

Ideally we would like to reach our goal however if we don’t raise the entire amount we will change the format of the script and the raised funds will go towards paying for insurance, locations and our cast and crew, outside of The Basement Bunch. Depending on the percentage that we're able to raise from our goal, post production could become in-house only as we think it'd be more ethical for us to pay our collaborators over paying ourselves- though nobody should have to work for free. One of our company values is community and we have a responsibility to uphold standards that communicate our respect for people, their efforts/skills and their time.

PERKS

The Basement Bunch have been discussing how best we can thank you for your financial contributions to our campaign, Thick As Thieves. The perks can be found on the right hand side of your screen (if you're viewing from a laptop/mac) but we've chosen to list them below as well, for a general look:

Shout outs on all our social medias, behind the scenes footage, view scenes that didn't make the cut, sneak peak into each production phase, set visit, online press pack, access to the series before it goes live to the public, names included in rolling credits, executive producer credit.
 

IMPACT

Your contribution to our campaign will provide working opportunities to a variety of rising professionals in a period of time that is unprecedented. Your support will champion the development of artists and creatives who aren't celebrated enough in mainstream media. Your subscription to us can elevate the belief in upcoming storytellers who see themselves in us.

Thick As Thieves may be a project that is made in Luton but the emotions of the characters and the experiences they face as young adults transcends borders. The women involved in this project are a reflection of the diaspora and some of the stories we tell are connected to many cultural roots, either through the theme or the characters names:

Naca, short film (2016), explores a young Bengali man's conflict between the traditions of his religion and his passion for dance. We won the runner up award for 'best film' at the Fresh Faced Film Festival in 2018.

The Eden Effect, theatre production (2019), Tiffany, Wren and Ashley Nduta are forced to adapt their lives due to the Married Women’s Property Act (Amendment) 2022. Biology first, gender second; that’s what they’ve been told. The show sold out in 2/3 of the venues it toured- Camden People's Theatre, The Hat Factory Arts Centre and Curve Theatre.
 

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

With filming there are often risks and challenges- from actors falling sick to the English weather being unpredictable however, we are considering all possibilities as we plan ahead to schedule the film shoot. As a collective, we have a wide range of production experience on multiple sets and have dealt with cancellations of locations, clashes of personalities and unforeseen events on set.  We have overcome them and continue to carry this ethic in all our projects, including our web-series; ensuring everything will run on time and on budget.
 

CATCH YOU LATER

Thank you so much for taking your time to read through our page. Please do share through word of mouth and on your social media platforms. Indiegogo has share tools which look like this: 
The heart icon allows fellow Indiegogo accounts to keep up with our campaign.
The facebook icon allows you to share directly to your page.
The twitter icon allows you to post a tweet about our campaign to your followers.
The link icon creates an url that you can copy and paste to share anywhere. 

  • If you follow us on instagram and twitter and like us on Facebook you are helping us to expand our reach and engagement.
  • When you share our posts on social media you are helping us to fight against the new algorithm that tries to keep smaller accounts hidden.
  • The more people who see our campaign the better possibility for us to receive financial support from those who can.
  • The more people who like and share our content, the better we can prove there's a demand for it. 
     

We hope this has been an enjoyable read and that this project now excites you as much as it does us. Let's continue on this road to 15K! We can't wait to celebrate with you!

Any questions or concerns you may have, please feel free to direct them to us on: info@thebasementbunch.co.uk

We hope this has been an enjoyable read and that this project now excites you as much as it does us. Let's continue on this road to 15K! We can't wait to celebrate with you!
Any questions or concerns you may have, please feel free to direct them to us on: info@thebasementbunch.co.uk

story:
WBYI

What Brings You In? (WBYI) is a comedic web series about famed Dr. William Park (The Park Method) and the various clients he has that come in to his office. Episode 1: Social Media is out now, to get a feel for the show. 

WHY WBYI?

Because society has created this allusion of everyone living their own life and in turn having their own set of "first world problems": Getting likes on Instagram, having the latest iPhone or Yeezys, upset that your favorite fast food place supports a political rival, upset at the series finale of the Bachelor or upset that your yoga spot no longer carries coconut water. We all have that one enormous issue to us thats trivial to the rest of the world.

FUNDING

WBYI is self funded through the full time hours we put in at our day jobs. It costs $400-$700 to film a single episode over the course of 14 hours. This pays key personnel while deferring pay for remaining cast and crew until the episode/series becomes profitable.

BENEFITS OF WBYI

What Brings You In? can be stand alone episodes but also follow a procedural order; Much like The Office or Friends. The roadmap for the series allows for many different characters to come on the series whether for 2 or 3 episodes or the entire season. WBYI has also given those new to the industry or interested in certain departments to come on and assist. Want to see what a 2nd AC does? Perfect. Need new reel footage as an actor? We can assist with that. Much like South Park, we also tackle modern issues in a comical way to show how petty it truly can be.

SOCIAL MEDIA

Can't donate? That's ok! Just following the series and watching is just as good. We need all the help and support we can get whether in the form of minutes watched or subscribers obtained. You can find WBYI at www.whatbringsyouintherapy.com

Facebook

Instagram

Reddit

Twitter

story:
THE DECADE IS THE 1980s - For years, Todd and Russell, with the help of their fearless producer Max, have been collecting action figures and fighting for ultimate toy freedom against nefarious villains like Bobby and Tommy, the Loathsome Spencer, and the Evil Vicky. The boys long for the day when they can collect and review in peace and solitude. This, however, is not in the cards for the wholesome duo. Their fate, rather, is an eternity of Sisyphian torment. Their only hope is to fight for freedom, and live tomorrow as if it were today.

In Future Cyborg Season 3, Todd and Russell face many strange new circumstances, across a vast animated landscape. Our heroes will be introduced to new worlds, inhabited by new creatures, all while keeping their eyes on the prize of ultimate toy freedom. We welcome you to the Future Cyborg Friendship Ship. Kick your shoes off and stay awhile, but do mind the gap.

To put it simply, we need support. We’ve just wrapped the second season of the toy review show and we’re starting the third season. The all-new third season will be FILLED with gorgeously retro-style ANIMATION, but that’s not all! We’re expanding and we are doing everything we can to get into every Freedom Fighters’ living room. Figuratively, of course. Outside of the show, we are planning for some awesome Future Cyborg TOYS, COMIC BOOKS, VIDEO GAMES, and more!

 

To help us get there, we’re offering up some wonderfully crafted goodies including enamel pin sets, patches, the Future Cyborg soundtrack by Doctor Fluorescent, Future Cyborg on Blu-Ray with exclusive content, toys, and more!

 

Your support will help us take Future Cyborg to the next level. Not only that, but it will help us to continue making something that we truly love. These last couple of years have been a wild ride, and we can’t wait to make things even weirder.

 

The risks are actually pretty low. We have been fortunate enough to partner with Sleeping Giant who have been gracious enough to offer their production assistance, and will also be helping us run the Indiegogo campaign. That said, the show will go on, but we need your support to bring our dreams to life.

There are lots of ways that you can help outside of pledging to the campaign. For starters, subscribing to our YouTube channel would be a huge help! Leave us comments! We’d love to hear from you. Liking our social media accounts is also a great way to help. Sharing our content with everyone you encounter at the grocery store. We mean it. Carve our logo into a watermelon and roll it down the deli aisle. Anyway you can help us get the word out is helpful and appreciated.

story:
We are Kyle and Bryan, hosts of the podcast "2 Boys Talk Survivor" and creators of the online series "Backyard Survivor". Our podcast introduced us to a community of like-minded fans and gave us the opportunity to meet and interview past contestants, we were also lucky enough to attend both the Australian and New Zealand live finales in 2018. We love the show, and Backyard Survivor is our way of delivering a simplified version of the game, that is open to anyone to play - because most of us won't get the opportunity to experience the real thing!

We host Backyard Survivor because we love it, but it does consume a lot of our time, and it costs quite a bit to make the challenges and to supply food and drink to the cast and crew. Everyone on the Backyard Survivor team is a volunteer; the project is a huge team effort, and we all put in long hours and a lot of hard work before the day and on the day because we believe in it. Any funds we can raise here will go towards the production and catering costs of future seasons.

We like to acknowledge the people who support us - so here are some perks we have on offer:

TBA

Backyard Survivor Season 1 exceeded our expectations, we never anticipated the success it would have and the demand we would get to create subsequent seasons. Additionally, how enthusiastic people would be to help us any way possible to ensure we could deliver above and beyond the standard we set for ourselves with season one. Any pledges we receive will help us to raise the bar even further when produce the next season. All S1 episodes are on Youtube and we love to hear back from people who have watched it so please get in touch with us and share your thoughts!

People have asked us to host seasons in other cities, and we would love to do that at some stage. For where we're at right now, it's not financially viable due to the overheads but the passion to bring what we've made to fans across the country is there, so beyond this campaign, that is a prospective goal for us further down the track.

We couldn't have made it this far without the support from our team, our families, friends and fellow Survivor fans. If you know anyone that might like to get involved and help us out in any way, please use the Indiegogo share tools and let them know what we're hoping to achieve. 

All updates and episode releases can be found on our Facebook page, or Youtube.

Thanks!

Kyle & Bryan.

story:
Short Summary

  • My name is Marty Lindsey and I'm an actor and filmmaker. I play a recurring character (Reese) on AMC's Better Call Saul. I've also been on NBC's The Night Shift, El Rey's From Dusk till Dawn, AMC's PREACHER, and the feature films SICARIO and OUTLAWS and ANGELS which premiered at the SUNDANCE FILM FESTIVAL last year. I was also in the sci-fi fantasy hit film INK. I'm from Denver, CO and have lived in Los Angeles, NYC and New Mexico.
  • MENver is, unequivocally, the epitome of my career, the coup de grace, the manifestation of everything I've done wrong (and somewhat right) in my dating life. So, yeah, I'm stripping myself down (metaphorically) in half-hour COMEDY PILOT EPISODE to share the ebbs and flows... mostly ebbs. What are the hardest stories to tell...? These ones! People sludging through the world which revolves around relationships and love. And we're not going to cheese it up. We're going to keep it real. Jason Knauf is the costar of MENver and we're both digging deep into our personal lives to pull out the good, bad, ugly... and shocking! Because lets face it, we've all been there... Right?
  • I've always felt it was my obligation to help bring TV back to Denver. In the late 1980's - early 1990's Viacom had a satellite studio in Denver where shows like Diagnosis Murder and Things To Do In Denver When Your Dead were produced. These teleplays/films employed many local crew, cast and post-production through which bolstering a fragile community ultimately providing a myriad of opportunities for Coloradans to work on a high quality shows. My goal with MENver is to bring episodic tv back to this community. Back to COLORADO. 

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The $30K will be funding the rest of the pilot. This will go to paying for locations, crew, cast, post-production and a venue for the premier which will be at the SIE Film Center in Denver with a second screening at the Chaplin Theater in Los Angeles. You might ask what things cost...? The average Director of Photography makes $800 - $1500 a day. Production Sound makes $600 - $800 a day. Post Production (editor) averages $1000 + a day.  SAG/AFTRA union rates for actors are $600 - $990 a day (I'm a SAG/AFTRA member, this is what I normally make). We'll need Set Designers $500, Hair and Make Up $600, Costume Designers $500, Grips $600, Gaffer $750 (Lighting), this list goes on and adds up incredibly fast. MENver will take seven days to shoot so our budget will be whittled down pretty quick. Now, we cannot pay everyone their normal day rate... so our entire project (everyone) will working for a reduced rate in order to stay under budget.
  • We have some terrific perks for you! Really, these little tidbits of awesomeness will go long way in making your day/week/month a heck of a lot more fulfilled... like, private Improv classes with Jason Knauf (teacher at VOODOO Comedy Playhouse). Private scene study class with Marty Lindsey (The Process Acting Studio). Personal video messages from Jason & Marty. Special thanks in the credits. Personal foot massage by Jason Knauf. Tics to the red carpet premier and after party. Executive Producer credit. Signed posters by the cast. Signed MENver pilot script. Are you getting excited about the awesomeness yet? I am!

 

The Impact

  • MENver is more than about dating in a town full of men. It's about two guys trying to find themselves... two guys trying to find love. This is essential to all of us. We all need and deserve to be connected to someone in this way no matter your age. We have a great show that examines ideas of identity, self reflection, loss, family, friendship and love. With a comedic undertone to the show we won't pull any punches about how strange it can be to date in your thirties and forties. It's a big idea for anyone at any age.  
  • I made a movie called SUBURBAN (vuze Audience AWARD WINNER Cinequest Film Festival, San Jose, CA) which examined the life of an ordinary couple living in the suburbs, family dynamics, infidelity, child rearing and letting go of the past. MENver has similarities. SUBURBAN had a very successful two week run at the Denver Film Center with subsequent screenings at the MAYAN THEATER and Old Town Cinemas. I'm taking everything I learned from the making of Suburban and pouring into MENver. Suburban was a big deal for our production team, for Colorado cinema, we learned a great deal and MENver will benefit because of this.
  • MENver is a pilot. A first episode of what we hope/want/think will be the first episode of many episodes... SEASONS of episodes. That's our plan. Sky is the limit to us. But we have to start somewhere and rock solid beginning is key. This is our deliverable. This is our promise to you.   

 

Risks & Challenges

  • Fruition Films has been making original content for the past twelve years. One feature film, three short films, several promo videos, commercials, short form documentaries, non profit videos, music videos and web content. We have surrounded ourselves with extremely talented folks in all departments. We have recon. We're ready. Poised. It's time. The biggest challenge in corralling all of this talent (cast & crew) is money. I'm just being real with you. Money solves a lot of issues, but it doesn't take the place of trust. Having established colleagues and friendships in this business is how you truly overcome the tough obstacles along the way. And a good reputation helps too.   

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If your short on money, we understand, we really do. If you like what you see in the MENver promo video please share it on social media. Stay connected to us on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram. Many thanks for keeping us in your consciousness!

 

We've kicked off this venture of making MENver but we need your help completing the project. JOIN US! We have many episodes of MENver just waiting to be shot but we cannot move forward until we shoot the pilot episode. We're ready. Are you?

 

Dating. It's a peculiar thing. We've all been there. Right? Why is it so awkward? We're all human beings trying to connect. We want to be valued, regarded, loved. But we tend to get in our own way. Why is this? What the hell is going on!? It was easier when we were nine years old and just asked the girl... "will you go with me?" Much easier, right? So as creators of a new tv show we are absolutely asking you... "will you go with me/us?" You will be a part of the MENver tribe. And we're here for you!

OUR TEAM

MARTY LINDSEY

Writer/Director

You've already learned so much about Marty in the above summary we thought it would be interesting to share some background. Marty loves to roller skate and play skee ball. His favorite sweet treats are redvines and starbursts which of course he rolls up in a ball like he did when he was twelve years old. He has three brothers and ten nieces and nephews. He's very close with his Mother. He's a pretty good water skier but terrible at paddle boarding. His girlfriend just got him into cycling but he doesn't like wearing the get up, ya know, the tight shorts and shirt. Marty is a singer-songwriter and is just starting to country dance. Notable acting projects are: OSCAR nominated film SICARIO, INK, OUTLAWS and ANGELS, AMC's BETTER CALL SAUL, NBC's THE NIGHT SHIFT, WGN's MANHATTAN, AMC's PREACHER, INK, SUBURBAN, and EL REY's FROM DUSK till DAWN. 

JASON KNAUF

"Joe"

 ​Jason Knauf received a BFA from Colorado State University, with a Minor in Theatre, in 2002. He studied the art of improvisation in Chicago at Second City, IO, and Annoyance Theater from 2002 to 2008. He moved back to Colorado to work with The Handsome Little Devils to develop "Squirm Burpee Circus: A Vaudevillian Melodrama" which he played the evil Baron Vegan von Hamburger. They headlined Off-Broadway's New Victory Theater in November 2010 in NYC. Since then, Jason continued to perform with many improv troupes and has taught improvisation with The Yes! Lab and Voodoo School of Comedy. He has starred in many commercials and short films. Recently, Jason received a Best Actor award for his performance in King Charles LTD, “UNSEEN" for the 2017 Denver 48 Hour Film Festival, which also won Best of Denver.

 

DANNY DIAZ

Producer

An award-winning writer and director of documentaries, The Lost Reunions, and short films, The Drama Kids, that has worked in the local industry since 2008 with local colorado agencies and on various TV shows such as The Daily Show with Jon Stewart, American Idol, and America’s Next Top Model.  Most recently working with new media technologies to produce our new award-winning interactive comedy series, The Reunion.

 

NICK BRUSO

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY

Nick, Danny and Marty collaborated on The Eko Network's AWARD WINNING interactive series THE REUNION. Nick is quickly becoming one of Colorado's most sought after Cinematographers and has garnered multiple awards for his work on FISH, THE LAUNCH and THE NUDIST.

story:
Create To Inspire

More than any other episode, we want this finale to inspire someone else to pick up a camera. Even if it's just one, even if it has nothing to do with Film. Speaking as someone who was set to do something, deep down, i really didn't want to. I want to help people feel the courage to do the same.

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our overall Aim is:  £10,000.

This will go towards:

Arri Alexa Camera

Hiring out a Cinema Auditorium for an advanced screening of the finale

30+ Cast & Crew

Special Effects

Original Score (OST) by Filip Olejka

Risks & Challenges

I understand there is a large percentage, who have no idea who we are. So from the day this campaign begins i will be out in public spreading the word. Marketing the long, hard but in the end, valuable way. Through busking, and cold opens. I understand that as the creator of the show, i have to take the most responsibility on my shoulders.

Earlier this year, I did 100 Short Films in 50 Days. All 100 can be found on my Youtube playlist section. Just for the sole reason to sharpen my skills for this episode. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Share ! Share ! Share ! We're all in this together and we are going to work ourselves into the ground for every single one of you.

Help spread the word about the show, even if it's not even this donation page but our social media sites are more than enough.

Twitter: theaopofficial

Facebook: TAOPOfficial

Instagram: mavriksartofpeople

Youtube.com/MavrikMovies

story:
Hey, I’m Marcus Osborne. For 25 years I had the privilege of working in one of the largest media markets in the country. As a teen-ager, I assumed I’d become a writer for film and television (or an FBI profiler) but for better or worse, I become neither. Nope, instead I ended up going from failed stand-up comic to being a radio and television broadcaster in the San Francisco/Oakland Bay Area. For the next couple of decades, I was afforded the good fortune of a multi-faceted and successful media career. My column, “Straight Male Friend” was published by multiple websites including, Huffington Post, Galtime.com, Yahoo!Shine, and various CBS Radio websites nationwide. I was the Executive Producer and host/cohost/sidekick on a few of the most popular morning radio shows in the Bay Area.

For the better part of 15 years, I reviewed film and some television for for “Sarah and Vinne/Sarah and NoName morning radio show. My on-air partner and I also reviewed film for a couple of local CBS/CBS-owned television affiliates. But that wasn’t all! During that same period, I wrote music/CD reviews for the The Oakland Tribune, reported live from live events including major motion picture film premieres, and awards shows like The Grammys and the Vibe Awards. I was also thrilled to be able to interview celebrities like Denzel Washington, Tom Cruise, Jon Stewart, Jamie Foxx, Jon Mayer, Rob Reiner, Kevin Hart, Simon Pegg, Adam Sandler, Don Cheadle, John Travolta, Billy Bob Thorton, Bruce Willis, and many many more.

I’ve hosted a nationally syndicated radio show, as well as a show for SIRUS XM’s Extreme Talk Channel. Additionally, we launched a popular podcast that ran for 7 years on various platforms. And I loved EVERY. SINGLE. MINUTE. What a run it was.

Two years ago, after I lost a great gig when the station for which I was working was suddenly taken over by a Spanish Language sports network, I was faced with a new quandary; uproot the family and leave the state for another radio gig or change careers altogether.

I chose the latter.

I decided that if I was ever going to bring to fruition, my lofty goal of writing and producing film and television shows, the time would be now. For years, I had written scripts and treatments for film and television, even received a few interested queries from a couple of major production companies, but nothing ever came of those dalliances. The blame being placed squarely on me because I chose not to follow through on those projects, “I could always come back and reconnect with these companies.”

Wrong. How naïve and delusional was I?

But I’ve come a long way since the late nineties. Much more focused and single-minded about what needs to be done to achieve the goal of getting these TV shows and films produced and distributed.

This is where I’m appealing to YOU. No one achieves anything alone. Our goal here is to raise enough capital to produce our very first television pilot, “The Laugh Out Lounge.”

I’ve been inspired by the number of amazing shows in distribution right now. This is truly the Golden Age of quality television. We expect that “Laugh Out Lounge” will be one of your new favorites!

The Pilot : "Laugh Out Lounge"

What's the show about?

A successful, self-absorbed radio host is humiliated when he loses his high-profile radio show and is forced to take a job as a doorman at a comedy club…which leads him to try his hand at a brand new career as a stand-up comic...much to the dismay of his wife.

SERIES SUMMARY 

Marc (our lead character) loses his job as a radio host and is forced to take a job well below his qualifications at a comedy club in San Francisco. Over the course of the series, “Laugh Out Lounge” will follow the self-centered celebrity on his journey back to the top…or what he perceives to be the top. Marc's road to redemption takes him through the loss of his job, the loss of his marriage, the reunion with his wife, the death of a friend, career highs, career setbacks and personal tragedy all leading to illuminating self-discovery. He eventually recognizes that his life is far richer when he’s not chasing acceptance through fame but instead, appreciating that the most important things in his life are his relationships with friends and family. 

What We Need & What You Get

We’re trying to raise at least 12k. What’s that going to cover? The production crew and equipment and the cast for a fifteen-day shoot. And EVERY. SINGLE. PENNY – no matter HOW much we raise will go directly to the production budget for the “Laugh Out Lounge” pilot. Based on our estimates, the amount of $12,000 would be the minimum amount needed to produce a strong pilot.

Of course, it’s always true that the more capital you have, the greater the opportunity to improve the overall production value and quality, so obviously the more we raise the better it will be for the final product, but we know that this dollar amount will afford us the chance to create a strong, quality TV production.

And even if we DON’T hit our goal, ALL funds raised will STILL be directed towards the production of the “Laugh Out Lounge” pilot, and we’ll attempt to make up the difference in other ways.

So, to encourage your assistance in getting this production completed, we’re offering a few very cool perks! Things like passes to a show at a comedy club, autographed scripts, a gig as a production assistant, all-access visits to the set, speaking roles, passes to the premiere screening and wrap party, and one person or business will get a VERY SPECIAL perk for their VERY SPECIAL donation!

This is SO meaningful and important to us – in truth, this is where my heart has been all along. The little boy watching Abbot & Costello movies and “Sanford & Son”, the teen-ager watching “Three’s Company” and “Moonlighting”, the adult glued to the latest episode of  “The Sopranos”, the husband and dad watching “Game Of Thrones,” “The Walking Dead,” “Veep” or “Atlanta” – they’re all me – all a heavy creative influence on the kinds of shows I want to create.

 

All that’s needed now is your help. 

 

And look, there are no guarantees in terms of the show being picked up by a network or streaming service, but we can guarantee a high quality program. We can guarantee that all funds raised will go towards making this the very best production possible.

And for those who can't contribute, but would love to help out, feel free to share our page with your network! Or if you have a specific talent or area of expertise, we're definitely open to volunteers and those who'd like to offer their skills pro bono for the pilot.

story:
Late Night Comedy with a kick

We wanted to make a show that isn't hosted by another Jimmy who just figured out how YouTube works. We wanted to talk about issues that were relevant  to us and get others thinking about why these things matter and how complicated they are. A lot of conversations are painted as black and white and we continue to hear about how millennials are ruining everything.

10 minutes, 9 Episodes, 2 hosts, Live on social media.

We're going to cover:

  • Are Millennials Lazy?
  • Who REALLY controls social media?
  • What if everyone was an entrepreneur?
  • AND SO MUCH MORE!

Women of colour on screen AND behind the camera. Authentically made for the curious, critical and undervalued people out there. And strategically sarcastic.

What We Need & What You Get

We're asking for 3,000$ for the following things:

  • Building our set (making it look nice and being able to make it safe)
  • Tech equipment for live streaming 
  • Special Guest appearances!

You'll get an inside look on how we're able to make this happen and be able to support women and women of colour in the creative industries!

The Impact

Samantha Bee and Chelsea Handler are some incredible late night hosts, but other than that, late night comedy is reserved to straight white men. We believe that their are other voices that are important to hear from, and that we can offer a unique perspective from what we usually see.

What makes us different:

  • Streaming on social media makes our show accessible worldwide
  • YOU get to partake in the conversation by asking questions that will be answered in REAL time
  • We cover topics young people care about, without dumbing down the facts or the humour

Risks & Challenges

Not all of this is easy, and we have a few challenges ahead. Are big obstacles are as follows:

  • Making sure to engage people in the show: a lot of the show relies on YOUR questions! So we need your help to share and engage when you can! 
  • We plan to start streaming this NOVEMBER. And that's really soon! We have a tight but flexible schedule to make this happen. This is a big part of that!

Other Ways You Can Help

We totally understand not everyone has extra money hanging around, but there are a bunch of ways you can help us out!

  • Share this campaign with your friends if you think they'll like it! It really helps us prove that what we're doing is worthwile!
  • Check out our website ThinkAboutIt.xyz for additional content!
  • Follow us on Twitter, Facebook and YouTube to eventually see the show and more content!

And that's all we've got! If you have any questions, ask us on social media and we'll be happy to answer! Have a more private question? You can contact us at ThinkAboutItSeries@gmail.com

story:
The Big Picture

Typo Squad  is a 2017 novel written by Amazon bestselling author Stephen Lomer (that's me!), and is set in a world where typos are lethal to 98% of the population. The other 2% who are unaffected by typos join Typo Squad, an elite team tasked with keeping the public safe from the forces of errorism.

The novel is very funny, if I do say so myself, and I'm looking to adapt it into a just-as-funny series with an eye toward Netflix.

Not only would a Typo Squad  series be entertaining, it would underscore the vital importance of proper spelling, good grammar, and literacy in general. So let's get this baby funded!

The Thing and The Stuff

What we're actually looking to create is called a proof-of-concept video. It's a 12- to 15-minute film that explains the plot of Typo Squad, and introduces the world in which it's set, the main characters, and the conflict.

The incredibly specific funding goal we have for the Typo Squad  project is $10,115.

Here's a breakdown of where all the money goes:

 

The Perks

Oh baby, you can get some really cool stuff for donating. You can get your hands on a signed copy of the Typo Squad  novel. There's a Typo Squad  t-shirt up for grabs, a signed cast photo, a signed Typo Squad  script, a chance to get your name in the Typo Squad credits, and more! Check out the SELECT A PERK section for full details!

Risks & Challenges

The only real risk to the Typo Squad  film project is not reaching our goal. We have the talent. We have the script. We have the motivation and the drive. We want Typo Squad  to rule the universe.

All we need is full funding and we're off!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a contribution toward our funding goal, would you consider sharing the Typo Squad Indiegogo project on social media? The more people who know about it, the better our chances of getting funded. Thank you!

story:
Short Summary

As an actress, I was always having to turn down parts because I didn't agree with the vulgarity or the content.  I dreamed of making people laugh with clean jokes and humor.  This show, Can They Get Away With It? fulfills that life-long dream. 5% of all proceeds go to CARRY the non-profit I'e been involved with since inception transforming loves of At-Risk and foster youth in L.A.

What We Need & What You Get

After years of creating this series, I shot a sizzle reel for this show in October, 2018 and it has been received with enthusiasm and open-arms.  I have a contract that will put this show into millions of homes in 2019.  However, I need your support to raise the funds to shoot, edit and complete the next episodes, so I can deliver finished product to my network distributor.  They need to have finished episodes to deliver to all their channels nationwide, as well as their streaming partners.  I feel this is an uplifting show, I hope you agree.  The world needs good, inspirational TV shows and "Can They Get Away With It?" fulfills that need.  

The Impact

You will be part of creating something magical that you can be proud to share with your friends, family and business associates.

Imagine brining laughter to the elderly, the sick, the heart-broken or anyone that just needs their spirits lifted?  That's what this show does. It also brings families back together again instead of watching violent or tasteless shows separately that have only negative impact on their lives. This show has a feel-good flavor that will induce joy and laughter.

5% of all proceeds will go to CARRY, the non-profit I've been blessed to be part of since its inception.  As a board member, I can tell you that we are helping transform the lives of At-Risk and Foster youth in Los Angeles.  I believe this is a worthy proposition. 

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk will be that the campaign doesn't raise the funds to produce and deliver the next episodes.  Then you would just have the perks.  I do not believe there is any chance of this.  The hardest part is behind us and the TV channels LOVE, really LOVE this series and are so thrilled to promote and air this show.  This TV series is God-Inspired.  I am so grateful for your support.

Other Ways You Can Help

You do NOT have to contribute financially to be a huge support.  If you are just willing to SHARE this campaign, you are being a conduit to its success.  You can share this on your social media pages.  Please check out the Indiegogo share tools and make some noise!  Thank you.  I'm incredibly appreciative! When it airs, you can Shout, "HEY, I HELPED MAKE THAT HAPPEN!"

story:
About Death's Guardian

Death’s Guardian is about Victoria Santos, a young women trying to figure out her life while taking care of her ailing father, when she accidentally cheats death and starts seeing a grim reaper type who keeps calling himself her Death Guardian. Now Victoria must earn back her mortality by helping him reap the souls of those her death would’ve affected, all 333 of them.

It’s basically The Good Place meets Dead Like Me.

My pilot presentation of this premise will be in the form of a short film where Victoria first learns of her new path and experiences her first “kill”.

I’ve rewritten this script about 14-16 times at this point, digging and prodding at the core motivations of my characters, constructing this crazy world just right while distilling its essence into the short form, but also retaining the most important story beats and emotional peaks. It has been a PROCESS, but a worthwhile one.

This short film is really an expression of my relationship with mourning, loss, and what that leaves us in life. It’s also a conversation on the burdens of our responsibilities and how they can get in the way of what we love and, sometimes, be intertwined with it.

The Impact

This kooky story isn’t just to honor my Aunt Victoria (as you saw in the video) but to also honor the mountain of emotions her life and her passing left me and my family. Death's Guardian is an expression of that sentiment and summarizes the type of stories I want to tell in my career. Stories with strong, complicated, women of color who find themselves in worlds much bigger than their own.

If you enjoy that type of diverse storytelling please consider donating! Any amount helps and we have some really fun perks including grim reaper plush toys, t-shirts, a digital copy of the original soundtrack, and more. 

Besides that, you'll have my eternal gratitude. This project means a lot to me and I have so many wonderful people working on it. I want to make sure their efforts aren't for nought. 

Risks & Challenges

There's a TON of risk that comes with making a short film on a shoestring budget of 7K. First of all, 99% of my crew are volunteers. Anyone, at any time, could not show up for set. Three of our actors are non-union and could also not show up. The only major consequence for either of these folks is, perhaps, a serious case of feeling like an asshole; but that's pretty voluntary. 

That being said, my cast and crew has little to no jerks. They believe in this project as much as I do and I have all the faith in the world everyone will show up and do what they've committed themselves to do. 

But, regardless, the show must go on. I have to turn in a thesis by the end of this school year. Death's Guardian will be delivered as a finished product. Your contribution ensures it'll be a product of worth.  All of the money that is received for this film will be used for the film, exclusively.

Where The Moola Goes

Production Design: All of the crazy shenanigans that go down in Death's Guardian will be taking place around Christmas. That's right, folks. Christmas. We're catching some decorations and decor on sale at the moment but could use some help in covering these costs. Victoria's room, her being quite the music lover, will need some loving as well. 

Catering & Craft Services: My trusty, reliable, volunteers/crew members need some love and what better way to express love than to feed them well. With catering costs for 16+ folks going between $150-200 a little boost financially could really make a difference on set. That's not even mentioning crafty. With one meal break, peckishness is a common "issue" on set but, surprisingly, it can also set a certain tone. I want to take care of my crew and I want them to feel appreciated. What better way than to give them good snacks and meals. 

Happy tummies = happy minds after all. 

Location Rentals: Y'all... Rental rates are rough. We're still hunting for the best location for our sidewalk, living room, front entrance, and hallway (almost there but not quite) but renting a house (working class, worn) for a day ranges from $40-60 an hour and most of our days will range between 10-12 hour. That alone, for one day, one location, will be about $516 -$756 for a day. 

Since we're filming one day of filming in a park ($450 location rental) we'll have to pay a $38 hourly rate for a park monitor as well. 

As you can see, it's quite an expense, but one that's worth making to bring this world to life as we're envisioning it. The outdoor scenes will be done in South LA, where Victoria lives, and our location will show a realistic portrayal of a working class, Latino, family. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially, that's okay. Please share this campaign with family and friends! Do you know of a hook-up? Someone who'd be willing to cater or donate food if we promote their business? DOOOPE. Please contact me. You love this idea and just want to express that with a happy note? Please send it over. I thrive off of encouragement and well wishes. 

Seriously, anything helps. Don't be shy. I'm just happy you read this far.
story_txt:
About Death's Guardian
Death’s Guardian is about Victoria Santos, a young women trying to figure out her life while taking care of her ailing father, when she accidentally cheats death and starts seeing a grim reaper type who keeps calling himself her Death Guardian. Now Victoria must earn back her mortality by helping him reap the souls of those her death would’ve affected, all 333 of them.
It’s basically The Good Place meets Dead Like Me. 
My pilot presentation of this premise will be in the form of a short film where Victoria first learns of her new path and experiences her first “kill”.
I’ve rewritten this script about 14-16 times at this point, digging and prodding at the core motivations of my characters, constructing this crazy world just right while distilling its essence into the short form, but also retaining the most important story beats and emotional peaks. It has been a PROCESS, but a worthwhile one.
This short film is really an expression of my relationship with mourning, loss, and what that leaves us in life. It’s also a conversation on the burdens of our responsibilities and how they can get in the way of what we love and, sometimes, be intertwined with it.

The Impact
This kooky story isn’t just to honor my Aunt Victoria (as you saw in the video) but to also honor the mountain of emotions her life and her passing left me and my family. Death's Guardian is an expression of that sentiment and summarizes the type of stories I want to tell in my career. Stories with strong, complicated, women of color who find themselves in worlds much bigger than their own.
If you enjoy that type of diverse storytelling please consider donating! Any amount helps and we have some really fun perks including grim reaper plush toys, t-shirts, a digital copy of the original soundtrack, and more. 
Besides that, you'll have my eternal gratitude. This project means a lot to me and I have so many wonderful people working on it. I want to make sure their efforts aren't for nought.

Three of our actors are non-union and could also not show up. The only major consequence for either of these folks is, perhaps, a serious case of feeling like an asshole; but that's pretty voluntary. 
That being said, my cast and crew has little to no jerks. They believe in this project as much as I do and I have all the faith in the world everyone will show up and do what they've committed themselves to do. 
But, regardless, the show must go on. I have to turn in a thesis by the end of this school year. Death's Guardian will be delivered as a finished product. Your contribution ensures it'll be a product of worth.  All of the money that is received for this film will be used for the film, exclusively.

With one meal break, peckishness is a common "issue" on set but, surprisingly, it can also set a certain tone. I want to take care of my crew and I want them to feel appreciated. What better way than to give them good snacks and meals.

That alone, for one day, one location, will be about $516 -$756 for a day.

I thrive off of encouragement and well wishes. 
Seriously, anything helps. Don't be shy. I'm just happy you read this far.

story:
From writer/comedian, Ben Paddon (PortsCenter, Boomer's Day Off), writer/actress, Mac Beauvais (Hit Girl, The Gloaming), and featuring director Justin Zagri (Severus Snape and the Marauders) comes a comedy of horrors about just how truly monstrous Hollywood can be.

Hollywood! Land of dreams, of opportunity and of...okay, we all know that’s BS.

This comedy follows a trio of actors who are getting regular paying work, but who feel trapped by the roles they keep getting cast in. Actors stuck in an endless parade of sci-fi shlock and horror films. And I guess maybe we should mention that they’re actually monsters.

Not actors in makeup, not computer-generated trickery, but real monsters. Like, for real real...this is Typecast.

We decided to take the struggling/disenfranchised actor trope and turn it on its head by imagining a world where all the creepy crawlies you’ve ever seen on the screen were played by actual monsters. If you need the elevator pitch (that’s Hollywood-speak for please compare your stuff to other people’s stuff), it’s a bit of Being Human meets Extras. And who wouldn’t enjoy a comedic story about monsters working in the industry but dreaming of something more? 

Our leads consist of Tony, a bog monster, who dreams of playing the lead in a drama instead of generic beasts in lame sci-fi horror films; Abby, a werewolf, who wants to ditch her regular gig as a breakfast cereal mascot; and Leeroy, a zombie, who just wants people to take the living-impaired seriously, which would be easier if he didn’t have to keep gluing his ear back on. The series also features their savvy but ultimately unhelpful agent, Dennis, who wishes they would just stick to what they’re good at (and get him his percentage).

 

We’ve written a first season arc consisting of 8 episodes, all aiming to be around 6-10 minutes in length, telling the story of these actors and their journey. We want to deliver the best quality possible, and that requires great locations, crew, catering and, of course, some truly monstrous makeup.

We’ve crunched the numbers and come up with a budget that will allow us to make this thing look as great as possible without breaking the bank. Nobody here is looking to buy themselves a solid gold toilet - we just want to tell our story, make you laugh, and look good doing it.

All of the money for this project is going to the project - crew, makeup, all of it. We're not keeping a penny.

We also understand that we are extremely ambitious and may not hit our 8-episode budget goal, but the great thing about IndieGoGo is that we can still use whatever is raised and turn it into as many episodes as possible. That means Typecast IS going to be a reality.

 

If you’ve read this far, you’ve probably - hopefully! - also watched the Full Moon Flakes commercial up above. We managed to produce that proof-of-concept thanks to the generosity of others and what we were able to dig out from our own pockets. Our cast and crew believe so much in this project that they were willing to donate their time and talents so that we could give you a taste of what we can achieve and the quality we want to maintain for this series.

We want it to look good, we want it to sound good, and we want our monsters to be in film-quality makeup. Without the funding we’re asking for, you’ll be looking at a werewolf with 99 cent store fangs and bog monster with a paper bag over his head instead of something or par with the below before-and-after.

Tony concept art by Matt Olson

 

Ben Paddon, Co-Creator/Co-Writer/Actor portraying Tony Surnaim: Too British for America and too American for Britain, Ben Paddon has decided, bafflingly, to use his powers for good. He brings his unnatural hybrid flair to projects such as PortsCenter, Jump Leads, Dalek Gary, and somehow managing to not die (1986-Present). Most likely to be typecast as: the British person.

Mac Beauvais, Co-Creator/Co-Writer/Executive Producer/Actress portraying Abby Ormel: With an IMDb list as long as your arm (provided it's printed in 50-point font), Mac Beauvais is a true renaissance woman, or whenever it was that witches were burned at the stake. She’s acted in numerous projects including The Hit Girl and The Gloaming, is a cosplayer and model, and may or may not kill again. Most likely to be typecast as: the sarcastic one or a supernatural creepy crawly.

Chris Dorman, Actor portraying Leeroy McDavre: Quite possibly from a yet unknown dimension, Chris Dorman has done a little bit of everything. His credits include 8.13, The Gloaming, Consumption, and WWE Slam City, where he’s played such varied roles as Man, Old Man, Dirty Man, Dead Man, Creepy Man, White Man, and Madman. Most likely to be typecast as: some sort of man.

Brian Ward, Actor portraying Dennis Redknapp: Once punched in the face by a monkey, Brian Ward joins us as Dennis. When he’s not playing an asshole talent agent, he produces features for Blu-rays and DVDs, and has worked on documentaries for Hackers, Transformers, Max Headroom, Pee-Wee’s Playhouse and more. He’s also directed award-winning shorts such as Rerouting, Almost Midnight and Soul Provider; making us wonder why he’s slumming with us. Most likely to be typecast as: the redhead.

Justin Zagri, Director: Though reports remain unverified, director Justin Zagri may actually be a wizard. He’s put his stamp on the worlds of magic and comics as the writer/director of Severus Snape and the Marauders, The Greater Good, Riddle of the Mask, Truth of the Mask, and Kiss (though that last one might be a request instead of a film). Fun fact: received a Kung Fu black belt at 17, which is how he keeps his actors in line.

Traycee King, Producer: Producer, actress, and thing that goes bump in the night, Traycee King has a love of all things horror. She loves horror so much that she’d probably marry it. Maybe that’s why her producer credits include 8.13, Insane Jane, and Sagas of Sundry: Dread. Fun fact: she’s so industrious that as a kid she upped the ante on local lemonade stands by also selling bubble gum and little green army men.

Michael Spatola, Head of Makeup: Likely the cause of more than a few childhood nightmares, Michael Spatola joins us as our Head of Makeup. A two-time Emmy-nominated entertainment veteran, his credits span classics of the horror and sci-fi genres including Return of the Living Dead, Terminator 2, Tales from the Crypt and Iron Man 3. He’s also the author of the Monstrous Makeup Manuals 1, 2 and 3. Fun fact: he was once a professional magician, but we’re scared to see the rabbit he’d pull out of a hat.

Aoife Baker, Wardrobe Designer: One neck bite away from being a vampire (she already has the sleep schedule), Aoife “Fe” Baker is a wardrobe expert. Having applied her skills to features like Summer Forever, Browse, Gone, Holidays, various music videos and commercials, she’s helping bring this series to life and unlife. Fun fact: her costume closet is a two car garage, which is basically a wardrobe TARDIS.

Drew Krassowski, Composer: Nice enough to make you suspicious, Drew Krassowski is a writer and orchestrator of music. He’s worked on the music from Guardians of the Galaxy, Castle and Wildstar, as well as composing from scratch the music for The Fairies’ Child and Delete My Photos. He’s also responsible for the Full Moon Flakes earworm jingle. Fun fact: he loves Korean dramas so much he’s started learning the language, but so far can only say, “I’ll never tell you where I hid the diamonds, Julia!”

 

Obviously we don't expect you to back this project without getting something in return. Everybody likes cool stuff, right? We have a number of awesome rewards such as exclusive behind the scenes content, script PDFs, a print-at-home cereal box, screen-used props, and a chance to join us on set and appear as a monster during filming. You can also leave your stamp as an Associate or Executive Producer. And for you tabletop gamers out there, you can have the chance to join Ben and Mac as they run a special monster-themed RPG for you via Skype.

We also owe special mention to our partners at Black Phoenix Alchemy Labs who have formulated an exclusive, unisex scent for us comprised of notes of sugar-soaked toasted oat cereal and chocolate marshmallows.

 

This is truly a passion project for everyone involved, but none more so than for its co-creators Ben Paddon and Mac Beauvais (that’s us). In September 2014, our mothers both passed away about a week apart. Less than a month later, Ben’s father also passed away. These are people we had shared our excitement for this project with, and who had expressed anticipation for seeing the finished product. Sadly they won’t be here to see it made, but it’s important to us that we make something that they would’ve been proud of. This show is as much for them as it is for us. Life is short, and we intend to spend the time we have on this big blue marble creating entertainment for others. We need your help to do that.

Thanks for reading.
