story:
Short Summary

As a new comedic series, Woof, seeks to entertain the contemporary American audience through the story of a 20 something year old dog walker in New York City. The creators of Woof are avid dog lovers who are looking to partner with local animal shelters to cast dogs for the show who the actors will then introduce in a 45 second tag at the end of each episode. Through this partnership with the local animal shelters, Woof hopes to help the dogs at these shelters to find their forever homes.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $5,000 so that we can buy the highest quality production gear possible (this includes microphones, cameras, booms, etc...), feed our cast, crew, and furry friends while on set, and give our cast and crew a small stipend in return for their hard work. 

If you donate to our cause, you will help save shelter dogs lives through helping us to increase awareness of local shelters. Anything you can and are willing to give will help us immensely, but the more you give, the more we give back to you. (More information in "Perks" section)

The Impact

According to the American Society for the Prevention of Cruelty to Animals' website, US animal shelters acquire roughly 6.5 million animals every year. Every year, an average of 1.5 million animals in shelters are euthanized - compared to the 3.2 million animals that get adopted. While it's great and a huge success that nearly double the animals being euthanized are being adopted, it's not enough. Woof hopes to partner with local animal shelters in New York and use the dogs as cast members and at the end of each episode, we will feature an animal shelter a a dog in need of adoption. The hope is that this will help increase foot traffic at the shelters and, in turn, increase adoption. 

Risks & Challenges

We already have one animal shelter totally on board with this project. Others are very interested in supporting us by word of mouth. Our main goal with this project is to promote these dogs who are in need of forever homes - but we want to do it through a well produced series. The funding from this campaign will help take our project from just a cool idea to a beautiful web series that will change lives forever. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested but can't give financially, that's okay! Help share our campaign! Your support means the world to us either way. 

 

Thanks so much for your time!

The Woof Team

story:
Raising Adults is more than another two-white girl comedy.

It’s a show about family and struggle and relationships we haven’t seen on screen, like, mother & daughter who flip flop parent/child roles OR father & daughter more like fag/ hag meets odd-couple who bond over boy-talk. And, the girls? They’re more like sisters and not in that made-for-Lifetime-movie kind of way.

It’s about hardship & class, healthcare & government. It’s entertaining and real and at times uncomfortable, from the seemingly mundane everyday-life-sh*t to the hilariously dark life circumstances we all know too-well but never see coming...

...Giving people something to laugh with OR laugh at. Whether it’s the crazy of family… pains of growing up… or self-deprecation as a coping mechanism...

No? Just us?

While not a reality show, Raising Adults, is based on real-life and likely-to-occur events. What started out as off-the-wall stories we told our friends growing up, turned into, “OMG! I think we have something here we haven’t seen out there!”. And, so, we put our lives on blast.

They say write what you know. The f*cked up part? We kinda didn’t... It’s written itself.

And, we want to share it with you.

 

 

 

MEET 'EM

BRITT (#IRL):

Britt is a Cincy native & now Chicago-based writer/ producer following her love of TV beyond the comfort of her couch (often with no pants). From award-winning independent short & feature films (like Reversal & Miriam is Going to Mars), music videos, parodies and web series to commercials and corporate brand videos, her work has garnered attention from all over the world by way of film festivals and online publications/ viewing.

Making sh*t happen at the cost of her sanity and sexual wellbeing. Likes: intensely detailed stories, manners, binge-watching Dr. Pimple Popper videos and the cold side of the pillow.

 

KAIT (#IRL):

Kait is a Cincy-based writer/ actor, who got her start in her own living room - performing for an audience of family, imaginary friends and often herself. She’s since expanded to theater, commercials and independent film in such works as, The Cure , Home , Punk Girl and Before You Go - making their way from LA Film Festival to Athens International Film Fest (and more!). Kait also taught for 7 years at a non-profit young adult theater group, DramaKinetics, embedding Social Emotional Learning skills, therapeutic goals, recreational & academic content to individuals of all abilities.

Enjoys pretending to be other people not solely for the sake of art, while gettin' sh*t done and trying to self-care. Likes: a snaggle-tooth rescue pit named Zeus, binge-watching B-rate sitcoms, the good ol' outdoors and vodka.
 

AND...

Our conspiracy theory, big brother-believing, pot-smoking, box wine-drinking, struggling parents…

Dad: A now gay, former construction-working father to 2 daughters, injured on the job, with disgruntled tendencies and a domestic partner meets fag/hag–like dynamic with Britt.

Mom: A job-hopping single mother of 2 with poor genetic health, crazy tendencies and a partner in crime meets an ever flip-flopping parent/ child dynamic with Kait.

$0 go towards the creators.

ALL funds are (rightfully) applied to production expenses and our people - in production & post - for their time, energy, and their should-be-award-winning patience.

We've assembled a team that's willing to put up the work without the promise of an exact dollar amount. I mean, are you kidding me?!

And, while we're all in it for 'love of the game' - we need to take care of those takin' care of us. 

There's no shortage of gettin' scrappy or resourceful, but we want to make a product everyone can be proud of (and entertained by!).

Your contributions will ensure we even come close to that, while helping others who've helped us.

Timeline = *60-day campaign
Pre-production: Currently in
Production: Now - May 2018
Post-Production: May - June 2018
RELEASE: June - July 2018

from Cincinnati to Chicago

Raising Adults is nothing without the people behind it. They’re friends, family and “work-fam”-turned-friends who we respect the ever-loving sh*t out of.

Our award-winning team comes from various pockets of the tv/ film/ music, media & ad industry, each with their own unique set of skills, life stories, personality quirks, and... dietary restrictions (*smh*). From Director to Assistant Editor, musical artists and everyone in between.

They’ve helped us make an otherwise very scrappy show about two scrappy gals - less scrappy. They’ve had our backs, they've stepped in, they’ve shown up. And, they've whole-assed-it.

They’re the sounding boards, emotional hand-holders, vibe-bringers, and creative touchstones of our dreams.

They are why we’re able to introduce #RAISINGADULTS to the world and, boy, do we look forward to returning this kinda favor!

We're #blessed to have folks who are down to put the work up front, but there's no shortage of need or props that are due and bills that need paying. (NOTE: the only time we'll use #blessed)

Because we're here to take care of EVERYONE takin' care of us... not just those on set, behind the screen or in front of the camera... but anyone for whatever contribution they're able to make...  

Donate and earn some dope perks!

‘Cause money’s not what we got, but returning the favor is something we’re good for.

Follow the show on Facebook, Twitter and Instagram.

‘Cause there’s a whole helluva lot more where these episodes came from!

Share the campaign with your family and friends. 

And, let us know when you do! We want to give props where they’re due and that includes you!

 

Much love & many thanks for however you're able to help! 

- Britt & Kait
story_txt:
Raising Adults is more than another two-white girl comedy.It’s a show about family and struggle and relationships we haven’t seen on screen, like, mother & daughter who flip flop parent/child roles OR father & daughter more like fag/ hag meets odd-couple who bond over boy-talk. And, the girls? They’re more like sisters and not in that made-for-Lifetime-movie kind of way.It’s about hardship & class, healthcare & government. It’s entertaining and real and at times uncomfortable, from the seemingly mundane everyday-life-sh*t to the hilariously dark life circumstances we all know too-well but never see coming......Giving people something to laugh with OR laugh at. Whether it’s the crazy of family… pains of growing up… or self-deprecation as a coping mechanism...No? Just us?While not a reality show, Raising Adults, is based on real-life and likely-to-occur events. What started out as off-the-wall stories we told our friends growing up, turned into, “OMG! I think we have something here we haven’t seen out there!”. And, so, we put our lives on blast.They say write what you know. The f*cked up part? We kinda didn’t... story:
Hi,

     I'm David K Jarreau, director and filmmaker.  I just completed my last short film Unit 68, with a budget of 18,000  to great reviews from several premieres. I'm an inspirational short film writer and I love to tell stories about my experiences and observations in life. I believe that as a storyteller, you must be true to yourself when writing your stories. That means that you should never be afraid to explore any theme or concept if it means something special to you, even at the risk of being misunderstood by your peers.

My latest film Rise is a case in point. 

     This film could be my most important work to date. It is admittedly disturbing, unsettling uncomfortable, unpleasant and at times comedic .  In RISE, we explore what justice would look like in the eyes of the victim. Justice in its true raw form that never truly restores what was lost but at the very least seeks to to balance the scales in some meaningful way. 

     I came up with the idea of RISE several years back while watching news stories of ISIS when they were on the move taking over cities and raping and killing the local women in the most horrific ways. They were given carte blanche to do whatever they wanted in the most evil ways imaginable.  The worst part of all perhaps, is that many were never brought to justice for their actions and will never pay for their crimes in this life. We know they will however pay for their crimes in the life to come. So the question I ask is, "what would their justice look like it it were repaid back in this life"? That's what RISE explores. 

    True raw justice is not about unforgiveness or even retribution, although to some it may be.  It's not even about settling the score. It's about paying for the crime committed in the most equal way possible, simply put-the administration of fairness.

     RISE is set in modern day Syria and stars three beautiful Black Ops soldiers, Gem, Minx and Diamond who are assigned to torture if need be, extract information and kill if necessary ISIS soldiers convicted of sex crimes and murder. The main character is Gem, a beautiful but deadly, highly intelligent, no nonsense special operations soldier who has no conscious when it come to following orders to torture and kill. She uses her beauty and charm mixed with her tough exterior to get what she wants. Gem was molested as a teen by her step dad shortly after her real father was killed in action in an Army combat mission. She always regarded her real father as a true example of a father and hero.  From that point on, she held a special contempt in her heart for abusers of women.  She joined the ARMY after high school and quickly rose through the ranks  soon becoming involved in Special Ops overseas. This is where her contempt was given an outlet. She responded to an offer to deal with sex crimes offenders in Syria.  She joined her best ARMY friend Minx and Diamond in Syria to organize and run Black Site 3. A holding area for convicted sex criminals are awaiting their sentencing.  Although originally from the US, GEM, MINX and DIAMOND officially joined the Syrian army to train and create a special paramilitary group called R.I.S.E. It's an acronym that stands for each members specialized skills. Reconnaissance, Interrogation, Surveillance and Execution. It also stands for the female gender RISING against those who would persecute and abuse and even murder her. Just for being female. Also it refers to the rise Gem and Minx will look for to determine if each ISIS soldier will walk free or be terminated.

     In the story, Gem, Minx and Diamond are on a much needed vacation headed to an airstrip where they are interrupted by a sat phone call from Command. They are ordered to cancel their vacation plans and head directly back to Black Site 3 where three high value ISIS convicts are awaiting their fate.   This totally derails the immediate plans for Gem, Minx and Diamond but they have to do what they are ordered.  On the way back to Black Site 3 while being driven by Diamond, Gem sees a baby doll on the side of the road, triggering a flashback to when she was molested by her step dad.  As she comes out of the flashback, she is reminded of why she does what she does and has a renewed fervor for her purpose. 

     At Black Site 3, the three ISIS convicts await their fate from Gem and Minx.  One of Gem's gifts is to mix mind games with her captives punishment.  Knowing that she was ordered to execute the convicts, she offers them a bargain they can't pass up.  A choice to die at her and Minx's hands or to walk out free men.  Being that the ISIS soldiers used sex as a weapon to kill and torture, Gem and Minx will use sex as a weapon back at them in their final day. Gem's mind game is that she and Minx will set a timer for 15 minutes and attempt to arouse the ISIS soldiers by any means. If they can withstand the temptation, they go free. If they give in, they die.  The climax of this film is to see who lives and who dies. And is justice served? Will they make it past 15 minutes?

 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $12,000 to fully fund RISE,  This will cover Actors and Crew salaries over two and a half shooting days, craft services, insurance and film permits as well as props and sfx.  All shooting locations have been negotiated free of charge.

For every contribution, over $25 you will receive an autographed script and a DVD as well as credit. If you contribute 25 per cent or more, you will receive associate producer status.

If we don't reach all the funds, we will contribute what we have the the shooting budget. Will will continue to save for the total till we are able to shoot the whole movie.

The Impact

As I share the story of RISE with selected people, its amazing how many people are supportive of the message even with it's controversial content. It's also amazing at the number of women who have been honest with me and told me of their experiences at the hand of abusers. They see RISE as an outlet, a voice for their innermost feelings. So I think by getting involved with this film, you are actually helping to bring a long silenced voice to many women who have searched for justice when there was none.

     I'm certain that we can produce a very professional film with this budget.  I just successfully produced a short with a similar budget and put together an amazing team of very skilled people. I'll do exactly the same for RISE.

Risks & Challenges

 I realize that there will be a few risks in making this film. For starters, it's a very unpleasant subject to tackle. We are depicting the administration of justice in an uncensored way. Some people will find this repulsive. Some people will welcome it and believe it's long over due. I'm creating the film with my team with boldness and letting the audience decide if something they can relate to. At the very least it will stimulate an interesting discussion.  I'm going to release this film no matter what and let it take a life of it's own. It's the only way to see what becomes of it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help monetary wise, please share this link and tell your friends. Every bit goes a long way!

story:
When donating, don't forget to click on each tier and see exactly what you'll get as a thank you for parting with your money! You'll receive exclusive merchandise and gifts corresponding to the value of your donation. Didn't think we'd leave you empty handed did you!?

The story follows Nim, the Last Red Witch, who embarks on a journey of true altruism.

Nim’s world centers on understanding the misunderstood and throughout the season the spotlight will shine on other characters. We will be transported to different moments in the past where the audience can gain a deeper, more holistic understanding of each character. Nim loves helping people, but there’s a catch. Nim is no ordinary witch and has been harboring a secret so deep that life in the Bog may never be the same.

Some of the central themes include acceptance, perseverance and learning to love your uniqueness. Nim wants to encourage children to search for the rainbow in every storm.
 

THEME SONG

 

Nim the Last Red Witch was created to teach not only kids but also adults to not be afraid of what life has to offer but to embrace it.

Nim is aesthetically comparable to Foster’s Home For Imaginary Friends while the story lines pay homage to the wonderfully weird world of Gravity Falls.

 

Who will be able to relate to this project?

  • People who have trouble dealing with their own emotions and focus on helping others to distract themselves
  • People stay true to themselves
  • People who remain determined despite their disabilities
  • People who are often misunderstood
  • People who are learning to stand up for themselves and for what they believe is right
  • People who struggle with trust

(The list goes on)

 


 

Kimberly Palmer is the creator of Nim The Last Red Witch. This will be her debut as a writer and director. Prior to this series, Kimberly flew across the globe to be a kindergarten teacher in Seoul, South Korea. During these years, her experience teaching inspired her to create a story that not only that kids would love, but also one that would teach valuable lessons about acceptance, perseverance and, above all else, love. Navigating emotions is difficult and complicated no matter what age you are - we often struggle and make mistakes, but these struggles are what help us learn and grow to become better people (or monsters~). 

See some of Kimberly's work


 

About the Animation Studio

MOCO Productions is an entertainment content development and animation studio based in South Carolina, USA. They produce high-quality digital content for television, commercial and online use.  You can see their work on Netflix, Comedy Central Digital, Apple TV, Amazon Prime Video, BET Digital, and Disney XD.


 


THE BOG

The story primarily takes place in the Bog, which is shrouded in mist while the ground is covered in a thick layer of peat and moss.  It is a bit of a dangerous place if you don’t know how to navigate it. In the center of the Bog, there is a tiny cottage built by Nim’s late grandmother. This is where Nim lives with her best friend Basil, and Charlie the spider.

NETHERBROOKE

Netherbrooke is a village that sits adjacent to the Bog. The people who live there tell stories of the horrors you can meet inside the Bog to encourage their children not to wander in there. However, there are the occasional few that wander into the Bog, but this often results in life-changing consequences...

THE TOWER

Peeking above the trees surrounding Nim's cottage is the Tower. It is ancient and covered in vines and moss. Maybe at one point it was a lookout or part of a castle, but now it sits alone, surrounded by ruins of something that used to be much greater. 

Though the series is animation, there will be moments that are inspired by real life experiences. A fan of tales, Kimberly found a way to smoothly integrate the humor and hard times of life in a way that's easily understood by not only kids but adults too.

The script for the first three (3) episodes of “Nim” is complete along with long summaries of the rest of the season which has 18 episodes total. The development process has been exciting, challenging and rewarding as we delve into Nim’s world. We focus on continuing to build the story and finding the perfect balance between the real and the fabricated world.

Marketing
“Nim” has a wide reach in the global film market due to its story and the balance between a family animated series and its relatability. It touches on the human emotions and finds heroic challenges as our main character fights for belonging. “Nim” is uniquely positioned to introduce audiences to an entirely new yet relatable world. It’s funny, dynamic yet sincere. The result is a heart warming animation that features a variety of 'real life' moments.

Though technically under development, Nim’s greatest strength is the main character, reality and the surreal world brought together by love and the desire for belonging. This is something many will be able to connect with as so many people are surrounded by loved ones yet feel alone. Nim gives the audience the opportunity to let their imaginations take flight. The season is full of exciting moments, built on trust.



Nim is an energetic and strong-willed witch. She lives in a small cottage in the center of The Bog with her best friend, a crow named Basil. Always upbeat, Nim likes to go on adventures with her friends. At times, she can be a bit stubborn, but with the help of her friends, she may be able to unlock a mysterious power dormant within her!

Basil is a crow and also Nim's best friend. He has a broken wing that Nim helped heal, but despite this care, he is still unable to fly. Basil is overly protective of Nim and can be a bit selfish. Inside, he's actually a big softy with a warm heart.

Long, long ago, Eddy found himself trapped in the mud. One day, Basil and Nim stumbled upon his bones and were able to unearth him! Eddy is loyal and calm. He likes to be included, but it's easy for him to find himself sitting on the side lines. Eddy's past is clouded in mystery, but with his new friends' help, will he discover who he once was?

Brisby is a bat with an insatiable appetite for fruit. Unsure of when or why this intense hunger began, Brisby befriends Nim in the hope that she will be able to help him. A bit mischievous and always willing to stir-the-pot, Brisby's antics result in some... unique... scenarios.

Charlie is a garden spider who traps and eats pesky bugs who sneak into the cottage. Now that Charlie's life is coming to an end, she has only one wish that she yearns for. Charlie is good natured and knowledgeable; tiny and mighty. Will this sweet spider see her dying wish come to fruition? 

The Underlings are three tiny creatures who serve the monster that lives in the Tower. There are three Underlings in total, differentiated by their number of horns. Their names are Hana, Teul, and Set. They skitter about, causing problems wherever they go. They seem to be looking for something, but for what remains unknown.

Millie and Annie are two cyclops sisters who inhabit the Bog. Millie is a bit timid, and unsure, usually deferring decisions to her more confident sister, Annie. For their entire lives, they've been labeled as "scary" from the nearby village people of Netherbrooke. As a result, they fled to The Bog to live peacefully together, away from the people who hurt them.

Lorel is another witch who lives in the Bog. She mostly spends time in her pond, not wanting to be involved in the affairs of others. Lorel is old, wise, and powerful. After outliving many of her fellow witches, Lorel keeps her heart guarded. She tries to keep to herself, but an intriguing discovery may be enough to urge her to seek the help of others.

Not much is known about Sam other than that she is a troublesome ghost. She floats around the Bog, pestering the residents. Is she looking for something? Does she have some kind of unfinished business? Or something else, entirely? Who knows!

Deep in the Bog is a strange and ominous tower. The Tower is hundreds of years old and falling apart. It's rumored that a monster dwells inside, but no one knows for sure. It's best to stay away from this place.

The average cartoon costs around USD$500,000 per episode. With Nim the Last Red Witch, we strongly believe in the success of this animation as do the current cast and crew. Therefore we have managed to bring the budget to $585,675 for 3 episodes. That's only $195,225 per episode with one of the best cast and crew to deliver nothing short of perfection.

Developing animations cost money.

You might be asking, “Where will my money be going?”, the answer: 

All of the money is going towards the production of the animation, and is based on a 9 month cycle (give or take), from the moment the crowdfund comes in.  The cast and crew will be working hard during this time to make sure the first three episodes are perfect. 

Some areas that will be covered by the budget are:

Talent, Production Staff, Animator/Animatic Editor, Visual Effects Artist & Animator, Background Designer, Sheet Timer/Xsheet Technician, Compositor, Post Production Sound, Theme Song, Composer, Recording Studio (Rental), Captions (Spanish, English, Japanese, German, French), Softwares & Equipment, Insurance, Legal Fees, Taxes, Marketing & Crowdfunding Fees (Including shipping & handling of the pledge tier rewards).

The cast and crew that we have thus far are fully invested in this project, ensuring that the result is not just another animation passing by, but an exceptional one with longevity. The world we are creating has not yet been introduced in animation. During post-production, the marketing campaign will be executed. 

Sooo... what happens if the goal isn’t reached?

The crowdfund campaign for Nim is a flexible funding campaign, which means that if we do not reach our target goal, we will still receive the funds that were raised. Even though it will make Nim the little witch sad, we will still move forward with production with the first episode if that is all we can do. We will then release the first episode and use that to help us fund the remaining episodes.

What about the pandemic???

Great News!! Unlike many other productions, Nim won't be affected by the pandemic since majority of the work will be done remotely. So even if there is another major lockdown, Nim will still be able to come to life!

Risks & Challenges

We’re employing a trademark lawyer to assist us with the legal processes and the creator, Kimberly Palmer, will be the legal owner of the animation so there won't be any issues with cease & desist from any third party.

The main risk involved in making Nim is schedule. If the crowdfund succeeds, our team would be able to dedicate more time to the cartoon (in most of our cases, even making it our full-time job), which would help reduce schedule slipping. There’s always the risk of something unexpected and outside of our control slowing the production, but such possibilities become remote once we have funding to work with.

I love Nim but can't donate. How else can I help?

Even if you can’t donate, spreading the word about the crowdfund campaign helps too! - Indiegogo has provided some easy-sharing tools which you can use to do so.

Remember, the more the word spreads about the campaign, the more likely is that we reach our crowdfund goal and the faster we can begin the production process! However, please be courteous when spreading the word. We want people to -LOVE- the campaign, not hate it. While telling all your friends, or people in your favorite forum helps to get eyes on the campaign, spamming the topic or being rude about it will have the opposite effect.

Thanks to everyone pledging to the crowdfund, spreading the word, supporting us and in general being awesome. We wouldn’t be here without you.

We still have a way to go, though, so let’s make this happen!
story_txt:
When donating, don't forget to click on each tier and see exactly what you'll get as a thank you for parting with your money! You'll receive exclusive merchandise and gifts corresponding to the value of your donation. Didn't think we'd leave you empty handed did you!?The story follows Nim, the Last Red Witch, who embarks on a journey of true altruism.Nim’s world centers on understanding the misunderstood and throughout the season the spotlight will shine on other characters. We will be transported to different moments in the past where the audience can gain a deeper, more holistic understanding of each character. Nim loves helping people, but there’s a catch. Nim is no ordinary witch and has been harboring a secret so deep that life in the Bog may never be the same.
Some of the central themes include acceptance, perseverance and learning to love your uniqueness. Nim wants to encourage children to search for the rainbow in every storm. THEME SONG Nim the Last Red Witch was created to teach not only kids but also adults to not be afraid of what life has to offer but to embrace it.Nim is aesthetically comparable to Foster’s Home For Imaginary Friends while the story lines pay homage to the wonderfully weird world of Gravity Falls. Who will be able to relate to this project?
People who have trouble dealing with their own emotions and focus on helping others to distract themselves
People stay true to themselves
People who remain determined despite their disabilities
People who are often misunderstood
People who are learning to stand up for themselves and for what they believe is right
People who struggle with trust
(The list goes on)  Kimberly Palmer is the creator of Nim The Last Red Witch. This will be her debut as a writer and director. Prior to this series, Kimberly flew across the globe to be a kindergarten teacher in Seoul, South Korea. During these years, her experience teaching inspired her to create a story that not only that kids would love, but also one that would teach valuable lessons about acceptance, perseverance and, above all else, love. Navigating emotions is difficult and complicated no matter what age you are - we often struggle and make mistakes, but these struggles are what help us learn and grow to become better people (or monsters~). See some of Kimberly's work About the Animation StudioMOCO Productions is an entertainment content development and animation studio based in South Carolina, USA. They produce high-quality digital content for television, commercial and online use.  You can see their work on Netflix, Comedy Central Digital, Apple TV, Amazon Prime Video, BET Digital, and Disney XD. 
THE BOG
The story primarily takes place in the Bog, which is shrouded in mist while the ground is covered in a thick layer of peat and moss.  It is a bit of a dangerous place if you don’t know how to navigate it. In the center of the Bog, there is a tiny cottage built by Nim’s late grandmother. This is where Nim lives with her best friend Basil, and Charlie the spider.NETHERBROOKENetherbrooke is a village that sits adjacent to the Bog. The people who live there tell stories of the horrors you can meet inside the Bog to encourage their children not to wander in there. However, there are the occasional few that wander into the Bog, but this often results in life-changing consequences...THE TOWERPeeking above the trees surrounding Nim's cottage is the Tower. It is ancient and covered in vines and moss. Maybe at one point it was a lookout or part of a castle, but now it sits alone, surrounded by ruins of something that used to be much greater. Though the series is animation, there will be moments that are inspired by real life experiences. A fan of tales, Kimberly found a way to smoothly integrate the humor and hard times of life in a way that's easily understood by not only kids but adults too.The script for the first three (3) episodes of “Nim” is complete along with long summaries of the rest of the season which has 18 episodes total. The development process has been exciting, challenging and rewarding as we delve into Nim’s world. We focus on continuing to build the story and finding the perfect balance between the real and the fabricated world.Marketing“Nim” has a wide reach in the global film market due to its story and the balance between a family animated series and its relatability. It touches on the human emotions and finds heroic challenges as our main character fights for belonging. “Nim” is uniquely positioned to introduce audiences to an entirely new yet relatable world. It’s funny, dynamic yet sincere. The result is a heart warming animation that features a variety of 'real life' moments.Though technically under development, Nim’s greatest strength is the main character, reality and the surreal world brought together by love and the desire for belonging. This is something many will be able to connect with as so many people are surrounded by loved ones yet feel alone. Nim gives the audience the opportunity to let their imaginations take flight. The season is full of exciting moments, built on trust.

Nim is an energetic and strong-willed witch. She lives in a small cottage in the center of The Bog with her best friend, a crow named Basil. Always upbeat, Nim likes to go on adventures with her friends. At times, she can be a bit stubborn, but with the help of her friends, she may be able to unlock a mysterious power dormant within her!Basil is a crow and also Nim's best friend. He has a broken wing that Nim helped heal, but despite this care, he is still unable to fly. Basil is overly protective of Nim and can be a bit selfish. Inside, he's actually a big softy with a warm heart.Long, long ago, Eddy found himself trapped in the mud. One day, Basil and Nim stumbled upon his bones and were able to unearth him! Eddy is loyal and calm. He likes to be included, but it's easy for him to find himself sitting on the side lines. Eddy's past is clouded in mystery, but with his new friends' help, will he discover who he once was?Brisby is a bat with an insatiable appetite for fruit. Unsure of when or why this intense hunger began, Brisby befriends Nim in the hope that she will be able to help him. A bit mischievous and always willing to stir-the-pot, Brisby's antics result in some... unique... scenarios.Charlie is a garden spider who traps and eats pesky bugs who sneak into the cottage. Now that Charlie's life is coming to an end, she has only one wish that she yearns for. Charlie is good natured and knowledgeable; tiny and mighty. Will this sweet spider see her dying wish come to fruition? The Underlings are three tiny creatures who serve the monster that lives in the Tower. There are three Underlings in total, differentiated by their number of horns. Their names are Hana, Teul, and Set. They skitter about, causing problems wherever they go. They seem to be looking for something, but for what remains unknown.Millie and Annie are two cyclops sisters who inhabit the Bog. Millie is a bit timid, and unsure, usually deferring decisions to her more confident sister, Annie. For their entire lives, they've been labeled as "scary" from the nearby village people of Netherbrooke. As a result, they fled to The Bog to live peacefully together, away from the people who hurt them.Lorel is another witch who lives in the Bog. She mostly spends time in her pond, not wanting to be involved in the affairs of others. Lorel is old, wise, and powerful. After outliving many of her fellow witches, Lorel keeps her heart guarded. She tries to keep to herself, but an intriguing discovery may be enough to urge her to seek the help of others.Not much is known about Sam other than that she is a troublesome ghost. She floats around the Bog, pestering the residents. Is she looking for something? Does she have some kind of unfinished business? Or something else, entirely? Who knows!Deep in the Bog is a strange and ominous tower. The Tower is hundreds of years old and falling apart. It's rumored that a monster dwells inside, but no one knows for sure. It's best to stay away from this place.The average cartoon costs around USD$500,000 per episode. Even though it will make Nim the little witch sad, we will still move forward with production with the first episode if that is all we can do. We will then release the first episode and use that to help us fund the remaining episodes.What about the pandemic???Great News!! So even if there is another major lockdown, Nim will still be able to come to life!Risks & ChallengesWe’re employing a trademark lawyer to assist us with the legal processes and the creator, Kimberly Palmer, will be the legal owner of the animation so there won't be any issues with cease & desist from any third party.The main risk involved in making Nim is schedule. If the crowdfund succeeds, our team would be able to dedicate more time to the cartoon (in most of our cases, even making it our full-time job), which would help reduce schedule slipping. There’s always the risk of something unexpected and outside of our control slowing the production, but such possibilities become remote once we have funding to work with.I love Nim but can't donate. story: Being a disabled American living overseas I was relying on the help from my mom to supplement my money while i was building my online work to a point of sustainable. Last week my mom had a stroke and two days latter my computer fried. I have to have a new computer as well as a upgraded one in order to continue my online teaching as well as grow my youtube channel.  I found the cheapest system that will fit my needs and it will cost 843 dollars once converted.

story:
Who are we?

DLM Media are a brand new Production Company based in Liverpool. We are dedicated in finding the latest talent in the UK and pooling them together to turn fantastic ideas into award winning films. So, who is working on Discretion?

Dave Morgan - Showrunner, Writer, Director, & Producer​.

Dave Morgan is a writer, director, and a Royal Television Society Award winning Producer, with nearly 6 years in the industry behind him writing several short films and TV pilots as well as directing many other projects. Dave studied Television Production Technology at Staffordshire University from which he graduated with a 1st Class Hons bachelors degree.

Neal McAndrew - Writer & Producer​.

As a lifelong friend and follower of Dave, and his work, Neal has brought enthusiasm and consultation that has seen this project grow to a place that is worth your time and investment. Neal is an in-house producer and script consultant working for DLM Media.

We will be having countless exciting updates about other cast and crew announcements, so keep your eyes pealed for those!

About Discretion​.

On his first mission as a newly recruited MI5 agent, Tom is assigned to retrieve a target called Andrew Dalton. In a fight for his life, Tom takes a brutal smack to the head causing him to momentarily lose his memory, and permanently lose some valuable Intel. Sophie, another MI5 agent, is on hand to help Tom when he needs it most, but a much larger threat has kidnapped Tom for killing Dalton, and the only person with a lead to Tom is the one he’s grown quite close to: Sophie. Events quickly take a turn for the worst as two terrorists break out of Belmarsh prison, leaving Tom, Sophie, and two MI6 Agents to find them before they act.

The cultivation of this project has been many years in the making, the vision of a six part web series however, has been a singular goal for the last year. The journey mapped out for this project has presented us with exciting plans in the near future, plans that will not be possible without the generosity and enthusiasm, displayed in your contributions.

While we have been blessed in the past with a group of dedicated and talented group of core cast and crew on previous projects, Discretion is a project in which we would like to take to the next level. The next level we speak of is to work with a higher profiled cast and crew, and that means we need money for their efforts. The breakdown of these disbursements will be sufficiently outlined later in the campaign.

What's in it for you?

Now, let's get down to what is in it for you.

While £50,000, appears from the outside to be a large sum, we have carefully outlined the budget, with our two distinct goals, these being the series getting made, and supporting and engaging local talent.

Your contributions, whilst getting us to our desired total, will also entitle you to, not only our eternal gratitude, but to some exciting perks that we have been cultivating. This will ensure that Discretion remains etched in your memory for years to come, as well as connecting you to our every growing community. Some of our favourite perks include;

  • A curated selection of film stills of Discretion.
  • An invite to our full cast and crew table read, which will be held in Liverpool, the home of Discretion,
  • And even an exclusive opportunity to sit down with the cast and crew over dinner!

All funds made will be going into production of Discretion. 

Where Will Your Money Go?

Filmmaking is expensive. There is a reason films have budges of millions and that is because everything is stupidly expensive. Here is a breakdown of where your contribution to Discretion will be going.

What You Donation Will Mean.

Your donations will enable young talent to navigate an industry that is very often influenced by name recognition and financial backing to create, innovate, and pave the way for up and coming artists that dream of entering the vast, enthralling world of visual media. Discretion will act as a cornerstone by which we can all flourish in our dedicated fields.

We can build a legacy with a project like Discretion, a legacy you will be a part of, as an investor. Engage us in our vision and visually see your contribution go to good and effective use.

What Happens If We Don't Make Our Goal?

No filming project goes perfectly to plan, the same can be said for the build up, and in turn, the funding.

We have experience in overcoming pre-production obstacles, be they location bookings, scheduling conflicts with cast and crew, equipment hire, budget delegation. This list could go on for days, this is to say, we have had our fair share of difficulties in productions.

We have however always found a way to ensure that despite these hurdles that the project is not derailed as a result. As we all know, the show must go on. We have in the past ensured contingencies to ensure we cannot be uprooted by circumstances out of our control. Planning our productions has been something that has been praised by our peers, stating how impressed they were with our overcoming of the aforementioned obstacles.

However, we do have some milestones in place for certain points in our campaign which are listed below in a little handy graphic.

Other Ways You Can Help.

This is a new project that will benefit from not only financial contribution, but from all round good will as word of mouth support.

Make the name Discretion synonymous with our project and vision. This will be achieved through diligent and extensive use of our social media accounts and websites.

Twitter - @DiscretionWS

Facebook - @DiscretionSeries

Company site - https://dlmmediainfo.wixsite.com/dlmmedia/home

Discretion Series site - https://www.discretionws.com

If all contributors and interested people can please also use the IndieGoGo Sharing tools, this will greatly boost our reputation on the site itself and engage your friends.

We will have campaign videos and other details to come in due to course, but in the meantime, enjoy!

Thanks

Dave and Neal

Producers - Discretion

story:
If you’ve made it here it means you've probably already watched the very first episode of Timberwood! Thanks for watching, we really appreciate it! If you haven’t watched it yet, go ahead and click play on the video at the top of the page...

Can you believe we shot that episode completely independently last summer? We did it all. Wrote it. Produced it. Directed it. Edited it. Starred in it. Everything.  We even put our money where our mouth is. Big time. Our director put up 150K of his own money to make the first episode! And since he didn't have it in cash, he did it by selling his house...

Now we want to make the rest of the first season for you to enjoy. 

Here’s the plan: You pre-order the first season of the show now, just like you might have anyway, and we use that money to fund the production of the rest of the episodes! Not only are you supporting the show by buying the first season, but you’re also helping fund it at the same time! And without you, there will only ever be this one episode. With your help we can shoot the whole first season of Timberwood this spring and send it to you as soon as it’s done!

If we raise $500,000 or more, we’ll be able to shoot a six-episode first season. But $500,000 is the bare minimum. The more we raise, the more episodes we can shoot and the better the show will be!

We’ve got so many great scripts written and we want to share them all! Visiting Day, Colour War, an Inter-Camp Roller Hockey Tournament, could Maricia actually exist? With the help of our fans, we’ll be able to raise the money we need and get this show made!

We know that $500,000 sounds like a lot of money. And really, it IS a lot of money. But when we’re talking about producing an ENTIRE SEASON of a TV show, this is a TINY budget. Look at the average cost to produce ONE episode of some of your favourite shows:

Back in the early 2000’s our director, Blake, worked as a counselor at a summer camp in upstate New York. In his words, the experience literally “changed his life”. Since then he’s wanted to make a fun, hilarious show that captures the actual experience he and so many other campers and counselors had.

Sure there have been other shows and movies about summer camp - satirical and goofy versions, camper point-of-view versions, versions where everyone gets (spoiler alert) murdered at the end, and even a version where 45-year-old Paul Rudd plays a 16 year old (I mean, he is pretty charming).

But to us, there’s never been a show that’s captured what it’s really like to work at a summer camp in an authentic way. That’s our goal – to tell a coming of age story set at summer camp in the tradition of Superbad or Dazed and Confused. 

Fast-forward from the early 2000s to two years ago. Blake and his two best friends, Ian and AJ, got to work writing that very show! We decided to call it Timberwood. And when it was all done, after months of hard work and endless writing sessions, we looked down at the hundreds of pieces of paper, turned to each other, and asked, now what? How do we actually go out and make this thing we just wrote? (We didn't actually print them for no reason, that would be wasteful).

The traditional way to do it would be to try to sell the scripts in Hollywood. The only problem with that is when someone does buy the scripts they definitely wouldn’t let us make the show we want to make, or the way we want to make it (mostly because we aren’t JJ Abrams or The Rock - although Ian did have a very brief/pathetic wrestling career).

Looking at it closer, producing this show independently meant we could do a whole episode for a fraction of what it would take a Hollywood production – mostly because we can work with a way smaller crew and be way more efficient as a result.

Then the unthinkable happened. Blake decided to sell his house - yes, he sold his actual house! - to raise enough money for us to spend a week up in the Catskills last August shooting the first episode! That’s the one you just watched for free!

Now we want to finish what we started and tell the rest of the story. But Blake doesn’t have any more houses to sell, so we need your help! If you liked the pilot episode of Timberwood and you want to see more, you can directly be a part of making it happen and join us on this adventure! When else do you get to become a producer for $10?

Apart from pre-ordering the first season, there’s all sorts of other ways you can be a part of Timberwood, with plenty of fun perks to go along with your contribution, from T-shirts and a Counselor’s Essentials Kit to VIP Tickets to the premiere in NYC or even getting to be an extra on the show!

Everything is at the top on the right hand side of the page. And if you want to sell your house like Blake did, we’ll accept that too! 

Every single dollar we raise will go entirely into making the show about camp you've always wanted. And because we’re doing this completely independently, every dollar really does make a huge difference. It’s not going into Venti Skinny Soy-based Pumpkin Spice Lattes or a travelling gym for Blake to work out  in (he's put on a few), it’s going directly into camera and lighting rentals, paying our small professional cast and crew, and making sure there’s enough mac n' cheese for lunch. And if one dollar makes a difference, you can imagine what $20 can do! Remember, the minimum we need is $500,000, but the more we raise, the better this show will be and the more episodes we can shoot.

(Although Ian did a brief a stint as a rodeo clown) 

We've been guerrilla filmmakers working with small and non-existent budgets for years. One of the last films Blake produced went to Sundance, AJ won a Canadian Comedy Award (and Canadians are funny!), Ian is a graduate of the famous Second City and UCB's comedy schools and even ghostwrote jokes for a famous comedian (whose name he can't say due to an NDA).  All together, our projects have accumulated millions of views on YouTube, and we're used to making mountains out of molehill budgets. 

Combined with great actors from some of your favourite shows like The Vampire Diaries, House of Cards, Homeland, Mr. Robot, Scream, Chicago Fire, Scream, Reign, and many more, Timberwood is where indie meets Hollywood. An accomplished indie team with experienced Hollywood talent. As you saw in the pilot, this perfect merger will give you great production value for a fraction of the cost!  Time to use the power of the internet and make a TV show come to life, together!

Even if you’re not able to contribute financially, the more people who see this, the better chance we have in raising the money we need. The pilot is FREE! So get your friends to watch it! Make some noise on social media. Put it on your Instagram stories! Put a link on your Facebook page! Tweet about it! Let’s make this more popular than those Riverdale kids!

Click the link below to download the Timberwood Media Pack which contains images and videos for you to post all over the internet.

CLICK HERE FOR THE TIMBERWOOD MEDIA PACK

 

We need to make as many Timberwood fans as we can as quickly as possible, and we can’t do it without your help! Remember, the first episode is 100% FREE to watch for a limited time! So tell people to watch it! They have no excuse! Help us spread the word. You’ll be helping your friends discover a great show, and maybe even help fund it along the way!

If you and your friends pre-order the show now, we’ll be able to use that money to make the show and you get to be a part of the experience! Along with some great other perks, for $25 you'll get exclusive access to the whole show directly to you as soon as it’s finished. You might have bought it anyway, think of this as just planning ahead! And even if it’s just $1, everything adds up to making this thing real! 

                                                       - Blake, Ian, and AJ
story_txt: If you’ve made it here it means you've probably already watched the very first episode of Timberwood! Thanks for watching, we really appreciate it! If you haven’t watched it yet, go ahead and click play on the video at the top of the page...Can you believe we shot that episode completely independently last summer? We did it all. Wrote it. Produced it. Directed it. Edited it. Starred in it. Everything.  We even put our money where our mouth is. Big time. Our director put up 150K of his own money to make the first episode! And since he didn't have it in cash, he did it by selling his house...Now we want to make the rest of the first season for you to enjoy. Here’s the plan: You pre-order the first season of the show now, just like you might have anyway, and we use that money to fund the production of the rest of the episodes! Not only are you supporting the show by buying the first season, but you’re also helping fund it at the same time! And without you, there will only ever be this one episode. With your help we can shoot the whole first season of Timberwood this spring and send it to you as soon as it’s done!If we raise $500,000 or more, we’ll be able to shoot a six-episode first season. But $500,000 is the bare minimum. The more we raise, the more episodes we can shoot and the better the show will be!We’ve got so many great scripts written and we want to share them all! Visiting Day, Colour War, an Inter-Camp Roller Hockey Tournament, could Maricia actually exist? With the help of our fans, we’ll be able to raise the money we need and get this show made!We know that $500,000 sounds like a lot of money. And really, it IS a lot of money. But when we’re talking about producing an ENTIRE SEASON of a TV show, this is a TINY budget. Look at the average cost to produce ONE episode of some of your favourite shows:Back in the early 2000’s our director, Blake, worked as a counselor at a summer camp in upstate New York. In his words, the experience literally “changed his life”. Since then he’s wanted to make a fun, hilarious show that captures the actual experience he and so many other campers and counselors had.Sure there have been other shows and movies about summer camp - satirical and goofy versions, camper point-of-view versions, versions where everyone gets (spoiler alert) murdered at the end, and even a version where 45-year-old Paul Rudd plays a 16 year old (I mean, he is pretty charming).But to us, there’s never been a show that’s captured what it’s really like to work at a summer camp in an authentic way. That’s our goal – to tell a coming of age story set at summer camp in the tradition of Superbad or Dazed and Confused. Fast-forward from the early 2000s to two years ago. Blake and his two best friends, Ian and AJ, got to work writing that very show! We decided to call it Timberwood. And when it was all done, after months of hard work and endless writing sessions, we looked down at the hundreds of pieces of paper, turned to each other, and asked, now what? How do we actually go out and make this thing we just wrote? (We didn't actually print them for no reason, that would be wasteful).The traditional way to do it would be to try to sell the scripts in Hollywood. The only problem with that is when someone does buy the scripts they definitely wouldn’t let us make the show we want to make, or the way we want to make it (mostly because we aren’t JJ Abrams or The Rock - although Ian did have a very brief/pathetic wrestling career).Looking at it closer, producing this show independently meant we could do a whole episode for a fraction of what it would take a Hollywood production – mostly because we can work with a way smaller crew and be way more efficient as a result.Then the unthinkable happened. Blake decided to sell his house - yes, he sold his actual house! - to raise enough money for us to spend a week up in the Catskills last August shooting the first episode! That’s the one you just watched for free!Now we want to finish what we started and tell the rest of the story. But Blake doesn’t have any more houses to sell, so we need your help! If you liked the pilot episode of Timberwood and you want to see more, you can directly be a part of making it happen and join us on this adventure! When else do you get to become a producer for $10?Apart from pre-ordering the first season, there’s all sorts of other ways you can be a part of Timberwood, with plenty of fun perks to go along with your contribution, from T-shirts and a Counselor’s Essentials Kit to VIP Tickets to the premiere in NYC or even getting to be an extra on the show!Everything is at the top on the right hand side of the page. And if you want to sell your house like Blake did, we’ll accept that too! Every single dollar we raise will go entirely into making the show about camp you've always wanted. And because we’re doing this completely independently, every dollar really does make a huge difference. It’s not going into Venti Skinny Soy-based Pumpkin Spice Lattes or a travelling gym for Blake to work out  in (he's put on a few), it’s going directly into camera and lighting rentals, paying our small professional cast and crew, and making sure there’s enough mac n' cheese for lunch. And if one dollar makes a difference, you can imagine what $20 can do! An accomplished indie team with experienced Hollywood talent. Let’s make this more popular than those Riverdale kids!Click the link below to download the Timberwood Media Pack which contains images and videos for you to post all over the internet.CLICK HERE FOR THE TIMBERWOOD MEDIA PACK We need to make as many Timberwood fans as we can as quickly as possible, and we can’t do it without your help! Along with some great other perks, for $25 you'll get exclusive access to the whole show directly to you as soon as it’s finished. You might have bought it anyway, think of this as just planning ahead! And even if it’s just $1, everything adds up to making this thing real!                                                        - Blake, Ian, and AJ

story:
What are we up to? 

We are a team committed to changing the way you react to and interact with the news. We want to raise the level of debate around the issues because information is everywhere and its important to be able to discern fact from fiction and to make an argument based on evidence and not simply conjecture or supposition. 

We live in a world where the structure of broadcasting is more blurred than ever. A single individual is now capable of informing the masses, right or wrong. News organizations are now more biased than ever. When there are those who peddle in misinformation or push a narrow-minded narrative there must be those who just as fervently fight to maintain the truth.

We want to bring you stories about the national issues and raise the level of debate around the conversations that we have about them. We want to focus on local issues and how they tie into the larger national narrative. We will do this by conducting investigative profiles, interviews and discussion panels, debates and focus groups with subject matter experts, prominent figures, politicians and voters across the country.

Your contributions will allow us to start this journey on the East Coast, starting in the DC, Maryland, Virginia (DMV) area by purchasing the equipment we will need to produce high quality content for you. We will then branch out to other locations, continuing our goal of exploring national issues from a local perspective and raising the level of debate around these conversations. Our goal is to eventually make our way to your city! 

We believe that all politics is local and so is the news that informs that politics. We think that getting back to the grassroots and highlighting issues and ongoing efforts to deal with them at the local level will better inform our conversations about them in the larger context of their national character. 

One thing every American can agree on is that we love this country dearly. In a time when it seems there is little else to find common ground on, its important to take a deep breath and not forget where we came from and how far we can go together. Rhetor is about finding our common ground, our common purpose and our common voice. We hope you'll support our campaign! 

What We Need & What You Get

Funding Goal: $8,000

  • $3,079.80 (4) Canon EOS Rebel T6i DSLR Bundles ($769.95 each)
  • $679.00 Canon Powershot G7 X Mark II 
  • $99.89 Outerdo 3D/VR Camera 
  • $269.95 Movo Wireless Lavalier Mic System
  • $99.00 Rode Video Mic
  • $239.99 Limo Lighting Kit with Photography Studio  
  • $109.93 Neewer 18'' ring light & stand
  • The rest will be used to cover shipping and handling and your great perks! 
  • If there is money left over after that, we will update you on where it goes. 

If we are able to reach our goal, we will be bringing you weekly stories covering the issues that matter. We will conduct interviews, moderate panels, lead focus groups and even VLOG about current events hot topics that have captured national attention, highlighting its importance from the local point of view. We can't wait to bring this series to life! 

 

Risks & Challenges

We aim to bring local stories to light so that they may better inform the national debate. One of the greatest challenges to doing this will be access to the right people. We have already laid the ground work of speaking with other respected names in the journalism and communications fields on how best to do this. Their advice on every occasion is to get out there and give it all you've got. Seek out differing points on view, ask tough questions and stay true to your mission.  That is exactly what we intend to do! 

-We will be relentless in our goal of talking to those who can provide thoughtful analysis, clarity and integrity to the issues Americans care most about and discuss on a regular basis.  

Sharing is truly caring! 

  • Money isn't the only way to help us! If you SHARE our campaign or FOLLOW us on our many social media channels, that would be just as big a deal! The more people know we exist, the better our chances of being successful are!
  • Following our other social channels will also allow you to see our content when our series comes to life!  
  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools!

Rhetor Email List: http://eepurl.com/bR_GvX

https://medium.com/@rhetornews

http://facebook.com/rhetoricmatters

http://facebook.com/groups/rhetor

http://instagram.com/rhetor

http://twitter.com/rhetor_

Snapchat: snaprhetor

story:
SHORT PITCH

A small-time drug dealer with lofty ambitions meets up with an old friend who leads him down an increasingly absurd path towards fortune and street infamy.

 

WHAT WE KNOW ABOUT THE CHARACTERS?

YASIN, with a split personality disorder, teams up with Jay.

 

JAY, with a devil on his shoulder, wants to dominate his territory as a small time drug dealer . 

 

WHAT INSPIRED ME?

Originally born in Afghanistan, my family made their way to America in 2002. In my new home I was surrounded and entranced by movies and media of all kinds. Drawing from these inspirations, I borrowed a camcorder in my freshman year of high school and discovered what would become a lifelong passion. Starting with family members, I began recording everyday life, trying to capture the drama all around me. I fell in love with film and dedicated all of my time and energy into honing my craft. From humble high school beginnings, to working with independent filmmakers like Pirooz Kalayeh, I’ve taken all this experience and channeled it into my own creative pursuits. 

CROOKS is the realization of that passion and energy. The result of years of planning, scripting, and revisions that have nearly reached fruition. All I need is a little bit of your help to make this series reach its full potential.

 

WHAT I NEED?

-Pay our actors

-Pay "COBB'SHILLPRODUCTION COMPANY"

-PAY for food during production (no one likes running on an empty stomach while we’re taking breaks)

COST BREAK DOWN

Director OF THE CROOKS: 50% <--- Goes towards actors and equipments---- 

COBB'SHILLPRODUCTION COMPANY: 30%

MUSIC EDITOR: 20%
 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP?

SHARE! By sharing, you will help us get closer to our needs.

story:
Who I am, why this campaign, how big your help will be

My name comes from being born on February 12, Abraham Lincoln's birthday. I am proud of that because of what Lincoln meant to America. Further, I was born the year John F. Kennedy became president, which was also 100 years after the start of the civil war.

As a first generation American, I have great respect, admiration, appreciation and love for the country. It is an organic entity that has shown the ability of a country to improve itself. So this campaign is intended to try to bring 'sense' to the misguided behavior that has crept into US sports via one football player. Your support will help arrest a veritable 'cancer' in America and redirect the 'well-intentioned portion of the message' to be more properly carried out.

I am an accountant, professor, author, father, husband, Christian, process-improvement professional.

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming here for $5,000.

  • A part will go to a very capable local production company that is presently performing for "credit" and a hopeful backend. That company is www.saguarofilms.com. A portion will go to a cast of over 15 actors and actresses. The scriptwriting team, rental of locations, insurance during filming, marketing costs and other operational expenses will bring the total all-in cost of the production to over $15,000. Your support would defray that cost by 33%.
  • We are offering FREE gavels and US flags for just "liking" our stuff. For nominal contributions, we will supply "The Head Coach" episode upon completion. We have completed episodes before. This is why you should not worry this will be completed. To that point, other episodes presently available on Amazon, will be offered here for big discounts from the Amazon price. And for exceptional, big contributors we offer behind-the-scenes fun plus all the other perks to boot!
  • If we do not reach our goal, the funds will go first to secure the production team. Because without that company, nothing will get delivered. Second, funds would go to retain the comedian and other cast we need. Third, funds would go to locations and other costs necessary to see this show is delivered for the good of America.

The Impact

The episodes we have delivered to date speak to compelling American topics. The American motto "In God We Trust," pugilism and safety in sports, commitment in relationships and women's rights are topics dramatized so far. 

Citizen behavior is critical in a country of 320 million, that allows the level of freedom allowed in America. Certain actions can work to undermine the intended fabric of the country. 

The main point with this episode is - if there is a problem, it is more advisable to use the "right" tool(s) to address the problem versus the "wrong" one(s.) 

Risks & Challenges

Ideally this American episode needs to be completed by February 2018, before the end of the football season. Beyond that, it needs to be completed before April 2018 to hopefully avert a spread of the ‘fire’ to baseball. Nevertheless, even if it gets delivered later than hoped, it will speak to sports in general. The bigger risk is the episode never getting completed and the misguided actions begun by one player going unchallenged intellectually and logically.

We want to provide quality similar to shows previously produced, so production costs are largely unavoidable. We also want to utilize the highest acting talent we will have employed to date.  Cast is critical to delivering the message as well.

We will find a way to get the episode produced. The main risk is how quickly we can deliver this needed opening of dialogue to America.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute, that's OK!

  • Please SHARE with friends and family for us!
  • You can use Indiegogo share tools!

Thanks so much!
