story:
Short Stem Summary

Our passion is simple, we really want to do what we love, and make you laugh while we do it! 

  • I'm Natasha Kradnikov and I have built up my following on Instagram to over 19K followers and  I want to make more people laugh than anything in the world! So I hope you enjoyed the video and wish for the same. I am Russian and work with only the best in the industry to make quality content for not only the fun of being creative, but also to be entertaining. 
  • We all love to create, if you donate to the campaign... We will be able to do just that! Imagine with the shoestring budget we made this skit on, how much more we can do with a budget! We want to smell good and it takes good pollinators to make us smell good, so pollinate our rose bush! <3
  • You will help us create content that could make people laugh that have never before laughed! Can you imagine never laughing in your life? We had one guy test out the video and he laughed and had to watch it twice. He is now addicted to laughing. I would say that's a really good goal in life, to make people laugh passionately! 

We need your help to make this dream of all of ours happen and we sure hope you're on board! Don't want to miss out on the adventure we're about to have! 

What We Need & What You Get

All the Bush trimmings: 

  • Essentially the $500 minimum we have on here is to pay the actors that have already trusted and believe in us enough to contribute to the making of the video you just watched! Our next goal is to continue to make more videos and to grow the online presence of Natasha (Be sure to follow her on IG, Facebook & TikTok @NatashaKradnikov on Twitter @NatashaKRussian) but, with an even higher rate of quality and comedy than you have already witnessed. For every $500 we raise, we can pretty much make another video. We have so many other things planned for Natasha in the future and look forward to consistently raising the bar for comedy. We even have a feature film in the long run, but that's down the road.
  • We're going to have some really cool (possibly borderline narcissistic) Perks in place for you. You just have to keep reading! 
  • We know we can count on you to reach our goal and hopefully even exceed it! But, if not it just means the actors and crew get paid a little less. But, you know what happens when the crew gets hungry? They don't like to work... So it's essential we do reach the goal!

The Impact

Rosey Bushes: 

  • Let's be real... We all love to laugh, (Last I checked, I really do anyway) and this may not be for everyone, but there are a lot of folks that will love this humor. We hope you're one of them! 
  • I can only point to the success of my Instagram in terms of being a content creator and influencer, but on my youtube channel I love to do tutorials on things. (Yes, I really can fix cars!)
  • I've been around Los Angeles for almost 5 years now and I don't intend to leave. I have worked so hard to be here and have convinced other people to kind of join the journey with me. Please don't let them down! I have been in a few movies, done some voiceover, acted in shorts, worked my butt off (which doesn't seem to actually be leaving me...) to be here. The impact you have on society will be awesome. We have other plans for helping give back to our community in place for the future, but we need your help to get the first stretch of the plan going. 

Risks & Challenges

The ultimate risk is not getting anything... And that really gripes my Rose Bush! So I will say per any crowdfunding campaign, we just want to create a fun journey with you including us into your life. 

  • We have teamed up with some other renowned filmmakers and content creators that have yet to be disclosed to protect their privacy. (they know what they're doing, we checked them out. Plus we're not too bad ourselves!) 
  • We have strategies in place that no matter what, we will continue to make awesome content. It just might mean lighter on equipment or locations or the opposite depending on the amount we get. We will adjust our budget accordingly, but we will always make the most with what we're given. That's a promise we can keep! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We know everyone sometimes can't even afford to donate a dollar, and that's okay! It is even more helpful to share this project with your friends if you believe in it and want to see us make more for you to enjoy. 

  • If you have media outlets that would love to share our content, please feel free to put them in touch with us. We are very media friendly. 
  • Please use all tools available to you to share and help us make this campaign and video go viral.
story_txt:
Short Stem Summary
Our passion is simple, we really want to do what we love, and make you laugh while we do it! 

I'm Natasha Kradnikov and I have built up my following on Instagram to over 19K followers and  I want to make more people laugh than anything in the world! So I hope you enjoyed the video and wish for the same. I am Russian and work with only the best in the industry to make quality content for not only the fun of being creative, but also to be entertaining. 
We all love to create, if you donate to the campaign... We will be able to do just that! Imagine with the shoestring budget we made this skit on, how much more we can do with a budget! We want to smell good and it takes good pollinators to make us smell good, so pollinate our rose bush! <3
You will help us create content that could make people laugh that have never before laughed! Can you imagine never laughing in your life? We had one guy test out the video and he laughed and had to watch it twice. He is now addicted to laughing. I would say that's a really good goal in life, to make people laugh passionately! 

We need your help to make this dream of all of ours happen and we sure hope you're on board! Don't want to miss out on the adventure we're about to have! 

What We Need & What You Get
All the Bush trimmings: 

Essentially the $500 minimum we have on here is to pay the actors that have already trusted and believe in us enough to contribute to the making of the video you just watched! Our next goal is to continue to make more videos and to grow the online presence of Natasha (Be sure to follow her on IG, Facebook & TikTok @NatashaKradnikov on Twitter @NatashaKRussian) but, with an even higher rate of quality and comedy than you have already witnessed. For every $500 we raise, we can pretty much make another video. We have so many other things planned for Natasha in the future and look forward to consistently raising the bar for comedy. We even have a feature film in the long run, but that's down the road.
We're going to have some really cool (possibly borderline narcissistic) Perks in place for you. You just have to keep reading! 
We know we can count on you to reach our goal and hopefully even exceed it! But, if not it just means the actors and crew get paid a little less. But, you know what happens when the crew gets hungry? They don't like to work... So it's essential we do reach the goal!


The Impact
Rosey Bushes: 

Let's be real... We all love to laugh, (Last I checked, I really do anyway) and this may not be for everyone, but there are a lot of folks that will love this humor. We hope you're one of them! 
I can only point to the success of my Instagram in terms of being a content creator and influencer, but on my youtube channel I love to do tutorials on things. (Yes, I really can fix cars!)
I've been around Los Angeles for almost 5 years now and I don't intend to leave. I have worked so hard to be here and have convinced other people to kind of join the journey with me. Please don't let them down! I have been in a few movies, done some voiceover, acted in shorts, worked my butt off (which doesn't seem to actually be leaving me...) to be here. The impact you have on society will be awesome. We have other plans for helping give back to our community in place for the future, but we need your help to get the first stretch of the plan going. 


Risks & Challenges
The ultimate risk is not getting anything... And that really gripes my Rose Bush! So I will say per any crowdfunding campaign, we just want to create a fun journey with you including us into your life. 

We have teamed up with some other renowned filmmakers and content creators that have yet to be disclosed to protect their privacy. (they know what they're doing, we checked them out. Plus we're not too bad ourselves!) 
We have strategies in place that no matter what, we will continue to make awesome content. It just might mean lighter on equipment or locations or the opposite depending on the amount we get. We will adjust our budget accordingly, but we will always make the most with what we're given. That's a promise we can keep! 


Other Ways You Can Help
We know everyone sometimes can't even afford to donate a dollar, and that's okay! It is even more helpful to share this project with your friends if you believe in it and want to see us make more for you to enjoy. 

If you have media outlets that would love to share our content, please feel free to put them in touch with us. We are very media friendly. 
Please use all tools available to you to share and help us make this campaign and video go viral.

story:
I am Fox RedSky, Director and  Producer of the Award Winning film Keep the  Fire  Lit - Lost  Tribes of Texas. The film was a success, having played at over 30 film festivals in 6 different countries. 

 

http://www.keepthefirelit.net

https://www.facebook.com/keepthefirelit/

 

Keep the Fire Lit- Lost Tribes of Texas  is only a small part of the story remaining to be told!! RedSky Ink Productions (100% Native American Owned Production company), is proud to announce a follow-up  Keep the Fire Lit - 10 Doc Series!!!! 

 

 The Tribes of Turtle Island: We All Spin Out From the Same Web

In the US alone there are over 500 recognized tribes, with more in Mexico and Canada. There are many tribes that remain in the shadows, never having claimed or even wanted official recognition. 

They all spin out from the same web. The things that divide us may be the very things that can unite us. We can help heal our people and mend the web through this documentary series. 

Keep the Fire Lit - Doc Series is relevant to tribes All throughout USA, Mexico and Canada with interviews and stories by Tribal leaders, Elders and Activist. At times inspiring, at times sorrowful and at times just beautiful, it provides a unique perspective of the First Nation in the modern world while touching the hearts of Turtle Island Peoples!

 

 

What We Need:

$12,000  we raise here will go into the PILOT Episode. 

March 2020 we begin by heading first to Arizona and New Mexico visiting the Hopi, Mohave, Apache and other nations, to speak with elders, traditional healers, youth, & other members of the tribes. We will shoot this entire series in 4K making it Netflix ready!! 

We have "the Gear," we have "the People," we have " the Heart." Now we just need your help!!

Keep The Fire Lit - Lost Tribes of Texas taught us how to stretch every dollar and still create award winning content. We require the following to film the pilot:

* Sound Crew & Equipment

* Transportation

* Food

* Insurance

* Marketing

* Lodging 

 

 

 

The Impact

 

Indigenous Stories by Indigenous Women 

Women are the life bringers and carry the stories of our people in our DNA. As we connect the dots and lift their voices, we all RISE! Through visiting Tribal Communities in the USA, Mexico, and Canada, Keep the Fire Lit - Doc Series raises awareness of issues in those communities and show our connections PAST - PRESENT - FUTURE.  Raising awareness inspires generations of young people to tell our stories and to take back their power.

The heart of any people is their women! 

 

 

 

Generational Trauma: The soul would have no rainbow if the eye had no tears.

The indigenous population suffered for generations through loss of land, resources and basic human rights. This is an effort to heal this.  When we share our stories our hearts heal. We can create real change in native rural and city populations.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

Fox Redsky is a Lipan Apache, Veteran and Mother who's heart and passion is in service to the native people and the greater good. Armed with the experience of producing an  AWARD WINNING full-length documentary, she is determined to Keep the Fire Lit! 

Fox has received encouragement from the film industry to continue creating this content. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

* Help us spread the word person to person or via social media

* Use the Indiegogo share tool to help us reach featured status

* Join our Facebook page  https://www.facebook.com/keepthefirelit/

* Go to Our Website  http://www.keepthefirelit.net/

* Donate $$ to the cause

 

Meet the TEAM

Fox RedSky -   Director/ Producer - Lipan Apache

 

 

 

Adrian Santiago - Director of  Photography 

Adrian Santiago is a multi-time award-winning independent filmmaker based in Dallas-Fort Worth.  He shot the original feature-length "Keep the Fire Lit" documentary.

Born in 1984, this entirely self-taught "King of Guerrilla-Style" filmmaker has been around the world with a full camera kit in his carry-on bag.

Most known for his $2,500 debut feature film "GRIM", Adrian Santiago is a skilled writer, director, director of photography, editor and producer.

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2831087/

 

 

Robin Bloor -Writer

https://www.linkedin.com/in/robinbloor/

 

 

Payton Aldridge - Assistant  Producer - Chickasaw

https://www.linkedin.com/in/payton-aldridge-7a322412/

story:
Space Trails: Life on Mars is a daring new undertaking - an episodic series portraying the struggles humans will face on Mars and the theoretical victories these colonists will have to achieve.

This project has been announced and has already gotten the attention of talents around the globe during casting. But filming locations, sets and costumes don't seek out interesting projects, so your contribution, of any amount, will be appreciated and used to fund pre-production and production expenses. If you wish you could go to "Mars Colony", though are stopped by the lack of existing structures on Mars, contribute to our show about it, for the chance to see this episodic series unfold, instead.

Even those who don't have much money to offer can still help advertise, so spread the word and keep an eye out. If you see an IFSE UFO on television, or the internet, it means we're bound for Mars!

Thank you very much for your support.

story:
The Verdict - One Hour Serialized Crime Drama

Following a brutal attack from a police officer, a once vibrant, now hardened young woman stops at nothing to put her perpetrator behind bars during an on going court case, while she simultaneously works to uncover the truth about her news station and their suspicious police dealings. 

Created and written by Cecily Vaughn, who is also a Los Angeles based actress, The Verdict is intended to be packaged and sold to a streaming platform or network with named talent attached.

The Verdict has spent the last two years in development. After countless hours of writing and rewriting, the pilot as well as the story bible are now complete. The last thing this series needs for the pitch package is a ​Proof of Concept.

I wrote and starred in my very first show when I was just a mere 8 years old. Fast forward 13 years, I courageously moved from Minneapolis, Minnesota  to LA to follow my dreams as an actor and writer back in 2011. I created my first web series in 2012 followed by making my directorial debut on a short film I wrote titled Divided in 2017. (You can stream Divided on Amazon Prime). After my role as a sexual assault victim in the film, I was inspired to revamp my character for television hence The Verdict being created. After years of writing and developing the show, I am extremely excited to continue the journey of getting The Verdict  picked up by a streaming platform or network.

Taking place in an up and coming, quiet city of Los Angeles County, The Verdict is a story that follows the lives of Entertainment Journalist JORDYN WHITE (20's) and LAPD Officer RANDY MICHAELS (40's) after a viscous assault. 

Once finding the courage to press charges against Randy, Jordyn, with the help of her attorney Rebecca, boyfriend Jasir and police officer brother Bryson, stop at nothing to put her perpetrator behind bars all while she works to uncover the truth about her corrupted boss and her suspicious police dealings. 

Randy with the help of his attorney Jim, Chief of Police Mark and wife Erin, must focus his time on maintaining his reputation, protecting his family, staying out of jail and dealing with his repressed memories all while learning the tragic death of his son Jonah plays a major part in his behavior. 

Jordyn and Randy’s lives unfold on this fast-paced journey. We’ll watch as a local crime turns into national news in today’s social media influenced society, making their court case available to the world and open to public scrutiny. 

While on trial, we’ll dig deep into the psyche of these individuals allowing the audience to explore the “why” behind their actions. We’ll get to know them before their encounter, understanding how life used to be. We’ll also explore in great detail the recounts of the assault. Leaving nothing off-limits. 

Off trial, we’ll see how the newfound notoriety affects everyone’s lives. We’ll show how two powerful entities, LAPD & Channel 8, have a direct correlation to each other. We will explore drug abuse and self-medicating while showing the highs and lows of mental and emotional health. Relationships will be tested, new ones will form and some will ultimately cave.

 Everyone has an agenda and these people will do anything by any means necessary to protect themselves and their families. But when all said and done, will justice be served? What will beThe Verdict?

This show is raw, unfiltered and offers an original premise. It is relevant to today's social issues and more importantly welcomes a new black female perspective. 

The Proof of Concept is a visual tool that helps networks, buyers, financiers, producers and even the audience better understand the world of a show. It's basically the final part of the pitch package. Mine will highlight the key elements of my show, showcase the tone and style, and I'll even make my debut as Jordyn!

The visual style will be artistic, bold and captivating with compelling cinematography, innovative transitions and exceptional directing. Flashbacks, memories and thoughts are a driving force on this show. They can appear anywhere, similar to a hallucination. To differentiate between present and past, neutral, cool and warm tones will be added depending on the mood. (Ex. Past: positive mood = warm tones, Past: negative mood = cool tones. Present = neutral.) There will be cinematic musical scores as well as popular hiphop and r&b to help drive a mood or story forward.

Funding Breakdown Chart shows distribution of 10k

  • Crew: Includes rates OR average day rates for key players up to three days of filming. Producer, director, cinematographer, camera operator, sound, lighting, script supervisor, set design, costumes and wardrobe, hair, makeup, crew assistants.
  • Cast: Includes day rates for SAG Ultra Low Budget Film Agreement for 8 actors up to three days of filming.
  • Locations: Includes rates for renting locations.
  • Post Production: Includes rates for editor and music composer.
  • Food Services: Includes catering and craft services for up to three days.
  • Rentals: Miscellaneous rental expenses ie: costumes, equipment.
  • Petty Cash: Cash for miscellaneous expenses.

Aside from being a great binge worthy show, I believe this project will be a gateway to a greater conversation about sexual assault and police brutality amongst women as well as other important topics. By contributing to this project, you will assist me in completing the pitch package by filming a proof of concept! 

Contributing doesn't always mean money! There are more ways to participate! You can simply:

  • Share this campaign with fellow peers! 
  • Share advice or resources you may have in the tv/film industry!
  • Make noise about this show on social media!  
  • Keep up with the me and the show on instagram! @CecilyVaughn @TheVerdict

http://instagram.com/CecilyVaughn   

  http://instagram.com/TheVerdictTvSeries

THANK YOU!

Make noise about this show on social media!

story:
What is Marked: Story of a Scar?

Two tattoo artists compete to design a unique tattoo inspired by the impactful stories behind the scars on everyday people they meet with.  The winning artist earns the right to “mark” the person with a tattoo design that incorporates the scar and immortalizes their story, while the loser endures a mark... of shame.

Our Goal is to produce an 8 episode season of the show.

 

Detail Summary

Marked - Story of a Scar, created by Dylan Ben-Israel, is a reality tattoo show like no other. In each episode, every day people marked with scars from experiences in their lives, sit down with two world class tattoo artists and share the stories behind the scars. Some scars are from injuries, some from surgeries, some from beating the odds of a disease, some from self harm, some from an abusive past, some from being a hero and some from doing something stupid.  

The two artists ask questions and listen, as the people recount their experiences and stories behind the scar, before retreating to their design areas and creating a custom tattoo inspired by the personal stories they heard.

Once both artists have completed their design, the person chooses which sketch best represents their unique experience and the winning artist gets to “mark” them. 

The overall result is a fun and hopefully cathartic experience for the person and the artist. By telling their story and having that story permanently etched onto their skin, not only do they get to immortalize one of the most important times in their life but they get to close that chapter, and as their new tattoo heals, so do they.

 

Message from the Creator

People get tattooed for numerous reasons. Some for honor, some for beauty, some for inspiration and some for celebration… but all of them to remember something or somebody in their lives. But there is another group who get tattoos for the exact opposite reason and that is to cover up a scar that they have… something they want to forget.

On this version of the reality tattoo show Marked, our tattoo artists will compete to design a tattoo that integrates or covers up the scar that haunts someone, and with it, hopefully help them heal and move forward in some way. I created the show originally as a way of letting people share stories that impacted them and made them who they are today… and sometimes by sharing these stories, it helps the healing process move forward. 

So please donate and help us make another season of this great show and help us share it with the world. If you can’t support us with money, then spreading the word is equally as valuable. Whether it’s telling a friend, a family member, or sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin, Reddit, Tik Tok, Clubhouse or any of the other social media sites, we appreciate the shout out… we’re passionate about getting another season made and every penny helps towards the goal of getting these stories out to the world.

 

Video Clips from Marked: Military Edition

 

 
 

 

 

Trailer from Marked: Military Edition

 

Show Format

The Greet: The participants arrive at the tattoo shop to meet with the 2 Tattoo Artists.

The Brief: The participants sit down the with both artists to recount experiences from their lives that resulted in their scars while the 2 artists carefully listen and take notes for inspiration.

The Design: After the brief, the 2 Artists retreat to their tattoo spaces to work on a design based on the stories they heard.

The Pitch: The Participant meets up with the 2 Artists again, this time to see both designs and hear what inspired each artist to draw what they came up with.

The Choice: After hearing both of the artists pitch their tattoo designs, the Participant selects who the winning artist is and the tattoo they want to get Marked on their body.

The Tattoo: The winning artist and the Participant go into the tattoo booth where the artist marks the Participant with the tattoo of their choice, while sharing more stories with one another. 

The Reveal: The artist reveals the finished tattoo to the Participant, hoping that this has been a cathartic experience for them by helping them immortalize one of the most important times in their life… and as their new tattoo heals, so do they.

The Wheel: The winning tattoo artist earned the right to ink the Participant while the loser must spin the Wheel of Shame and face the punishment that lands on.

 

Emotions from Marked: Military Edition

 

Tattoo Designs from Marked: Military Edition

 

What People said about the Show

 

Other Editions in Development

 

Money Milestones

$ 50 000 - Pre-Production Begins

$ 75 000 - Pilot Episode Films

$ 100 000 - Episode 2 Films

$ 125 000 - Episode 3 Films

$ 150 000 - First four episodes are filmed and move into post production

$ 200 000 - We can now add in some phenomenal score music to the show, including trying to license some kick ass songs to support local bands.

$ 300 000 - All Eight Episodes are filmed and into post production

$ 350 000 - Goal Reached to produce everything with all the bells and whistles we wanted in the show, as well as additional funds used on marketing and sales to get it on a network somewhere.

$ 700 000 - Begin Production on Marked - Story of a Scar - Season Two

$ 1 000 000 - Begin Production on Marked - First Responder Edition - Season One

$ 1 000 000 + - For every additional $ 350 000 we raise, we will produce a new season of Marked, including potentially city based versions.

Phases of Production

Pre-Production -  Production Office, Legal, Scouting, Casting

Physical Production - Crew, Food, Locations, Production Design, Vehicles, Accommodation, Equipment, Cameras, Compliance, Extras

Post Production - Editing, Graphics, Show Intro, Sound, Color, Music Licensing

Marketing - Posters, Decks, EPK, Festivals, Selling the Show, Premieres etc. 

 

 

Thank you for taking the time to read all of this and we hope that you are as excited about funding and watching the new season as we are about making it. We look forward to sharing it with you and the rest of the world. 

-- Dylan Ben-Israel (Creator/Producer of Marked)
story_txt:
What is Marked: Story of a Scar?
Two tattoo artists compete to design a unique tattoo inspired by the impactful stories behind the scars on everyday people they meet with.  The winning artist earns the right to “mark” the person with a tattoo design that incorporates the scar and immortalizes their story, while the loser endures a mark... of shame.
Our Goal is to produce an 8 episode season of the show.
 

Detail Summary
Marked - Story of a Scar, created by Dylan Ben-Israel, is a reality tattoo show like no other. In each episode, every day people marked with scars from experiences in their lives, sit down with two world class tattoo artists and share the stories behind the scars. Some scars are from injuries, some from surgeries, some from beating the odds of a disease, some from self harm, some from an abusive past, some from being a hero and some from doing something stupid.  
The two artists ask questions and listen, as the people recount their experiences and stories behind the scar, before retreating to their design areas and creating a custom tattoo inspired by the personal stories they heard.
Once both artists have completed their design, the person chooses which sketch best represents their unique experience and the winning artist gets to “mark” them. 
The overall result is a fun and hopefully cathartic experience for the person and the artist. By telling their story and having that story permanently etched onto their skin, not only do they get to immortalize one of the most important times in their life but they get to close that chapter, and as their new tattoo heals, so do they.
 
Message from the Creator
People get tattooed for numerous reasons. Some for honor, some for beauty, some for inspiration and some for celebration… but all of them to remember something or somebody in their lives. But there is another group who get tattoos for the exact opposite reason and that is to cover up a scar that they have… something they want to forget.
On this version of the reality tattoo show Marked, our tattoo artists will compete to design a tattoo that integrates or covers up the scar that haunts someone, and with it, hopefully help them heal and move forward in some way. I created the show originally as a way of letting people share stories that impacted them and made them who they are today… and sometimes by sharing these stories, it helps the healing process move forward. 
So please donate and help us make another season of this great show and help us share it with the world. If you can’t support us with money, then spreading the word is equally as valuable. Whether it’s telling a friend, a family member, or sharing it on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Linkedin, Reddit, Tik Tok, Clubhouse or any of the other social media sites, we appreciate the shout out… we’re passionate about getting another season made and every penny helps towards the goal of getting these stories out to the world.

story:
Short Summary

My name is Luke Burge, I'm an Actor, and first time Director and Writer.

Having a huge passion for this project, I'm really hoping to get it off the ground to expand my career, as I would very much like to direct and act in my own films.
The Dead and Us is very much inspired by The Walking Dead, and apocalyptic style stories in general; I'm hoping to branch off the project into something unique.

I've brought together a brilliant cast, whom are all fired up and ready to go, along with a dedicated crew who are very excited bring this series to life.
This project is so important to me and especially with how it will be made, I plan to produce it where the story is most important, it will be gripping and well told, characters will develop through emotional factors, and the unexpected can and will happen.
New ideas throughout the story will be told in ways you wouldn't begin to imagine.
There's endless ideas for this short series and we want this to be the best it can be.
Not only can we make this happen, but you can as well!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We are aiming to raise roughly £500 or more in order to bring this series to life, this would cover makeup artist effects, food and water for cast and crew, editing effects, accommodation support for cast/crew who are travelling long distance to contribute to the series.
If we do not reach our goal, all money we raise will still be put into project, however much we raise will help, big or small, so whatever you donate won't go to waste!
As a way of thanks, donating certain amounts of money can unlock perks, in which could even find you being involved in the series itself!

 

The Impact

The impact for myself and for everyone working on the series will be more than words can describe, we really want this to work, and have so much energy and positivity for this short series, we really want to make this something we can be proud of and can show online and hopefully beyond that.

 

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

We have had to delay this short series once already in order to prepare further, we've since learned that rushing into a project will cause sloppy results.
With this currently being the situation for this project we have found it's giving us enough time to finalise and double check absolutely everything so we are 100% prepared for when we aim our first slot of filming.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We fully understand that not everybody can contribute, however that doesn't mean you can't help in other ways; sharing our campaign on social media would be amazing, telling your friends about the series and who knows where it could lead. Even if you can't donate, sharing this campaign could help us reach someone who can.

story:
Short Summary

Super Insurance is a vlog style comedy that follows the life of Micah Barnett as he tries to prove how important his job is. He's... an insurance agent. But not your regular insurance guy, Micah works for a company that specializes in damages done by superheros and villains. He believes wholeheartedly that his job is crucial to the work that the supers do and will do everything in his power to make sure its done correctly.

Super Insurance has just announced that "a certain billionaire super hero" (*cough* Iron Man *cough*) is offering two VIP passes, along with a private tour of his lab, to the agent that process the most claims by the end of the quarter as a thank you for all of their hard work. As a self proclaimed super fan, Micah HAS TO WIN.  Follow Micah and his cubicle mate/best friend, Riley, as they take on every crazy call and dangerous plan to get those tickets. 

 

This webeseries is created by three life long friends, myself (Sharon), Liv, and Tray. We have always loved theater and creating stories and have found that the internet is a perfect place to combine the two. We believe that representation is important and are working towards creating projects that show diverse characters and situations. All types of people should be seen in media and it is our jobs as creators to help make that happen. This project is the first in many to come and we hope that with your continued support we can tell wonderful stories.

What We Need & What You Get

We are asking for $3500 to produce season 1 (19 episodes). All of the funds raised will go towards equipment, set, costume/props, post production editing, travel expenses/actor pay, and any Indigogo fees. 

Equipment: $1000 - New camera, audio, lights, monitors, etc 

Set: $500 - Rent for location as well as funding to build cubicle walls 

Costume/Props: $300 - cast costumes as well as back ups for when things get messy (they are going to get pretty messy)

Post Production: $700 - editors, animation, and marketing

Travel/Actor Pay: $500 - We would like to be able to give our actors a bit of pay as well as some travel stipend for those that need to travel. Thankfully it is a small cast and the majority live close by! 

Indiegogo Fees: $500 - This will give us a safety net for any fees that Indiegogo takes out. Any money left from this budget (after fees) will go towards Travel and Actor Pay

All funds will go to the creation of this webseries. If we do not meet our goal than any money raised will be used for these items in order of importance. 

FOR YOUR DONATION: 

We are offering perks for donation levels! Every level will get its perk as well as the perks for the levels before it. 

All Donations: Receive social media shout out and our eternal love and thanks

$150: Exclusive behind the scenes videos

$250: A personalized thank you from our cast and creators 

$350: A Producer's credit on every episode 

$500: A Super Insurance care package! - Signed Super Insurance script, cast photo, and a Super Insurance polo! 

 

The Impact

Our goal with everything we make is to show positive representation in any and every way that we can. We need more things created by people of color, women, and LGBTQ creators and our group checks all of those boxes. We want to show that we all have stories to tell and that no one culture or person fits neatly into a box. This show is just the first of many and we hope that you will help us make it a reality. 

Risks & Challenges

Our largest challenge is funding. We all come from humble beginnings and work every day to make ends meet. This means that we don't really have extra money to put towards the things we want to create. It's through amazing donors like you that we can overcome that hurdle. 

This show is also being created by people that live across the nation from each other. Liv and Tray live in North Carolina and I live in Las Vegas. While this is a challenge, we all work well together and through long chats, video calls, and emails we have been able to get things moving! 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate to projects that they love or want to see, but by sharing our campaign or just telling your friends about us and what we are trying to create can be a HUGE help! Please share as many places you can and tell as many people as you can about our little project! 

 

Thank you for being our Hero!!!

Please share as many places you can and tell as many people as you can about our little project! 
 
Thank you for being our Hero!!!

story:
Airplay TV: Binge-worthy TV shows

We are bringing 12,000 new TV shows & series every year, with 1,000 new titles added monthly. Enjoy Airplay TV on every device, across all streaming platforms, Smart TV, Roku, Chromecast, Amazon fire stick, Apple TV, Android TV, Xbox, PlayStation, Mobile phones, Tablets, PC.

The company:
A video-on-demand network for original & exclusive entertainment shows created by indie vloggers and video content creators. It’s like Netflix but with user-generated premium content.
Users can discover binge-worthy premium original shows in a wide range of categories in Comedy, Reality, Politics, Celebrity, Sports, Beauty, Tech, lifestyle, fashion & more

The Problem
Many talented video creators never make it to TV, Hollywood or big screens. These creators want to build a true career.
Youtube, Vimeo & Instagram provide these opportunities but there is so much noise (irrelevant & random videos) on these services that these creators cannot actually make their shows stand out to their target audience.
This is because these services weren't actually designed with these types of creators in mind (they only offer creators a channel & not an actual show). 

Our solution:
With our service, creators can create their own TV shows and TV series in form of episodes and seasons. Episodes must be a minimum of 10 mins, to eliminate “noise makers” & ensure premium & quality content only.
We could have more "Oprah Winfrey" or "keeping up with the Kardashians" type shows without having a major production deal.
These creators can build a true career while entertaining their unique audience (our users)

What We Need

  • We are raising $2,500 funding which will be used to :

1. Complete the development of our TV apps and launch our service to 90 million+ smart TV and streaming devices across the U.S and U.K (TV shows are better enjoyed on a big screen), 

2. Pay for our servers and video hosting ( we couldn't afford to renew our server and we are currently offline)
 ( Airplay TV Inc limited is currently incorporated in the UK. Company number 10513965)

What you get

  • Backers get a ''lifetime free subscription'' with a VIP account on Airplay TV.  
  • Backers also have an option of having 3 years free subscription for just $3

The Impact

 We started the company by offering curated music shows only (500 monthly active users, over 1200 downloads on IOS and Android in less than 7 months with zero ad budget), but based on user feedback, we are:
-    Expanding the categories and providing users generated content.
-    Bringing the service to 90 million+ Smart TV and streaming device platforms across the  U.S & U.K

- Re-launching with thousands of shows by thousands of creators across all 12 categories. Then we will add 1000 new shows per month. That's 12,000 new TV shows every year.

The world is going digital, video-on-demand is the future of TV & entertainment. We want to help bring that to reality and also giving every talented creator a chance to shine.

  • We recently graduated from the Y-combinator startup school online program, where we learned a lot of valuable lessons about building a company from people who have done it before https://www.startupschool.org/companies/na-XbUG...
  • Although our server is currently offline, here is the link to our current mobile apps, so you can use it when we are back online.
  • IOS; https://apple.co/2SXcFVa 

  • Android: http://bit.ly/2SWxfVx

Team

Michael Oni (Founder)
CEO, Business Development & Operations.
8 years experience in showbiz

Rahul Jakkam (Co-founder)
CTO, Full stack developer 
IT M.Sc graduated with a CGPA 4.0 (Gold medal) & 4year+ work experience.  


 

Challenges

 Funding has been our major challenge, that is why we are raising funds here on IndieGoGo to offset our company costs.

Other Ways You Can Help

We are obsessed with this company and we strongly believe it will succeed

  • Kindly help get the word out and make some noise about this campaign, help us reach our goals.
  • Kindly remember to share this campaign on social media! , this will be helpful in reaching our goals.

And we appreciate you all.

story:
What Is The Project?

The pilot episode of "The Project" has already been produced and is currently available for viewing on Amazon Prime...for Free!  (https://www.amazon.com/Lilith/dp/B07MB6TT1H)  The pilot episode was produced for less than $5,000.  We are seeking a production budget of $25,000 in order to complete the first 8 episodes of Season One. If we are able to exceed our initial goal, the additional funds may be applied to additional stand-alone monster-of-the-week style episodes and increase the number of episodes in the first season.

At it's heart, the Project is an 90s style horror serial that follows four women as they are recruited into a secret organization that hunts down and kills demonic and other supernatural threats.  At it's heart, the show is a suspense series, but has more than its share of humor and drama. It follows those involved in the Project as they learn and grow as characters.  You won't find those perfect, all powerful characters that plague cinema and TV today.  These characters are all flawed and have a lot to learn.  

What We Need & What You Get

The pilot episode of "The Project" has already been produced and is currently available for viewing on Amazon Prime...for Free!  (https://www.amazon.com/Lilith/dp/B07MB6TT1H)  The pilot episode was produced for less than $5,000.  We are seeking a production budget of $25,000 in order to complete the first 8 episodes of Season One. If we are able to exceed our initial goal, the additional funds may be applied to additional stand-alone monster-of-the-week style episodes.

Most of the production staff is already secured, the first three seasons completely written, and the primary cast already found and starring in the pilot episode.  We currently shoot 4K and have our own production gear, including lights, audio and cameras.  The additional funds are needed to compensate the on-screen talent for their valuable time and efforts, as well as to help secure locations, additional props and special and visual effects.

  • Locations
  • Props
  • Payment for talent
  • Marketing
  • Larger name talent for cameos (YouTube stars and other non-SAG talent)
  • Some minor equipment purchases including additional lights and microphones

What You Can Get

With several different levels of perks, you should have no difficulty in finding a rewarding donation amount to contribute.  Among the perks are:

  • Special thanks
  • T-Shirts
  • DVDs
  • Walk-on role (travel not included)
  • Day Player Role (travel not included)
  • Posters
  • Personalized Behind the Scenes Photos
  • Hour-long video chat with Creator and select cast members
  • Used props from the series
  • Signed Scripts
  • Associate Producer credit
  • Executive producer credit
  • Name a character
  • Choose a character to die in the season finale (some restrictions apply)

Will This Be Completed?

That's an easy question. Yes, absolutely.  Without a doubt. How can we be sure, you ask?  Because we've done it 40 times before. The pilot episode is even currently available on Amazon Prime. Feel free to visit our IMDb page, YouTube pages and Amazon home page to view all of the titles we have completed so far. Your help in funding will not only guarantee the project is completed, but that it will look phenomanally better than our past projects.

Decades in the making

In 1991, director Brett William Mauser began writing a series of screenplays that were based around the same characters, places and events.  For ten years, he continued to grow this cinematic universe creating low budget films with his VHS and Hi8 cameras.  Then in 2002, Mauser took the first step into a larger world with "The Knight Watchmen," his first serious effort into commercial filmmaking. Over the next ten years he would helm the Ponderous Universe that would see 35 feature films produced, all taking place in the same cinematic world.  The "Universe' climaxed with the ten feature film epic, "The Innocence Saga."

While the films were extremely low budget, some made with less than $150, the production team of Ponderous Productions honed their skills and learned the secret to making films with little to no money. After Mauser returned to complete his BA and MA at Texas A&M University - Corpus Christ, he learned the "right way" to produce films, but he still saw the wasted time and money and was able to combine his new found professional knowledge with his experience in making films with no money and founded Not So Sane Entertainment.

Through all of this, Mauser slowly found more and more success. Films like "Barrio Angelz" turned a profit and reached international audiences, while projects like "Serial Rabbit III" hit Netflix and gained popularity and eventually cult status.  More recently, his films "Blow A Kiss" and "Serial Rabbit V" have reached even greater audiences through Amazon and Amazon Prime. 

Now Brett Mauser and his team are revisiting the old Ponderous films, but with a new professional and experienced outlook.  Having realized that the stories and themes of the old films were powerful and endearing, he also realized that it was the wrong format to present them. So he started from scratch and rewrote the entire Ponderous Universe into 2 - five season episodic series.  The first fo which is, "The Project."

What makes these series different is not just what goes on behind the camera, but the material itself.  While the series is aimed and designed for contemporary audiences, unafraid of tackling controversial and current topics while maintaining adult content, it also attacks these from a more conservative and traditional voice, which presents alternative viewpoints and ideas that are not typically seen in today's television and film world.

The world in which these characters live and breath may be one of fantasy, where vampires and demons lurk in the shadows, but it also approaches it from a more scientific and realistic perspective, one in which a 110 pound woman is not capable of sending a 350 pound mercenary flying through the air with a front flying kick.  While it is a fantasy world, it must still abide by the laws of physics.

story:
Welcome to our campaign page! Risen8 is a dramatic web series, based on the life of college students and their faith, while also learning how to overcome the battle between the flesh and the spirit. Our goal is to film eight to ten episodes, with an ensemble cast of eight characters, with each episode consisting of 15-20 minutes.

My name is Cailan Sandusky, I am a graduate from Clark Atlanta University.  In 2017 I received a Bachelor of Arts degree in Mass Media Arts with a concentration in Film/TV.  

 

I am proud to share with you all a series God has led me to create called "Risen8".

 

Above you may also watch our promo trailer that shows our concept. 

 

"Risen8" will follow the lives of seven college students, the series will focus on how the characters deal with learning how to rise above their sins such as lust, pride, envy, and greed. My mission for this series is to show that although life may be difficult at times when you get to the root of the issue, it can bring forth healing.  Romans 12:2" Do not conform to the pattern of this world, but be transformed by the renewing of your mind. Then you will be able to test and approve what God’s will is—his good, pleasing and perfect will".

The budget is $7,000.  Any contribution no matter big or small, whether it be a $1 or your prayers we would greatly appreciate! All funds will cover all production costs such as equipment, make-up, hair, craft services, transportation,  post production  and promotion. 

Thank you for reading and for your contribution,

 

- Cailan

story:
Short Summary

"OFF CAMERA" Is a mockumentary styled television concept. It is about Jackson Iakopa, the writer/director of a very popular crime show "Tell Tale Murders" and the crew behind it:

  • Our creative team is a diverse crew of story tellers with collectively over 20+ years of experience.
  • This project is important to us because we have a passion for quality TV, making people laugh and letting them enjoy their day a little more.
  • Your contributions will go towards getting the right equipment and building sets to make our project a success.

What We Need

We are looking to fundraise for the following:

  • Microphones. (So the sound is clear and no joke is unheard.)
  • Equipment.  (We are currently a one camera show. In order to keep things efficient we would like to grow that number to 2.)
  • Sets. (The procuring of locations and building of sets is not cheap but we want to do our best to make each shot appealing to the viewers eye.)
  • Artist. (There are many talented creatives on board and more to join. Although we are not compensated we would like to eat.)

The Impact

We want to use our collective talents to bring a little light and joy even if only for 20 mins once a week.

Risks & Challenges

The road to make this show a reality will be filled with hurdles but we intend to take each as a learning experience and a chance to overcome. Some of our biggest challenges are:

  • Searching for the right talent to make the story feel real and authentic.
  • Getting the necessary funds. (We will work tirelessly to use what we have at our disposal.)

Other Ways You Can Help

You can't contribute? That's alright. Here are other ways you can support us:

  • Share. (Share on social media, to your friends or your next door neighbor.)
  • Watch the show. (If we achieve our goal then do us a favor and watch our show. we really think you will like it!)

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Writer/Director J.A. Walker is slowly becoming confident in her abilities to put on a production and make a way for her own stories to share. With two shorts currently in post-production, Jennaffer has worked non-stop over the last two years, immersing herself in the tri-state film community in order to learn all that she can about writing, directing, and producing independent films.

Although My Natural Life is a passion project for Jennaffer, it has taken her some time to find the courage to explore this topic. However, her desire to help young girls and women of color understand that the only standard of beauty is self defined is what keeps her motivated. She has finally overridden her fear and decided to take the steps necessary to bring this story to life. Being a “natural girl” herself, she truly understands the plight of young girls/women of color who struggle to find their identity while trying to maneuver through the natural hair process. 

What We Need & What You Get

The My Natural Life team is looking to raise $6,000 for season 1 and beyond. We are offering unique perks when you make a contribution that include but are not limited to: an invite to the series premier, end of film thank you credits, and a DVD of the behind the scenes footage.

story:
Who wants to be in Super Bowl 2021?

The Super Bowl. It's the biggest advertising event of the year, viewed by over 100 million people. But getting an ad spot during the big game has ever only been available to the biggest and richest companies. Until now!  My idea is a simple one. I want to give anyone with just 25 dollars the opportunity to be seen on the biggest stage. Have a small business to promote? Let's do it. Looking for an over the top proposal to your girlfriend? She'll love it. Want more Instagram followers? Sure, that works too. Just want to show off how sweet your ride/family/barn/whatever is to nearly every person in the country? Done. Let's make advertising history as the first crowd-funded and crowd-sourced Super Bowl ad. All it takes is $25 to get in the game! #inthegame

 

The Impact

Today our country feels so divided. Divided along political, economic, generational, racial and ethnic lines. Yet, our country's motto for centuries has been "E pluribus unum", "Out of many, one". From many states come the United States, from many walks of life and backgrounds come the people of  those United States. Watching the Super Bowl feels like one of the last events that still brings us all together as a country. That is why I chose it to create something that unites us all by showcasing our diversity, celebrating our differences and highlighting what brings the many together as one nation, indivisible.

 

How it works

So, Super Bowl ads are crazy expensive (30 seconds~$6 million!) and I'm just a guy with a day job that can't afford to lose $$$ making this happen. I'm mostly in this to do something big and fun that brings a lot of people together. I set the goal to (hopefully) at least break even after taxes, fundraising fees and overhead costs on a 15 second ad. If we go over the goal, we'll buy more ad time. If it doesn't work for any reason, everyone gets their money back. So please share this page with everyone you know! As an added bonus, use the Indiegogo referral tools to refer your friends and I will give $50 in credit towards one perk of your choice for every $1000 referred (must be logged into account and use share tools). 

Each perk level provides a different size ad space and time on the screen during the commercial. If you contribute more you get more, either more time, more space, or both. For each $25 pledge, a backer will receive 25 characters for a name or message that will briefly show during the credits.  A $40 pledge (limited quantity) gets a 50x50 pixel space to advertise whatever they want (within reason, see the rules) for 2 frames (that's 1/12th of a second). That will look like this.

$40 perk @ 1/12 second (limited quantity)

 

You catch that? If you missed it, don't worry. At the end of the ad there will be a website address where you and the rest of the world can go watch and re-watch the ad frame-by-frame, as many times as you would like. You can also easily record it on your DVR and play it back frame-by-frame on your big screen TV to make sure she caught that proposal.

Too small? Then you can move up to 100x100 pixels. Here are the four possible perks in this size. 

$100 perk @ 1/12 second (limited quantity)

 

$450 perk @ 1/4 second

 

$850 perk @ 1/2 second

 

$1,700 perk @ 1 second

 

If that still isn't enough, then you can move up to larger sizes. Here are the 200 x 200 through 400 x 400 sizes at 12 frames (1/2 second).

$3,500 perk - 200 x 200 @ 1/2 second

 

 

$7,500 perk - 300 x 300 @ 1/2 second

 

 

$14,000 perk - 400 x 400 @ 1/2 second

 

 

And there you have all the possible sizes and amounts of time you can be on screen with your personalized spot. All other perks are just different combinations of those sizes and screen times (if you would like a different size/time on screen, contact me and I will add a perk).

Now you might still be wondering what the heck all of this will actually look like on game day. Well, that all ultimately depends on you, my backers, but I did mock up this 15 second version of what it might looks like. Ready? OK, but It's a little crazy...

 

 

Can you imagine seeing that come on your big screen after the tenth beer commercial of the night? Since it will be like nothing anyone has seen, I expect it to generate a lot of buzz and immediate traffic to the website (in-the-game.com). That's a lot more free exposure for everyone's ad. The website will also include a grid system and frame by frame navigation to make it easy for anybody to find the exact grid cell and timestamp of any advertisement. 

 

So, what's the plan?

If we do make our funding goal, here is my five-point plan for getting all this done:

  • February-March: Meet some cool Indiegogo people and hit the funding goal. Yay!
  • March-April: Build website and collect all images from backers.
  • May-June: Engage an advertising team to create final commercial and purchase airtime from CBS.
  • July-September: Review final advertisement with CBS's standards and practices department and make any necessary changes.
  • October-January: Inform all backers of the location and frames where their reward will appear on the screen. 
  • February 7th, 2021: Collapse on my couch, crack open a beer, and enjoy the game!

     

    Risks & Challenges

    As mentioned above, if for any reason at all this doesn't work, I will be refunding everyone's money less any expenses incurred in the production of the commercial (if any). These expenses will be deducted proportionately from the amount contributed. So the overall risk to you the backers is low. 

    The first risk is that honestly, I’ve never done anything like this before. I'm not a "Mad Man". But I'm not going to let that stop us. I'm a professionally successful and know first-hand what it takes to get a large project like this across the finish line. I also know when to call in the pros, so I've budgeted enough money to hire professionals to put the final product together and purchase the ad spot from CBS. 

    The other risk I've identified is clearing the ad through CBS's standards and practices department given that it is going to have thousands of images and will be unlike anything they've ever seen. So, I've built a lot of lead time into the schedule to allow the network to thoroughly vet and accept the ad. If for some reason the ad is initially rejected, I will work closely with the network to make any reasonable changes. 

    Finally, it is possible that some people's perk just won't fit into the overall ad. In this case, ads will be included in the order that the pledge was made within each perk level (so pledge early!). Anyone not included will receive a full reimbursement of their pledge amount.

    Rules (Important Stuff)

    • Backer must provide an image in a standard electronic format (jpeg, gif, png) and of sufficient quality/size within a month of the close of the fundraising campaign. 
    • The subject matter of all images must be appropriate for broadcast television.
    • The backer must hold the copyright to all submitted images and indemnifies me and holds me harmless for any copyright infringement claim that may result from the use of aforementioned images. 
    • The placement and timing of all images will be determined by me, and the exact location and frames of the images will be communicated prior to the air date.
    • Reward descriptions assume a standard 1080p commercial shot at 24 frames per second. If the final video is at a different resolution or speed then the reward may need to be slightly modified, but I will try to get as close as possible. Ads may also be slightly resized to make them fit in the display size.   
    • I reserve the right to refuse images for any reason. If the image is not displayed in the ad, then the backer will receive a full refund.
    • Let's follow all the rules and make this fun and easy for all!

    Other Ways You Can Help

    Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to making this a reality. Help me make it happen by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or by helping us spread the word by sharing this page and using the #inthegame hashtag to spread the word. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo referral tools and I will give $50 in credit towards one perk of your choice for every $1000 referred (must be logged into account and use share tools). THANK YOU for helping make this happen!

$14,000 perk - 400 x 400 @ 1/2 second
 
 
And there you have all the possible sizes and amounts of time you can be on screen with your personalized spot. All other perks are just different combinations of those sizes and screen times (if you would like a different size/time on screen, contact me and I will add a perk).
Now you might still be wondering what the heck all of this will actually look like on game day. Well, that all ultimately depends on you, my backers, but I did mock up this 15 second version of what it might looks like. Ready? OK, but It's a little crazy...
 

 
Can you imagine seeing that come on your big screen after the tenth beer commercial of the night? Since it will be like nothing anyone has seen, I expect it to generate a lot of buzz and immediate traffic to the website (in-the-game.com). That's a lot more free exposure for everyone's ad. The website will also include a grid system and frame by frame navigation to make it easy for anybody to find the exact grid cell and timestamp of any advertisement. 
 
So, what's the plan?
If we do make our funding goal, here is my five-point plan for getting all this done:


February-March: Meet some cool Indiegogo people and hit the funding goal. Yay!

March-April: Build website and collect all images from backers.

May-June: Engage an advertising team to create final commercial and purchase airtime from CBS.

July-September: Review final advertisement with CBS's standards and practices department and make any necessary changes.

October-January: Inform all backers of the location and frames where their reward will appear on the screen. 

February 7th, 2021: Collapse on my couch, crack open a beer, and enjoy the game!


 
Risks & Challenges
As mentioned above, if for any reason at all this doesn't work, I will be refunding everyone's money less any expenses incurred in the production of the commercial (if any). These expenses will be deducted proportionately from the amount contributed. So the overall risk to you the backers is low. 
The first risk is that honestly, I’ve never done anything like this before. I'm not a "Mad Man". But I'm not going to let that stop us. I'm a professionally successful and know first-hand what it takes to get a large project like this across the finish line. I also know when to call in the pros, so I've budgeted enough money to hire professionals to put the final product together and purchase the ad spot from CBS. 
The other risk I've identified is clearing the ad through CBS's standards and practices department given that it is going to have thousands of images and will be unlike anything they've ever seen. So, I've built a lot of lead time into the schedule to allow the network to thoroughly vet and accept the ad. If for some reason the ad is initially rejected, I will work closely with the network to make any reasonable changes. 
Finally, it is possible that some people's perk just won't fit into the overall ad. In this case, ads will be included in the order that the pledge was made within each perk level (so pledge early!). Anyone not included will receive a full reimbursement of their pledge amount.
Rules (Important Stuff)

Backer must provide an image in a standard electronic format (jpeg, gif, png) and of sufficient quality/size within a month of the close of the fundraising campaign. 
The subject matter of all images must be appropriate for broadcast television.
The backer must hold the copyright to all submitted images and indemnifies me and holds me harmless for any copyright infringement claim that may result from the use of aforementioned images. 
The placement and timing of all images will be determined by me, and the exact location and frames of the images will be communicated prior to the air date.
Reward descriptions assume a standard 1080p commercial shot at 24 frames per second. If the final video is at a different resolution or speed then the reward may need to be slightly modified, but I will try to get as close as possible. Ads may also be slightly resized to make them fit in the display size.   
I reserve the right to refuse images for any reason. If the image is not displayed in the ad, then the backer will receive a full refund.
Let's follow all the rules and make this fun and easy for all!


Other Ways You Can Help
Any pledge amount brings us one step closer to making this a reality. Help me make it happen by clicking the ‘Back This Project’ button at the top of the page, or by helping us spread the word by sharing this page and using the #inthegame hashtag to spread the word. Don't forget to use the Indiegogo referral tools and I will give $50 in credit towards one perk of your choice for every $1000 referred (must be logged into account and use share tools). THANK YOU for helping make this happen!

story:
Bref résumé

Je suis Kinda Marie Elias, journaliste franco-libanaise. Je dirige un média spécialisé dans l'émigration libanaise depuis 1993. Nous avons plus de 71000 abonnés à notre Newsletter dans 42 pays.

J'ai déjà produit 3 films long métrage et 1 documentaire économique. 

Je viens d'écrire une série policière dont le terrain de jeu est encore l'émigration libanaise. Elle sera produite en 2018. 

Cette série nous permettra de faire connaitre cette formidable émigration qui apporte énormément aux sociétés où elle s'est intégrée et dont elle tire énormément d'enseignement.

Cette osmose entre la civilisation libanaise ancestrale et les sociétés tant historiques que modernes pourrait servir d'exemple et des idées de solution aux questions d'immigration contemporaine.

Notre équipe partira aux 4 coins du monde pour découvrir ces communautés et réalisera des reportages documentaires de 25 minutes par pays/état/région visités.

Nous avons déjà tourné au Sultanat d'Oman, en Italie, à Chypre, en Argentine, au Brésil et en Uruguay.

Votre soutien de 20000 € à ce stade du projet, nous permettra d'économiser plus de 300 000 € sur l'ensemble du projet. Economie de taille et accélération de l'action dans le temps et dans l'espace.

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

  • Nous avons besoin de 20 000 € pour acheter une caméra professionnelle, ses 3 lentilles, ses batteries rechargeables, ses cartes mémoires, son trépied, son matériel d'éclairage et de son.
  • La location de ce matériel nous coûte plus de 2500 € par épisode. Nous avons besoin de tourner 150 épisodes...
  • Nous offrons à chaque contributeur des gadgets personnalisés, des billets d'invitation aux séances de lancement dans chaque pays concerné, une interview exclusive sur notre site, une présence sur nos outils de communication, etc.
  • Si nous n'arrivons pas à récolter l'ensemble des 20 000€, chaque centime collecté servira à acheter du matériel de la liste, car chaque pièce achetée nous permettra d'économiser sur les budgets de chaque épisode.

 L'impact

Soutenir Jalyatouna, c'est participer au retour aux sources, de personnes déracinées depuis des années.

Soutenir Jayaotuna, c'est célébrer une communauté internationale qui ressemble en temps réel aux multiples facettes du monde.

Soutenir Jalyatouna, c'est faire preuve de foi en un avenir meilleur.

Pour plus d'infos : www.jalyatouna.com

 Risques et défis

  • Depuis 25 ans, nous avons tissé un réseau de correspondants qui alimentent notre média en infos sur les communautés libanaises dans leurs villes et pays respectifs.
  • Ces correspondants nous aident à trouver le financement de chaque épisode auprès de sponsors locaux, afin de réduire les frais fixes du programme.
  • Ce projet s'inscrit dans le temps. Il prendra au moins 3 ans pour aboutir à sa fin. Il nous faudra du souffle, de la patience, beaucoup d'adaptation car nous changeons constamment de fuseau horaire, de culture, de population, etc.
  • Chaque épisode dépend de la bonne volonté des sponsors potentiels que nous connaissons dans chaque vile, pays ou région. Jusqu'à présent, nous nous en sortons honorablement, mais cela peut devenir plus difficile avec le temps.
  • Les sponsors qui acceptent de nous soutenir doivent accepter d'attendre la fin d'une vingtaine d'épisodes pour commencer à voir de manière tangible le fruit de leur soutien. Cependant, nous commencerons à leur donner la visibilité promise dès la signature du contrat de sponsoring.
  • Nous travaillons sur l'émigration libanaise depuis 1993 et aurons donc la patience, le souffle et la persévérance nécessaires pour venir à bout de cette série.

 

D'autres façons d'aider

Si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider à financer l'achat de ce matériel, vous pouvez faire passer l'info auprès de vos contacts, rentrer sur nos pages internet, nous suivre sur Facebook et Twitter car cela encouragera des sponsors éventuels à nous soutenir.

Vous pouvez également demander à vos amis de venir sur notre page sur indiegogo pour découvrir notre projet.

Quel que soit le choix que vous ferez, nous vous en remercions par avance !

L'équipe de Jalyatouna

story:
Short Summary

Azreal's Dissent 2.0-She's coming for you. Or maybe she is running away. 

Azreal, the Death Angel, tired of shouldering the world's grief, shrugs off her duties and upsets the the balance of life and death. After a year of no one in the world dying, Archangels Michael and Lucifer join forces in a fight to restore proper order, only to discover their enemy, Lilith, is rising to her destiny to oppose them.

New web series-- micro online graphic novel on youtube. Amazing artistry that catches your eye and tells a story in less than 5 minutes. Watch at the train or bus station, picking up coffee, waiting on a friend, needing five minutes to kill--allow us to take you on a journey.

Hello, I'm Joyia D. Bradley of EB Film Productions. EB Film Productions is an independent film company based in New York and dedicated to creating, collaborating and promoting stories that uplift and entertain the human spirit. We seek to focus on challenging the stereotypical notions that are prevalent in the world today regarding “the others”-people of color, women, children and seniors. We specialize in creating visual phenomena that nourishes and inspires the imagination and intellectualism of our audience. 

What We Need 

Seeking 3K or $3,000 to complete 2nd episode. --So what does that cover?

  • Paying all artists--illustrator, editor, composer, actors (everyone who has come on board this project has done so at a discounted rate and I am thankful for it.)
  • Film Festival marketing and submissions to get in front of big name producers and sites like Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc 

Perks

While we would love to give pens, t-shirts, etc, I just don't have the budget this time. But what we can offer:

Associated Producer credit on IMDB and Episode 2 for $25

Producer Credit on IMDB and Episode 2 for $125

Executive Producer Credit on IMDB and all episodes hereafter for $500+ 

The Impact

Your contribution will make an impact no matter how much you contribute:

  • Every bit goes a long way...ever heard the story of the donkey that fell in the well and the farmer trying to get him out? The farmer started to dump a shovel of dirt in the well and kept adding to it until the donkey could climb on the piled dirt and get out of the well. Not asking for millions here--what you can give is a shovel to us.
     
  • Also, send out to five friends and say--Can You Help A Sista Out?!

Plan of Action

  • Make a contribution--any amount we will take and we thank you and appreciate you being one of our angels.
  • Subscribe to our Youtube channel so we can keep you updated on all things Azreal including episodes and more https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC6giIp6zdvghDg...
  • Share Share Share--tell your friends you gave to an amazing campaign and let them know they can give as well.
  • We will keep you updated on all things, Azreal's Dissent 2.0--PR, Blogs, Festivals, and of course Netflix, Amazon, Hulu, etc

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Summary

  • Corn Warriors is the only reality television show based on American agricultural life and the highest yielding corn farmers in the industry. 
  • We are raising money to fund our fourth season which will air in the Fall of 2020. 
  • You as a contributor will help us achieve a historic goal and help Corn Warriors grow and innovate! 

What We Need & What You Get

  • Producing a high-production-value television show is an expensive task and to continuously push the limits of what is possible in agricultural TV we need an additional $99,000 from individual sponsors like you! 
  • We'll be offering various levels of perks, ranging from access to special coverage of our production and insight into the farmers' lives to the possibility to be on the show yourself!
  • If we don't reach our entire goal, we will still be able to utilize this money to make Season 4 of Corn Warriors better than ever before! 

The Impact

  • Corn Warriors provides a unique perspective on the lives of some of the most productive farmers in the world.
  • We offer insight into American agricultural life, innovative farming techniques, and the struggles and triumphs of the American farmer. 
  • So far we have had three highly successful seasons, all of which are available to watch free of charge on YouTube and Amazon Prime. We want to continue to provide this entertainment and information to farmers and agriculture enthusiasts all over the world. 

Risks & Challenges

This will be our toughest season yet, as we have huge plans to increase the production value and scope of our project. 

  • Our team has over 50 years of combined experience in film and television production and we strive to be on the cutting edge of media creation. 
  • As the risks for the farmers get bigger, they do for us. 
  • We're in this together with the agricultural community, and we will face the coming struggles from weather, the economy, and unforeseen circumstances with a fighting spirit and a drive to entertain and educate farmers everywhere. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might not be able to contribute, but you can still help! 

  • Share word about our campaign on social media!
  • Watch our show on YouTube and Amazon Prime (be sure to like our videos and subscribe, it truly does help!)
  • Make sure you use the share tools on this website so we can get our word out even more. 

Corn Warriors Season 4 is going to be epic.

story:
L.Y.F.E. is REAL!

Welcome To The Good L.Y.F.E.

My name is Jerail Fennell, and I am the creator of L.Y.F.E., a YouTube Series that I created during the Global Coronavirus Pandemic. I wanted to tell an authentic story about four college students trying to maneuver through Love. Youth. Freedom. and Education.  If you're a college graduate, current college student, or just someone making your way through L.Y.F.E. as well, this show will hit home with you! 

Our campaign is simple. We are seeking to raise funds to complete season one of L.Y.F.E. If you loved episode one, then you are in for the ride of your life. During season one, we touch on important topics surrounding us today, including the BLM movement, #MeToo, Depression in College, Consent, Sexual Relations, Domestic Violence, and much more. We have eight episodes of L.Y.F.E. written and two filmed. 

Your contribution will allow us to tell this coming of age story that needs to be told. There is some story that will resinate with you in some way. You will also be supporting a group of  black actors, writers, and directors. No amount is too small, really. 

Let's Talk Turkey. 

So, where would the money be going? I'm happy you asked: 

Funding will go solely to the production of L.Y.F.E. which includes, equipment, locations, actors, support staff. Up to this point, I have funded the project out of my own pocket, and have also got a few investors for future episodes, but there is always room for more.  

What do you get for being an investor of L.Y.F.E.? Let's talk about perks: 

First Look At All New Episodes - We all like to be first, right? 

Extras including behind the scenes and outtakes

L.Y.F.E. T-Shirt ($50 or more)

Personal video messages from the cast and producers 

Early release of the Season 2 Premiere 

Sponsorship of an episode ($100 or more) 

Other Ways You Can Help

I understand that everyone isn't in the position the contribute monetarily; I get it! But there are many other ways you can help! 

You have social media? Share the series and tell everyone how good it is. You can also share the link from this page to others who may be interested in contributing. 

That's all there is to it.

Thank You! #LYFE 

- Jerry
