story:
STORY

WHAT IS MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS

It all started a warm February night in Los Angeles, at the FIDM Museum's Annual Art Of Motion Picture Costume Design exhibition: me and Sakis got really excited in front of the costumes that got an Oscar nomination that year. We looked for the people who designed them and we asked them how those amazing costumes were born, what's behind a costume from the moment it is created to the moment we see it on the big screen.

And that's how we got involved in the magical world of costume designers. An exciting world we totally fell for.

We wanted to give everyone the chance to virtually meet the costume designers: and that is how the idea of the docu-series MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS, a fascinating inside into the costume designers' world, was born.

We started to shoot the first episodes and each episode was a real trip down the White Rabbit Hole. Deborah Landis, in the episode dedicated to her, told us about how the iconic costumes of The Blues Brothers and Indiana Jones were born and how she convinced Michael Jackson to give up studs and chains and to wear that legendary red jacket in Thriller. Anthea Sylbert taught us that inspiration comes from reality: in the episode dedicated to her she told us that Faye Dunaway in Chinatown is dressed like her (the costume designer's) mother. In the episode dedicated to him, Carlo Poggioli explained that the real job of the costume designer is to help the actor to totally get into the character: the heavy costumes in The Young Pope helped Jude Law to realize the burden that a pope carries in the church.

These are just some of the stories that the costume designers told us in the Season 1 of MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS.

But this is just the beginning: there are still many costume designers to meet and many stories to be told.

 

WHY THIS DOCU-SERIES?

Why, Meet the Hollywood Costume Designers? Because if you're a fashion and movies lover, this docu-series will certainly ring a bell.

Because in each episode of Season 1 – online on: http://www.thedarkcandy.com/category/docu-series/ - you meet legendary costume designers as Deborah Nadoolman Landis, costume designer of The Blues Brothers, Indiana Jones and Michael Jackson's Thriller, Oscar nomination for Coming to America; Anthea Sylbert, costume designer of Rosemary's Baby, twice Oscar nomination for Chinatown and Julia; Carlo Poggioli, costume designer of Divergent and The Young Pope, Oscar nomination for Cold Mountain; Lou Eyrich, costume designer of American Horror Story and Emmy award 2018 for The Assassination of Gianni Versace.

And we take you in very special places where only a select few can go: in a wardrobe trailer on the Los Angeles set of Transparent where we met Marie Schley, in the Paramount Studios wardrobe department where we met Chrisi Karvonides, in the UCLA offices where we met Deborah Nadoolman Landis, in a West Hollywood costume house where we met Lou Eyrich, in Rome where we met Carlo Poggioli in his house, even in Skiathos, the real island of Mamma Mia in Greece, where we met Anthea Sylbert in her house.

And this is just the beginning: with your help we – and you - can keep meeting the Hollywood Costume Designers in Season 2.

 

WHO ARE WE?

The docu-series MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS is hosted on The Dark Candy (www.thedarkcandy.com)

The Dark Candy is not just an online magazine.

The Dark Candy is the only online platform that connects cinema and fashion through the Costume Designers.

It is the go-to online spot for costume designers to be constantly updated on new designers, manufacturers, textiles and handcrafts and for young or aspiring costume designers to learn from and read about their favorite Hollywood role models.

Behind this creepy-sweet name there are a photographer – Sakis Lalas – with a long string of celebrity portraits in his portfolio, and a fashion journalist & fashion consultant – Valentina De Giorgi: a couple in life and work, a couple dressed in black, a couple that travels extensively and spends too many nights watching old and new movies.

 

WHY DO WE NEED YOU?

Season 1 of MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS was a huge, unexpected success: aspiring costume designers, costume design lovers, fashion insiders and Press congratulated and thanked us, and costume designers appreciated our work and asked us to be part of the project.

Each episode has thousands of views on our Youtube Channel.

And this is just the beginning.

Meet the Hollywood Costume Designers needs your help to reach more and more costume designers. We have already started to shoot the first episodes of Season 2 and we have a list of very strong costume designers ready to sit in front of our camera and to show you what Hollywood is.

But to go and see them on set, in their homes, in the studios and in the costume houses costs a lot.

We are looking to raise 20.000 euros to produce the 10 episodes of Season 2. Your money will help to cover all the expenses, such as flights and stay on location, equipment rental, editing

Ideally, we'd like to raise as much as possible. If we surpass our goal, there is so much more we can do. We could travel all over the world, not only in Los Angeles, to meet costume designers where they work or where they live.

With your help the Season 2 will be bigger, more sparkling and more Hollywood than ever.

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

We value any help we can get! Sharing this campaign online, talking about it to friends and family. You can use the Indiegogo share tools too!

If you are interested in investing please contact us through our platform THE DARK CANDY:

info@thedarkcandy.com

www.thedarkcandy.com

 

And don’t forget to follow us on our social:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thedarkcandymagazine/

Youtube: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtwagJoUFfWgWw...

Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thedarkcandy_magazine/

 

NEWS

David C. Copley Center for the Study of Costume Design at UCLA University of California”  sharing the episodes of our docu-series “Meet the Hollywood Costume Designers”.

 

 

O GLOBO the most important newspaper in Brasil talks about us, The Dark Candy magazine/online platform and about our “Meet the Hollywood Costume Designers” docu-series.

 

 

Thank you LIFO magazine for the wonderful article about our online platform The Dark Candy (where fashion meets cinema), and our “Meet the Hollywood Costume Designers” docu-series.
story_txt: STORYWHAT IS MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERSIt all started a warm February night in Los Angeles, at the FIDM Museum's Annual Art Of Motion Picture Costume Design exhibition: me and Sakis got really excited in front of the costumes that got an Oscar nomination that year. We looked for the people who designed them and we asked them how those amazing costumes were born, what's behind a costume from the moment it is created to the moment we see it on the big screen.And that's how we got involved in the magical world of costume designers. An exciting world we totally fell for.We wanted to give everyone the chance to virtually meet the costume designers: and that is how the idea of the docu-series MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS, a fascinating inside into the costume designers' world, was born.We started to shoot the first episodes and each episode was a real trip down the White Rabbit Hole. Deborah Landis, in the episode dedicated to her, told us about how the iconic costumes of The Blues Brothers and Indiana Jones were born and how she convinced Michael Jackson to give up studs and chains and to wear that legendary red jacket in Thriller. Anthea Sylbert taught us that inspiration comes from reality: in the episode dedicated to her she told us that Faye Dunaway in Chinatown is dressed like her (the costume designer's) mother. In the episode dedicated to him, Carlo Poggioli explained that the real job of the costume designer is to help the actor to totally get into the character: the heavy costumes in The Young Pope helped Jude Law to realize the burden that a pope carries in the church.These are just some of the stories that the costume designers told us in the Season 1 of MEET THE HOLLYWOOD COSTUME DESIGNERS.But this is just the beginning: there are still many costume designers to meet and many stories to be told. WHY THIS DOCU-SERIES?Why, Meet the Hollywood Costume Designers? story:
Who are the Around The Way Girls?

 

My name is Tisha Griffith.  I am a filmmaker based in Cincinnati Ohio. I am creator of the new and upcoming webseries “ Around the Way Girls”. This series revolves around  five beautiful and uniquely flawed African American women. Jasmine, Carmen, Rochelle, Porcha and Eve have been friends since college, and they are now embarking on their 30’s.  Together, they face life’s test and triumphs, from dating to divorce, love and betrayal, these women learn about true friendship in the process.

 

How you can be a Part of Around the Way Girls

In order to bring this wildly entertaining series to life, our budget requires $10,000.  This money will fund our 5-day shoot at locations in Los Angeles California. Our budget breakdown includes crew ($5,650) equipment ( $1,850) locations ( $1,075) and finally meals and misc. ( $1,425). We hope to reach our goal so we can shoot this amazing project!

This is where you come in. With your generous donation, we can make this dream a reality and become a part of the Around the Way Girls family.

 

#TeamJasmine  $20  A Facebook and Instagram/ YouTube  Shout Out, and a Signed Poster by Fab Five

 

#TeamCarmen $50 A Facebook/ Instagram / You tube Shout Out, Signed Poster by Fab Five  and a #ATWG T-Shirt

 

#TeamEve $100 A Facebook/ Instagram / You tube Shout Out, Signed Poster by Fab Five  and a #ATWG T-Shirt, Your name listed as associate producer on the credits.

 

#TeamRochelle $300  A Facebook/ Instagram / You tube Shout Out, Signed Poster by Fab Five  and a #ATWG T-Shirt Your name listed as associate producer on the credits and invitation to a private screening in L.A

 

#TeamPorcha  $500 A Facebook/ Instagram / You tube Shout Out, Signed Poster by Fab Five  and a #ATWG T-Shirt Your name listed as associate producer on the credits, invitation to a private screening in L.A and cameo appearance on the set of #ATWG in L.A

story:
My name is Joey Shinobi, a content creator through the streaming service Mixer. I stream video games and host live IRL talk shows. People have always told me I have this unique blend of charisma that motivates and inspires. I am a natural entertainer, and more importantly, I try and give back to my fellow communities as much as possible. I need your help! 

 

Over the last few years I have been slowly building up a home studio that will allow me to deliver the most unique and professional streaming experience ever. I have accomplished so much and met so many wonderful new friends from all over the globe, the journey has been nothing short of fantastic. This campaign will help me finalize the studio with the most expensive and equally important backbone of the studio, the PC RIG itself. 

Currently, I run everything through a steam machine,a low end unit, its out run it's use. I am currently experiences issues and crashes as it struggles to keep up with all the programs running when i hit the go live button. It has had a good run as a beginners set up. Unfortunately, I have outgrown it rather quickly, and the specs are un-upgradeable. I need a pC i can grow with, upgrade as needed, and that will last me for a solid few years.  

I have offered what I think is some fairly unique and fun perks, most of which are connected to my digital content and shows. I am growing on mixer very fast, and I offer unique experience for those interested in potentially testing the waters, or just want to have a fun time with my amazing community. 

If we do not reach the entire fun, the money will be set aside as i continue to receive donations from my streams and through patreon. Whether or not we reach the goal or not, every dollar pledged will be spent on the RIG. The more we make, the stronger the RIG will be built.

story:
More Information

Hi, I'm Chris!

I'm an independent documentary filmmaker and photographer, passionate about people. 

The films are short and digestible, something that you could sit and watch over a coffee. The series covers a diverse range of stories, hopefully gaining some insight into a world you may not be so familiar with and meeting the people along the way that are passionate enough to make it their life.

I am in the process of shooting 7 short films for the series:

  • Adrian, defending his regional bodybuilding title in the North East,
  • Hamish, 17-year-old bouldering champion,
  • Simon, who is running 50 marathons in 50 weeks to raise awareness for mental health,
  • Oliver, young entrepreneur and hot air balloon pilot,
  • Ryan, riding his bike across Europe to raise awareness for mental health,
  • Nathan, Portland’s youngest coffee roaster,
  • Young climate change activists, putting up a fight for direct action.

There are lots more interesting people I am in contact with for the series that would require additional funding to shoot as the travel and accommodation expenses exceed what I can currently afford for the project.

I can't offer many perks in response to your donations, however your contribution to the project would be greatly appreciated!

If you can't donate, but would still like to help get these short documentaries made, please share on the campaign and spread the word through social media channels.

Thanks for reading!

All the best,

Chris

story: Claramente estamos creando contenido audiovisual que busca mostrar a la sociedad panameña tal cual es, tocando temas de manera directa como no hacen los medios convencionales. En los últimos meses claramente ha crecido y ha ganado reconocimiento, es por eso que queremos expandir nuestra capacidad para desarrollar contenido de mayor y mejor calidad. Esto por supuesto conlleva una mayor inversión de recursos y tiempo y es por eso que estamos pidiendo tu ayuda.

story:
Short Summary

We are the MorphinTokuSociety, a coalition of ranger fans who hope to bring a new light and scope to the power ranger fandom. Each of our members are authors of their own individual ranger teams who've joined together to build a whole new universe. This project has been a dream for many of our members.

By joining us with this campaign you'd be following us as we explore this new and unknown dungeon. New stories will be told based on the ones we all know and love.

Questions that were left ambiguous will finally be answered.

The first step in getting to all the good stuff is laying the ground work. Power Rangers Ancient Age is the first of our series and will essentially take the place of the 30th anniversary. Ancient Age has a starting team of 6 rangers and are mentored by none other than Jason Lee Scott. They draw their powers from the ancient gods of Egypt who have taken up residence in the the bodies of our 6 protagonists. Through out their journey we encounter many archaic threats such as other demons, monsters, and gods. We also get to see many familiar faces along the way all of whom impart wisdom to the Ancient Age team.

THEME SONG!

 

What We Need & What You Get

We're hoping to accumulate roughly 50k or less. All funds will be poured directly into key areas of the the project primarily in terms of equipment and software. Another crucial area would be in securing familiar voices in the ranger fandom. Imagine not only seeing your favorite characters but actually hearing them. There have been talk with having ACTUAL TV RANGERS voicing their character so that will be a plus. We also need help in getting singers and composers in order to draft music for future sound tracks. We need help also securing sound designers and vfx artists. We hope to give you the best experience possible, one that will not easily be forgotten.

If we don't meet our full funding, what we receive will be put into the animation software as we continue to negotiate with TV actors.

The Impact

This project was once produced as an online story which received stellar reviews by fans stating that this was something much needed. A group of fans went on to draft a petition to make this project a reality and now here we are. We aim to expand Power Rangers Ancient Age beyond just the written narrative as it was originally but to now add the long awaited visual aspect. By contributing to this project and joining to make this dream a reality you will be supporting the hope of a much needed change in the grand narrative of Power Rangers.

One notable lack in the fandom is acknowledgment of he impact of the first Red Ranger Jason Lee Scott. In our story we expand more on his character making him a father and delving more into his past as a ranger. He too has a connection to Egypt all of which led to his eventual becoming of the red and gold rangers

There was so many questions left unanswered, as well as too many unrealistic situations. This story hoped to give answers and add a degree of realism that fans of all ages can enjoy.

Risks & Challenges

We understand that the goal we set may seem a bit far fetched, however that will not deter us from striving to get all we can. Every single penny will be put to use, none of it will be wasted. If we are unable to secure the desired TV rangers we will need reliable fans who are willing step up and voice their characters.

We are determined to try as many times as it takes to get where we need to be. We’ve come to far to throw in the towel and run

Other Ways You Can Help

If for whatever reason you are unable to give, pass the word on. If we can get over 100 people telling their friends about the project we’re bound to see a great harvest. This is a truly original team, not based on anything seen before pleas consider donating whatever you can.

story:
**IMPORTANT UPDATE**
Our budget needs have dropped to only $6,085!

Give now to help us reach our goal, only 30 days left!!

 

The Fairfield Boys Mini Series

Brief Synopsis

In the backwoods of the old west, two brother outlaws (The Fairfield Boys), are hunted by a skilled bounty hunter out for his own kind of justice. Inescapably the brother's lives are intertwined with two unsuspecting runaways, changing all of their lives forever. From the rights and the wrongs, to the twists and the turns, they discover the bonds of family among thieves in this five part mini-series set in the old west. Filmed entirely against the scenic Oregon landscape.

Episode 1 "Rough Times"
Morgan and Clive find themselves engaged in a shootout in the remote hills with a deadly hunter. When Abigail stumbles upon one of the survivors, her and her brother must nurse the stranger back to health and make a difficult decision.

Episode 2 "Blood and Vengeance"
Abigail and Zeke arrive at the lake with their battered survivor in tow, but a night meant for rest and recuperation, turns violent. As the trio is ambushed, another wounded victim is added to the list, forcing the three to seek aid at a nearby farm.

Episode 3 "Our True Enemy"
The true enemy is revealed as old ties reconnect. Once considered enemies become allies and new revelations come to light. A harrowing loss reveals the truth that will lead our troupe back to town and back into the throngs of a past better forgotten.

Episode 4 "Back In Town"
The hard truth is faced, as backwoods meets civilization. With hope dwindling and little makings of a plan or advantage, the troupe returns to face demons of old. A corrupt town will offer little aid to the outcasts, but a stand needs to be made even with the threat of a noose in sight.

Episode 5 "Redemption"
The final stand is made and all is revealed. As the Sheriff and his Deputies vie for power in town, the streets run red with blood. Abigail and her allies fight against corruption and injustice as they look for redemption at the end of their long road.

 

Out West

Some of the best westerns made were mini series. Take Lonesome Dove and Larry McMurtry's further series Streets of Laredo, Dead Man's Walk and Comanche Moon. Then there were the History Channels popular Hatfields & McCoys and Texas Rising. Of course there have been countless westerns throughout the years, ranging from the black and white Roy Rogers and Errol Flynn movies to today's Dances With Wolves, Hostiles and The Magnificent Seven (remake of the original). Of course I would be remiss if I did not include John Wayne and Clint Eastwood. All of these are shot against beautiful landscapes and are full of thrilling adventure and stories of survival, during a time that was rough and gritty. What better place to film a western than right here in Oregon (home to the Oregon Trail)? Why not tell a gritty story of survival, hope, redemption and love? Well, that right there is what we are aimn' to do!

 

Meet The Team

 

Episode #1 - Rough Times
 

Peter Wickliffe - Writer / Director / Cast 'Clive Fairfield
Peter Wickliffe was born in Escondido, California. In middle school and high school he did various film projects and theatrical productions. His first credited film role was for the short film For God and Country directed and produced by The Donnelly Brothers. Peter later moved to Southern Oregon and has been involved in many theatrical productions, films and commercials in the area. He has also acted theatrically in Eugene, Roseburg, Grants Pass, Cottage Grove and McMinnville Oregon. He has written seven produced theatrical productions and several short films. Peter's feature film roles include The Last Avatar and In a Hail of Bullets. Roomies and The Bullet of Time, which he was featured in, both traveled the festival circuit in 2018.

 

Josiah Wise - Cast 'Morgan Fairfield'
Josiah grew up in Gasquet California and has been involved in theatre since 2008, taking an interest in film acting not long after. Most recently on stage he has performed in Les Miserables, Into the Woods, Company, Joseph and the Amazing Technicolor Dreamcoat, A Midsummer Night’s Dream and Spamalot. In film he has worked independently as part of Plain English Films, and as an extra in several local films. Josiah enjoys writing, guitar and piano, as well as nearly any outdoor activity. He hopes to put his interests and talents to use in Christian ministry at some point in the future.

 

Agatha Robinson - Cast 'Abigail Colfax'
Born and raised in rural Southern Oregon, Agatha Robinson is an artist, actor, singer, musician, music teacher, and midwife-in-training. She loves to travel, work with children, and spend time in nature. Living to love, Agatha is passionate about sharing the Arts with people in all walks of life, knowing it touches the soul in ways we cannot comprehend. She is thankful to the Lord for giving her the opportunity to serve those around her.

 

 


 

 

Jeff Wisdom - Cast 'Art'
Jeff began his singing/acting at Pleasant Hill High School. He attended Southern Oregon University and University of Oregon in Theater and Dance. He performed with Mary Miller Dance and Eugene Ballet. In Los Angeles he performed in television series and original musicals. Recent theatrical performances include Mamma Mia,  Wizard of Oz, Midsummer The Musical, Hunchback of Notre Dame and Brigadoon.

 

 

 


Caleb Pruitt - Cast 'Zeke Colfax'
Caleb started acting at seven years old when his school performed Shakespeare’s Comedy of Errors.  Each year from 2006-2015 contained a new Shakespearean production as Caleb’s love for theatre continued to grow. Aside from school, Caleb has participated in many local theater companies including The Shedd, Willamette Repertory Theatre, Actor’s Cabaret of Eugene and more. He has enjoyed productions of A Christmas Carol, The Wizard of Oz and Guys and Dolls. Most recently, Caleb finished his studies at LCC receiving his Associates Degree and portraying the character of Peter in their production of Peter and the Starcatcher.

 

 

Ben Collins - Director of Photography
Ben Collins has been in the industry for 5 years working as a grip/gaffer, 2nd AC, AC and Director of Photography. He has tried to work in all aspects of crew as well as different types of productions, including reality tv, documentaries, commercials and on several movies. He most recently finished film in a Noir detective piece.

 

Rocky Garrotto - 1st Assistant Camera
For more than 20 years Rocky has made his living working exclusively in the film and video industry. In a smaller market like Southern Oregon, you have to wear multiple production hats to work year-round. Over the years Rocky has racked up more than 40 IMDB credits including: Cinematographer, Location Scout and Manager, Grip and Electric, Director, Assistant Director, Editor, and of course 1st Assistant Cameraman. These diverse credits span the production scope from local commercials to countless episodes of ‘Reality TV’ to working on 17 feature films, some shorts and a full-length documentary. Rocky’s professionalism and experience are the most valuable assets he brings to each production and he looks forward to being part of the team on ‘The Fairfield Boys’ Mini Series.

Autumn Carter - Makeup/Costume Assistant
 Autumn is a recent graduate from University of Oregon, earning her Bachelors of Science in Art Administration and Journalism. By day she works as a Project manager for FPW Media. While she mainly takes to the stage to pursue theatrical endeavors, her passion for make-up has drawn her to this project. Autumn has a past with fashion make-up, owning her own YouTube channel in 2014 and working as a make-up artist for multiple weddings in the past year. She feels very blessed to be a part of this project with such a supportive cast and crew behind her.    

Beau Moser - Historical Advisor
Beau Moser is from Canyonville, Oregon. He has a Bachelor’s Degree from Western Oregon University in Social Sciences. His main focus is History, especially military history. The American Civil War is a favorite area of his. Beau is an amateur stage actor who has been involved with the Umpqua Actors Community Theatre in Roseburg, Oregon for 5 years. He loves not only acting, but also being involved with behind the scenes functions, such as crew and management.

Nathan Nickerson - Script Advisor

 

Episode #2 - Blood and Vengeance
 

Agatha Robinson - Cast 'Abigail Colfax'

Caleb Pruitt - Cast 'Zeke Colfax'

Mike Schwab - Cast 'Angus'
Mike Schwab is an Actor, Writer, Director, and Producer. He’s been in local theatrical productions at Actors Cabaret and The Shedd, and he directed a play in Lane’s Winter Shorts. He’s also been in several films, TV shows, and commercials. He started as an Extra on the shows Boston Legal and 24. He has also been in several films with local productions, such as in the 72 hr Adrenaline Film Festival, the Travel Lane County commercials, and in the upcoming productions Ordinary Heroes, Mastifinol, and We Need Rent Money. In addition, he produced a film for the Eugene Film Society’s Horror Film Competition. Finally, he has produced several films for the community TV station and for his YouTube channel: Delta Ponds Productions.

 

Ryan Olson - Cast 'Deputy Bantiff'
Ryan has been acting since 2003. After the military, he trained at Lane Community College for acting in Eugene OR from 2003-2007. Upon completion, he performed steadily in the community theater scene in Eugene which led to professional local/regional television, radio and print commercial work. It also led to working in the independent film scene in and around the Eugene area. Ryan currently lives in Eugene.

 

 

 

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #1'

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #2'

 

Episode #3 - Our True Enemy
 

Agatha Robinson - Cast 'Abigail Colfax'

Caleb Pruitt - Cast 'Zeke Colfax'

Ryan Olson - Cast 'Deputy Bantiff'

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #1'

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #2'

David Mort - Cast 'Sheriff Allen Monroe'
David Mort is a Eugene based actor, director, and producer.  Working on both stage and screen for over 20 years his most recent film credits include; We're Friend Right? and Blindspot.  He is also a professional puppeteer,  having performed in production of Avenue Q and the YouTube Series, ALL Things Z.  David's most recent project is directing the 1940's film noir piece, Wounds, New and Old. When not working David loves to spend time with his wife and two daughters. 

 

 

 

 

Will Brack - Cast 'Deputy Damon'
Will Brack is a Eugene, OR transplant born in the Washington, D.C area. He has recently been heavily involved with the independent film scene and has acted in a number of short films including; the upcoming western Blood Money, Portland-based We’re Friends, Right? and the 72-hour Horror Film Fest award-winning , Trouble in Tracktown. He is currently filming and associate producing Wounds, New & Old, a 1940’s era noir, and studying Meisner technique and scene study with several instructors in the Eugene area. Will loves spending time with his family & two dogs, producing hiphop beats and embarking on Dungeons & Dragons campaigns in his spare time.

 

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #3'

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #4'

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #5'

TBA - Cast 'Deputy #6'

 

Episode #4 - Back in Town
 

Agatha Robinson - Cast 'Abigail Colfax'

TBA - Cast 'Amos'

TBA - Cast 'Swifty'

TBA - Cast 'Customer #1'

Will Brack - Cast 'Deputy Damon'

David Mort - Cast 'Sheriff Allen Monroe'

TBA - Cast 'Miss Jane'

Beau Moser - Cast 'Abner'
Beau has been very involved in local community theater in Roseburg for nearly 8 years. He has been involved in productions for both UACT and Umpqua Community College’s Center Stage Theater. Shows he has been in include The Diary of Anne Frank, It’s A Wonderful Life, Curtains, Kiss Me Kate, Lend Me A Tenor, The Kitchen Witches, Rough Crossing and Shakespeare In Love. This will be Beau’s first time being in a film.

TBA - Cast 'Mayor Morgan'

TBA - Cast 'Doc'

 

Episode #5 - Redemption
 

Will Brack - Cast 'Deputy Damon'

David Mort - Cast 'Sheriff Allen Monroe'

Agatha Robinson - Cast 'Abigail Colfax'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #1'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #2'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #3'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #4'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #5'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #6'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #7'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #8'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #9'

TBA - Cast 'Posse Member #10'

TBA - Cast 'Miss Jane'

TBA - Cast 'Amos'

TBA - Cast 'Swifty'

TBA - Cast 'Bill'

TBA - Cast 'Abner'

TBA - Cast 'Mayor Morgan'

TBA - Cast 'Doc'

 

       

The Production

Location
Oregon is the perfect place to make a film! We want the scenic backdrops of Oregon to serve as a character in our film. Just as the Lord of the Rings and Hobbit trilogies used the sprawling landscapes of New Zealand as a character in their storytelling, we are looking to do the same here. We start by filming our first episode on privately owned property, that we have been granted permission to use, in Cottage Grove Oregon. Cottage Grove already has a name in the film industry, being the place that Buster Keaton's The General was filmed. Other recent films that have utilized locations in Cottage Grove include Stand By Me, Animal House and Emperor of the North. Oregon has also been named one of the best places to live and work as a moviemaker.

Time Period
The series is set around the mid to late 1860's. During this period of time there was an influx of settlers to the Pacific Northwest due to the Donation Land Claim Act of 1850, a federal statute enacted by the Congress of the United States to promote homestead settlement in the Oregon Territory. It permitted settlers on unsurveyed lands to select claims without regard to legal subdivisions. This is where our outlaw brother's have gotten a name for themselves by robbing the influx of settlers. Now being that it is a period piece we will be looking to match details in props and costumes of the time period, to add authenticity to the production.

Funding
Our primary purpose for raising funds is as follows:

A. Cast & Crew - About 80% of our funding. The budget goal we have set here is for Episode 1 alone (beyond that we will need to continue to raise funds as the series progresses).

B. Authenticity - 15% goes into props, costumes and makeup. In order to make this something we can all be proud of, and to retain a certain amount of historical accuracy, we will need to create some costumes and rent others. As well as prop and firearm rental, or procurement.

C. Housing, Travel and Food - 5% to keep our folks fed and happy. In order to film against the beautiful landscapes of Oregon, much of our cast and crew will be required to travel to location. While we will look to carpool and open up our homes as much as we can to cut down on budgetary spending, a certain amount will be needed to keep our hardworking team happy and healthy.

 

Making An Impact

Actors & Artists
Many of us spend much of our time traveling to and from one project (theatrical/film) or another on a voluntary basis. We are actors and artists trying to make a living doing what we love, but many productions pay little to nothing. Our schedules and finances consist of jumping from one project to the next and sweating the whole time, because of the low pay and sacrifice. Here we have the chance to provide work for Oregon artists through 5 episodes. This will equate to several years of regular work for many Oregon filmmaker's and artist. But heck! We are not just looking to employ from our State only, we would love to expand, but this is just the jumping off point.

A Good Story
We want the story we tell here to have an impact. Why tell a story unless it is worth telling? I find that historical, or historically based stories have such an impact. Why? Because they are about real people and they really happened. Moreover, a story that elicits  emotion can change the way we think and the way we are. To cry with someone, or for someone or to feel empathy, tragedy, or any course of emotion is informing us and moreover forming us into people, better people, that feel and think. We are not telling a story just to tell a story.

Bringing History to Life
Research. While not an actual historical recount of people and happenings, the story does delve into the history of the 1860's and the people and locations around it. Think of the Netflix's show Stranger Things, nothing historical about it other than the time period and settings. And then Downton Abbey, while somewhat more historically based, still a work of fiction.

Spread the Word

If you cannot contribute, please spread the word and even if you do contribute spread the word. Awareness of what we are trying to do here will help us grow this project. We hope this will be the start of something great and would love to have more fellow artists included as we move forward. What we need is a start. The train is leaving the station and with every passing mile, we just hope to pickup more speed.

INSTAGRAM.  TWITTER.  YOUTUBE.
story_txt:
**IMPORTANT UPDATE**Our budget needs have dropped to only $6,085!
Give now to help us reach our goal, only 30 days left!!
 
The Fairfield Boys Mini Series
Brief Synopsis
In the backwoods of the old west, two brother outlaws (The Fairfield Boys), are hunted by a skilled bounty hunter out for his own kind of justice. Inescapably the brother's lives are intertwined with two unsuspecting runaways, changing all of their lives forever. From the rights and the wrongs, to the twists and the turns, they discover the bonds of family among thieves in this five part mini-series set in the old west. Filmed entirely against the scenic Oregon landscape.
Episode 1 "Rough Times"Morgan and Clive find themselves engaged in a shootout in the remote hills with a deadly hunter. When Abigail stumbles upon one of the survivors, her and her brother must nurse the stranger back to health and make a difficult decision.
Episode 2 "Blood and Vengeance"Abigail and Zeke arrive at the lake with their battered survivor in tow, but a night meant for rest and recuperation, turns violent. As the trio is ambushed, another wounded victim is added to the list, forcing the three to seek aid at a nearby farm.
Episode 3 "Our True Enemy"The true enemy is revealed as old ties reconnect. Once considered enemies become allies and new revelations come to light. A harrowing loss reveals the truth that will lead our troupe back to town and back into the throngs of a past better forgotten.
Episode 4 "Back In Town"The hard truth is faced, as backwoods meets civilization. With hope dwindling and little makings of a plan or advantage, the troupe returns to face demons of old. A corrupt town will offer little aid to the outcasts, but a stand needs to be made even with the threat of a noose in sight.
Episode 5 "Redemption"The final stand is made and all is revealed. As the Sheriff and his Deputies vie for power in town, the streets run red with blood. Abigail and her allies fight against corruption and injustice as they look for redemption at the end of their long road.
 
Out West

story:
Update 4th August 2020

Unfortunately we have had to pause the tour. We plan to pick it up again once it is feasible and safe to do so. We thank you very much for your patience and understanding.

Who are we?

We are a team of seasoned professionals from the entertainment, tourism and IT sectors living on Corfu and using our skills to promote this beautiful island. We offer a new style of social media engagement through professionally presented livestream broadcasts and communicating instantly with, and connecting, our viewers. Collectively we are known as Studio Kerkyra and we specialise in Social Presenting & Livestream Productions.

Our passion is Corfu!

What are we doing?

Due to the current situation we are all experiencing this year, and the necessary holiday cancellations, our team here at Studio Kerkyra has decided to take everyone that sadly can't make it this year to beautiful Corfu on a 4 week long road trip through their paradise.

Corfuholics Road Trip Through Paradise 2020

15 Livesteam Locations

We have chosen 15 exciting locations where we will spend 2 days each exploring the surrounding area, their history, culture, activities, accommodation and gastronomic delights.

28 Interactive & Professionally Presented Livestream Shows

Presented through 28 interactive livestream shows combined with local interviews and mini documentaries this road trip through paradise is going to be a great adventure not only for our team but also for our viewers and followers of Studio Kerkyra.

Interact with our Social Presenters

The tour will be supported by a daily (Monday to Saturday) interactive livestream show which will start 8pm greek time and run for approximately 60min. This fully interactive tour gives future holiday makers the opportunity to send their questions live and interact in realtime with our Social Presenters Thomas Haas and Adrian Marvell.

The "Corfuholics Summer 2020" tour will be starting on the 27th of July and run until the 22nd of August.

Corfuholics Livestream Schedule:
Sidari 27th & 28th, Kassiopi 29th & 30th, Arillas 31st & 1st, Korakiana 3rd & 4th, Paleokastritsa 5th & 6th, Gouvia 7th & 8th, Pelekas 10th & 11th, Benitses 12th & 13th, Paramonas 14th & 15th, Lefkimmi 17th, Kavos 18th, Vitalades 19th, Petriti 20th, St George South 21st, Corfu Town 22nd. Locations are subject to, and may be neccessary to, change.

Interactive Location Map

See where we are, where we will be and where we have been with a location services map that gives you directions to your nearest livestream location as well as the upcoming livestream info or previous livestream video. Take a look at www.kerkyra.live and click to allow the website to use your current location.

If you are on the island why not join us at a location, keeping within social distancing rules of course, we would love to say hi!

Our goal

To promote the island of Corfu, in a unique way, as the perfect holiday destination to a wide variety of holiday makers of all ages.

You can follow our tour live on Facebook, YouTube, Twitter, Instagram or on our website www.kerkyra.live.

What do we need?

We need your support to be able to continue exploring & promoting Corfu in this unique way. Corfu is currently the only Greek island with a professionally manned and fully equiped mobile livestream and editing studio. The team at Studio Kerkyra can livestream independantly from anywhere and would love to be able to bring this technology to other islands in the future too, but for now this is what we will do with any funds raised:

Tour Costs
Whilst we love the island and will do this tour regardless of finances it would be a great help, and allow us to do more livestreams in the future, with a little bit of backing from our fans and supporters.
€500 - this will help very much and go towards the costs for one week of the tour.
€1000 - this will contribute to the costs of two weeks of doing the tour.
€2000 - yes, you know it, this will help tremendously for all 4 weeks of the tour.

New & Upgraded Equipment
€3000+ will contribute to buying additional and upgraded equipment, with cameras being the first on the list since ours still use tapes! Shock, horror! And... now you have an idea of how long Thomas Haas has actually been livestreaming for, they were the latest thing when he started!

Solar Power Van Conversion
In the, erm... unlikely, event that we reach €10000+ we would like to convert our livestream van to solar power instead of using a generator to power our equipment when no local source is available. We do our best, with the tools we currently have, to keep our carbon footprint as low as possible and try to be eco friendly.

How can I help?

We came up with several ideas and decided on a select few.
Better yet... not all of them cost money!

Help us for free:
It is already a big help if you would like, follow and share our Social pages please:

Please also use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word about our Crowdfunding Campaign.

Buy Corfu Pixels from €20:
A must have for all Corfuholics!
Get your very own virtual piece of Corfu and surrounding seas. Claim your favourite area and put your name on Corfu Pixels for 5 years. Each square on the map represents 100px (10 x 10). Corfu Pixels is updated daily. A popup with your name will display on your pixels once they are active.
€20 = 100px
€40 = 400px
€60 = 600px
€100 = 1000px
Important: if you want a specific location on the Corfu Pixels Map please let us know by email after your pixel purchase. Pixel locations are allocated on a first come first served basis, and if your preferred area has already gone we will put you as close as possible, your pixels will be placed next to each other on the map subject to availability.
UPDATE!  You can now select your own Corfu Pixels. Purchase them here and then visit https://www.kerkyra.live/corfu-pixels to select them. You will still need to go through the checkout process and choose ‘Indiegogo Crowdfunding Campaign’ as the payment method. Pixels will be activated once they have been matched to an order placed here, so please be sure to use the same email address on both systems.
Updated: 29th July 2020

Buy the Corfuholics Signed Tour T-Shirt 2020 €30
Pre order your Corfuholics Summer Tour 2020 T-shirts. T-shirts will be printed, signed by Thomas & Adrian, and shipped within 30 days of the end of the tour, we aim to be faster than that but are reliant on printers and postal services during a pandemic too. The t-shirt design will include the Corfuholics logo and the location names that are in the tour, but since we can't guarantee that our scheduled locations won't change due to circumstances beyond our control we won't be finalising the design until the end of the tour. Price includes shipping within Europe.

Social Inclusion & Island Promotion

The internet has played a huge part in keeping people connected during lockdowns and we know just how many people have lost out on their holiday abroad this year, especially those that were planning to come to Corfu. Our presence, live from Corfu, has been a Corfiot hug and some verbal sunshine for many during a difficult time. Reconnecting them to the island even if, and especially because, they can't be here which is reflected in our reviews.

We all have one thing in common... our passion for Corfu! It's addictive and hard to leave behind. Hence the term Corfuholics which was coined by one of our regular viewers, thank you Anthonie (a signed T-shirt will be making its way to you).

"This show is what I look forward to after a day at work. I feel like I'm back on my favourite island and great to be able to take part. Great show, informative, funny and great presentation. How can any Corfuholic resist listening in!"
Elaine Sgourou 13th July 2020

"The Studio Kerkyra deliver a light hearted, fun but very informative hour on the islands news and issues. Thomas, Claire and Adrian are very welcoming and it is a fun interactive show. You can ask any question and if they don't know, they will find out for you - but the other listeners might beat them to it. They welcome all comments and contributions - its like getting a great big Corfu hug everyday."
Sarah Roseamann 10th July 2020

"Great show with information and humour. Especially important at this time we all feel so disconnected. Nice to know there are other people all feeling the same with similar thoughts and questions."
Claire Harris 8th May 2020

"For anyone either living in Corfu or with a love of the island, I thoroughly recommend listening to Lockdown SK. The presenters are very open-minded, informative and their obvious affection and enthusiasm for their adopted home is very endearing. I particularly appreciate their attention to accuracy as they, and their producer, constantly check and re-check the verity of the information they relay to their audience. The listeners are encouraged to contribute so we feel totally included and part of the hour. They also speak via Skype with very interesting people from all over the world. Thank you Lockdown SK for making this difficult time much easier for so many of us each day."
Lavinia Psarras 3rd May 2020

Risks & Challenges

Covid-19 and local lockdowns are currently our biggest concern. We are committed to maintaining Social Distancing to protect our team as well as those we are lucky enough to meet on the tour. Lockdowns would cause disruption to our schedule, but not to worry though as we will pick up where we stopped once lockdowns are lifted even if we have to make some adjustments to locations and time schedules.

We are also reliant on internet connectivity and Social Platforms to provide a consistant service. Our current fans and followers are already aware that these things can cause occasional disruptions to livestreams but thay also know we will pick up where we left off as soon as all systems are stable again. Some will remember, not so long ago, that Facebook was having streaming issues one day so we jumped ship, mid stream, and took the commenting and conversation over to YouTube instead where the livestream was stable and uniterrupted.

story:
Short Summary

We always strive to see the people are happy and friendly to each other, and the world we live is a big community where everybody is equal and have the same rights. 

So, we came up with an idea to create 30 seconds short animated videos for people. These videos are short enough to watch for busy people and long enough to convey the message of happy life.

Our goal is to create 3 short videos in a week. Season 1 consisting of 100 series.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to make this, we're going to need money for production costs. (Please look over to the right where you'll see the perks that come with different donation amounts!). The videos we made are produced by our team, and we can make it even better if we have better equipment and software.

Fortunately, we have an incredibly talented and professional team of people who are excited to make this series with us. BUT there are still many costs (10 000$) associated with filming an animated short video series, including:

  • Software License
  • Equipment 
  • Promotion and marketing 

And your contribution will allow us to pay for these expenses.

We are open to receive stories from contributors, we can discuss together if we think the video will be helpful for people. 

The Impact

This series will bring people together. Our goal is to reach more than million followers all over the world in a half year period. All the videos will be distributed from our official Facebook page, Youtube channel and Instagram account. 

We believe that people will understand the importance of living happy and healthy life, protecting each other and making love spread all over the world.

Risks & Challenges

The only risks & challenges is generating at least three useful stories every week. But we are always open to discuss the stories from everyone, because our goal is to spread the love and happiness, improve the life of people through our videos.

PS. We already generated 40 series, so this is enough for 13 weeks of work.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't make a donation, but you're excited about the series, we need you! We want "The brothers" animated videos to reach as large an audience as possible, so every "like" and "share" on social media really helps. If you can share this campaign with friends, that would be great. And when the series actually gets made, sharing and liking those videos will help tremendously. Thank you so much.

Please share this or follow our social media accounts and put likes. 

Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/thebrothersvine/

Instagram page: https://instagram.com/sar_group_social

Youtube channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCmlzPPN_6LiRPVbocJmvXrw

story:
Welcome! 

Thanks for stopping by, I hope you are as passionate as I am about enabling and elevating people. My name is Bill Branch and I have been a dedicated teacher/instructor since 2001. 

In the past year I have dedicated myself to creating free training for anyone seeking to pass the FAA's Remote Pilot Exam for a drone or unmanned aircraft. I have just recently made those available on YouTube. I have also create the industry's best professional grade 174 page visually intense study guide for free right here.

Now is the time: the right thing to do is to make this all accessible and useful for the D/deaf & HoH communities.

Here is a link of my experience helping people elevate their lives.

What We Need & What You Get

My current research indicates that it will require $22,000 to have all 82 training videos with an ASL translator & captions. 

You are contributing to more than a campaign, you are helping build something larger...something magnificent, something magical. It is my hope that this campaign inspires other training programs to provide more ASL enabled services.

1st: What you get is about what you gave. That is our path too.

2nd: Contributors will get perks such as:

  • A) access to our premium training services to use or gift to a friend.
  • B) a unique token of appreciation such as a high quality long sleeve shirt indicating that you contributed to a higher purpose.

OK, if we do not reach our goal we will continue to use the funds to create as many videos and training resources for the D/deaf & HoH communities as possible. If at this point then we hope that we find ASL volunteers to help finish the project.

If the funding goal is exceeded then the remaining funding will be used, to the extend possible, to help fund D/deaf & HoH students for our premium services. 

The Impact

The highest service is the service to others without asking for anything back but a smile, to elevate others and cherish that moment forever. So...Smile it looks good on you. 

I have created 82 freely available training videos on YouTube & a 174 page document for free. My dedication to helping others is real, it is important to me and it is priceless.  

This is my passion! I hope it is your passion too...

Risks & Challenges

I value the input of the D/deaf & HoH community and as such I will listen but I also know that there might be a few conflicting or contrasting opinions. I will do my best to consider all ideas and opinions with the highest level of respect possible. 

Again, this project might not achieve full funding...I have never given up on my service to others and as such I will, one way or another, make sure this project comes to full fruition. I am always seeking volunteers so...If you are a reputable ASL translator willing to help then please please contact me today.

Other Ways You Can Help

I value people who are passionate about enabling and elevating others. If you can volunteer in any way please let me know :-)

story:
RAYOLIGHT PRODUCTIONS, the award winning Outer Banks production team behind Lost In Buffalo City, Boy!, Night of the Fluffet, and love, intergalactic, are excited to announce their next local OBX project, the intergalactic mini-series titled The Battle For Space (insert echo “SPACE… Space… space”).

The Battle For Space will be a compelling and wildly entertaining sci-fi adventure series that the whole family can enjoy!  Our story begins in Season 1, and is told over the course of four 30 minute episodes that follow a ragtag crew of space outlaws who must battle their way across corporate controlled space to find the mysterious science stones that will bring peace back to the universe, and overthrow the evil Amadan Empire. 

But let’s be clear, WE'RE NOT MAKING STAR WARS, and we don’t want to. What we will be making is a fun, modern, and action filled B-Movie space adventure with some Outer Banks flair.  But we need help to make it happen.

The estimated $50,000 budget is a decent chunk of change that surpasses our current financial means.  So to help us secure the funding to make our series a reality, we’re asking for your help to raise $25,000 which will enable us to bring our project to a screen near you the summer of 2021.  

But we’re not just asking for your money.  We are also reaching out to our local Outer Banks community for help in other ways.  We need extras! People who can show up and wear a Space Trooper outfit or an alien costume and look bad a$$.  We need a warehouse! One big enough (2 - 3 car garage or larger) that we can build spaceship interiors in and film scenes in over the winter.  Plus much more! Do you want to be a part of the production or know of a cool location that could serve as an alien planet or futuristic interior?  Reach out and let us know!

Lastly, we want The Battle For Space to promote our area’s unique landscapes, skilled artisans, acting talent, and local businesses that are here, ready and waiting to support larger scale Hollywood productions… You know, the kinds that could bring in millions of dollars during the off season months.

Rayolight Productions

RAYOLIGHT PRODUCTIONS is an award winning commercial, film, and video production company based in Manteo, NC.  Specializing in narrative film, commercial, and corporate videos, the production group brings with it a wide variety of experience and local knowledge to help bring any production to life.

 

Stuart Parks II

Stuart Parks, the Producer, Writer, and Creative Director of The Battle For Space, is an award nominated actor and writer based in Kill Devil Hills, NC.  A regular favorite of the local stage, his work has spanned lead roles in Spamalot, One Flew Over The Cuckoo’s Nest, and the renowned The Lost Colony.  On screen, he can be seen in the local award winning productions Lost In Buffalo City, as well as Boy! and Night of the Fluffet which he both wrote and produced.

 

Raymond Wallace

Raymond Wallace, the Producer and Production Director of The Battle For Space is an award winning independent film Producer, Writer, Director, and Director of Photography based in Manteo, NC.  His previous award winning productions Lost In Buffalo City, Boy!, and Night of the Fluffet have garnered a collection of awards at film festival screenings throughout the world.

 

Kelsey Thompson

Kelsey Thompson, the star of The Battle For Space, is a respected actress and regular member of the local stage, based in Southern Shores, NC.  Trained in theater and art, Kelsey has starred in such local productions as Spamalot, The Rocky Horror Show, and A Midsummer Night’s Dream, the renowned production The Lost Colony, and the award winning short film Night of the Flufflet.

 

Intergalactic Supply

The world renowned Kill Devil Hills based company Intergalactic Supply has been creating, building, and selling screen accurate Star Wars props the world over, for more than 3 years.  They will be crafting several original suits of armor and robot costumes for the production.

So what does $25,000 mean to our production?  Let’s break it down…

 

Campaign Fees - Let’s face it, they’re a necessary evil that we have to deal with.  If you'd prefer not to pay the fee and contribute directly, reach out to us and let's talk.

Rewards and Shipping - The awesome perks that you receive based on your level of giving cost money, and to ensure that we meet yours and our expectations we feel it’s important to give you the best that we can, for supporting us with all that you can.

Production Costs - We’re talking costumes, sets, models, camera equipment, props, location and permit fees, catering, robots, aliens, etc.  The things that are going to make our film happen.  The estimated $17,500 left over from the $25k raised will go straight into the production costs.

As you may notice, the production costs cover a wide gamut.  But something that they don’t cover are the salaries of cast and crew.  What makes this project so awesome is that it’s a passion project for all involved. All of the cast and crew will be giving their free time to make this happen.  So every dollar we have, will be seen on screen.

WHAT IF WE DON'T REACH OUR GOAL?  Well, as much as that would suck, we want to keep it fair and ensure that when we do this project that we do it right.  Which is why we are all or nothing in this campaign.  If we don't reach our goal, then your contribution gets refunded and that's that.

 

Every dollar, resource, or second of time that you contribute to our project will help us complete the series' first season, and make it available for online streaming.  Your support also helps to promote the Outer Banks as a viable production location with more to offer than just sunny beaches during the summer season.

Film and video productions of any kind are economic generators that pump money into local economies.  When a production comes to town, not only will they rely on local businesses to house and feed their cast and crew, but they also require construction supplies, shipping services, car rental agencies, general labor forces, local acting talents, extras, and much much more!  By helping to support local productions, you are helping to bring awareness to our area as a viable option to larger scale productions that could help broaden and strengthen our local economy.

 

As long as we reach our funding goal, we’ll be able to produce the first season, four episodes, of our series.  But that’s not to say that our production couldn't face several challenges.  The biggest of which, as any Outer Banks local can tell you, is the weather (insert the crash of thunder and a distant ominous evil laughter)!

It’s all rainbows and sunshine one minute, and then the next you’re stuck in a severe storm and faced with the loss of a full days filming schedule.  (sighs) Yeah, we’ve been there.  Which is why for this production we are renting a warehouse for the entirety of our shoot, so that no matter what the weather may hold, we can adjust our schedule and keep filming.

And for circumstances outside of time delays and torrential downpours… Well, we’ve got insurance and contracts for that!  So come what may, as long as we meet our funding goal, we’re making this series and we won’t stop until it’s completed.  You have our word on that!

 

As we mentioned before, it’ll take more than just money to make this project happen.

So if you can’t contribute any money and want to help, the easiest thing you can do would be to share our campaign.  Share it on your social media feeds, tell your friends, your nerdy coworkers, your rich uncles, anyone and everyone you’ve ever met since birth, would be extremely helpful to us in getting the good word out.

But we’re not just asking for your money.  We are also reaching out to our local Outer Banks community for help in other ways.   We're looking for extras, a warehouse, other worldly and or futuristic filming locations, space aged props and costumes, or perhaps you’d be willing to donate a couple lunches from your business to our crew, or a specialty service that could be tied into our production… Any and all help you can offer is greatly appreciated.  So please reach out and email us at info@rayolightproductions.com and let us know what and or how you’d like to contribute and be a part of the production.
story_txt:
RAYOLIGHT PRODUCTIONS, the award winning Outer Banks production team behind Lost In Buffalo City, Boy!, Night of the Fluffet, and love, intergalactic, are excited to announce their next local OBX project, the intergalactic mini-series titled The Battle For Space (insert echo “SPACE… Space… space”).
The Battle For Space will be a compelling and wildly entertaining sci-fi adventure series that the whole family can enjoy!  Our story begins in Season 1, and is told over the course of four 30 minute episodes that follow a ragtag crew of space outlaws who must battle their way across corporate controlled space to find the mysterious science stones that will bring peace back to the universe, and overthrow the evil Amadan Empire. 
But let’s be clear, WE'RE NOT MAKING STAR WARS, and we don’t want to. What we will be making is a fun, modern, and action filled B-Movie space adventure with some Outer Banks flair.  But we need help to make it happen.

The estimated $50,000 budget is a decent chunk of change that surpasses our current financial means.  So to help us secure the funding to make our series a reality, we’re asking for your help to raise $25,000 which will enable us to bring our project to a screen near you the summer of 2021.  
But we’re not just asking for your money.  We are also reaching out to our local Outer Banks community for help in other ways.  We need extras! People who can show up and wear a Space Trooper outfit or an alien costume and look bad a$$.  We need a warehouse! One big enough (2 - 3 car garage or larger) that we can build spaceship interiors in and film scenes in over the winter.  Plus much more! Do you want to be a part of the production or know of a cool location that could serve as an alien planet or futuristic interior?  Reach out and let us know!
Lastly, we want The Battle For Space to promote our area’s unique landscapes, skilled artisans, acting talent, and local businesses that are here, ready and waiting to support larger scale Hollywood productions… You know, the kinds that could bring in millions of dollars during the off season months.


Rayolight Productions
RAYOLIGHT PRODUCTIONS is an award winning commercial, film, and video production company based in Manteo, NC.  Specializing in narrative film, commercial, and corporate videos, the production group brings with it a wide variety of experience and local knowledge to help bring any production to life.

story:
The animation centres around three friends, Ben, Ade and Yong. Ben is a recent graduate currently working as a software tester, Ben a club promoter and Yong, the joke of the group is a stock broker. The story alternates around their lives and how they manage to survive as  young men in a fragile environment. The animations covers every detail of their day from the moment they wake up in the morning to when the night stand is turned off in their rooms. Sit back and I hope you enjoy the animations when we start the uploads in early August.

This is the first production from the our production company, ASTERI PICTURES. The dream is to bring an animation that you can relate with to life. The storyline in the animation incorporates real life events and other events we do on a daily basics. Interested in a preview of the first few chapters, go on the website/ projects /scripts. Click the link http://www.asteripictures.co.uk​.

Our budget as stated is £3,000. Included is a detailed copy of our outline, so you'll know exactly where each money donated is going. But to summarize, the main expenses is represented with the pie chart below:

With each contribution, we've offered a certain PERK. From the very low investment, to the highest of highs, you'll get a gift in exchange for helping us achieve our goal. They're detailed below, but range from a social media shout out, all the way to a full-fledged credit at the end of the film.

Like all investments, the biggest question is - what if you don't reach your goal? Although we expect nothing but going well above it, if we don't happen to hit our amount, we'll use the money we do raise in order to still tell the story. We'll cut back and delegate different amount of money to different areas, but we'll issue full transparency on where each and every money of yours is going.

If you have been with us thus far, THANK YOU! It would mean the world for us if you back this project and help make this dream a reality.

Even if you can't support us financially, it would be just as beneficial if you spread the word: Share the campaign on social media or on your blog, or just tell people about the project. We are honoured that because of your amazing support so far, we've been able to continue our work. We will not give up and with your help, we can make this series a reality. This is your project. Thank you! :)

Can I contribute internationally? 

Yes! You can donate in USD, CAD, EUR, and GBP.

What form of payments are accepted?

Credit card or paypal

Can we exceed the goal?

Yes! That would be extraordinary! Surpassing our goal would put us in the position to create an even better animation.

What do you plan on doing with the animation?

The episodes will be uploaded on Youtube for every one to watch. 

If I contribute do I have to choose a perk?

Not at all. And, you can contribute any amount of money you wish. 

Our Thanks:

On behalf of the entire Co-op we thank you so much for your consideration and support!

-Life in Phases
